Once upon a time there was a girl named Molly. Molly loved to draw! Every day she would take her pen and paper and try to make the most beautiful pictures. She was so excited to watch the ink swirling around the paper and make a masterpiece. But one day, the pen ran out of ink! Molly was so sad that she couldn√¢t draw any more. Luckily, her mom was very persistent. She helped Molly make more ink for her pen. Molly was so happy that she jumped around and clapped her hands. Now Molly can make as many beautiful pictures as she wanted! She was filled with excitement and she couldnt wait to get started. Molly and her mom laughed and smiled. Molly was filled with gratitude to her mom for being so persistent and helping her to be able to draw. They hugged each other and Molly went back to creating the most amazing pictures. The End.Once upon a time there was a girl. She was very brave and always wanted to try new things. One day she decided to crawl up a big hill. As she reached the top she saw a bow. It was shiny and sparkly. She reached out to pick it up and when she did it made a fake noise. She was so surprised and laughed. She held the bow in her little hands and admired its beauty. She was so proud of herself for climbing up the hill and finding the bow. From that day on, she always kept the bow with her.Once upon a time there lived a bee. The bee loved to fly around outside in the fresh air. One day as the bee was flying, it saw a nice sunny spot. The bee liked the warm sun, so it flew down and relaxed. Suddenly, the bee heard a loud noise and felt a sharp pain. The bee was dead! The bee had been stung by a big bee. The bee was very sad it had died but it was happy it had been able to relax in the sun for a bit before it passed away. The other bees were sorry to hear that their friend was dead. They made sure to keep an eye out for any more bees flying around, so that they could stay safe. The lesson from this story is to relax and enjoy life, but also be careful.Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a nosy bunny named Bob. Bob liked to hop around and see what his friends were doing. One day, he saw his friend, a squirrel named Sam, looking sad. Bob asked, Sam, why are you sad? Sam said, I want to play with my ball, but it keeps rolling into the street. I dont want to get hurt. Bob thought hard and had an idea. He said, Lets build a little fence to prevent the ball from going into the street. They worked together and built the fence. It stopped the ball from rolling away. Sam was happy and said, Thank you, Bob! You have a big heart. They played together all day and had lots of fun. From that day on, Bob learned that being nosy can sometimes be helpful.There once were two friends, Alex and Tommy. One day it started raining and Alex wanted to go outside to play. But Tommy said that he had to stay inside. Alex was very sad. He wanted to play, but Tommy was so insistent that he had to stay inside. Soon, the rain stopped and Alex and Tommy looked outside. The sun was now shining, and not a single raindrop was available. Tommy then told Alex that he was right to make him stay inside. If they had gone out, they would have gotten very wet. This taught Alex a very important lesson sometimes it is better to stay indoors even if you really want to go out. If a storm is coming, it is better to be safe than sorry!One day, Mommy and Buster were in the living room. They were playing with a gray chair. Buster was making it spin around. Mommy said, Buster, please dont disturb the chair! Buster stopped and asked, Disturb? Whats that? Mommy said, It means when something moves too much and makes noise, its disturbing. Buster asked, But why cant I spin the gray chair around? Mommy said, Well, we dont want to disturb the other people in the house. We dont want them to be bothered by the noise. Buster thought for a moment and said, OK, I wont disturb the chair any more. He smiled and started playing quietly with his toys.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He was very excited because it was his birthday. His mom and dad had planned a big party for him. But Timmy was very poor, and his parents couldnt afford to buy him any presents. Timmy didnt mind, though. He was just happy to be surrounded by his friends and family. During the party, Timmys friends played games and ate cake. But when it was time to open presents, Timmys parents realized they had forgotten the key to unlock the closet where they had hidden Timmys gift. Everyone searched and searched, but they couldnt find the key. Timmy was so sad that he didnt even want to blow out the candles on his cake. The party ended with everyone feeling very disappointed. It was a very bad birthday for Timmy.Once upon a time, there were two friends named Max and Spike. Max was a very happy little boy and Spike was a small, miserable little hedgehog. They often played together, which made Spike feel a little bit better. One day, when they were playing, Max started to poke Spike with a stick. Spike felt really angry and uncomfortable but said nothing. He just curled himself up into a ball and stayed still. Max kept poking and poking at Spike until Spike started to cry. He knew he had to do something to stop Max from feeling so miserable. He started to wiggle around and use his spikes to protect himself from Max poking. Max was very surprised that Spike was protecting himself and he quickly stopped. Then he asked Spike Why did you do that? Spike said Because I dont want anyone to be miserable, Max. Then Max realized how wrong he had been. Max and Spike hugged each other and from that day, they never poked each other again. They were the best of friends.Once there was a little dog named Max. Max loved to run and play all day long. But one day, Max got very tired and needed to rest. He found a cozy spot under a tree and lay down to take a nap. While Max was resting, he saw a bird flying above him. The bird accidentally dropped some ink on Maxs nose! Max was surprised and didnt know what to do. He tried to lick the ink off, but it didnt come off fast. Maxs owner came over and saw the ink on his nose. She gently wiped it off with a cloth. Max was happy to be clean again and went back to resting under the tree.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was three years old and every day he was full of energy and laughter. One day, Tim was playing with his friends in a field, when he saw an arrow in the grass. Curious, he picked up the arrow and stared at it, pointing it towards his friends. Its a magic arrow! one of Tims friends, Jessica, exclaimed. Tim loved the idea, and the two decided to play a game with the arrow. Jessica said if Tim held up the arrow and pointed it at someone, they would have to do whatever they said. Tim thought this was a great idea, and pointed the arrow at a friend. However, the friend refused, and Tim got angry. He started to yell and said his friend was being selfish. Seeing his reaction, Jessica laughed. She then suggested that they forget the game, and share the arrow. She said that if Tim and his friends shared the arrow, everyone would get to enjoy it. Tim thought about it for a moment, then smiled and agreed. He realized that sharing was the best way to make everyone happy. From then on, Tim and his friends shared the arrow, always laughing and having a good time.There was a giant in the forest. He was so big and so tall that he could look over the trees. He was an enormous giant! One day, a baby bunny came to the forest. He wanted to peek at the giant, but he was scared he might get into trouble. He hid in the grass and peered through the leaves to peak at the giant. The giant didnt even know he was there. The bunny saw the giants enormous feet, and decided he had seen enough. He hopped away and ran back home to his family, thankful he had been able to peek at the giant without getting into trouble.Once upon a time there was a hairy bear. He loved to climb up and down the tall trees near his home. One day, he spotted a shiny diamond on the ground and he thought to himself, That diamond is sure nice! He wanted it for himself, so he quickly shut his eyes and wished for it. Then, all of a sudden, the diamond turned into a magical butterfly and flew away! The bear sighed and opened his eyes. Just then, he heard a voice calling out from behind him. It was a little girl! She asked the bear, Did you want this? Its my diamond! She held up a shiny diamond and smiled at the bear. The bear was so happy and thanked the little girl. The little girl smiled and said, Its mine to share. Lets play together. So the bear and the little girl played together for the rest of the day. They laughed and ran around, chasing the magical butterfly and exploring the tall trees. At the end of the day, they hugged and said goodbye. The bear went back home with a big smile on his face and the little girl went home with her shiny diamond.Tim and Kim were twins who liked to play with kites. They had many kites of different colors and shapes. One day, they saw a fancy kite in the store. It was big and shiny and had a long tail. They wanted to buy it, but it was too expensive. They asked their mom and dad to buy them the fancy kite, but they said no. They said they already had enough kites and they should be happy with what they had. Tim and Kim were sad and angry. They thought their mom and dad were mean and unfair. The next day, they decided to sneak out of their room and go to the store. They took some money from their piggy bank and ran to the store. They bought the fancy kite and hid it in their backpack. They were very happy and excited. They wanted to fly the fancy kite in the park. But when they got to the park, they saw a big problem. The wind was too strong and the fancy kite was too heavy. They tried to fly the fancy kite, but it kept falling and crashing. They tried to fix it, but it was too hard. They started to cry and regret. Then they saw their mom and dad coming. They had followed them to the park. They were very worried and angry. They scolded Tim and Kim for being dishonest and disobedient. They took the fancy kite and the money and said they would return them to the store. They said they were very disappointed and sad. Tim and Kim felt very sorry and ashamed. They realized they had made a big mistake. They hugged their mom and dad and said they were sorry. They said they learned their lesson. They said they didnt need the fancy kite. They said they loved their mom and dad and their other kites. Their mom and dad forgave them and hugged them back. They said they loved them too and they were proud of them for being sorry. They said they could still play with their other kites, but they had to be careful and respectful. They said they hoped they would be more grateful and happy with what they had. The moral of the story is Be honest and obedient, and be happy with what you have.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a unique teddy bear that she loved very much. One day, Lilys little brother took her teddy bear and wouldnt give it back. Lily was very upset and cried. Lilys mom saw her crying and asked what was wrong. Lily told her that her brother took her teddy bear and wouldnt give it back. Her mom asked her brother to give back the teddy bear, but he refused. He said he wanted to play with it. Lilys mom had an idea. She went to the bathroom and got a razor. She showed it to Lilys brother and said, If you dont give back the teddy bear, I will settle this with the razor. Her brother got scared and gave back the teddy bear. Lily was happy to have her teddy bear back and hugged it tightly.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One day, she got very tired and needed to rest. She sat down on the grass and closed her eyes. Suddenly, she heard a loud noise. It was her friend, Max. He was shouting, Lets play tag! But Lily was too tired to play. She said, No, Max. I need to rest now. Max didnt understand. He said, Why are you so lazy? You always want to rest. Lily explained, Im not lazy. I just need to rest so I can be healthy and play later. Max understood and said, Okay, Ill rest with you too. And they both sat on the grass, counting the number of clouds in the sky.Once upon a time, there was a rabbit named Benny. Benny loved to eat radishes from the garden. One day, he found a big radish and started to eat it. Suddenly, he felt funny and started to shrink! Benny became so small that he was the size of a toy. He cried out for help and his friend, a mouse named Molly, heard him. What happened, Benny? asked Molly. I ate a big radish and now Im tiny! Benny replied. Molly felt sorry for her friend and said, Dont worry, Ill help you find a way to grow big again. They went to see the wise owl who lived in the tree. The owl told them that Benny needed to eat a special mushroom to grow big again. They found the mushroom and Benny ate it. Suddenly, Benny grew big again and was back to his normal size. He thanked Molly and the wise owl for their help. From that day on, Benny never ate too many radishes again.Once there was a little girl. She was so excited because she was going to her first day of school. She was in a very big class, with lots of other children. The teacher was very nice and showed them around the classroom. Everyone was so happy. The teacher said it was time to start, so they all sat down. Then the teacher asked everyone to clap. So the little girl and all the other children clapped and it was so loud. The teacher said it was time for a break, so everyone went outside to play. There was a huge playground with lots of fun things to do. The children laughed and clapped and had a great time. When it was time to go home, the little girl was so sad to leave. But she knew she would be coming back the next day and couldnt wait to see her new class again.Once upon a time, there were two shapes that were different. One was yellow and the other was blue. The two shapes wanted to understand each other, but they couldnt. They soon became friends and smiled at each other. The blue shape thought the yellow shape was pretty and the yellow shape thought the blue shape was funny. They decided that they should try and understand each other better. So, they played together and made games out of their different shapes! They laughed and had lots of fun. In the end, the two shapes understood each other better.Tim and Sue are twins. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big bag on a bench. They are curious. They want to see what is in the bag. They walk to the bench. They open the bag. They see a lot of balloons. They are happy. They like balloons. They take some balloons out of the bag. Suddenly, they hear a loud voice. It is a man. He is angry. He says, Hey, those are my balloons! Give them back! Tim and Sue are scared. They drop the balloons. They run away. The balloons rise in the air. They fly away. The man is sad. He says, Oh no, my balloons! Come back! Tim and Sue are sorry. They did not know the balloons were his. They hide behind a tree. They watch the balloons go up and up. They hope the man will find his balloons. They say, Sorry, mister. We did not mean to take your balloons.Once upon a time there was a nice swan. It lived by the lake. Every day it would swim in the lake. One day the swan was flying around the lake. Suddenly, it lost its balance and fell into the lake. The swan splashed and kicked its legs to stay afloat. A little nearby girl saw what happened and ran over to the lake. She asked the swan in a worried voice Are you okay? The swan replied, Yes, I am okay. Thank you for asking. And then it swam away. The girl was happy to see that the nice swan was safe.One day, a little girl went outside to her backyard. She saw there was something special waiting for her! It was a pale kite with a big, colorful ribbon attached to it. She couldnt wait to start flying it! The little girl opened the ribbon, grabbed the kite, and held it close to her. She took it to the edge of the backyard and tried to tie the ribbon to a stick. But she couldnt do it all by herself. She looked around and saw her big brother and asked him for help. Her big brother smiled and took the ribbon from her. He quickly tied it around the stick and then held it up in the air for the little girl. She smiled, holding one end of the kite in each hand. She looked up into the sky and the kite was twirling and dancing in the wind! The little girl was so happy she had so much fun flying her new kite in her backyard!Once upon a time, there was a big, big dog. He was so huge that he could barely fit in his doghouse. One day, he saw a cartoon on TV and he loved it so much that he sat there for hours and hours watching it. But then, his owner had to leave and turn off the TV. The dog was sad that he couldnt watch his favorite cartoon anymore. But then, he remembered that he had a big bone to chew on, so he left the TV room and went to his doghouse to enjoy his bone. The end.Lily and Ben went to the park with Mom. They saw a big pond with many ducks and swans. Lily liked the swans. They were white and graceful. She wanted to feed them some bread. Mom, can I give some bread to the swans? Lily asked. Sure, but be careful. Dont go too close to the water. And dont throw the bread too hard. The swans might get scared, Mom said. Lily nodded and took a piece of bread from Mom. She walked slowly to the edge of the pond. She saw a swan swimming near her. She smiled and tossed the bread gently to the swan. The swan caught the bread and ate it. It looked happy. Thank you, swan! Lily said. The swan nodded and swam away. Lily looked for another swan to feed. She saw one that was hidden behind some reeds. It was smaller than the other swans. It looked shy. Hello, swan! Do you want some bread? Lily called. The hidden swan peeked out from the reeds. It saw Lily and the bread. It wanted the bread, but it was afraid of Lily. It stayed behind the reeds. Come on, swan! Dont be scared. I wont hurt you. I just want to be your friend, Lily said. She threw the bread closer to the hidden swan. The hidden swan saw the bread. It was hungry. It decided to try the bread. It swam out from the reeds and took the bread. It tasted good. Thank you, Lily! The hidden swan said. Lily was surprised. She didnt know that swans could talk. Youre welcome, swan! Whats your name? Lily asked. My name is End. Im the last of my family. The other swans left me because Im different. I can talk, but they cant, End said. Thats sad, End. But youre not alone. You have me. Im your friend. And youre not different. Youre special, Lily said. End smiled. He felt happy. He had a friend. Thank you, Lily. Youre special too. Can I stay with you? End asked. Of course, End. You can stay with me. Come on, lets go to Mom. Shell like you too, Lily said. She took Ends wing and led him to Mom. Ben saw them and was amazed. Wow, Lily! You have a talking swan! Ben said. Yes, Ben. This is End. Hes my friend. Can he play with us? Lily said. Sure, Lily. He can play with us. Hi, End. Im Ben. Nice to meet you, Ben said. Hi, Ben. Nice to meet you too. Youre Lilys brother, right? End said. Yes, I am. Youre very smart, End, Ben said. Thank you, Ben. Youre very kind, Ben, End said. Mom saw them and was shocked. Lily, Ben, whats going on? Whos this swan? Mom asked. Mom, this is End. Hes a talking swan. Hes my friend. Can he stay with us? Lily said. A talking swan? Thats incredible. How did you find him? Mom asked. He was hidden behind some reeds. He was lonely. I gave him some bread. He thanked me. He told me his name. He asked me to be his friend. I said yes. Hes very nice, Mom. Please, can he stay with us? Lily said. Mom looked at End. He looked at Mom. He nodded. Hello, Mom. Im End. Im a talking swan. Im Lilys friend. Can I stay with you? End said. Mom was speechless. She didnt know what to say. She looked at Lily and Ben. They looked at Mom. They smiled. Please, Mom. Please, they said. Mom sighed. She smiled too. Okay, okay. You can stay with us, End. But only if you promise to be good and not make too much noise. And you have to share the bread with the other swans. Deal? Mom said. Deal, Mom. Thank you, Mom. Youre very nice, Mom, End said. Lily, Ben, and End hugged Mom. They were happy. They had a new friend. A talking swan. His name was End. But his story was just beginning.Once upon a time there was a very sad boy. He was always very sad because he had a secret that no one else knew. This secret made him suffer very much. His secret was hidden away deep inside his heart and he never wanted anyone to find it. One day the boy went to the store and bought a special lotion. It was a magical lotion that was said to give a person strength when they were sad. So the boy decided to try it and see if it helped his suffering. He opened the bottle and ran the lotion all over his body. He laughed as he felt the healing power of the lotion work its magic. He felt happiness and relief from the secret he had been keeping for so long. The boy was so thankful for the lotion that he went around and told everyone about it. Everyone was amazed at the power of this lotion to help him. Finally, his secret was hidden no more.Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to sail on his toy boat in the bathtub. One day, he asked his mom if he could sail his boat in the big lake. His mom said, Be patient, Timmy. Youre not big enough yet. Timmy was sad, but he waited and waited. Finally, he grew big enough to sail his boat in the big lake. He was so excited! The day was perfect the sun was shining and the water was calm. Timmy sailed his boat for hours, but then the wind picked up and the waves got bigger. Timmy didnt know what to do. Suddenly, a big wave came and flipped his boat over. Timmy tried to swim, but he couldnt. Sadly, he drowned in the lake. The end.Once there was a prune. He was very delicate and could talk. One day, the prune heard a voice. It said Hello! Who is there? The prune was scared but brave, so he answered Im Prune. Who are you? The voice said My name is Bird. Where are you? The prune replied Im in a tree. Bird said I can help you if you want! Prune replied Yes please! I want to get down! Bird hopped over and told Prune Jump onto my back and hang on tight! Prune was brave and did what Bird said. When he jumped, he felt a strange sensation. But soon enough, Prune was on the ground. Thank you Bird! said Prune. Youre welcome, replied Bird. Be careful next time delicate Prune!Once there was a boy named Rob. He was a curious little boy who loved exploring. He was always asking his mom and dad questions. One day, while exploring in his backyard, Rob heard a strange noise. He followed the noise until he found a big pile of waste. Rob was sad to see so much waste, he wanted to make it original again. He thought and thought, until he had an idea. Rob found some boxes and started making something. With lots of hard work and creativity, Rob made an interesting toy out of the waste. He was very proud of himself. She needs a bath. He ran to the bathroom with Lily. Sara was angry. She did not want Tom to wash Lily. She knew that water would ruin her blouse and her hair. She wanted to prevent Tom from doing that. She ran after him and shouted, Stop! Give me Lily! Tom did not listen. He turned on the faucet and put Lily under the water. One day, she was picking daisies in the field when she saw her friend Ben coming towards her. Hi Lily! said Ben. What are you doing? Im picking daisies, replied Lily. Do you want to help me? Ben nodded and they picked daisies together. Suddenly, Lily had an idea. Lets throw the daisies up in the air and see where they land! she said. She couldnt wait to play with her friend again and throw more daisies in the air.Once upon a time there was a soldier. He was very tall and he was always ready to go and help. But one day, he realized he was feeling very sad. He didnt know why he felt so sad and he didnt know what to do. He thought and thought and then he decided to take a walk. As he was walking, he came across a beautiful lake. He couldnt resist and he started to fill up his bucket with the water. He filled and filled until the bucket was completely full. When he stopped to take a break, he noticed that the lake had become very full. He saw that his bucket had filled the lake. He smiled and felt better. He knew he had helped fill the lake and he felt proud that he had done something useful. His sadness soon went away and he was happy again. The tall soldier was very happy and so was everyone else in the village.Once there was a bird who loved to fly. He flew above the trees and up into the sky. He felt free as he soar in the air. One day while he was flying he saw a match on the ground. He wondered how he could get to it. Suddenly he had an idea! He swooped down and picked it up with his beak. He took the match to an organized area and made a game of it. He used sticks and leaves to make a track. He put the match on the track and then flew quickly around it. The match twirled around and around, zig zagging back and forth. The bird had a lot of fun watching the match fly!Once upon a time there was a frog. He was very messy, with dirt on his head and ribbit everywhere. He wanted to talk but he didnt know how. He hopped around looking for someone to talk to. He hopped through the forest and over the stream. He hopped past the trees and the bright flowers. Suddenly he saw a little girl. She was in her garden playing with her toys. The frog hopped right up to her. He opened his mouth and said ribbit. The girl was so surprised! She smiled and said hello frog!. The frog was so happy that he could talk. They talked and talked all day. They talked about the flowers, and the birds, and the trees. The frog never wanted to leave. The little girl and the frog were the best of friends.Once upon a time, there was a daisy. It was a very thin daisy. The daisy was sad because it was so thin. One day, it started to rain. Every day it grew a bit bigger, until it was a tall daisy with lots of happy petals. All of the petals were very bright and colourful. The daisy was so happy. Everyone said it was the happiest daisy that ever grew!Once upon a time, there was a big elephant. He was very heavy and had a long trunk. One day, he was walking in the jungle when he saw a small mouse. The mouse was very scared and asked the elephant for help. The mouse told the elephant that he needed to cut some cheese, but his knife was broken. The elephant felt sorry for the mouse and decided to help him. He used his strong trunk to cut the cheese into small pieces. The mouse was very happy and thanked the elephant. He said that he would never forget the kind elephant who helped him in his time of need. From that day on, the elephant and the mouse became good friends and they would often play together in the jungle.Once upon a time, there was a big, strong, and reliable tree. It lived in a forest for many, many years. The tree had lots of little seeds that it would scatter every year. The little seeds would grow into new trees. One day, a little squirrel named Sammy came to the tree. Sammy loved to play on the trees branches. The tree liked Sammy, too. The tree told Sammy about its seeds that it would scatter soon. Sammy was excited and wanted to help. The tree and Sammy made a plan. When the time came, Sammy would help scatter the seeds. The day came, and Sammy took the seeds and ran all around the forest. He scattered the seeds far and wide. Soon, new trees began to grow, just like the big, strong, and reliable tree. The forest became a beautiful place, and Sammy and the tree were very happy.Once upon a time, there was a happy boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and run around with his friends. Lily wanted to go home, but she did not know the way. She didnt have any grownups to help her. So she started jogging again. She ran and ran until she saw a familiar big tree. It was a really special day!Once upon a time, a wise owl and a silly monkey were playing together in the jungle. The owl was very good at games, but the monkey was not. They decided to play a game of twist and turn. The owl twisted and turned his body in funny ways, and the monkey tried to copy him. But the monkey kept falling down and laughing. After a while, the monkey got frustrated and said, Im not a good player like you, Mr. Owl. Can you teach me how to be better? The wise owl replied, Of course, my dear friend. Lets practice together every day, and soon you will be the best player in the jungle! And so, they continued to play and practice together, twisting and turning until the monkey became a very good player too. The end.One day, a little girl named Lily went out to play. She saw a delicate flower that was very pretty. Lily wanted to help the flower grow, so she thought of giving it a shower. Lily ran inside her house and got a small cup. She filled it with water and went back outside. She gave the flower a gentle shower with the water in the cup. The flower seemed to smile and say thank you to Lily. Every day, Lily would give the flower a shower. The flower grew bigger and more beautiful. Lily was happy that she could help the flower. The flower was happy too, and they became best friends.Zoe likes to count. She can count to ten with her fingers. She knows zero is when you have no fingers up. She likes to hold zero in her hand and pretend it is a ball. One day, Zoe goes to the park with her mom. She sees a big slide. She wants to go on it. She holds zero in her hand and runs to the slide. She climbs up the steps and sits on the top. But then she feels scared. The slide is too high and too fast. She wants to go back down. She cries and calls for her mom. She squeezes zero in her hand. Her mom hears her and comes to the slide. She tells Zoe to be calm and brave. She says she will catch her at the bottom. She says zero will help her too. Zoe listens to her mom. She takes a deep breath and lets go of the slide. She slides down and feels the wind in her hair. She smiles and laughs. She lands in her moms arms. She hugs her mom and shows her zero. She says zero is her friend. Her mom says she is proud of her. They go to play some more.Lila and Ben were playing in the sand. They liked to make shapes and animals with their hands and buckets. He did not like the big boy. They looked at their sand shapes. They wanted to fix them, but they did not have enough sand. Maybe we can make something else, Lila said. She had an idea. What? Ben asked. He liked Lilas ideas. Lila pointed to some shells and rocks on the beach. We can use these to make new shapes. They are harder and prettier than sand. The big boy cant break them. Ben smiled. He thought that was a good idea. He followed Lila to the shells and rocks. They picked some and started to make new shapes. They made a star, a flower, a fish, and a heart. They were happy and proud of their work. They did not let the big boy ruin their fun. They were creative and smart. I will mail you letters and pictures. And you will mail me too, right? Lily said. Of course. You are my loyal friend. I will never forget you, Ben said. They hugged and said goodbye. Ben got in the car with his mom and dad and waved to Lily. Lily waved back and watched them drive away. The next week, Lily got a letter from Ben. She was so happy. One day, a little girl came to visit the owl. She said, Mr. Owl, can you help me find my way home? The owl looked at her and said, Yes, little girl, I can help you. But first, lets gather some wood for the fireplace. They went outside and picked up wood. The little girl was happy to help. They put the wood in the fireplace, and the fire grew big and warm. As they sat by the fire, the wise owl told the little girl how to find her way home. Follow the path by the big tree, and you will find your house, he said. The little girl thanked the owl and went on her way. She followed the path and found her house. She was happy to be home and grateful for the wise owls help.Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big temple. It is very old and has many stones. Wow, look at that! Lily says. Can we go inside? I dont know, Ben says. It looks scary. Maybe there are ghosts. Lily is not afraid. She wants to see the temple. She runs to the door. Ben follows her, but he is slow. Come on, Ben! Lily calls. It is fun! They go inside the temple. It is dark and quiet. They see many pictures on the walls. They are of people and animals and stars. What are these? Ben asks. I think they are stories, Lily says. Maybe the people who lived here long ago made them. They walk around the temple. They see a big room. In the middle, there is a tall statue. It is of a man with a beard and a hat. He has a stick in his hand. Who is he? Ben asks. I dont know, Lily says. Maybe he is a king or a god. They stand in front of the statue. They look at him. He looks at them. Hello, Lily says. The statue does not answer. It does not move. Maybe he is sleeping, Ben says. Maybe, Lily says. They are quiet. They hear a noise. It is a bird. It flies into the temple. It lands on the statues hat. Shoo, shoo! Lily says. Go away! The bird does not listen. It pecks at the statues hat. It makes a hole. Uhoh, Ben says. The statues hat falls off. It breaks on the floor. The statues head cracks. Uhoh, Lily says. They hear a loud rumble. The temple shakes. The stones fall. Run! Ben says. They run to the door. They are fast. They get out of the temple. They are safe. They look at the temple. It is broken. It is sad. Im sorry, Lily says. Me too, Ben says. They hold hands. They go back to the park. They play with their toys. They are happy.Once upon a time, there was a tall giraffe named Jerry. Jerry loved to play sport with his animal friends. They would run and jump and have so much fun together. One day, they decided to play with water. Jerry had a special spray bottle that he used to cool himself down when it was hot outside. He sprayed his friends with water and they all laughed and played together. From that day on, they made sure to always have fun playing sport and spraying each other with water. The end.Tom and Sam are friends. They like to play with balls and nets. They have a big net and a small net. They want to see who has the bigger net. Tom says, I have the bigger net. Look, it is longer and wider than yours. Sam says, No, you dont. My net is bigger. Look, it has more holes and it is heavier than yours. They start to argue and pull each others nets. They are angry and loud. Mom hears them and comes to see what is wrong. She says, Stop, boys. Why are you fighting? You can share your nets and play together. Tom and Sam say, But we want to know who has the bigger net. How can we tell? Mom says, You can measure your nets. You can use a stick or a rope or a tape. You can see how long and how wide and how heavy they are. Then you can compare them and see the difference. Tom and Sam think that is a good idea. They find a stick and a rope and a scale. They measure their nets carefully. They see that Toms net is longer and wider, but Sams net has more holes and is heavier. They realize that their nets are different, but they are both good. They say, Sorry, Mom. Sorry, friend. We were silly and mean. We dont need to fight. We can play with both nets and have fun. Mom says, Thats right, boys. You can be happy with what you have and respect what others have. You can learn from each other and share your things. That is what friends do. Tom and Sam hug Mom and each other. But Max was a brave little boy and he didnt want to give up. Please, he begged, just this once? Maxs mom finally agreed. Max was so excited he put on his rash guard and climbed out onto his surfboard. The waves were bigger than he expected and he started to feel a little scared. But then he noticed a big wave coming and he realized that he could do this! Max started paddling with all his might and soon he was up and riding the wave. It was the most amazing feeling! Max caught wave after wave and kept surfing until the sun started to go down. As Max climbed off his board he realized that he had been wrong to think surfing was dangerous. The weak duck threw the mix into the pond. All the ducks stopped and looked. Then he smiled. The mix had made bubbles and the other ducks loved it. They started to play in the bubbles. She had many blocks of different shapes and sizes. She was very proud of her blocks. One day, Lilys big brother Tom came into her room. He saw her blocks and wanted to play with them too. He did not ask Lily. He just took some of her blocks and made his own tower. Lily was angry. She said, Those are my blocks! Give them back! But Tom did not listen. He said, I am bigger than you. I can play with whatever I want. He took more of her blocks and made his tower taller and taller. Lily tried to get her blocks back, but Tom pushed her away. He said, Go away, you little baby. You dont need so many blocks. You can play with something else. He laughed and made his tower even higher. Lily felt sad and mad. She wished she could make Toms tower disappear. Then, she had an idea. She saw her moms iron on the table. She knew that the iron made steam when it was hot. She also knew that steam was like water, but very hot and thin. She thought, Maybe if I make steam near Toms tower, it will make his blocks wet and soft. Then his tower will fall down and he will be sorry. She waited until Tom was not looking. She turned on the iron and moved it close to Toms tower. She saw the steam coming out of the iron. She smiled and said, Bye bye, tower! But Lily did not know that the iron was very dangerous. The steam was not only hot and thin, but also fast and strong. It did not make Toms blocks wet and soft. It made them fly away and disappear. It also made the iron fall off the table and hit the floor. The floor made a loud noise and the iron made a big spark. Tom and Lily were both scared. They screamed and ran out of the room. Their mom heard the noise and came to see what happened. She saw the iron, the spark, and the missing blocks. She was very angry and worried. She said, What did you do? You could have started a fire! You could have hurt yourselves! You are both in big trouble! Tom and Lily felt sorry and ashamed. They realized that they were both wrong. Tom was wrong to take Lilys blocks and be mean to her. Lily was wrong to use the iron and try to ruin Toms tower. They said, We are sorry, mom. We were not nice to each other. We did not think about the iron. We will not do it again. Their mom hugged them and said, I am glad you are sorry. I love you both. But you have to be careful and respectful. You have to ask before you use someone elses things. You have to share and play nicely. You have to stay away from things that can hurt you. You have to learn from your mistakes. Tom and Lily nodded and said, We will, mom. We will. They hugged each other and said, We are sorry, too. We love you, too. They went to look for their blocks. They hoped they could find them and make new towers together. Suddenly, he heard a rustling in the bushes. Out stepped two of the most beautiful animals he had ever seen! They picked up the mask and placed it back on the boys face. When she was finished organizing her sack, she added a few extra toys. They all fit nicely in the sack! She was very proud of how healthy and organized her sack was. From then on, Lola made sure her toys were always healthy and organized. The end.Sara liked to help her mom at the restaurant. Her mom cooked food for many people who came to eat. Sara helped by bringing plates, cups and napkins to the tables. She was very good at carrying things and not dropping them. One day, the restaurant was very busy. Many people wanted to eat pizza, but the pizza dough was almost gone. Saras mom asked her to go to the supply room and get more dough. Sara ran to the supply room and looked for the dough. She saw a big box with a picture of a pizza on it. She tried to lift the box, but it was too heavy for her. She saw a smaller box next to it. It had a picture of a pretzel on it. She thought, maybe this is also dough, but in a different shape. She opened the box and saw many long and flexible pieces of dough. They looked like snakes. She had an idea. She took some pieces of dough and twisted them into circles. She put them on a tray and brought them to her mom. Her mom was surprised to see the dough circles. She asked Sara, What are these? Sara said, They are pizza pretzels. I made them from the pretzel dough. Maybe the people will like them. Her mom smiled and said, That was very clever of you, Sara. You are very flexible and creative. Lets try to bake them and see what happens. They put the pizza pretzels in the oven and waited. They smelled very good. They took them out and put cheese and sauce on them. They looked like mini pizzas. They brought them to the people who wanted pizza. The people were curious and tried them. They liked them very much. They said, These are delicious. What are they called? Saras mom said, They are pizza pretzels. They are a special invention by my helper, Sara. The people clapped and cheered for Sara. Sara was very happy and proud. She helped her mom at the restaurant and made many people happy.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy who loved the ocean. The water was cold at first, but it felt good on their feet. They laughed and splashed each other. Lucy wasnt scared anymore. She loved the ocean more than ever. One day, they find a big stick on the ground. Tom picks it up and says, This is my stick. I can use it as a sword or a wand. Anna wants the stick too. She says, No, it is my stick. I saw it first. I can use it as a flute or a telescope. Tom and Anna start to pull the stick from each other. They shout and cry. They do not want to share. A lady who works in the park sees them. She walks over and says, What is going on here? Why are you fighting over a stick? Tom and Anna stop pulling. They look at the lady. They say, It is our stick. We both want it. The lady says, That is not a nice way to play. You are being spoiled. A stick is not a toy. It can hurt you or someone else. You should put it back where you found it and find something else to play with. Tom and Anna feel ashamed. They say, We are sorry, lady. You are right. We should not fight over a stick. We should share and be kind. They put the stick back on the ground. They hug each other and say, We love you, brothersister. Lets go and play on the swings. The lady smiles and says, Thats better. Im glad you made up. Have fun and be careful. She walks away. Tom and Anna run to the swings. They take turns and push each other. They laugh and have fun. She said it was dangerous, and they could fall and hurt themselves. She also said that sometimes, there was fire in the fireplace, and they could burn themselves. Tom and Lily did not like this. They wanted to climb on the fireplace. They thought it was fun and not scary. When their mom went to the kitchen, they decided to climb on the fireplace again. They did not listen to their mom. They thought they were smart and fast, and nothing bad would happen. They climbed on the shelf, and looked for something to play with. They saw a shiny metal thing, and a long black thing. They did not know what they were, but they looked interesting. Tom reached for the shiny metal thing, and pulled it. It made a loud noise, and sparks flew out of the fireplace. Tom was scared, and dropped the metal thing. It was a poker, and it hit the long black thing. The long black thing was a hose, and it had gas in it. The gas came out of the hose, and caught fire. The fire spread quickly, and made a lot of smoke and heat. Lily saw the fire, and screamed. She jumped off the shelf, and ran to the kitchen. She told their mom what happened. Their mom was angry and worried. She grabbed a fire extinguisher, and ran to the living room. She saw Tom, who was still on the shelf, and scared and crying. She sprayed the fire extinguisher, and put out the fire. She took Tom off the shelf, and hugged him. She checked if he was hurt, and he was not. She was relieved, but also very mad. She scolded Tom and Lily, and told them they were very naughty and foolish. She told them they could have died, or burned the house down. She told them they had to listen to her, and never climb on the fireplace again. She told them they had to say sorry, and go to their room. Tom and Lily said sorry, and went to their room. One day, she saw a big crane outside her window. It was lifting heavy things and making loud noises. Lily wanted to write on the crane. She thought it would look charming. She took her crayons and ran outside. She climbed on the crane and started to write. She wrote LILY in big letters. She wrote a heart and a star. She wrote a smiley face. She was having fun. But then, the crane driver saw her. He was angry. He shouted at her to get down. He said she was naughty and dangerous. He said she ruined his crane. He called her mom. Lilys mom came and took her away. She was sad and scared. She said sorry to the crane driver. She said sorry to her mom. She learned that she should not write on things that are not hers. She learned that writing is good, but only in the right place. She learned to be careful and respectful.Once upon a time, there was a big, green crocodile who lived in a swamp. He was very scary and had lots of sharp teeth. One day, a little girl was walking by the swamp and saw the crocodile. She was so scared that she ran away as fast as she could. But then, a kind man came along and saw the little girl crying. He asked her what was wrong and she told him about the crazy crocodile. The man knew just what to do he went to the store and bought some special polish. When he got back to the swamp, he used the polish to make the crocodiles teeth shiny and clean. The crocodile was so happy that he stopped being scary and became friends with the little girl. From then on, they would play together every day and have lots of fun.Anna liked to play in the attic. She had many toys there, like dolls and cars and books. She also liked to look at the old things that her grandma and grandpa had. There were boxes and bags and trunks full of clothes and pictures and letters. One day, Anna found a big hat in a trunk. It was red and fluffy and had a feather on it. She put it on her head and felt very fancy. She wanted to show it to her mom and dad. She ran to the stairs, but she did not see the loose board on the floor. Anna stepped on the board and it moved. She lost her balance and fell down the stairs. She bumped her head and her knee and her elbow. She cried out loud. The hat flew off her head and landed on a lamp. Mom and dad heard Annas cry and ran to the attic. They saw her lying on the floor, with blood on her face and her clothes. They were very scared and worried. They picked her up and hugged her. They said, Are you okay, Anna? What happened? Anna sobbed and said, I found a hat and I wanted to show you, but I fell and it hurt. And I lost the hat. Im sorry, mom and dad. Mom and dad kissed her and said, Its okay, Anna. Were not mad at you. Were glad youre not hurt too bad. Well clean your wounds and put a bandaid on them. And well find the hat. Its a very pretty hat. You look very cheerful in it.John was a little boy who really loved cars. He had a big red car and it was his favourite. Every day, he would take his car for a drive. One day, John was driving around when he drove into a dark tunnel. He could hardly see anything but he kept driving until suddenly, he heard a loud crash. His car had gone over a broken fence at the end of the tunnel. John got out of his car and looked at the broken fence. He thought it was so strange. He wanted to know who had put the fence there. Just then, a big bus drove up to the tunnel. Out popped a friendly man who said to John, What are you doing in this tunnel? John told the man about the broken fence and asked him who had put it up. The man smiled and said, Im the one who built this fence and put it here. You see, I wanted to keep everyone safe and make sure that no one got hurt by driving into this tunnel. But it looks like my fence is broken now. John thanked the man for being so kind and said goodbye. He drove away happy and content, having cleared up the mystery of the broken fence in the tunnel.One day, a little boy went outside to play. He wanted to explore the world around him. He finally reached the west. In front of him was something so bright and beautiful. He couldnt believe it was real. He stood there in awe. Lily promised to take good care of the rabbit and not to hurt it. She said she would bring it back as soon as she was done playing with it. Timmy finally agreed and let her borrow the rabbit. Benny didnt like to exercise, but his mommy bunny showed him how to hop and run around. It was impressive how much energy she had! Benny tried to do the same, and soon he was having fun while he exercised. After a few days of rest and exercise, Benny felt much better. He realized that taking care of his body was important, and he promised to exercise every day. From that day on, Benny was a healthy and happy bunny who loved to play and eat carrots even more. She gave it water and sun and said nice things to it. She hoped the plant would reply, but it never did. It only grew green leaves and sometimes flowers. One day, Lily saw a new plant in the garden. I eat bugs and sometimes birds. Who are you? Lily was surprised and scared. She had never heard a plant talk before. She ran back to her house and hugged her normal plant. You are my friend, plant. You dont eat bugs or birds. You are nice and quiet and pretty, she said. The normal plant did not reply, but it seemed to smile. Lily felt happy and safe with her plant. So, he trudged over, his feet clamoring over the soft grass. When he was close enough, he stopped and gazed at the stone. It was beautiful, with swirls of green and blues. He wanted it to be his, so he carefully picked it up. He stared at it for a few moments more, then shuffled away, admiring his sparkling new treasure. Ted was always very careful whenever he went out for his adventure. One day, as he was hopping around, he saw a very yummy looking carrot. He said to himself I must have a bite of this delicious carrot. So Ted hopped closer and took a big bite! It was the yummiest carrot Ted had ever tasted, but something was different about this carrot. As it slipped down his throat, he felt a strange wetness. So Ted hopped over to a nearby pond to take a look. The pond was full of tasty carrot juices! He quickly hopped back to the carrot patch and found that all the carrots had soaked up all the water from the pond! Wow! Ted said, Im so lucky I got here quick. I need to be careful next time! Ted hopped away with a full tummy, happy to have had such a great adventure. All thanks to that one special carrot!Once upon a time, there was a frog who was scared of taking risks. He blows on the boat and makes it move across the tub. They play for a long time. The sun is hot and the water is cool. They get wet and so do their toys. Uhoh, Mom is calling us! Sara says. She hears Moms voice from the house. Time to come in, kids! Lunch is ready! Mom says. Sara and Tom get out of the tub. They pick up their toys and run to the house. Wait, we have to dry our toys! Tom says. He remembers that water can make toys go bad. Youre right, Tom. Youre very smart! Sara says. She agrees with Tom. They find a towel and wipe their toys. They make sure they are not wet anymore. Good job, kids! You took good care of your toys! Mom says. She smiles and hugs them. They go inside and eat their lunch. They are happy and hungry. They still have their yellow duck and blue boat. They will play with them again later.Lily and Tom were playing in the park. They liked to run and jump and slide. But today, the park was full of fog. They could not see very far. Where are you, Tom? Lily called. She could not see her friend. Im here, Lily! Tom answered. He was on the swings. He tried to swing high, but the fog made him slow. He could not see the trees or the sky. Lily ran to the swings. She saw Toms shape in the fog. She smiled and joined him. They swung together, back and forth. Lets raise our hands and touch the fog! Lily said. She thought the fog was soft and cool. OK, lets do it! Tom said. He liked to try new things. They raised their hands and reached for the fog. They felt the wet air on their fingers. They giggled and swung faster. The fog was like a big blanket. It made them feel cozy and happy. They did not mind that they could not see very far. They had each other and the swings. They had fun in the fog.Once upon a time, there was a big, strong robot made of steel. He was very powerful and could lift heavy things with ease. One day, he was walking in the park and he saw a little girl crying. He went to her and asked her what was wrong. She said that she had torn her favorite teddy bear and couldnt fix it. The robot felt sad for the little girl and wanted to help her. He used his powerful arms to tear a piece of steel from his body and gave it to her. He showed her how to use it to fix her teddy bear. The little girl was very happy and hugged the robot, thanking him for his kindness. From that day on, the robot and the little girl became friends. They would often play together in the park and the robot would always be there to help her whenever she needed it. And the little girl never forgot how the robot had torn a piece of steel from his body to help her fix her teddy bear.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom loved to play at the gym. Just then, the nosy little girl had a great idea. She ran to her mommys bedroom and opened a small box. Inside the box was a key! She took the key and ran to the kitchen. The little girl put the key in the lock and turned it. The freezer clicked and the nosy little girl opened the door. To the nosy little girls surprise, inside the freezer was ice cream! She was so excited that she called her mommy to share the good news. Jumpy thought and he realized the voice was right. He knew he had to be gentle. He carefully teetered to the edge of the hoop, he held his breath and he hopped! He made it! He had jumped over the hoop without breaking it! He was joyous and he did a happy dance around the hoop. Jumpy learnt that day that if he took care and was gentle, he could do anything he wanted. Jack wanted to show Jill something special, so he held up a small cube and said, This is my special cube. It is dependable and I always keep it with me. Jill asked, What does it do? Jack grinned and said, It doesnt do much, but I always rely on it. It reminds me to be kind and dependable. Confused, Jill asked, What do you mean? Jack replied, If Im feeling sad or scared, I look at my cube and it reminds me that I can always rely on myself and my friends. Jill smiled and nodded. She said, Thats a nice message. We should always be kind and dependable to each other. The two friends held hands and continued walking thoughtfully through the forest. The moral of this story is to always put others needs before your own and to be dependable when others need you.Once upon a time, there was a little bear. He was ready for a big adventure but he wasnt sure what he should do. So he decided to take a walk in the woods. As he walked, he heard a sound. It was a raven, cawing in the tree above. The ravens beak glowed in the moonlight. The little bear could feel the bright light shining all around him and he knew something special was coming. The little bear kept walking and soon he saw a cave. He was scared, but he was also brave and he was ready to explore. He stepped into the cave and saw a glowing object in the distance. The raven flew into the cave and landed next to the glowing object. The little bear saw that the object was a magical gem. He wanted to take it with him but the raven wouldnt let him. He was ready to fight the raven, but just when they were about to fight, a bright flash of light filled the cave and a beautiful fairy appeared. The fairy told them that the gem was an important part of their magical forest, and that it was their job to protect it. So the little bear and the raven understood, and the raven left in peace. The little bear was relieved. He now knew what his adventure was aboutto guard the gem and protect the magical forest.Once upon a time, there was a girl named Eva who was three years old. She was very happy and loved playing with her toys. But Eva was also curious. She wanted to do something special. So one day, Eva asked her mom if she could learn how to cook. Her mom said yes and taught her all kinds of dishes. Eva was very proud and happy that she could make all these amazing meals. But Eva wanted to do something else as well. She asked her mom to teach her a new skill and her mom said she could learn how to play the violin. Eva was so excited! She practiced every day and became very good at it. At the end of the summer, Eva entered a competition where she could show off her cooking and violin skills. Everyone was so impressed with her√¢she had really improved! Her cooking was special, and her violin playing was truly impressive. Eva won first prize and everyone praised her talent. Eva smiled and was very proud of herself. She had made her wish come true!Ben and Mia like to play in the big room with many books and papers. They see a big box with a lock on it. They want to know what is inside. They look for a key, but they cannot find one. They see a metal thing that looks like a stick. It is a file. They think it can open the lock. They take the file and try to put it in the lock. They push and pull, but nothing happens. They hear a loud noise. It is a beep. They look at the box. It has a red light and a number. The number is going down. 10, 9, 8... They do not know what it means. They are scared. They tremble. They want to run away, but they do not know how. The door is locked too. They scream for help, but no one hears them. The number is going down. 3, 2, 1... The box explodes. It makes a big fire and a big boom. It hurts Ben and Mia. They fall down and do not get up. The box was dangerous. It was a bomb. Someone put it there to hurt people. Ben and Mia did not know. They just wanted to play. They are gone. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily was playing outside in her backyard when she saw a wild mole digging a hole. Hello, little mole, said Lily. What are you doing? Im digging a home, said the mole. Oh, can I help? asked Lily. Yes, please, said the mole. Lily got a shovel and helped the mole dig its home. When they were finished, the mole was very happy. Thank you for helping me, said the mole. Youre welcome, said Lily. I had fun getting dirty with you. From that day on, Lily visited the mole every day and they became the best of friends.Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was three years old. She woke up early one morning. She felt a bit worried. She looked around her room. She was all alone. She saw something in the corner of the room. It was her teddy bear. She picked it up with her hand. Then she heard something outside in the garden. It was her Mummy and Daddy! She was so happy! So she went to the window and waved to them with her hand. They waved back and smiled. She wasnt worried anymore. She smiled back and went downstairs to give them a big hug. The end.Tim and Sue liked to play in the park with their dog, Max. They liked to run, slide, swing and throw a ball for Max to catch. One day, they saw a big van in the park. It was white and had many pictures on it. They wanted to see what was inside. They walked to the van and saw a door. They opened the door and saw many books and toys. They were very happy and started to look at them. They did not see the elderly man who was sleeping in the back of the van. He was the owner of the van and he was very tired. The elderly man woke up and heard some noise. He got up and went to the front of the van. He saw Tim and Sue playing with his books and toys. He was not happy and shouted at them. He told them to get out of his van and leave his things alone. Tim and Sue were very scared and ran out of the van. They grabbed Max and ran to their mom, who was sitting on a bench. They told her what happened and she hugged them. She told them they should not go inside a strangers van without asking. She said it was not safe and it was not nice. Tim and Sue said they were sorry and they learned their lesson. They said they would not do it again. They asked their mom if they could play some more in the park. She said yes, but they had to stay close to her. They agreed and went to play. They saw the elderly man drive away in his van. They waved at him and said sorry. He waved back and smiled. He was not so angry anymore. He lay down in his van and took a nap. He dreamed of his books and toys.One day, a little girl named Lily went to the zoo with her mom. She saw many animals, like monkeys, lions, and giraffes. She wanted to see the elephants, because they had big ears and long noses. Mom, can we go see the elephants? Lily asked. Sure, honey. Lets go this way, Mom said. They walked to the elephant enclosure, where they saw two big elephants and a baby elephant. The baby elephant was playing with a ball, and the big elephants were eating hay. Look, Mom, the baby elephant is so cute! Lily said. Yes, he is. Do you want to introduce yourself to him? Mom asked. Lily nodded. She walked closer to the fence, and waved at the baby elephant. The baby elephant saw her, and came closer too. He lifted his trunk, and sniffed Lily. Hello, little elephant. My name is Lily. What is your name? Lily said. The baby elephant made a loud noise, and flapped his ears. He seemed happy to meet Lily. His name is Nelly. He is very friendly, a zookeeper said. He came over to the fence, and smiled at Lily and Mom. Hi, Im Sam. I take care of the elephants. Do you like them? he asked. Yes, I love them. They are big and smart and funny, Lily said. Im glad you do. Do you want to feed them some carrots? Sam asked. Yes, please! Lily said. Sam gave Lily and Mom some carrots, and showed them how to hold them for the elephants. Lily and Mom fed the carrots to Nelly and the big elephants. They crunched them with their teeth, and thanked them with their trunks. Lily and Mom had a lot of fun with the elephants. They thanked Sam for letting them feed them. Youre welcome. Come back anytime, Sam said. Lily and Mom said goodbye to the elephants, and went to see other animals. He held up a shiny coin. Wow, that is cool! Sue said. Where did you find it? It was under the sofa. Maybe it is a treasure, Tom said. Maybe we can buy something with it, Sue said. The lady had a big smile on her face as she watched Sue got away. She looked forward to seeing Sue again soon.Bunny and Squirrel were best friends. They liked to play in the forest and find nuts and carrots. One day, they saw a big pile of nuts near a tree. They ran to the pile and started to eat. Yum, these nuts are so good! said Bunny. Lets take some to our homes! said Squirrel. They filled their cheeks with nuts and ran to their holes. But they did not see that the pile of nuts belonged to Bear. Bear was sleeping under the tree. He woke up and saw his nuts were gone. Who took my nuts? he roared. He followed the trail of nuts to Bunnys hole. He saw Bunny hiding inside. Bunny, did you take my nuts? he asked. Bunny felt guilty. He knew he did a bad thing. He nodded his head. Im sorry, Bear. I was hungry and I did not know they were yours, he said. Bear was angry. He wanted his nuts back. He reached into the hole and tried to grab Bunny. But the hole was too small for his paw. He got stuck. Ow, ow, ow! he cried. Squirrel heard Bears cry. He ran to Bunnys hole. He saw Bears paw in the hole. He saw Bunnys scared face. Bunny, are you okay? he asked. No, Squirrel. Bear is mad at me. He wants his nuts back. But I ate them all, said Bunny. Squirrel felt sorry for Bunny. He also felt guilty. He knew he did a bad thing too. He had some nuts in his hole. He decided to share them with Bear. Squirrel, what are you doing? asked Bunny. Im going to give some of my nuts to Bear. Maybe he will forgive us and let us go, said Squirrel. He ran to his hole and brought some nuts. He gave them to Bear. Here, Bear. These are some of the nuts we took. We are sorry. Please let us go, he said. Bear looked at the nuts. He looked at Squirrel. He looked at Bunny. He saw they were sorry. He felt a little better. Thank you, Squirrel. That was very nice of you. I forgive you and Bunny. But dont take my nuts again. They are mine, he said. He pulled his paw out of the hole. He took his nuts and walked away. Bunny and Squirrel came out of the hole. They hugged each other. Thank you, Squirrel. You are a good friend, said Bunny. Thank you, Bunny. You are a good friend too, said Squirrel. They learned their lesson. They never took nuts that were not theirs again. They played in the forest and found nuts and carrots that were free. They were happy.Lily likes hockey. It stopped smiling and its sails drooped down. All of the fish and birds that had been its friends felt very sad. The ship wanted to get better, so it sailed away and looked for help. But everyone it asked for help said no. The ship sailed for many days and felt very lonely. Finally, the ship found a special place called Home. It was a happy place where a boy and girl lived. They made the ship feel better. They gave it a hug and put special bandages on its hurt. The ship was so happy to have found Home! It didnt want to leave, but knew it had to. Jack was proud of his work. As the sun began to set, Jack knew it was time to go inside. He said goodbye to his snowman and promised to come back and play again tomorrow. A man at the gate says they have to pay money to play. Toms dad does not have money. He forgot his wallet at home. He says sorry to Tom and the man. He says they have to go back and get the money. Tom is upset. He wants to play golf with his dad. He does not want to go back. He cries and stamps his feet. He says it is not fair. His dad tries to calm him down. He says they can come back another day. He says they can do something else fun. Tom does not listen. He runs away from his dad. He sees a golf cart. He thinks it is a toy. He gets in and pushes a button. The golf cart starts to move. Tom is scared. He does not know how to stop it. He screams for his dad. His dad hears him and runs after him. He catches up with the golf cart and jumps in. He stops the cart and hugs Tom. He says he is glad he is safe. He says he is sorry he ran away. He says he is sorry he made him upset. He says he loves him. Tom says he is sorry too. He says he loves him too. He says he does not need to play golf. He says he just wants to be with him. They hug and smile. They go back to the gate and say sorry to the man. The man is nice. He says they can play golf for free. He says he likes to see happy dads and sons. Tom and his dad thank him and go to play golf. They have a lot of fun.Once upon a time, there was a boy who loved to help others. Every morning, he would get dressed and rush off to his class. He walked over to them and asked, √¢≈ìCan I help?√¢ The new students were so happy for the help, and thanked him for it. Everyone in the class felt so happy and thankful for his kind help that day.Anna likes to help her mom in the kitchen. She wants to be a good cook like her mom. One day, mom asks Anna to get a pan from the shelf. Anna sees a big pan that looks shiny and new. She wants to use that pan. Can I have this pan, mom? Anna asks, pointing to the big pan. No, Anna, that pan is too big for you. You need a smaller pan that fits your hands. The big pan is heavy and hot. You might drop it and hurt yourself or make a mess. Mom says. But I want to try, mom. Please, let me have the big pan. Anna says, not listening to mom. Okay, Anna, but be careful. You have to balance the pan with both hands and not let it touch the stove. Mom says, hoping Anna will learn her lesson. Anna takes the big pan and tries to carry it to the counter. But the pan is too big and heavy for her. She cant balance it well. She feels the pan slipping from her hands. She tries to catch it, but it is too late. The pan falls to the floor with a loud bang. It makes a dent in the floor and a scratch in the pan. Anna is scared and sad. She starts to cry. Anna, are you okay? What happened? Mom runs to Anna and hugs her. Im sorry, mom. I dropped the big pan. I wanted to use it, but it was too big for me. I couldnt balance it. I made a big noise and a big mess. I ruined the pan and the floor. Anna says, sobbing. Its okay, Anna. Im glad you are not hurt. The pan and the floor can be fixed. But you have to listen to me next time. I know what is best for you. You have to use things that fit you and your skills. You cant do everything by yourself. You have to ask for help when you need it. That is how you learn and grow. Mom says, wiping Annas tears. I understand, mom. Im sorry I didnt listen to you. I will use the smaller pan next time. And I will ask for help when I need it. Thank you for teaching me, mom. I love you. Anna says, smiling. I love you too, Anna. You are a good girl. Now, lets clean up this mess and make some cookies with the smaller pan. How does that sound? Mom says, smiling too. Yay! I love cookies. And I love you, mom. Anna says, hugging mom. The end.Jimmy was so excited. He was going to get a sack! It was gray, his favorite color. He took it outside and put it in the grass and started jumping in it. He was having so much fun! Then, surprisingly, a voice came out. Hey! What are you doing? it said. Jimmy looked up and saw his neighbor, Mrs. Jones. She had a very serious look on her face. Im jumping in my sack, Jimmy said. Mrs. Jones didnt look happy. You should not be doing that. Thats against the rules, she said. Jimmy looked down, feeling sad. He didnt understand why Mrs. Jones had to be so mean. Im just trying to do my job, and the rules dont allow you to jump in a sack in the grass. Jimmy thought about what she said. He realized that Mrs. Jones wasnt trying to be mean she was just trying to keep him safe. He smiled and said, Sorry, Mrs. Jones.Jack was playing in the garden one day when he heard a tiny cry coming from behind the tree. He went to investigate and found a small caterpillar nestled in the grass. He carefully picked it up and noticed it had a broken wing. He had to help it! Jack ran inside and asked his dad for some glue. His dad found some and gave it to Jack. Jack took the glue and some leaves and went back to the caterpillar. He used the glue to carefully stick the leaves together and make a little patch for the caterpillars broken wing. Now it could fly again! The caterpillar thanked Jack. Jack was so pleased that he gave it a little pinch on the cheek to show his appreciation. But then, a selfish spider came along and scolded the caterpillar. You shouldnt have accepted Jacks help, he said. You will have to do everything yourself now. Jack was furious. He looked at the spider with his big eyes and said sternly, Its better to be kind and help others, than to be selfish like you! The spider scurried away and Jack smiled. He was so excited to meet new friends! He plodded around the meadow looking for someone to meet. He could smell a little cub nearby. He crept up slowly, trying not to make too much noise. He found a little cub, cuddled up in a bush! The leopard slowly stepped closer and said hello. The cub was startled but before he could run away, the leopard assured him he was just saying hi. The cub eventually smiled and hopped up to meet his new friend. He and the leopard spent the afternoon playing together around the meadow. They laughed and ran around the cub was amazed at how fast the leopard ran! Before it got too dark, the cub said goodbye to his new friend and they hugged tightly. The cub was sad to see the leopard go, but he was looking forward to meeting him again soon.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and read books. One day, she was playing hideandseek with her friend, Timmy. She hid behind the enormous bookcase in the living room. Timmy looked for her everywhere, but he couldnt find her. Finally, he saw her little feet sticking out from behind the bookcase. I found you, Lily! he shouted. Lily giggled and said, You did! But now its my turn to find you. She crawled out from behind the bookcase and stood up. Suddenly, she kicked her toy car and it went flying across the room. Oops! Lily said, I didnt mean to do that. Lets go play something else. And off they went to play with their dolls.One day, Jill the giraffe was walking through the savanna and admiring the beautiful scenery. She saw the tall trees, blue skies, and the animals scurrying around. Suddenly, she spotted a pile of dust on the ground. When she got closer, she saw that the dust was actually a delicate porcupine teddy bear. Jill wanted to take it with her, but she couldnt find anyone around. Jill was about to leave when she heard a voice Why are you taking my toy? It was Sophie the elephant, and she looked really sad. Jill quickly apologized and told Sophie that she was just admiring the teddy bear, and she offered to help Sophie find it. The two friends went on a long hunt until they finally located the teddy bear. When they got it, Sophie was so glad that she hugged Jill, thanked her and ran home. The moral of the story is that friendship and kindness can help us through difficult times. The moral of the story is that sharing is important and being graceful can solve conflicts.Lila and Ben were playing on the beach. They liked to dig in the sand and look for shells. They found many shells of different colors and shapes. Some were big, some were small, some were smooth, some were rough. Look, Lila, I found a weird shell! Ben said, holding up a shell that was round and spiky. It has little holes in it. What do you think is inside? Lila looked at the shell and shrugged. I dont know. Maybe a bug or a fish. Do you want to open it and see? Ben nodded. He was curious. He tried to pull the shell apart, but it was too hard. He tried to hit it with a rock, but it was too strong. He tried to poke it with a stick, but it was too sharp. Ow! Ben cried, dropping the shell. It hurt me! Lila ran to him and hugged him. Are you okay, Ben? Let me see your hand. Ben showed her his hand. It had a small cut and a drop of blood. Lila took a tissue from her pocket and wrapped it around his hand. Its okay, Ben. Its just a little cut. It will heal soon. Dont touch the shell anymore. Its mean. Ben nodded. He felt better. He looked at the shell and saw something move inside. He gasped. Lila, look! The shell is alive! Something is coming out of it! Lila looked at the shell and saw a small creature with legs and claws and eyes. It was a crab. It crawled out of the shell and scuttled away. Wow! Lila said. It was a crab! It was hiding in the shell. It was scared of us. Thats why it hurt you. It wanted to protect itself. Ben nodded. He understood. He felt sorry for the crab. He wished he had not tried to open the shell. Im sorry, crab, Ben said. I didnt mean to hurt you. I hope you find a new shell. A nice one. Goodbye, crab. Lila smiled. She took Bens hand and they walked away. They left the shell on the sand. They hoped the crab would release it and find a new home. They learned something new that day.
