The shopkeeper said no and the little girl started to cry. She tried to open the window to take her hat, but the shopkeeper grabbed her. The little girl screamed and screamed, but nobody heard her. The shopkeeper pushed her out of the store and locked the window. The little girl went home with her broken hat, feeling worse than before. She never got her new hat, and she never saw the shopkeeper again.Sara likes to make things with clay. She has many colors of clay and some tools to shape them. She wants to make a cup for her mom. She thinks mom will like a cup to drink tea or water. She takes some blue clay and rolls it into a long snake. She bends the snake into a circle and presses the ends together. This is the bottom of the cup. She takes some yellow clay and makes a flat circle. She puts it on top of the blue circle and presses them together. This is the top of the cup. She makes a hole in the middle of the yellow circle with her finger. She makes the hole bigger and bigger until it is the size of her fist. She smooths the edges of the hole with her thumb. She takes some red clay and makes a small snake. She attaches one end of the snake to the side of the cup and the other end to the opposite side. This is the handle of the cup. She looks at her cup and smiles. She thinks it is very pretty and useful. She is proud of her work. She shows her cup to her mom and says, Look, mom, I made a cup for you! Mom hugs her and says, Thank you, Sara, this is a wonderful cup! You are very successful at making things with clay! Sara feels happy and loved. She gives her cup to mom and says, You can use it for tea or water or anything you like! Mom says, I will use it every day and think of you! They both smile and drink some tea from the cup.Lily and Tom were playing with their toys in the living room. They had a lot of fun making a big castle with blocks, cars, dolls and animals. They used glue to stick some parts together, so the castle would not fall down. Look, this is the king and the queen, and this is their baby princess, Lily said, showing Tom her dolls. They live in the castle and they are very happy. Thats nice, Lily, Tom said, nodding. And this is the dragon, he is very big and strong. He protects the castle from bad guys. He can breathe fire and fly in the sky. Wow, Tom, your dragon is cool, Lily said, admiring his toy. Can he be friends with the king and the queen? Sure, he can, Tom said, smiling. He is a good dragon, not a mean one. He likes the castle and the people in it. They played for a while, making up stories and sounds for their toys. They were having a lot of fun, until they heard a loud noise from the kitchen. What was that? Lily asked, scared. I dont know, lets go see, Tom said, curious. They left their toys on the floor and ran to the kitchen. There they saw their big brother Sam, who had knocked over a jar of cookies and made a mess. Sam, what are you doing? Lily asked, angry. I was hungry, and I wanted a cookie, Sam said, shrugging. But the jar was too high, and I dropped it. You are so clumsy, Sam, Tom said, shaking his head. You broke the jar and the cookies. Mom will be mad at you. Sam looked at the broken jar and the crumbs on the floor. He felt bad and sorry. He didnt mean to make a mess. He wished he could fix it. Maybe we can help you, Sam, Lily said, kindly. We have glue, we can glue the jar back together. Really? You would do that for me? Sam asked, surprised. Sure, we would, Tom said, nodding. You are our brother, and we love you. And glue is important, it can fix things. They ran back to the living room and got the glue. They carefully glued the pieces of the jar together, and put the cookies back inside. They were very proud of their work. Thank you, Lily and Tom, Sam said, hugging them. You are the best. You saved me from trouble. Youre welcome, Sam, Lily and Tom said, smiling. But next time, ask mom for a cookie, okay? Okay, I will, Sam said, nodding. And next time, can I play with you and your castle? Okay, you can, Lily and Tom said, nodding. But you have to be careful, and not break anything. Okay, I will, Sam said, nodding. And I will protect the castle with you and your dragon. They all laughed and hugged. They were happy and glad. They were a family, and they stuck together. Just like glue.Tom and Lily are playing in the house. They like to make forts with pillows and blankets. They find a big blanket in the closet and drag it to the living room. They see the stairs and have an idea. Lets make a slide! Tom says. We can remove the pillows from the couch and put them on the stairs. Then we can slide down the blanket! Okay! Lily says. That sounds fun! They work together to remove the pillows and pile them on the stairs. They spread the blanket over the pillows and the stairs. They climb to the top of the stairs and look down. Are you ready? Tom asks. Im ready! Lily says. They hold hands and slide down the blanket. They go very fast and feel the wind in their hair. They laugh and scream. But they slide too fast and too far. They reach the end of the blanket and the pillows. They fly off the stairs and land on the floor. They hit their heads and their arms and their legs. They cry and cry. Mom hears the noise and runs to the living room. She sees Tom and Lily on the floor, bleeding and bruised. She sees the blanket and the pillows and the stairs. She is very angry and very scared. What have you done? Mom yells. You could have killed yourselves! You are very naughty and very stupid! She picks up Tom and Lily and takes them to the car. She drives them to the hospital. They need stitches and bandages and medicine. They are in a lot of pain and a lot of trouble. They are not happy. They are sorry.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat candy and cookies all day long. One day, Lilys mommy told her it was time for bed. Lily didnt want to go to bed because she was not sleepy yet. Her mommy said, Lily, you have to go to bed now. You can taste more candy tomorrow. Lily went to bed but she couldnt sleep. She saw a spider on the wall and she thought it was interesting. She wanted to catch it, so she got out of bed. Suddenly, she fell and hit her head on the floor. Her mommy heard the noise and came to check on her. She saw that Lily was hurt and took her to the hospital. The doctors said that Lily had to stay in the hospital for a long time. Lily was sad because she couldnt eat candy and cookies in the hospital. She wished she had listened to her mommy and stayed in bed. The end.Once upon a time, there was a cow named Daisy. Daisy was very hungry and wanted to eat some grass. She went to a field where the grass was very wide and green. Daisy started to eat the grass and was very happy. Suddenly, a big bad wolf appeared. The wolf wanted to eat Daisy! Daisy was scared and started to run away. She ran and ran until she found a gate. She closed the gate and the wolf couldnt get in. Daisy was safe! From that day on, Daisy always made sure to close the gate behind her when she went into a field. She never wanted to be scared like that again.Once upon a time there was a pepper who was very troubled. He was feeling very sad and he didnt know why. He went looking for help and he found a friend who said she had a plan. His friend took out a big knife and she said, I will cut the pepper into lots of little pieces. This will make you feel much better. The pepper was very scared but he agreed. The friend carefully cut the pepper into pieces using the sharp knife. When she finished, the pepper really did feel better. His sadness had gone away. The pepper thanked his friend for helping him. He went away feeling happy and free. The end.Sara and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big tree with many roots. The roots are like long arms that come out of the ground. Lets visit the tree, Sara says. Maybe we can find some bugs or worms. OK, Tom says. But be careful. The roots are hard and rough. They can hurt you if you fall. They run to the tree and start to look for bugs or worms. They see some ants, a spider, and a snail. They are happy and curious. Look, Sara, I found a snail! Tom says. It has a shell and a slimy body. It moves very slow. Wow, Tom, thats cool! Sara says. Can I see it? Tom gives Sara the snail. Sara holds it in her hand and looks at it. She smiles. Hello, snail, she says. You are cute and funny. Do you like the tree? The snail does not answer. It hides in its shell. Suddenly, Sara trips on a root. She falls and drops the snail. The snail falls on a rock and breaks its shell. Sara and Tom are shocked and sad. Oh no, Sara, are you OK? Tom asks. He helps Sara get up. Im OK, Tom, but look at the snail! Sara says. She points at the snail. The snail is still and quiet. Oh no, Sara, Im sorry! Tom says. He picks up the snail. The snail does not move. Im sorry, too, Tom! Sara says. She starts to cry. We hurt the snail. We were not careful. We were bad. They hug each other and cry. They feel sorry for the snail. They wish they could fix the snail. They decide to bury the snail under the tree. They dig a small hole with their hands. They put the snail in the hole. They cover the snail with dirt and leaves. They say goodbye to the snail. Goodbye, snail, Sara says. We are sorry we hurt you. We hope you are happy in the ground. We will not forget you. Goodbye, snail, Tom says. We are sorry we hurt you. We hope you are safe in the ground. We will remember you. They leave the tree and go back to their parents. They tell their parents what happened. Their parents hug them and comfort them. They tell them they are sorry for the snail, too. They tell them they are not bad, but they should be more careful. They tell them they are proud of them for being honest and kind. Sara and Tom feel a little better. They learn a lesson. They promise to be more careful and respectful of the bugs and worms. They thank their parents and their friends. They still miss the snail. They hope the snail is OK.Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived an elderly lady. She had many books that she loved to read. She tried to hold it in, but she couldnt. Achoo! she sneezed, and her book flew out of her hands. The elderly lady looked around for her book. She found it under the table. She picked it up, wiped her nose, and went back to her big chair. She smiled and started reading her book again. And from that day on, she always had a tissue nearby, just in case she needed to sneeze.Once upon a time, there was a panda. She liked to peek out of her cave early in the morning. The cat responded, I was planning to change my ways and do something nice. I thought I would try to catch a fish. The frog smiled and said, I understand, but why dont you help me instead? The wolf might find us. But Tom was stubborn. He wanted to see the wolf. He wanted to be brave. He shook off Mias hand. No, Mia. I want to see the wolf. Maybe I can scare it away with my spear. You stay here. I will go and look. Mia did not understand. She did not want to stay alone. She did not want Tom to go. She tried to stop him. No, Tom. Dont go. The wolf might hurt you. Please, Tom. Come with me. But Tom did not listen. He ran to the big rock. He peeked behind it. He saw a big, black wolf. The wolf saw him too. It growled and bared its teeth. It jumped at Tom. Tom screamed. He dropped his stick. He turned and ran. He ran back to Mia. He grabbed her hand. He said, Mia, you were right. The wolf is big and bad. Lets go home. I am sorry I was stubborn. Mia hugged him. She said, Its okay, Tom. I am glad you are safe. Lets go home. Maybe we can play something else tomorrow. They ran out of the woods. They did not look back. They did not hear the wolf howl again.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play and discover new things. One day, he found a candle in a box. Tim showed the candle to his mom. Look, Mom! I found a candle! he said. His mom smiled and said, Great job, Tim! That candle can give us light when it is dark. That night, Tim wanted to use the candle. He asked his mom, Can we use the candle now? His mom said, Yes, but be careful. The fire can be hot. Tim felt a little embarrassed because he did not know that. Tim and his mom lit the candle together. They watched the candle glow in the dark. Tim felt happy that he discovered the candle. They had a cozy night with the candles light.The sun was high in the sky and the day was hot. Suddenly, it started to rain. The drops of rain were big and heavy. Emily looked up at the sky, excitedly. She opened her mouth and let the raindrops hit her tongue. They tasted cool and sweet. Next, Emily went outside and saw a puddle of orange water. She smiled and went closer. She picked up a small dish and scooped up some of the water. She played with it, making figures in the mud. The rain stopped, but Emily stayed outside. She played with her dish of orange water, until it disappeared in the sun. Emily was happy and covered in mud. But she also had a big smile on her face. She knew that it would rain again soon.Once upon a time, there was a grumpy old man who lived in a hotel. He didnt like to see any children and he always said Go away! when they visited. He bet down and looked around until he found the teddy bear. Then he walked outside, picked it up and handed it to Lily. Lily thanked him with a big smile and he couldnt help but smile back. The grumpy man realised that being grumpy was unnecessary. From then on, he started to welcome the children in the hotel and make them feel special.Once upon a time, there was a big tree with deep roots. The tree was very happy because it had many friends. One day, a big storm came and the wind blew very hard. Some of the trees friends fell down, but the tree remained strong because of its deep roots. The tree was very sad that its friends were gone, but it knew that they were still there in the ground. The trees roots went deep into the dirt to find its friends roots. The tree was happy to find that its friends roots were still there and they were still alive. From that day on, the tree and its friends remained together and grew even stronger. The tree was very proud of its deep roots because they helped it to stay strong and keep its friends safe. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. So he climbed inside the crib and lay down. Jake was snuggled up with his favourite teddy and he wasnt so scared anymore. He knew he could always go back to his crib if he ever felt frightened again.Lila and Tom were on a big boat with their mom and dad. They were going to an island for a holiday. Lila liked to look at the water and the fish. Tom liked to play with his toy cars and make them speed on the deck. Look, Tom, there is the island! Lila said, pointing to a green spot in the distance. It has palm trees and sand and shells. Maybe we can find some treasure there! Tom put down his cars and looked at the island. He smiled and said, Yes, Lila, maybe we can. But we have to be careful. Lila nodded and said, OK, Tom, we will be careful. But we will also have fun. I cant wait to get to the island and explore! The boat got closer and closer to the island. The old man shook his head and said, √¢≈ìOh, that poor apple.√¢ He went on his way, but he couldn√¢t stop thinking about the poor old apple. He decided that he must help. So he went home and got some news. He came back with the news and planted it around the apple. Soon enough, the news grew and the old apple stopped looking so brown and rotted. The old man smiled and said, √¢≈ìAh, now you look better!√¢ The old man was so happy that he shared the good news with everyone he met. He told them, √¢≈ìThe old apple is happy again! When he got to the farm, he tried to find something he could lift, but everything seemed too heavy for him. Then he saw a big rock. He tried to lift it, but it was too tough for him. Suddenly, he remembered the napkin he was carrying in his mouth. He put it over the rock and started to push with all his might. Finally, the rock started to move. He was so proud that he could move something so heavy. The other cows in the farm were happy too! They clapped and cheered for the tough cow. She loved to play in the garden and dig in the soil. One day, she found a little worm who was very sad. Why are you sad? asked Lily. I lost my way home, said the worm. Dont worry, said Lily, I will help you find your way home. I am a compassionate friend. Lily picked up the worm and placed him on a leaf. She carried the leaf and walked around the garden. Where is your home? asked Lily. Its over there, said the worm, pointing to a patch of soil. Lily gently placed the worm back into the soil. Dont be sad anymore, said Lily, you are back home now. The worm was very happy and thanked Lily for her kindness. You are a good friend, said the worm. I am happy to comfort you, said Lily. From that day on, Lily and the worm were the best of friends and they played together in the garden every day.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to the fair with her mommy and daddy. They had so much fun riding on the merrygoround and eating cotton candy. But then, Lilys mommy bought her a muffin. Lily was so happy to eat it, but she forgot it on a bench when she went to ride on the Ferris wheel. When she came back, the muffin was gone! Lily was very sad and cried a lot. But then, a kind lady found the muffin and gave it back to Lily. Lily was so happy and hugged the lady. From that day on, Lily always remembered to hold onto her muffin tightly and not forget it again.Once there was a bald man who lived in a house by the sea. The man loved to look out the window and watch the waves. But one day, he was having trouble seeing the waves. A big curtain was in his way! The man tried and tried to get the curtain to move. He grabbed it, he pulled it nothing was working. He was about to give up when he had an idea. He tried standing on his chair and pushing the curtain aside. This time it worked! The man smiled as he saw the waves out the window again. He was so happy that he wanted to show his friends. He opened his door and took one step out but was stopped by a big curtain! He couldnt believe it. But he didnt give up. The man tried and tried, and eventually he was able to get the curtain out of the way. He stepped outside and showed his friends the beautiful view. From then on, the man was never bothered by curtains again.Once upon a time there were two little kids named Susie and Emmie. One day, they wanted to go the park to play together. So they put on their coats and left the house. But soon after they left, Susie fell and hurt her arm. She started to cry. Luckily, an ambulance came and took her to the hospital. The ambulance was big and noisy and very filthy. At the hospital, the doctor checked Susies arm. He said it would be okay with some rest. So the doctor put Susie in a special bed and gave her some yummy ice cream and juice. Finally, Susies arm was all better. Emmie and Susie had a big hug and were so glad to be done with the hospital. Together, they skipped all the way home.Ben and Sam were brothers who liked to play on the farm. They liked to run, jump, and chase the animals. But they did not like to do their chores. Their mom and dad always told them to help with the milk, the eggs, and the hay. But Ben and Sam always said no. One day, they saw a big cow in the field. The cow had a bell around her neck. Ben and Sam thought it would be fun to take the bell and make noise with it. They ran to the cow and tried to grab the bell. But the cow did not like that. She mooed loudly and kicked with her legs. Ben and Sam got scared and ran away. The cow followed them, still mooing. She wanted her bell back. She chased them all the way to the barn, where their mom and dad were. Their mom and dad saw the cow and the bell and knew what Ben and Sam had done. They were very angry. Ben and Sam, you have been very bad boys! their mom said. You should not take things that are not yours. You should not bother the cow. She gives us milk. You have made her angry and sad. You have to give her back her bell and say sorry. And you have to do your chores for a week, their dad said. That is your punish. You have to learn to be good and helpful. Or else you will not get any milk or eggs or hay. And you will not get any cake or candy or toys. Do you understand? Ben and Sam nodded. They felt sorry and ashamed. They gave the cow back her bell and said sorry. The cow mooed softly and licked their faces. She forgave them. Ben and Sam learned their lesson. They did their chores and were good and helpful. They never took things that were not theirs again. And they never bothered the cow again.Anna and Ben were very happy. They were going to the festival with their mom and dad. The festival had many fun things. There were balloons, games, music, and food. Anna and Ben wanted to see everything. They saw a big clown with a red nose and big shoes. He made funny faces and noises. He gave Anna and Ben each a balloon animal. Anna got a pink bunny and Ben got a blue dog. They thanked the clown and ran to the next thing. They saw a big tent with a sign that said Magic Show. They wanted to see the magic. They went inside the tent and sat on the floor. There were many other kids and grownups. They waited for the show to start. The show started with a man in a black hat and a cape. He had a wand and a box. He said he was going to make a rabbit appear from the box. He waved his wand and said some words. He opened the box and everyone gasped. There was no rabbit. There was a big sneeze. The man looked surprised and confused. He looked inside the box again and saw a small boy with a red face and a runny nose. The boy had sneaked into the box and was hiding there. He had sneezed because of the dust. He said he was sorry and ran out of the box. Everyone laughed except the man. He was angry and embarrassed. He said the show was over and left the tent. Anna and Ben felt sorry for the man. They thought he was not a good magician. They wondered why the boy was in the box. They saw the boy outside the tent. He was holding a yellow cat. He said his name was Tom and he liked magic. He said he wanted to see the rabbit and he was jealous of the man. He said he did not have a ticket for the festival and he had to hide. He said he liked the cat and he had found it in the street. Anna and Ben felt sorry for Tom. They said he could be their friend and share their balloons. They said they had tickets for the festival and they could show him around. They said they liked the cat and they asked if they could pet it. Tom smiled and said yes. He said he was sorry for ruining the show and he thanked them for being nice. They all became friends and had fun at the festival.Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. One day, Timmy decided to create something special. He wanted to make a big tower out of his toy blocks. He worked hard and finally, he made a tall tower! Timmy was so happy with his creation, but then he saw something strange. There was a pale tube on the ground near his tower. Timmy didnt know what it was, but he decided to play with it. He put the tube in his mouth and accidentally swallowed it. Timmy started to feel sick and went to the hospital. The doctors couldnt save him because the tube was poisonous. Timmys parents were so sad because they lost their little boy. They wished they could go back in time and stop Timmy from playing with the tube.Once upon a time, there was a smart little girl. She liked to explore and try new things. One day, she saw a glass door. She was really curious about it and thought it looked fun to open and close! The little girl reached up and grabbed the handle of the door. She tried to open it, but it was too heavy. She felt very discouraged. Just then, an older and intelligent man walked by and saw her struggling. Do you need some help? he asked. Yes please! she replied. The man smiled and opened the door for her. He showed her how to hold the handle and pull to close it. Now try it on your own, he said. The little girl smiled and confidently grabbed the handle. She pulled the door shut and felt excited and proud. Good job! said the man. The little girl said thank you and waved goodbye as she skipped back to her house, feeling so happy that she had learned something new.Sara and Tom are twins. They like to play with their toys and books. But they do not like to take a nap. Mom says they need to nap every day, but they think it is boring. One day, Mom tells them to go to their room and nap. Sara and Tom say no. They want to play more. Mom says they can play after they nap. She gives them a kiss and leaves. Sara and Tom are not sleepy. They decide to sneak out of their room and go to the living room. They see a big vase with flowers on the table. They think it is pretty. They want to touch it. Tom reaches for the vase, but he is clumsy. He knocks it over and it falls to the floor. It breaks into many pieces. The water and the flowers spill everywhere. Sara and Tom are scared. They hear Mom coming. Mom sees the mess and is angry. She asks them what they did. Sara and Tom say they are sorry. They did not mean to break the vase. They just wanted to see it. Mom says they should have listened to her and napped. She says they are in trouble. She makes them clean up the mess and go back to their room. She says they cannot play for the rest of the day. Sara and Tom are sad. They wish they had napped. They realize that napping is not so bad. They hug each other and say they will nap tomorrow. They close their eyes and fall asleep.Anna loves to play dress up with her dolls. She has many dolls, but her favorite is Lily. Lily is a famous fashion doll who has many clothes and shoes and hats. Anna likes to try different outfits on Lily and make her look pretty. One day, Anna decides to have a fashion show with Lily. She puts a pink dress, a blue scarf and a yellow hat on Lily and says, You look so nice, Lily! Do you want to walk on the stage? Lily nods and smiles. Anna takes Lily by the hand and walks to the living room, where she has set up a stage with a chair and a curtain. Anna says, Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the fashion show! Our first model is Lily, the famous fashion doll! She is wearing a pink dress, a blue scarf and a yellow hat. Isnt she lovely? Anna makes Lily walk on the stage and strike a pose. She claps and cheers for Lily. But then, Anna hears a loud noise from the kitchen. She turns and sees her brother Tom, who has knocked over a bowl of cereal. Tom is covered in milk and cereal and looks very messy. He says, Oops, sorry, Anna. I was hungry and I wanted some cereal. Anna is angry. She says, Tom, you are so clumsy! You ruined my fashion show! Go away! She runs to the kitchen and grabs a spoon. She chases Tom with the spoon and tries to strike him. Tom runs away and laughs. He says, Anna, you are so silly! Its just a game! Dont be mad! Anna and Tom run around the house, making a lot of noise. Their mom hears them and comes to see what is going on. She sees Anna with the spoon, Tom with the cereal, and Lily on the stage. She says, What are you two doing? You are making a big mess! Stop fighting and clean up! Anna and Tom stop and look at their mom. They say, Sorry, mom. We were just playing. They put the spoon and the cereal away and help each other clean up. They also pick up Lily and her clothes and put them back in Annas room. They say, We love you, mom. And we love Lily, too. She is the best fashion doll ever! Mom smiles and hugs them. She says, I love you, too. And I love your fashion show. It was very creative and fun. But next time, please be more careful and respectful of each other. Anna and Tom nod and say, OK, mom. We will. They kiss mom and go back to their room. They play with Lily and have another fashion show, but this time, they invite Tom to join them. They have a lot of fun and make Lily strike many poses. They are happy and proud of their fashion show. The end.Once upon a time, there was a big, hot sun in the sky. The sun made everything feel warm and nice. One day, a little rat appeared from behind a tree. The rat was small and brown, with a long tail. It looked around and saw some cheese on the ground. The rat was hungry, so it ran over to the cheese and ate it all up. Then, the rat disappeared back behind the tree. The sun kept shining and everything was happy. The end.Once upon a time, there was a family. The mom, dad, and their two children. The two children were named Susie and John. One day the family decided to go on a zoom. They zoomed around in the car for a very long time. They enjoyed looking at the trees and sky. As they were zooming, they began to see lots of bright lights and make crazy sounds. John was amazed by the lights and wanted to get a closer look. So mom and dad decided to stop the car and let him out. He was so happy to explore. John saw something twinkling on the ground and he picked it up. It was a little rock! He was so excited to have found this treasure. But then, he started to think, maybe it had value. He thought it was too special to keep, so he put it back where he found it. John was proud of himself for valuing the little rock. He got back into the car and they continued with their zoom.Ben liked to look for insects in the garden. He had a jar with holes in the lid, and he wanted to fill it with different kinds of insects. He liked to watch them crawl and fly and make noises. One day, he saw a big, shiny insect on a flower. It had four wings and a long tail. It was green and blue and yellow. Ben thought it was the most beautiful insect he had ever seen. He wanted to catch it and put it in his jar. He ran to the flower and reached out his hand. But before he could grab the insect, he heard a loud buzz and felt a sharp pain in his finger. He screamed and dropped the jar. The insect flew away. Ow, ow, ow! Ben cried. He ran to his mom, who was sitting on the porch. She saw his finger and hugged him. What happened, Ben? she asked. I tried to catch a pretty insect, but it stung me! Ben sobbed. Oh, Ben, Im sorry. That was a bee. Bees are not good insects to catch. They can hurt you. They make honey, but they also have stingers. You have to be careful around them. She took him inside and put some ice on his finger. She gave him a cookie and a glass of milk. She kissed his finger and his cheek. Next time, I recommend you look for other insects, like butterflies or ladybugs. They are also pretty, but they dont sting. They are more available and friendly. Do you understand? Ben nodded. He felt better. He learned his lesson. He decided to leave the bees alone and look for other insects. He hoped he would find a butterfly or a ladybug soon. He still liked insects, but he was more careful now.Once upon a time, there was a whale who was swimming in the warm ocean. She was looking for something special. She had heard about a big treasure that was guarded by a whale and she wanted to find it. She kept swimming until, suddenly, she saw a glimmer of yellow. It was just what she had been searching for! The whale felt so happy and she opened the large chest. As she opened it, a wave of gold coins and jewels spilled out. The whale was so excited and she wanted to take the treasure with her. But, it was so heavy that she couldnt carry it. Suddenly, a magical fish appeared and told her that if she wanted to take her treasure, she must yield to its power. The whale nodded and, with a wave of its tail, the fish granted her wish. Now the whale had all the gold and jewels she could ever need. She was so grateful that she thanked the magical fish and went back home, feeling warm, happy and full of joy.Lily liked to help her mom in the kitchen. She wanted to work like a big girl. Lily took a fork and poked the carrots. She liked the sound they made. She poked and poked until all the carrots were on a plate. She was very patient and careful. Mom said, Good job, Lily! You worked very well. Now we can cook the carrots for dinner. Do you want to stir them in the pot? Lily nodded and said, Yes, please! She put down her fork and climbed on a stool. Mom gave her a wooden spoon and showed her how to stir. Lily stirred and stirred until the carrots were soft and yummy. Mom said, You are a great helper, Lily. I am proud of you. Clara took a deep breath and calmly tried again. She turned the feather and finally, it fit! Clara was overjoyed! She ran to tell her mom all about the feather fitting in the doll house. He has many friends who swim and splash with him. But sometimes Tom is naughty and does not listen to his mom. She tells him to stay close to the bank and not to go too far. But Tom wants to explore and see new things. One day, Tom sees a big fish in the water. He thinks it is a toy and chases it. He swims faster and faster, and forgets about his mom. He does not hear her calling his name. He does not see the fish is a pike, with sharp teeth and a hungry look. The pike turns around and snaps at Tom. Tom is scared and tries to run away. He cries for help. His mom hears him and swims to him. She bites the pike and makes it go away. She hugs Tom and says, Are you okay, my baby? Tom is sorry and says, Im okay, mom. Im sorry, mom. Lily thanked the woman and continued on her way. As Lily walked deeper into the forest, she noticed a strange feeling. Something was watching her. She looked around but didnt see anything. Suddenly, she heard a rustling in the bushes. She was scared, but she remembered the berries the kind woman gave her. She ate them and felt brave. As she continued on, she saw a beautiful tree with a big berry on it. She picked the berry and ate it, but it didnt taste good. Suddenly, she heard a loud noise. It was a bear! The bear was angry and was coming towards her. Lily was scared, but she remembered the feeling of bravery from the berries. She threw the berry at the bear and it revealed a hidden treasure. Jo was three years old and she loved to explore. One day, she wanted to explore a big hill near her house. As she walked up the hill, she felt strange heat coming from the ground. This made Jo very scared. When Jo got to the top of the hill, there was a big crack in the ground. Jo couldnt believe what she saw! She wanted to climb in but it was too big for her. She walked around the crack and tried to find a way to improve it. Suddenly, her Mom appeared. Jo was so excited to see her. Her Mom smiled and said, What are you doing, Jo? Jo told her Mom about the crack in the ground and asked if they could do something to make it better. Her Mom smiled and nodded. She said, We need to make the crack smaller, so that you can get inside. Lets use some sticks and stones to help us do that. Jo and her Mom worked hard to make the crack smaller. Finally, they were successful. Jos Mom said, Now, Jo, you can get inside of the crack and explore. Jo was very excited now. She climbed inside the crack and was amazed at what she saw. She felt hot air coming from inside and she knew there was something interesting in there. Jo found crystals and gems and she was filled with joy.Once upon a time, in a unique land, there lived a little fairy named Lily. Lily loved to use her magic wand to make flowers bloom and butterflies dance. One sunny day, Lily met a friendly squirrel named Sam. Hi, Lily! said Sam. What are you doing? I am using my wand to make the flowers pretty, Lily replied. Sam watched Lily wave her wand, and the flowers grew big and colorful. The two friends played together all day. They ran, laughed, and played hideandseek. Lily used her magic to make their day special and fun. As the sun began to set, Lily and Sam said goodbye. They promised to meet again soon and have more fun together. And from that day on, the unique fairy and her squirrel friend had many more happy days filled with magical adventures.Once upon a time there was a tiny mouse who lived in an ancient castle. The castle was full of secrets and the mouse was always curious to explore it. One day the mouse saw an inviting door. He hesitated for a moment but then decided to enter. Inside was the most delicious looking salad the mouse had ever seen! He eagerly started snacking on the salad when suddenly, he heard a loud voice. Hey! Get off my salad! The mouse looked up to see a giant lizard standing in front of him. The mouse was terrified and stopped eating right away. The lizard was angry and demanded that the mouse pay for the salad. The mouse had no money, so he offered to clean the ancient castle as payment instead. The lizard reluctantly agreed, and the mouse got to work. Eventually, the mouse managed to clean the castle and the lizard was very impressed by his hard work. The lizard said hed let the mouse go for this one time but advised him to never enter the castle again. The mouse thanked the lizard and ran off, never to return.Sam and Mia are playing in the park. They like to slide and swing and run. They hear a loud noise. It is a cop car. It has a siren and a light. The cop car stops near the park. Wow, look at that! Sam says. It is a cop car. Maybe there is a bad guy. Lets go see! Mia says. Maybe it is interesting. They run to the cop car. They see a cop. He is talking to a man. The man looks angry. He has a big bag. Hey, kids, stay back! the cop says. This is not a game. This is a robber. He took money from the bank. Wow, a robber! Sam says. That is bad. Why did he do that? Because he is greedy and mean, the cop says. He wanted to have more money than he needs. But I caught him. Now he will go to jail. Jail? Mia says. That is scary. I dont want to go to jail. Me neither, Sam says. We are good kids. We dont take things that are not ours. Thats right, the cop says. You are good kids. You should always be honest and kind. Then you will be happy and safe. Thank you, cop, Sam and Mia say. You are brave and nice. You help people. Youre welcome, kids, the cop says. Now go back to your play. Have fun. Sam and Mia wave to the cop. They run back to the park. They slide and swing and run. They are happy and safe. They think the cop car is interesting. But they think the park is more fun.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved ice cream and always asked her mom to take her to the ice cream truck. One day, Lilys mom took her to get a cone, but it was very icy outside. Lily was so excited to eat her cone, but she accidentally dropped it on the ground. She was very sad and didnt know what to do. Suddenly, Lilys mom had an idea. She told Lily to use her hands to make a snowball and put the icy snow on top of the dropped cone. Lily was hesitant at first, but she tried it and it worked! The icy snow made the cone even better than before. From that day on, Lily always remembered to use the icy snow to make her cone even more delicious. She was happy that her mom taught her a new trick.Tommy was scared of the dark. He hated when his mom turned off the light and said good night. He wanted to see his toys and his books and his teddy bear. He did not like the shadows and the noises in his room. One night, he heard a loud knock on the door. He heard his mom open it and talk to someone. He heard a strangers voice. He did not know who it was. He did not like strangers. He wished his mom would come back to his room and hug him. He got out of his bed and walked to the door. He peeked outside and saw a man with a big bag. The man was wearing a dark coat and a dark hat. He looked mean and scary. Tommy was afraid. He wanted to hide. He ran back to his bed and pulled the covers over his head. He held his teddy bear tight and closed his eyes. He hoped the stranger would go away. He hoped his mom would come back soon. He hated the dark and the stranger. He wanted to be safe and happy.Once upon a time there was an adorable little bear named Tommy. Tommy loved to play and explore, but he didnt know very much. He wanted to learn more, so he asked his Mama Bear for help. Mama Bear was so happy to provide for Tommy. She smiled and told him that she would teach him all sorts of things. She taught him how to count, name colors, and even the alphabet. Tommy was so excited to learn. He shouted and clapped his hands as he learned. His Mama Bear was so proud of him. After some time, Tommy learned so much from his Mama Bear. She provided him with all of the love and knowledge that he needed. With her help, Tommy became a very smart and wise little bear.Bella was a dog who loved to chew. She chewed on bones, toys, shoes, and sometimes things she should not chew. One day, when her family was out, she saw a big, soft armchair in the living room. She thought it looked like a good thing to chew. She jumped on the armchair and started to bite and tear the fabric. She made a big hole and pulled out the stuffing. She felt happy and proud of her work. But when her family came back, they were not happy. They saw the mess and the ruined armchair. They knew it was Bella who did it. They scolded her and said, Bad dog! You should not chew on the armchair! That was very naughty and expensive! Now we have to buy a new one! They pointed at the hole and the stuffing. Bella felt ashamed and guilty. She lowered her head and tucked her tail. She knew she had done something wrong. She wanted to say sorry, but she could not speak. She only whimpered and licked her familys hands. They saw that she was sorry and forgave her. They hugged her and said, We love you, Bella, but you have to learn to chew on the right things. Here, have this chew toy. It is yours and you can chew on it as much as you want. But please, leave the armchair alone. They gave her a chew toy and a treat. Bella was happy and grateful. She learned her lesson and never chewed on the armchair again. The moral of the story is Do not chew on things that are not yours or that can be damaged. Chew on things that are meant for chewing. Say sorry when you make a mistake and try to do better.Once upon a time, a cow entered a big, green field. She was looking for some food to eat. Suddenly, the most compassionate little boy she had ever seen came walking across the field. The little boy had the biggest, warmest smile. He walked up to the cow, reached out his hand and offered her some kind words. The cow felt so happy and safe around the boy. Even though she wasnt sure what he was saying, it still made her feel good inside. The little boy then opened up his bag and pulled out some delicious hay. He tossed it over to the cow and she was so happy! She gobbled it up and said thank you with a smile and a big moo. The compassionate little boy smiled back and gave her a pat on the back. She then happily trotted off, feeling so lucky to have been welcomed by such a sweet boy.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, but she always made a big mess. One day, her mom came in and said, Lily, you need to clean up your toys. Its not safe to leave them all over the floor. Lily replied, But mom, I dont know how to balance them all! Her mom smiled and said, Thats okay, we can work on it together. So, they started to clean up the toys and Lilys mom showed her how to balance them on top of each other. Lily thought it was charming how they could all stay together without falling. After they finished cleaning, Lilys mom said, Remember, its important to take care of our earth too. Just like we balance our toys, we need to balance the things we do to keep our planet healthy. Lily nodded and said, I will try my best to keep the earth clean and balanced too!Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, she went to the park with her mom. They sat on a bench and watched the birds. Suddenly, Lily felt something on her arm. It was a little bug! She started to panic and waved her arms around. Her mom quickly tapped the bug away. Lily felt relieved and hugged her mom. After a while, they decided to go home. Lily was thirsty and wanted some water. But when she took a sip, she realized her throat was dry. She asked her mom for more water, but her mom said they had to wait until they got home. Lily felt sad, but she knew her mom was right. They walked home together, holding hands. When they finally got home, Lily drank a big glass of water and felt much better.Once upon a time there was a tiny spider called Jasper. Everyday, he spun a beautiful cobweb in his small corner of the garden. It was so delicate that everyone said it looked like a rare and delicate piece of art! One day, a strong wind came and blew Jaspers cobweb away! The poor spider was so sad! Jasper was determined to build his cobweb back up. He scrambled up the long vines and worked away spinning out his web. But try as hard as he could, the cobweb would not look how it did before. Until one day, Jasper had an idea. He spooled the strands backwards and when he had finished, he was surprised to find that the cobweb was better than before! He had reversed the cobweb and made it look even more special. From that day on, Jaspers cobweb was admired by all in the garden, and it became even more rare and beautiful.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to run fast and play outside. One day, she went to a carnival with her mom and dad. She played games and won tickets. At the end of the day, there was a big raffle. Lilys name was called and she went up to receive her prize. It was a big stuffed bear that she hugged tightly. She was so happy and couldnt wait to take it home. Lily went to bed that night with her new prize beside her. She dreamed of running fast with her bear by her side. She knew it would be her new best friend.Penny and Dan were walking in the park one day. Suddenly they noticed a small, furry animal running around the trees. What is it? asked Dan. Penny laughed. Thats a squirrel! Lets see if we can touch it. Dan was frightened. Im scared, Penny. Penny smiled. Dont be afraid. Well just follow the squirrel around the trees and see if we can get close enough to touch it. And thats what they did. The squirrel seemed miserable, jumping from branch to branch and moving around quickly. Finally, after a few minutes, the squirrel stopped and Dan carefully reached out his hand. But as soon as he touched it, the squirrel ran away and they never saw it again.Once upon a time, there was a prince who was very smart. He wanted to find a magic crown. The prince was so happy that he quickly picked up the crown. He couldnt believe his luck and hurried home to show his parents. When he arrived, his mom and dad were so proud of him. Every day, it would rain in the morning and the cat would go outside to play in the sunshine and the rain. One day, he was playing in the grass when he found a bone! He was so happy to find it, so he ran and showed it to his friends. Everyone was excited to see the bone and they gathered around to look at it. They tossed it around and played with it until it grew dark. Then, the rain came back. The cat and his friends had to go find shelter, so they all ran back home. But the cat still had the bone, and he kept it safe until the rain stopped and they could play again. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Alice. Alice was walking along the beach one day when suddenly she spotted a crab. The crab had a big frown on its face. Alice wanted to help and so she reached out her hand to pat the crab. But before she could, the crab scuttled away. Alice was sad that she couldnt help the crab. Later, she saw some friendly seagulls flying in the sky. She waved to the seagulls and followed them over the dunes. At the top of the dune, Alice found the crab again! It was looking around, but this time it didnt seem scared. Alice knew it was looking for help and so she said hello and carefully placed one finger on its shell. The crab looked at Alice with a big smile! Alice was so excited she started clapping her hands. The crab had been so helpful. She was happy this time she could help. The crab scuttled away again and waved goodbye. Alice felt really proud of herself. She had found a way to help a crab in need. She would never forget the crab and its helpful smile.Once upon a time, there was an elderly lady who loved to sit on a bench in the park. She would watch the children play and smile at them. One day, a little girl came to sit on the bench next to her. They started to talk and the elderly lady was happy to have a new friend. As they talked, the little girl noticed that the bench was old and falling apart. She asked the lady if she knew why the bench was like that. The lady explained that many people had sat on the bench over the years and some had not taken care of it. They had left it dirty and broken. The little girl understood and promised to take care of the bench from now on. She knew that it was important to take care of things that we share with others. And so, she cleaned the bench and made sure that no one would part it again. The elderly lady was proud of her new friend and they continued to sit on the bench together, enjoying the park and each others company.One day, Sally went to the post office. Spot barked happily and ran to get his ball. The man threw the wire and Spot ran to get it. But when he picked it up, he felt a shock! The wire was not a toy, it was an electric wire. Spot yelped and ran back to the man. The man was sorry and gave Spot a treat to serve as an apology. From that day on, Spot only played with his ball and never touched wires again. She saw a pot and it was stirring by itself. She slowly came closer to see what was inside the pot. It was oxygen! It was slowly bubbling up and stirring the pot around. The little girl was excited and wanted to take some of the oxygen home with her. She put it in a bottle and started to walk home. She was careful to not stir the pot too much because the oxygen was too precious. As she went home, she sang a slow song and the wind blew slowly in the trees. A nice ladybug was sitting on the grass. Molly slowly bent down and picked the little bug up. She put it in the palm of her hand. She felt so gentle and careful. Molly smiled as she watched the ladybug crawl around. She was so happy to see something so nice and pink! She opened up her pocket, put the flower back in and kept walking. What a nice morning!Once upon a time there was a gloomy town. Everyone in the town did the same trade. They polished rocks. Every day they woke up early and went to the rock shop. They were very good at their trade. They could make a shiny rock from a dull one. But one day the townspeople encountered a problem. There were no dull rocks left! All the rocks had been polished so much that they were too shiny. The townspeople started to worry. What kind of trade could they do if there were no dull rocks? Then one day a happy little girl came to town. She loved rocks and knew how to make a dull rock from a shiny one. She showed the townspeople how to do it. Everyone was happy again. They could now do their trade again. The town returned to its former glory with shiny rocks. Everyone was thankful to the girl!Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. After playing at the park, Timmys cough started to get better. He knew it was because he took his medicine like his mom told him to. Timmy was happy and felt much better. She finally caught the butterfly and showed it to the judge. He said, Well done, little one! and Lily felt proud of herself.Tom and Mia were twins who liked to play in the park. They had a lot of toys and clothes because their parents were wealthy. They did not like to share with other kids. One day, they saw a new boy in the park. He had a red jacket with a zipper. Tom and Mia wanted the jacket. They ran to the boy and tried to pull the zipper. Hey, stop that! the boy said. This is my jacket. Go away! No, we want it! Tom and Mia said. We have more toys and clothes than you. You have to give it to us! The boy did not want to give his jacket. He zipped it up and ran away. Tom and Mia chased him. They were angry and mean. A lady saw them and came to help. She was the boys mom. She hugged the boy and said, Are you okay, Ben? What happened? Those kids tried to take my jacket, Ben said. They said they were wealthy and I had to give it to them. Thats not nice, the lady said. You dont have to give your jacket to anyone. Its yours. And being wealthy doesnt make you better than others. Its how you treat people that matters. She looked at Tom and Mia and said, You should be ashamed of yourselves. You should apologize to Ben and learn to share and be kind. Tom and Mia felt sorry. So, Lily took the clock and played with it. She loved the sound it made every hour. Suddenly, the clock stopped ticking. Lily was sad and asked her grandma, What happened to the clock? Timmy asked her what polish meant, and she explained that it meant to make something shiny and clean. Later that day, Timmys grandma made him some cauliflower for dinner. Timmy remembered what she had said about polishing and decided to try to eat it neatly. To his surprise, it was much easier to eat and he didnt make a big, messy mess. Suddenly, Max spotted a small mouse eating something tasty in the garden. He knew it was wrong but he just had to have a taste. He walked up to the mouse and told him that he wanted to try the tasty food. So the mouse let Max have a tiny bite. Max loved it so much that he asked the mouse if he could have more. The mouse said no and ran away. But Max didnt mind at all. His collar sparkled in the sun and he was happy. He was so happy he even began to sing. The end.Tim and Sam were twins who liked to play outside. One day, they saw a big cane in the snow. It was shiny and red and had a hook at the end. They wanted to touch it and see what it was. They ran to the cane and grabbed it. It was very cold and icy. They felt a sharp pain in their hands. They looked and saw little teeth marks. The cane was not a cane, but a snake! It was hiding in the snow and bit them when they touched it. They screamed and dropped the snake. They ran back to their house and told their mom what happened. She was very scared and angry. She wrapped their hands in a cloth and took them to the doctor. The doctor gave them some medicine and said they would be okay. Tim and Sam learned a lesson. Timmy and his mom said a little prayer together. Then, they went inside to get some tools to fix the truck. It was easy to fix, and soon Timmy was back outside playing with his truck again. The rabbit replied, Im here to serve the animals of the jungle. I help them with food, shelter, and anything else they need. The tiger laughed. You cant do a lot with those tiny arms and legs! The rabbit smiled. Its true that my body is small. But I will do what I can to serve others. Thats really all that matters. Its not about how much you can do. Its about how much you give. The tiger was impressed. He realized that it was not just about being brilliant. Serving others was also important. He thanked the rabbit for showing him the right way. Then one day it began to rain. The pony snuggled under a bush to keep warm and dry. After a while the rain stopped and the sky cleared. The pony went into the field and rolled in the wet grass. When it was done it looked so big and shiny. The pony stayed in the field until the sun set behind the big hill. Then it trotted back home and went to sleep.Once upon a time, there was a messy dog named Spot. He loved to dig and bury his bones in the yard. One sunny day, Spot found a big, juicy bone. He was so happy and couldnt wait to bury it. Spot dug a big hole in the yard and put the bone inside. Then, he covered it with dirt. Now, I will wait until later to eat my bone, he thought. Spot went to play with his friend, a little bird named Chirpy. Chirpy saw the messy dirt and asked, Spot, what did you do? Spot told Chirpy about the bone he buried. Chirpy smiled and said, Thats a great idea! Now your bone will be safe. Spot and Chirpy played all day, and when the sun went down, Spot dug up his bone and enjoyed his tasty treat.Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily had her birthday. She was very happy and excited because she was going to have a big party with all her friends. She wanted to have a big cake and lots of balloons. But when her mom went to buy the balloons, she found out they were all sold out. Lily was sad and started to cry. Her dad tried to cheer her up and said, Dont worry, we can still have fun. Lets play a game where we fly like birds! Lily loved the idea and started to flap her arms like wings. Her dad was very flexible and could do lots of tricks. He showed Lily how to do a somersault in the air. Lily tried and tried, but she couldnt do it. She started to cry again and said, I cant do it! This is the worst birthday ever! Her dad hugged her and said, Its okay to feel frustrated, but we can keep trying until we get it right. And remember, even if we cant fly like birds, we can still have fun together. Lily smiled and hugged her dad back. They spent the rest of the day playing and laughing together.Mommy, I want to swing! said the three year old. She pushed off and away she went, swinging higher and higher. The three year old felt so free, it was like she was flying! The wind tickling her face and passing through her hair. Look mom, no hands! exclaimed the three year old. Oh my! Now make sure to use your reliable lungs and hold on tight, ok? said mom with a smile. The three year old couldnt help but laugh and smile. She never wanted the moment to end.Once there was a little girl who was scared of the dark. Every night, she heard an alarm that made her trembling in her bed. As she was getting older, she wanted to be brave and not be scared anymore. One night, she asked her mom if she could turn off the alarm. She trusted her mom, so she knew it was okay. She jumped out of bed and carefully tiptoed over to the alarm. She was so brave! She slowly put her hand over the alarm and with a deep breath, she turned it off. There was no noise just peaceful silence! She smiled, feeling proud that she was brave enough to do this all by herself. Before she went back to bed, she saw a nasty, dirty sock under her bed. She quickly put it in the laundry and went back to bed with a feeling of trust in herself.Once there was a boy and he was three years old. One day he went for a bike ride with his dad. They wanted to make a cake for Mom. They had a big bowl, some flour, some eggs, some milk and some sugar. They also had a spoon to stir the batter. Let me stir, Lily! Ben said. He grabbed the spoon from Lilys hand. No, Ben, its my turn! Lily said. She pulled the spoon back. They both tugged on the spoon, making the batter splash out of the bowl. Some of it landed on the fan that was on the counter. The fan was on, so it blew the batter all over the kitchen. Oh no! Lily and Ben said. They saw the mess they made. They saw Mom coming into the kitchen. What are you two doing? Mom asked. She looked at the batter on the walls, the floor, the fan and her children. We wanted to make a cake for you, Mom, Lily said. One day his mom came to him and said, Tom, I think you are ready for a phone now. You have been so independent and I think its time to provide you with a phone. Tom was so excited. She was very scared because she was all alone. She had no one to protect her. One day, a friendly farmer saw the poor goose. He felt so sorry for her that he decided to help her. He collected the goose and brought her back to his farm. When the farmer arrived home, he saw that his other farm animals were scared too. He understood that they all wanted someone to protect them. So the farmer put the goose in a special pen and put a fence around it. He also put food and water in the pen for the goose to eat and drink. From that day on, the farmer looked after the goose. He made sure that she was never scared again. He also made sure that she was safe and happy. He turned on the water and started to clean the apples. He rubbed each apple with his hands until it was shiny and wet. He put the clean apples in a bowl. He counted them as he did. One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten. He had ten clean apples. He smiled and called his mom. Mom, I cleaned the apples for you. Can I help you make the pie now? Mom came to the kitchen and saw the bowl of apples. She was very happy and proud of Tommy. She hugged him and said, Thank you, Tommy. You did a great job. You are such a good helper. Yes, you can help me make the pie. Lets roll the dough and cut the apples together. Tommy and his mom had fun making the pie. They put it in the oven and waited for it to bake. It smelled delicious. Tommy could not wait to taste it. He knew it would be the best pie ever. He was very enthusiastic about cleaning and cooking. He liked to help his mom and dad with the chores. He felt happy and proud when he saw how nice the house looked and how yummy the pie was.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Julie. He was brown and had big horns. One day, he saw a red light in the sky. It was so bright! The bull was scared and started to run. He ran and ran until he saw a little girl. The girl had a bow in her hair. She saw the bull and smiled. She knew he was scared. She took the bow out of her hair and gave it to the bull. The bull felt better and stopped running. He looked at the girl and mooed. The girl laughed and petted the bull. From that day on, the bull and the girl were friends.Once upon a time, there was a little girl who had a big problem. She told her daughter that it was okay and that she was not in trouble. The little girl felt much better. Her mom said that if she was hungry she could have another waffle from the kitchen. He always wanted to go faster and faster. The little dog had a special bubble around him when he ran. The bubble made him even faster and the other animals couldnt catch him. One day, the little dog met his friend, a big, hairy bear. The bear was so big and strong, but he was also very slow. The bear asked the little dog if he could join him in his bubble and run with him. The little dog was excited and said yes. They started running around together, faster and faster. The bear was getting faster and faster, just like the little dog. They had so much fun. Soon, the hairy bear was running just as fast as the little dog. From then on, they ran together all the time, never stopping and always running at top speed.Tom and Lily were twins who liked to play outside. One day, they saw a big star in the sky. It was very bright and shiny. Look, Lily, a star! Tom said. Do you think it can talk? I dont know, Tom. Maybe it can. Lets ask it a question. Lily said. They both shouted at the star. Hello, star! Can you hear us? What is your name? The star heard them and smiled. It had a soft and kind voice. Hello, Tom and Lily. I can hear you. My name is Starla. I am a star of wisdom. I know many things about the world and the sky. Tom and Lily were amazed. They wanted to learn from Starla. Wow, Starla, you are so smart. Can you tell us something? Tom asked. Sure, Tom. What do you want to know? Starla asked. Tom thought for a moment. He was curious about many things, but he also had a fear. Starla, why are some people mean and scary? Why do they hurt others? Tom asked. Lily nodded. She was also fearful of mean and scary people. Starla sighed. She knew that some people were not kind and good. Tom and Lily, that is a hard question. Some people are mean and scary because they are unhappy and angry. They do not know how to love and share. They do not have wisdom in their hearts. They need help and kindness, but they do not ask for it. They make others sad and afraid. Tom and Lily felt sad for the mean and scary people. They wondered how they could help them. Starla, how can we help the mean and scary people? How can we make them happy and kind? Lily asked. Starla smiled again. She was proud of Tom and Lily. They had wisdom in their hearts. Lily, you and Tom can help the mean and scary people by being brave and gentle. You can show them that you care and that you are not afraid. You can share your toys and your smiles. You can say nice words and give hugs. You can be friends with them. Maybe they will learn from you and change their ways. Maybe they will find wisdom in their hearts. Tom and Lily liked Starlas answer. They decided to try it the next day. They thanked Starla for her wisdom and said goodbye. Goodbye, Starla. Thank you for talking to us. You are a wonderful star. We hope to see you again. Tom and Lily said. Goodbye, Tom and Lily. You are wonderful children. I hope to see you again too. Remember, always shine with wisdom and kindness. Starla said. Then Starla winked and faded away. Tom and Lily went back to their home. They were happy and hopeful. They had learned a lot from Starla. Her mom said no and warned Lizzie that it was dangerous. But Lizzie didnt listen and opened the icy closet door. As soon as she stepped inside, she heard a loud snap. Lizzie was stuck inside the icy closet and no one was able to rescue her. The moral of this story is to listen to your parents. She had to go to the hospital. The doctors said she couldnt walk for a long time. Lily was sad because she couldnt play with her family anymore. She had to stay in the hotel room all day. Her family went out to have fun without her. In the end, Lily had to go home in a wheelchair. She missed the rest of the trip and wished she never slipped. The end.Once upon a time, there was a mysterious knight. He lived in a faraway kingdom, and he was always ready to rescue people in need. One day, he heard a loud sound coming from a nearby village. He knew he had to help! He rushed over on his horse and saw a huge fire. People were shouting for help, so the knight rushed in. He worked fast and started rescuing people, one by one. Suddenly, he heard a loud sound. It was an ambulance! It was here to take any injured people to the hospital. The mysterious knight helped everyone get in the ambulance, and then he watched it drive away. Everyone was safe. The knight was proud of his rescue mission, and everyone in the village was very thankful. The knight had proved himself to be a brave and mysterious hero.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a humble house with a big yard. They are very happy. Look at our snowman! Anna says. He is so big and nice! Yes, he is! Ben says. Lets take a picture of him. We can show it to Mom and Dad. He runs to the snowman and jumps on him. He bites the hat and the scarf. He pulls the carrot nose and the coal eyes. He makes the snowman fall down. Anna and Ben are very sad. They cry and scream. Go away, bad dog! Anna says. You broke our snowman! Leave us alone, bad dog! Ben says. You ruined our picture! But the dog does not listen. He is having fun. He covers the camera with snow. He scratches the image. He makes it icy and blurry. Anna and Ben cannot see their snowman anymore. They cannot see their picture anymore. They have nothing to show to Mom and Dad. They have a bad day.Tom and Lily liked to play in the park. They liked to run and jump and slide and swing. One day, they saw a big pond in the park. They wanted to see what was in the pond. They walked to the pond and looked. They saw some fish and some frogs and some ducks. They also saw something big and green and scary. It was an alligator! The alligator saw them and opened its mouth. It had many sharp teeth. Tom and Lily were scared. They ran away from the pond. They shouted for help. They saw their mom and dad. They ran to them and hugged them. They told them about the alligator. Mom and dad were worried. They looked at the pond. They saw the alligator too. They called the park ranger. The park ranger came and caught the alligator. He said the alligator was hurt and lost. He said he would take it to a safe place. Tom and Lily were glad. They said sorry to the alligator. They hoped it would feel better. They said thank you to the park ranger. They learned to be careful near the pond. They went back to play in the park. They had fun. They did not see the alligator again.Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had soft hair and a big smile. She was the best at everything, but had a problem. She couldnt grab the language. Everywhere she went, everyone talked, but she didnt understand. She would struggle to make sense of it all and it made her sad. She wanted to talk too, but it just wouldnt work. One day, her family came together to help. They sat down with her and tried to show her how to grab the language. It was tricky at first, but with lots of help and patience, she got better and better. Finally, her hard work paid off and she started to grab the language. She talked, laughed and played with her family. She was so proud of herself and so happy. The End.Once upon a time, two brothers named Ben and Max were arguing about something. They didnt know how to decide who was right and who was wrong, so they decided to weigh a big barrel to see who was right. Just then, an old man named Mr. Badger walked by. He had a very mean look on his face. He noticed the boys arguing, and he asked them why they were fighting. Ben and Max told him about the barrel and how they were both trying to prove who was right. Mr. Badger thought for a moment and then said, If you want to know who is right, then let me weigh the barrel. That way we can decide who gets the credit. Ben and Max were excited and thankful for Mr. Badgers help. So, they carried the barrel over to his old scale and put it onto the scale. Mr.Badger peered at the scale, and then he said to Ben and Max, You know what? You are both right! The boys couldnt believe what Mr. Badger said because the barrel was too heavy for either one of them to be right. Mr. Badger then explained that the barrel was too heavy for either one of them to be wrong, either. Ben and Max were very happy, and they thanked Mr. Badger for his help. She climbed up the tree and picked it. It was so sweet! She enjoyed it very much and then carried on down the path. At the end of the path, there was a big lake. Amy saw some fishes swimming in the water, so she decided to try to catch them. She went to the shore and threw in a pebble. The fishes got sharp and started to swim away. Amy was so happy to see them. She sat by the lake with her strawberry and watched the fishes. It was a beautiful day. And best of all, she was no longer hungry.Ben and Lily were playing with their toys in the living room. Ben had a big truck that he liked to zoom around the floor. Lily had a doll that she liked to dress up and talk to. They were having fun, but they also wanted different things. Let me play with your truck, Ben, Lily said. It looks so fast and loud. No, its mine, Ben said. You have your doll. She is so pretty and intelligent. She can do anything. But I want to try your truck, too, Lily said. Please, Ben, just for a little bit. Ben did not want to share his truck. He liked it too much. He zoomed it away from Lily and made it jump over a pillow. He laughed and said, My truck is the best toy ever. Your doll is boring. Lily felt sad and angry. She did not like Bens words. She thought her doll was not boring. She thought her doll was wonderful. She wanted to show Ben that her doll was better than his truck. She grabbed her doll and ran after Ben. She tried to catch his truck and make it fall. But Ben was faster and smarter. He saw Lily coming and turned his truck around. He made it go towards Lily and bump into her legs. Lily lost her balance and fell to the floor. Her doll flew out of her hands and landed on the couch. Ha ha, I win! Ben said. My truck is stronger than your doll. Your doll is weak and silly. Lily felt hurt and angry. She did not like Bens actions. She thought his truck was not stronger than her doll. She thought his truck was mean and rude. She wanted to tell Ben that he was wrong. She got up from the floor and ran to the couch. She picked up her doll and hugged her. No, you dont win! Lily said. My doll is not weak and silly. She is brave and kind. She can do anything. She can even fly! Lily threw her doll in the air and made her soar over Bens head. She smiled and said, See? My doll is the best toy ever. Your truck is boring. Ben looked up and saw Lilys doll flying. He felt surprised and curious. He wondered how Lily did that. He wanted to try it, too. He grabbed his truck and threw it in the air. He hoped it would fly like Lilys doll. But his truck did not fly. It fell to the ground and broke into pieces. Ben felt sad and angry. He did not like what happened. He thought his truck was not boring. He thought his truck was wonderful. He wanted to fix his truck and make it work again. He looked at Lily and said, You broke my truck! You are mean and silly. I dont want to play with you anymore. Lily looked at Ben and saw his broken truck. She felt sorry and guilty. She did not mean to break his truck. She thought his truck was not mean and rude. She thought his truck was fun and cool. She wanted to help Ben and make him happy again. She looked at her doll and said, Im sorry, Ben. I didnt mean to break your truck. It was an accident. Your truck is not boring. It is fast and loud. It can do anything. It can even fly! He felt confused and happy. He did not expect her to give him her doll. He thought her doll was not weak and silly. He thought her doll was brave and kind. He wanted to play with her doll and make her fly. He took her doll and said, Thank you, Lily. Im sorry, too. I didnt mean to hurt you. Your doll is not boring. She is wonderful. She can do anything. The big cat did not care. He was deaf and could not hear the dogs words. The cat kept slapping the dog, and the dog felt sad. Then, the dog had an idea. She dreamed of spinning and fairies, and of her mom.Timmy and Julie were best friends and loved to play together in the park. One day, they were walking near the corner of the park and saw a faucet dripping water. Julie suggested that they should fill their bucket with the water and use it for a game. But Timmy didnt want to. He said they should use the water for a different game. They started to quarrel. Suddenly, a thought came to Julies mind. She had a thoughtful idea. She suggested they use the dripping water to play a game of tag. Timmy liked that idea, and they both agreed they could run around the park while the water filled their bucket. They both had a great time playing and running around. In the end, the bucket was full of water and they shared a hug, happy to have played such a fun game together.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. One day, Timmys mom came into his room and saw that his toys were all over the floor. She asked Timmy to help her organize the toys. Timmy was happy to help and started putting his toys away in their proper places. As Timmy was organizing his toys, he found a toy car that he had been looking for. He wondered where it had been hiding all this time. He was so happy to have found it and started playing with it right away. After Timmy was finished organizing his toys, he realized that he had accidentally broken one of his sisters toys. He felt very sorry and went to his sister to apologize. She forgave him and they continued to play together with all of their toys, now neatly organized.Once upon a time, there was a rich bird. He had the most beautiful feathers and the happiest song. He sang from the highest tree in the land. One day, he spotted a cauliflower in the farmers field. He swooped down and picked it up in his beak. He was so excited, he started to sing louder and louder. The farmer heard the birds happy tune. He came out of his house and said, Thank you for the song, little bird! As a reward, here is a cabbage for you. The bird was happy and so he started to sing again. The farmer was delighted by the birds voice. He said, You have the most beautiful song. Please, come back here and sing any time. Ill give you some cauliflower even if youre not wealthy. The bird was pleased to hear this. From then on, he visited the farm every day to sing for the farmer and enjoy the yummy cauliflower.Tom and Sam like to play pirate. They have a big box that is their ship. They have hats and swords and a map. They want to find treasure. One day, they see a new box in the yard. It is bigger and nicer than their box. It has a flag and a wheel and a cannon. Tom and Sam think it is a pirate ship too. They want to have it. They run to the new box and try to get in. But there is a boy inside. He is Ben. He says the box is his ship. He says he is the captain. He says Tom and Sam are not pirates. He says they are enemies. Tom and Sam are angry. They say they are pirates. They say they are better than Ben. They say they will take his ship. They use their swords and try to fight Ben. But Ben is not afraid. He uses his cannon and makes a loud noise. He scares Tom and Sam. They drop their swords and run away. Ben laughs and says he is the most successful pirate. He says he has the best ship and the most treasure. He says Tom and Sam are silly and weak. Tom and Sam are sad. They go back to their box. They say they are not successful pirates. They say they have a bad ship and no treasure. They say Ben is mean and strong. But then they see something shiny in their box. It is a coin. It is gold. They find more coins and jewels and pearls. They are happy. They say they have treasure after all. They say they are successful pirates. They say they have a good ship and a good map. They say Ben is wrong and greedy. They put on their hats and smile. They say they are the best pirates. They say they will have more adventures. They say they will have more fun.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to watch movies with her mommy and daddy. She wanted to play with her blocks, but they were on the table. The table was too high for her. She could not reach the blocks. She tried to climb on a chair, but she fell down. She hurt her knee. She began to weep. Anna, what is wrong? Mama asked. She heard Annas weep. She came to the room. She saw Anna on the floor. She saw the blocks on the table. She saw the chair on its side. I want my blocks! Anna said. She wept louder. She pointed at the table. Mama hugged Anna. She kissed her knee. She said, Im sorry, Anna. You should not climb on the chair. It is not safe. Emma got so excited that she started spinning with the hoop, faster and faster. The bright sunshine made the hoop shine like it was made of gold. Everywhere she looked, it was calm and peaceful. Emma kept spinning around with the hoop until she was so tired that she couldnt move! She laid down on the ground and watched the clouds move across the sky. Everything felt so calm and peaceful. He decided to smile and be friendly to the goose. The goose was surprised and didnt know what to do. The duck said, Lets share the pond and swim together!
