She loved being surrounded by other flowers but she was alone. One day, a little girl came up to the flower. She had little hands and big eyes. She looked at the flower and said, Oh, youre so pretty! Then she asked, Can I pick you? The flower thought for a moment. She wanted to stay here in the garden, but she also wanted to give the little girl a special gift. Finally, the flower said, Yes, you can pick me but only if you promise to take care of me. The little girl agreed and plucked the flower from the ground. She carried it with her all the way home and kept it in her room. She watered the flower every day and it bloomed brighter and redder. The moral of the story is that its good to give when it comes from the heart. But then something strange happened, he got confused and couldnt remember what to do. He started to repeat himself, saying the same things over and over again. He was so confused he didnt know what to do. He started to fly around in circles and it seemed like he was lost. Luckily, he stayed in the sky long enough that the sun was about to set. He stared at the sky and thought about what he should do when he saw a twinkling star. He flew close to the star and asked it for help. The star said, Dont worry, pilot! Ill help you. They decided to talk to the bird and ask him to sing softly. They went to the birds nest and talked to him about how they felt. The bird listened and understood how he was bothering everyone with his loud singing. From that day on, the bird changed his ways and sang softly. The animals were happy and could finally sleep. The bird also realized that its important to listen to others and be considerate. The moral of the story is that its important to be mindful of others and to listen to their needs. He took the car and ran to his room. He thought he was clever. But Lily woke up and saw that her car was gone. She cried and called her mom. Her mom came and asked, Whats wrong, Lily? Lily said, Tim stole my car. He took it in the night. He is a bad friend. Her mom hugged her and said, Dont worry, Lily. We will get your car back. Stealing is wrong. Tim will be sorry. He said, What do you want? Her mom said, I want you to give back Lilys car. You stole it from her. That is not nice. How would you feel if someone stole your car? Tim felt ashamed. He said, Im sorry. I wanted the car. It was black and shiny. I didnt think Lily would miss it. Her mom said, Lily loves her car. She was very sad when she saw it was gone. You hurt her feelings. You need to say sorry to her and give her back the car. Tim took the car and followed her mom to Lilys room. He said to Lily, Im sorry, Lily. I stole your car. It was wrong. Here is your car. Can you forgive me? Lily looked at Tim and saw that he was sorry. She said, Thank you, Tim. I forgive you. But dont steal again. It is not nice. We can share our cars if we ask nicely. Tim nodded and said, Youre right, Lily. Im sorry. Can we still be friends? Lily smiled and said, Yes, we can still be friends. But next time, ask me first. They hugged and played with their cars. They learned a lesson. Stealing is bad. Sharing is good. Friends are better.Once upon a time there was a poor soldier who had to wander through the forest all alone. As he wandered he came across a small cottage. When he knocked on the door the owner of the cottage opened it. The soldier asked the owner, Do you have anything to eat? The owner replied, Yes I do. Please come in and help yourself. The soldier thanked the owner and stepped inside. Inside he found a big pot of stew. The soldier enjoyed the stew and thanked the owner. The owner said, Its my pleasure. The forest can be a scary place and you look like you could use a friend. The poor soldier was so happy to have a friend. From then on whenever he needed to wander through the forest he knew he could count on the owner of the cottage for a hot meal and some kind words.Lily liked to do things by herself. She was independent. She did not need help to put on her shoes, or to brush her teeth, or to pick her clothes. She liked to choose what she wanted to do and when she wanted to do it. But sometimes, Lilys mom and dad wanted her to do things their way. They wanted her to eat her vegetables, or to take a nap, or to share her toys. They said it was good for her. Lily did not like that. She said no. She said she was independent. One day, Lily and her mom went to the park. Lily saw a big slide. She wanted to go on it. She ran to the slide and climbed up the ladder. She did not wait for her mom. She did not look back. She was independent. But when she got to the top, she saw a boy. He was bigger than her. He was on the slide. He did not move. He did not let her go. He said it was his turn. He said she had to wait. Lily did not like that. She said no. She said she was independent. She tried to push him. He pushed her back. She tried to yell at him. He yelled at her louder. She tried to point at her mom. He pointed at his dad. They both looked angry. They both looked scared. They both wanted to go on the slide. Then, Lilys mom came. She saw what was happening. She said stop. She said it was not nice. She said they had to share. She said they had to be kind. She took Lilys hand and helped her down the ladder. She gave her a hug. She said she was sorry. She said she was proud of her. She said she was independent, but she also needed love. Lily felt better. She hugged her mom back. She said she was sorry too. She said she loved her. She said she was independent, but she also needed help. Then, the boys dad came. He saw what was happening. He said stop. He said it was not nice. He said they had to share. He said they had to be kind. He took the boys hand and helped him down the slide. He gave him a hug. He said he was sorry. He said he was proud of him. He said he was independent, but he also needed love. The boy felt better. He hugged his dad back. He said he was sorry too. He said he loved him. He said he was independent, but he also needed help. Then, Lily and the boy looked at each other. They did not look angry. They did not look scared. They looked curious. They looked friendly. They said hello. They said their names. They said they wanted to go on the slide. They said they could take turns. They said they could play together. They said they were independent, but they also needed friends.Mum and Jack were walking in the park. Jack was so excited! What are we here for? he said, eyes wide and filled with wonder. Were here to watch the parade, Mum said. Lots of people will be marching and it will be really festive! Jack couldnt wait! The parade started and there was music, bright flags and throngs of people cheering. He watched with awe and delight. Then suddenly, it was over. What happened? Jack asked, disappointed. Mum explained that the people were celebrating a victory. Everyone was very happy and feeling a bit dizzy. Jack thought about that and smiled, understanding what had happened. Then, he cheered too and smiled from ear to ear. He had been part of the victory too.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He had a big head and loved to play with his friends. One day, he wanted to invite his friend Billy to come over and play with him. So, he went to Billys house and knocked on the door. Billys mom answered the door and Timmy asked if Billy could come over and play. Billys mom said yes and Timmy was very happy. When they got to Timmys house, they played with toys and had lots of fun. But then, Timmy accidentally broke one of Billys toys. He felt ashamed and didnt know what to do. But then he remembered his mom telling him that when you make a mistake, you should say sorry and try to make it right. So, Timmy apologized to Billy and promised to buy him a new toy. Billy forgave him and they continued to play happily. The end.One day, a boy named Tom wanted to eat yogurt. He was very hungry. He went to the kitchen and saw a big yogurt cup. Tom was very happy. He wanted to eat it all. Toms sister, Lily, came into the kitchen. She saw the yogurt too. She said, I want some yogurt too! Tom did not want to share the yogurt. He wanted it all for himself. This made Lily sad. Tom thought about it for a moment. He wanted to be a generous brother. So, Tom said, Okay, we can share the yogurt. But when he tried to open the yogurt cup, it was very hard. He pulled and pulled, and then the yogurt cup broke! Yogurt went everywhere! Tom and Lily looked at each other and started to laugh. They knew they had to clean up the mess. After cleaning, they both learned to share and be more careful with their food. And from that day, Tom and Lily always shared their snacks and became more generous with each other.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She wanted to catch it, so she reached out her hand and tried to grab it. But the butterfly flew away too fast. Oh no, I missed it! Lily said. Her mommy hugged her and said, Dont worry, Lily. There will be more butterflies to catch. And we can always admire the nice cobwebs in the garden. Lily smiled and hugged her mommy back. She was happy to spend time with her and enjoy the simple things in life.Once upon a time there was a little girl who was very clever. She had a brilliant idea. Its a funny face I made with my pencil and paper, said the little girl with a smile. Mum laughed. Let me see, she said. The little girl handed her the piece of paper. Mum looked at the funny face and smiled. Thats brilliant! she said. Well done! The little girl felt very pleased with herself. She smiled, put the piece of paper away, and ran off to show her friends.Tom and Lily liked to play with their dads phone. They could record funny sounds and watch them later. One day, they found a new button on the phone. It said zoom. They wondered what it did. Lets try it, Tom said. He pressed the button and pointed the phone at Lily. The phone made a beep and showed Lilys face very big on the screen. Lily laughed and made a silly face. Wow, thats cool! Tom said. He pressed the button again and zoomed out. Then he zoomed in on his own face. He made a funny noise and recorded it. Let me try, let me try! Lily said. She reached for the phone, but Tom pulled it away. No, its my turn! Tom said. He was selfish. He did not want to share the phone with Lily. He zoomed in and out on different things and recorded them. Please, Tom, give me the phone! Lily said. She was sad and angry. She wanted to play with the zoom too. She tried to grab the phone, but Tom pushed her away. Stop it, Lily, youre annoying! Tom said. He did not care about Lilys feelings. He only cared about the phone. Suddenly, they heard their dads voice. He came into the room and saw them fighting over the phone. What are you doing, kids? he asked. He looked at the phone and saw the zoom button. He realized what they were playing with. Did you record anything with the zoom? he asked. Yes, dad, look! Tom said. He was proud of his recordings. He showed his dad the phone and played the sounds. Dad listened to the sounds and looked at the screen. He saw Toms face, Lilys face, a toy, a book, a lamp, and a flower. He also saw Tom pushing Lily and Lily crying. Dad was not happy. He was disappointed and angry. He took the phone from Tom and turned it off. Tom, you were very selfish and mean to Lily, he said. He felt sorry for her. Im sorry, Lily, he said. I was selfish and mean. I should have shared the phone with you. Will you forgive me? Lily looked at Tom and saw his sorry face. She felt better. She forgave him. Its okay, Tom, she said. I forgive you. Lets be friends again. She hugged him and he hugged her back. Dad smiled. He was glad they made up. He gave them both a kiss. Good kids, he said. Now, how about we watch the recordings together and have some fun?Once there was a leopard who lived in a jungle. He was very unique because he loved to talk to everyone he met. One day, while he was out on a walk, he came across a group of animals. The leopard stopped and said hello. The other animals looked at the leopard and didnt answer him. They glanced at each other, confused and curious about why the leopard was talking to them. The leopard continued to talk, but the other animals just stared back at him. Finally, the leopard got angry and yelled, Why dont you like to talk!? The other animals still didnt answer. They just looked away, embarrassed and ashamed. The leopard was upset and walked away. He had wanted to make new friends, but the other animals wouldnt even talk to him. He hung his head low and went back to the jungle, wondering why he had to be so unique.Once upon a time there was a boy named Ted. Ted was thirsty, so he went to find something to drink. He found a vine in the garden and went to take a sip. But the vine was all sour! Ted didnt like the taste and was ashamed. He quickly put the vine back in the garden and left to find something else to drink. Pretty soon Ted found a lake. He went close to the edge and dipped his cup in it. The water was cool and fresh and Ted was so happy! He drank and drank until he was no longer thirsty. Ted was now happy and full of energy, and he ran back to the garden to see the vine. He looked at the vine and smiled. He was no longer ashamed and he suddenly saw the vine in a new way. He even thought the vine was kind of fun! Ted now knew to stay away from the sour vine, but he thanked it for teaching him such an important lesson.Once upon a time, there was a duck. He was strong and powerful. The little boy looked scared. He said, Im trying to resist the bad wolf! The duck laughed and said, Thats a brave thing to do. Here, let me help you! The duck and the little boy worked together and soon, the bad wolf ran away. The duck was so strong and powerful that the wolf was too afraid to stay. They like to play with their toys in the living room. One day, they see a shiny chain on the table. It is their moms chain. She wears it when she goes out. Wow, look at this chain! Lily says. It is so pretty and sparkly. Can we play with it? Ben shakes his head. No, we cant. Mom said it is expensive. It is not a toy. We might break it or lose it. She will be mad at us. Lily pouts. But I want to play with it. It looks like a necklace for a princess. Please, Ben, just for a little bit. Ben thinks. He likes to make Lily happy, but he also wants to obey mom. He decides to say no. She decides to wait until Ben is not looking. Then she quickly grabs the chain and puts it around her neck. She feels like a princess. But then, something bad happens. The chain gets caught on a button on her shirt. She tries to pull it off, but it only gets tighter. She starts to cry. Help, Ben, help! The chain is stuck on me! Ben hears Lilys cry. He turns around and sees her with the chain. He is shocked and scared. Oh no, Lily, what did you do? Mom will be so angry! Let me help you! He runs to Lily and tries to untangle the chain. It was big and tall and had lots of pretty roses. But the rose bush was different from other rose bushes because it had sharp thorns. One day, a little girl was walking by the bush. She saw the roses and wanted to pick one. She reached out to pick it, but the sharp thorns poke her hand. She was sad and started to cry. Meanwhile, a little boy saw what happened. He wanted the little girl to be happy. So he thought of an idea. He ran to his kitchen and got some spices from his moms cupboard. He mixed the spices to make a special spicy powder. He sprinkled the powder onto the rose bush and the thorns started to turn soft. The little girl was so happy. She reached for the rose again and this time the thorns were soft. Now she could pick the rose and take it home with her. From that day, the little girl and the little boy picked all the roses from the rose bush and made a big beautiful bouquet.Tom and Sam are brothers. They like to play in their room. They have many toys and books and games. But they do not share well. They always fight over who gets what. One day, Mom says, Boys, I have a surprise for you. We are going to spend the day at the zoo. You can see the animals and have fun. But you have to be good and not fight. Can you do that? Tom and Sam nod and smile. They love the zoo. They put on their coats and shoes and follow Mom to the car. They are very excited. At the zoo, they see lions and tigers and bears. They see monkeys and elephants and giraffes. They see birds and fish and snakes. They have a lot of fun. They also see a panda. Mom says, Look, boys, a panda. It is very rare. You do not see it often. It is special. Tom and Sam look at the panda. It is black and white and fluffy. It eats bamboo and rolls on the ground. It is very cute. Tom and Sam both want to touch it. They run to the fence and reach out their hands. Stop! Mom says. You cannot touch the panda. It is not a toy. It is a wild animal. It can bite you. You have to be careful and respectful. You have to share the space with the panda and the other people. Can you do that? Tom and Sam nod and say sorry. They realize they were wrong. They do not want to hurt the panda or make Mom angry. They step back and watch the panda from a distance. They also let other children see the panda. They learn to share and be kind. Mom smiles and hugs them. She says, Good boys. I am proud of you. You are learning and growing. You are special too. Just like the panda.Once upon a time there was an oyster who lived in the ocean near a small beach. The oyster was so excited because he could finally be around all the other animals of the sea. Every day he would greet them with a cheerful hello and the other animals were happy that he was so friendly. One day, two children came to the beach. They both brought buckets and began to explore. The oyster watched curious what they were doing and then he saw one of the children pick up a large found shell on the shore. The child exclaimed, Mom, look what I found! Its called an oyster! The mom said, Thats wonderful, but you must remember to behave well around the oysters. Oysters are special and need to be treated with kindness and respect. The child agreed and the mom put the oyster gently back into the ocean. The child waved goodbye and the oyster was happy that he was still available to live in his home. He smiled and said, Thank you for respecting me. I feel very lucky to have a home here. The other animals watched in admiration, proud that the oyster had been well taken care of. They all began to sing a song of appreciation for the available oyster. And thats the story of the oyster and the children who were so gentle and kind.Once there was a girl named Jessie. She was friendly and everyone loved her. Every morning, Jessie would chew and enjoy her breakfast. One morning, Jessies mommy told her she was going to a new class today. Jessie was so excited! She got her shoes on and brushed her teeth, then jumped into the car. At the class, there were lots of friends to meet. Some of them were friendly and some of them not so friendly. Jessie felt nervous, but she was determined to make new friends. Jessie sat down and started to chew her snack. Suddenly, one of the friendly kids spoke up. Hi, Jessie! said the kid. My name is Tommy. Can I have some of your snack? Jessie smiled and said, Sure! She gave Tommy a few pieces of her snack to chew. From then on, Tommy and Jessie were the best of friends. They did everything together, from playing tag in the park, to working on their class projects. The end.Once upon a time there was a family who went out to buy some ice cream on a hot summer day. But when they got to the store, they saw that the weather was not nice at all it was very cloudy and stormy. The mom of the family, being very stubborn, insisted that they still buy the ice cream. But the kids knew that their mom was wrong. They thought it would be a good idea to go home instead. Connor, the oldest son, stepped up and asked his mom to listen to reason. He said that if they bought the ice cream, it wouldn√¢t be nice anymore by the time they got home. Finally, the mom listened and decided not to buy the ice cream. She thanked Connor for his good advice and praised him for being so brave. The moral of this story is that it√¢s often better to be brave and listen to your own thoughts than to be stubborn.The two friends, Jane and Jake, were playing in the park. Jane said to Jake, Lets climb the tree! But Jake was serious and said, No way! It looks too high and I dont understand why you want to do it. Jane frowned and said, You dont have to come with me, but Im going up. Jane began to climb, but suddenly she slipped and fell, cutting her arm on the way down. Jake saw that she was hurt and said, Let me help you. He carefully picked her up and took her to the bench. Jane said sadly, It hurts so much. I should have listened to you and not tried to climb the tree. Jake gave her a hug and said, Its ok, I understand. When Jane was feeling better, Jake said, Lets get something to help your cut. They got a plaster at the nearby shop and put it on the wound. Jane smiled and said, Thank you for understanding me and helping me. Jake smiled back, happy that Jane was ok and said, Its what friends are for.Once there was a mommy and a baby. The baby was very happy, because it was a sunny day. The mommy took the baby for a walk. They went for a walk in the park. The baby saw a pretty butterfly flying in the sky. The baby wanted to try and catch it. But just as the baby was about to run, the mommy said, Wait! The mommy pointed to smoke coming out of the woods. The baby asked, What is it? The mommy said, Lets stay here and be careful. The baby said OK. Just then, the baby heard a loud, violent sneeze coming from the smoke! The mommy and baby were both scared! The mommy took the babys hand and said, Come on, lets go back home and be safe. The baby agreed and they went back home, happy and safe.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his hoop. He would roll it around and around and it made him very happy. One day, Timmys mommy made him a yummy snack. She gave him some juicy grapes and Timmy loved them very much. After he finished his snack, Timmy went outside to play with his hoop. He was having so much fun, but then his hoop got stuck in a tree. Timmy tried and tried to get it down, but he couldnt do it by himself. He looked up at the hoop and said, Please come down, hoop! Suddenly, a gust of wind blew and the hoop fell down from the tree. Timmy was so happy and said, Thank you, wind! Thank you, hoop! Timmy continued to play with his hoop and eat his yummy grapes, feeling very grateful for all the fun things in his life. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and have fun. One day, she went to the park with her mom. While they were playing, Lily saw a spark in the grass. She ran over to see what it was. Mommy, look! A spark! Lily said. Her mom looked over and saw the spark too. Lets go show Daddy, her mom said. So they went home to show Daddy the spark. But when they got home, they saw that their house was on fire! The fire was big and scary, and the smoke was pale. They called the fire department, but it was too late. Their house burned down and they lost everything. Lily was sad because she lost her toys, but her mom and dad were just happy that they were safe. They hugged each other and knew that they would always be together, even without their things.Once upon a time, there was a wise old man who had two eyes. He used his eyes to watch the world and he knew a lot of things. One day, he gave a very important advice to his friend. He said Hurry, dont be so foolish!. His friend thanked him and ran away. The wise old man soon noticed that his friend had gone too fast and he became worried. He closed his eyes and thought deeply. Then he got an idea. He took off his shoes and ran after his friend as fast as he could. He ran and ran and ran, until he was able to catch his friend. He was very relieved! The wise old man told his friend, You must always remember to be careful. Hurry but dont be foolish! His friend thanked him again and they both went home.Once there was a small girl named Sarah. She was only three years old and very curious. She loved to see new things, and explore her world. One day Sarah was walking in the park with her mother. As she walked, she noticed something strange. Look Mommy, a pole! said Sarah, pointing ahead of her. Mommy looked and smiled. Yes, that is a pole, she said. Then Sarah saw something even more interesting. There was a strange light coming from the pole. She had never seen anything like it before. Mommy, what is that light? That is the result of something called mixing, Mommy said. People mix together different colors of light and make this special kind of light. Sarah was very excited. She had learned something new. Sarah kept walking and exploring the park with her mom, but from then on, every time she saw a pole with a special light, she would remember what Mommy said and smile.Molly was walking through the forest and she noticed something strange. There was steam coming from the ground and she thought it was very interesting. She stepped closer and saw a little creature, wearing a funny hat and frowning. Molly cautiously stepped closer and said, Hello, why are you frowning?. The little creature replied, Im stuck here and I cant leave. I just keep making more and more steam and its not helping me get out. Molly smiled and said, I might be able to help you, but youll have to trust me. The little creature perked up, smiled and said, I would love your help! Molly carefully stepped towards the creature, held out her hand and helped the little creature up. Then, together, they walked away from the steam and out into the sunshine.Jack and Jill were walking around the park one day. Jack wanted to discover something new. Suddenly he saw a dove in a tree. He was so excited and wanted to get closer to take a look. He ran up to the tree and stood underneath looking up. He was so frustrated when he could not get close enough. Jill came over and found a ladder nearby. She put it close to the tree and helped Jack climb up. When Jack was close enough, he was so happy. He held out his hand and the dove let him stroke it. Jack was so thrilled to have discovered something new with Jill. He looked back at the dove and thanked it before they left. Jack was never so happy as when he discovered the dove. Tweetie felt scared and tired from all the flying. But Tweetie knew what to do. She flew down to the ground and found a safe place to rest. After a little while, the earthquake stopped and Tweetie felt better. She flew back up into the sky and zoomed around again, happy to be flying freely once more. From that day on, whenever Tweetie felt tired or scared, she remembered the earthquake and knew that she could always find a safe place to rest. And so, Tweetie continued to zoom through the sky, enjoying every moment of her flying adventures.Once upon a time there were two best friends, Jon and Katy. They did not know what it was for, but they wanted to play with it. Bob said to Tim, Lets pull the cord and see what happens! Tim was a bit scared but decided to try. They both pulled the cord together. Suddenly, a big box fell from the sky and landed near them. The other animals heard the noise and came to see what was going on. The big box had a lock on it, and all the animals tried to open it. They pushed and pulled but could not open it. Tim had an idea and said, Lets use the cord to open the lock! They tied the cord around the lock and pulled with all their might. The lock broke, and the box opened. Inside the box, there were toys for all the animals to play with. Thank you, Mommy. This armchair is the best surprise ever! she exclaimed.Sara and Ben were twins who loved animals. They lived on a farm with their mom and dad. They had a dog, a cat, a cow, a horse and some chickens. Every morning, they helped feed and pet the animals. One day, they saw a new animal in the stable. It was a baby donkey. It was very small and chubby. It had long ears and a fuzzy coat. Sara and Ben wanted to play with it, but their mom said they had to be gentle and quiet. Where did the baby donkey come from? Sara asked. God gave it to us, their mom said. The mama donkey was very sick and we prayed for her to get better. God heard our prayers and sent us this miracle. Can we name the baby donkey? Ben asked. Sure, you can, their mom said. What do you want to call him? Sara and Ben thought for a moment. They looked at the baby donkeys ears, his coat and his eyes. They smiled at each other. Lets call him Fuzzy, Sara said. Fuzzy is a good name, Ben agreed. They hugged their mom and thanked God for Fuzzy. Then they went to the stable and gave Fuzzy some hay and water. They stroked his ears and told him stories. Fuzzy nuzzled their hands and made a happy sound. Sara and Ben felt very happy too. They loved Fuzzy and Fuzzy loved them.Tom and Sam were friends who liked to sail boats. They had small boats made of wood and paper that they put in the pond. They liked to see whose boat was faster and better. One day, they saw a big trophy on a table near the pond. It was shiny and had a boat on top. They both wanted the trophy very much. They decided to have a race with their boats and the winner would get the trophy. They put their boats in the water and said, Ready, set, go! They blew on their boats to make them move. Toms boat was red and Sams boat was blue. They were both very colorful. Toms boat was faster than Sams boat. It reached the other side of the pond first. Tom was very happy and ran to the table to get the trophy. He picked it up and shouted, I won! I won! This trophy is mine! Sam was very sad and angry. He did not like to lose. He wanted the trophy too. He ran to the table and tried to take the trophy from Tom. They both pulled and pushed and yelled at each other. But the trophy was not very strong. It broke in half and fell to the ground. The boat on top fell off and the shiny part cracked. Tom and Sam looked at the broken trophy and cried. They had ruined it. A man came to the table and saw the mess. He was the owner of the trophy. He was very mad and said, What have you done? This trophy was for the best sailor in the town. You are not sailors, you are troublemakers. You have to pay for the trophy and you have to leave the pond. You are not welcome here anymore. Tom and Sam felt very sorry and ashamed. They had lost their boats, their trophy, and their place to sail. They had also lost their friendship. They learned that being greedy and selfish is not good. They wished they had shared the trophy and played nicely.Tom and Anna were playing in the forest. They liked to pretend they were explorers and find new things. They saw a big cave and wanted to look inside. Maybe there is treasure in there, Tom said. Or maybe there is a monster, Anna said. They were both a little scared, but also curious. They held hands and walked into the cave. It was dark and cold. They heard a growl. Who is there? a voice said. Tom and Anna stopped and shivered. They saw two yellow eyes shining in the dark. They were afraid it was a wolf. Please dont hurt us, Tom said. We are just playing. The voice laughed. I am not a wolf. I am a bear. And I am not going to hurt you. I am generous. The bear came out of the shadows and revealed himself. He was big and brown and furry. He had a friendly smile. Hello, little explorers, he said. What are you looking for? Tom and Anna relaxed a bit. They saw that the bear was not mean. He was kind. We were looking for treasure, Anna said. Well, you are in luck, the bear said. I have some treasure to share with you. Follow me. The bear led them deeper into the cave. He showed them a pile of shiny stones, colorful feathers, and sweet berries. He gave some to Tom and Anna. These are my treasures, he said. But I have more than I need. You can have some too. You are my new friends. Tom and Anna were happy. They thanked the bear and gave him a hug. They took some of the treasures and went back to the forest. They had a new friend and a new adventure. They learned that not all caves have wolves, and not all bears are bad. He asked the bird to give him the feather. The bird said no! The frog wanted the feather so badly. Then, he had a bright idea. He asked the bird if they could play a game. The bird agreed. The frog said if he won, he could have the feather. The bird said yes. The frog and the bird played a game. The frog was very cunning and won all the games. Finally, the cool, green frog had the feather in his mouth. He hopped happily back to his pond. Tom and Lily ran to the house and told their mom. Mom, there is a big cloud and it is going to rain a lot! Tom said. Lets go inside and wait for the rain to stop, mom said. We dont want to get wet and cold. But Tom and Lily liked the rain. They wanted to splash in the puddles and make boats with leaves. They did not want to go inside and play with their toys. Please, mom, can we stay outside for a little bit? Lily asked. No, sweetie, it is not safe. The rain can make a flood and carry you away. You have to listen to me and come inside, mom said. They looked out the window and saw the rain falling harder and harder. The garden was full of water and mud. The flowers and the grass were drowning. The cloud was still in the sky and it was not going away. Tom and Lily felt sad and scared. They wished they had listened to mom and gone inside sooner. They hugged mom and said they were sorry. The spell was sparkling and glittery and Bobby and Bonnie were very curious. They hopped up to it and Bobby said to the spell, Please, let us have some fun! The spell was so happy and it granted their wish. It made them very playful and they began to hop around like crazy. Bobby and Bonnie were so happy they could hop and play with the spell. They hopped faster and faster and higher and higher until they had to take a break. They hopped back to the spell again and this time it was spinning and dancing. Bobby and Bonnie laughed and laughed as they watched the spell dance. The spell was so playful and the bunnies had so much fun. They hopped and hopped around the spell until it was time to go home. They thanked the spell for the fun day and said goodbye. They hopped happily away, knowing that they could come back and play another day.Once upon a time, there was a girl called Sally. Sally was 3 years old. She loved to explore, and today she had come across a big white glass wall. Can I climb it, Mummy? Sally asked her Mummy. Mummy smiled. No, no, darling, Mummy said. Its too high and too slippery. But Sally was determined. She was going to climb the white glass wall, no matter what! Taking a deep breath, Sally started to climb. She used her little hands and feet to grip onto the smooth glass and, bit by bit, Sally inched her way up. After a few minutes, Sally was at the top! I did it! she cheered. Mummy was so proud of her and gave her a big hug. Sally smiled from ear to ear. She had climbed the big white glass wall and she was so happy!Lily was excited to wash her new doll. She got a pink bucket and filled it with water and soap. She took her doll to the garden and put her in the bucket. She rubbed her hair and face and clothes with her hands. Look, Mommy, Im washing my doll! she shouted. Mommy came to the garden and saw Lily and her doll. She was not happy. She took the doll out of the bucket and shook her head. Lily, you cant wash your doll like that. She is not a real baby. She has a battery inside. If you get her wet, she will stop working. You have to be careful with your toys. Lily did not understand. She wanted to play with her doll. She reached for her, but Mommy held her back. Sorry, Lily, but your doll is broken. She wont talk or move or sing anymore. You have to say goodbye to her. Lily started to cry. She was very sad. She loved her doll. She hugged her and said sorry. She wished she had not washed her doll. She wished she had listened to Mommy. She wished she had a new doll.Ben and Lily are twins. They like to play soccer with their friends. They are on the same team. Their team is called the Tigers. The Tigers are very good at soccer. They can run fast, kick hard, and score goals. Today, the Tigers have a big game. They have to play against the Lions. The Lions are another team. The Lions are very noisy. They yell and roar and try to scare the Tigers. The Tigers are not scared. They are brave and strong. Before the game, Ben and Lily pray. They pray to God. They say, God, please help us play well. Please help us have fun. Please help us be kind to the Lions. And please help us win. Amen. Then, the game starts. The Tigers and the Lions run and kick and chase the ball. The Lions are still noisy. They say, We are the best! We will beat you! You are no match for us! The Tigers are quiet. They say, We are a team. We work together. We respect you. We will try our best. The game is very close. Both teams score many goals. But at the end, the Tigers score one more goal than the Lions. The Tigers win! They are very happy. They hug and cheer and thank God. The Lions are sad. They cry and pout and blame each other. Ben and Lily go to the Lions. They say, Good game. You played well. You are a good team. Dont be sad. We can be friends. The Lions are surprised. They say, Really? You are not mad at us? You are not mean to us? You are nice to us? Ben and Lily say, Yes. We are nice to you. We are all Gods children. We can all pray and play together. The Lions smile. They say, Thank you. You are right. We are sorry for being noisy. We are sorry for being rude. We can be friends. Then, the Tigers and the Lions hug and cheer and thank God. They are all happy. They are all friends. They are all teams.In an old house, there was a family. It was dinner time and tonight the family was having spaghetti. He realized that it was fun to share with others. He thanked Peter for coming over and asked him to come again tomorrow. One day, Fin saw a fancy shell on the sea floor. He wanted to show it to his friends. But, he could not pick up the shell. He needed help. Fin saw a big wave coming. He asked the wave for help. Wave, I need help to pick up this fancy shell, said Fin. The wave was kind and helped Fin. The wave pushed the fancy shell up to Fins friends. Fins friends loved the fancy shell. They thanked the wave and Fin. They all learned that it is good to ask for help when you need it. And they lived happily ever after.Once upon a time there was a charming little port. All the boats would come in for docking and refueling before going off to explore new lands. One day a young sailor named Jack set off on a grand adventure, with one mission to rescue his beloved sailboat from a distant island. Jack was so determined to reach his goal, but as he ventured farther out to sea, he began to fear he would never get there in time. Suddenly, a wave washed up onto the deck, revealing a tiny island in the distance. Without hesitation, Jack steered his boat toward the small port. At the charming port, Jack was able to refuel his boat and find supplies for his rescue mission. He said his goodbyes to the friendly locals and sailed off into the horizon. Finally, after days of sailing, Jack arrived at his destination √¢ the island where his beloved sailboat was stranded. Jack set out to explore the island, until he discovered his sailboat, just as he had left it. With great joy he was able to rescue his boat from the island and make his voyage back home. What an adventurer Jack had been!Lily loved her doll very much. She gave her doll a name, Anna, and played with her every day. She dressed her doll in pretty clothes, brushed her hair, and sang to her. Lily was happy with her doll. One day, Lily had to go to the store with her mom. She did not want to leave her doll alone in her room. She was afraid that her brother, Tom, would take her doll and make fun of her. Tom was older and liked to tease Lily. He said that dolls were silly and only for babies. Lily did not like that. So Lily decided to lock her doll in her closet. She found a key and turned it in the lock. She said to her doll, Dont worry, Anna. I will be back soon. You will be safe here. I love you. She kissed her doll and closed the closet door. But when Lily came back from the store, she could not find the key. She looked everywhere, but it was gone. She started to cry. She wanted to see her doll. She missed her doll. She knocked on the closet door and said, Anna, are you there? Im sorry, I lost the key. Please dont be mad at me. Then she heard a voice from the closet. It was not her doll. It was Tom. He said, Ha ha, Lily. I found your key. I opened the closet and took your doll. She is so ugly and stupid. Look what I did to her. He opened the closet door and showed Lily her doll. It was a weird, blue creature. It had funny eyes and big ears. The creature blinked and the little boy blinked too. She gave the letter to Max and he opened it. He was very happy. He hugged Lily and said, You are the best friend ever! They put the letters in a special folder and kept it in the box. They kissed and hugged and said, I love you!Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy who loved motorcycles. He had a toy motorcycle that he played with every day. Timmy was sad that his toy motorcycle broke and he couldnt play with it anymore. But his mom had an idea. She took the broken motorcycle and fixed it with some glue. He also learned that even if something breaks, it can be fixed with a little bit of help.Tom and Anna were in school. They had to learn about history. History was boring. It was about old people and old things. Tom and Anna did not like history. The teacher showed them a big book. The book had many pictures and words. The teacher said, This is a very important book. It tells us about our history. We have to take good care of it. Tom and Anna did not care. They wanted to play. They waited for the teacher to look away. Then they took the book and ran outside. They wanted to have fun with the book. They threw the book in the air. They kicked the book. They ripped the book. They laughed and laughed. They did not see the big dog. The big dog saw the book. The big dog liked books. The big dog wanted to eat the book. The big dog ran after the book. Tom and Anna were scared. Help! Help! they shouted. The dog wants to eat the book! The teacher heard them. The teacher ran outside. The teacher saw the dog and the book. The teacher was angry and sad. Stop! Stop! the teacher said. That is a very bad thing to do. You are hurting the book. You are hurting our history. You have to save the book. Give it to me! Tom and Anna were sorry. They did not want to hurt the book. They did not want to hurt history. They gave the book to the teacher. The teacher took the book and hugged it. Thank you for saving the book, the teacher said. But you have to learn a lesson. History is not boring. History is amazing. History is about us and our stories. History is a gift. You have to respect it and love it. Tom and Anna nodded. They felt bad. They wanted to learn more about history. They said sorry to the teacher and the book. They promised to be good and listen. The teacher smiled and forgave them. The teacher took them back to the classroom. The teacher showed them more pictures and words. Tom and Anna looked and listened. They learned and enjoyed. History was not boring. But one day, the sun went away and it became a dark night. Jazz tried to bounce but he was scared, he didnt like the dark. Jazz was in big trouble because he knew he wouldnt be able to find his way home. He tried to find someone to help him, but there was no one around. As he was walking, he heard some music coming from the darkness. It was jazz, and he realized it was coming from his pond. Jazz began to bounce again and he quickly made his way to his pond. When he got there, he was amazed to see all the other frogs, who had been scared of the dark, dancing and playing to the jazz music. He had found his way home! From then on, Jazz always bounced whenever it was dark.Lily and Ben were playing in the kitchen. They saw a big pastry on the table. It looked yummy and sweet. Can we have some pastry, Mom? They found a nice spot under a big tree and started to play. Tom banged his drum and Anna blew her flute. They had fun making their own rhythm. But then, a big bird came and landed on the tree. He hopped out of his nest and started to flutter his wings. He flew up and up into the sky, higher and higher. Joe flew by a boy walking along the ground. He was wearing a red shoe. Joe watched the shoe as he soared and he wanted so badly to fly closer to it. The boy saw Joe and smiled. He reached out to Joe, but Joe was too shy to go near the boys hand. Soo, Joe flew away, but he kept looking back at the shoe. Joe returned to his nest, safe and happy. He knew he would never forget the day he finally soared. Mommy saw that Lily needed help and decided to call an ambulance. Soon, the ambulance came with its lights flashing and siren blaring. The ambulance had big doors that could open and close quickly. The paramedics were very nice and helped Lily onto a stretcher. They put her in the ambulance and drove her to the hospital. After the doctors looked at her knee, they put a bandage on it and told Lily she would be okay. From that day on, Lily knew that if she ever needed help, she could call an ambulance and they would come to help her. She was happy that the ambulance doors could open and close so fast because it meant she could get help quickly.Maria and her dad were walking in the park. Maria was feeling very excited, as it had been a long time since she had been outside. She looked around and saw lots of children playing. Her dad asked her, Do you want to join them? Maria smiled, Yes! She started to walk over to the other kids, but when she arrived she felt very anxious. All the other kids were older and seemed to know each other. Maria felt embarrassed. Her dad noticed that Maria was getting anxious and put his arm around her shoulder and said, Its ok, Maria. You dont need to be embarrassed. You can still be with the other children and make friends. You just need to give it a try. Maria was still feeling embarrassed, yet she did not want her dad to be disappointed in her. She decided to take her dads advice and try. She smiled and walked over to a group of the older children. They said hello and welcomed her to join them. Maria felt a huge sense of relief that she had not been too embarrassed to try. She joined in the game and eventually made some friends. Maria had gone from feeling anxious to feeling proud and happy.Once upon a time, there was a big guard. He was strong and very brave. He loved protecting the people of the town. Every day, he would stand guard at the castle gate and make sure nobody came in who he didnt know. He was happy to do this job because he loved to help others. One day a little girl came to the castle gate. She was very small and scared. The guard saw her and smiled. He knew she must be lost and wanted to help. He asked where she was going and she said she was looking for her mom. The guard felt so sorry for the little girl. He asked if he could help her find her mom. The little girl said yes, so the guard searched all around town but he couldnt find her mom. He decided to take the little girl home with him, so she would be safe. The little girl was happy to have a place to stay. She loved the guard and was so grateful for all he had done. The guard was happy too. He knew he had done a good deed and he was glad he could help the little girl. They were both very happy. Love had made them safe.Once upon a time, there was a chubby cricket named Jim. Jim loved to sing and hop around in the grass. One day, Jim hopped into a hole and couldnt get out. He cried out, Help! Help! Im stuck! Just then, a little girl named Lily walked by and heard Jims cries. She peeked into the hole and saw Jims chubby body. Dont worry, Jim. Ill get you out! she said. She reached in and pulled him out of the hole. Thank you, Lily! said Jim. You saved me. Suddenly, a big storm came and lightning struck a tree nearby. Lily and Jim were scared, but they stuck together and waited for the storm to pass. After the storm, they said goodbye and Jim hopped away, singing a happy song.Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max loved to whistle. He whistled all day long. One day, Max went for a walk and found a filthy seat. He thought it was a good place to rest. Max sat on the filthy seat and whistled a happy tune. A little girl named Lily heard Maxs whistle and came to see who was making the lovely sound. She saw Max sitting on the filthy seat and said, Hi there, little dog! I like your whistle! Max looked up and wagged his tail. He whistled back at Lily. Lily giggled and said, Youre so funny, Max! But why are you sitting on that filthy seat? Lets find a clean place to sit and play together. Max agreed and jumped off the filthy seat. Together, Max and Lily found a clean spot under a big tree. Max whistled and Lily sang, and they played all day long. They became best friends and promised to meet under the tree every day to whistle, sing, and have fun.Lily was sick. She had a bad cough and a hot head. Mommy gave her a pill to make her feel better. Lily did not like the pill. It was big and bitter. She made a face and spit it out. Come on, Lily, you have to take the pill, Mommy said. It will help you stop coughing and cool your head. Lily shook her head. She did not want the pill. She saw her brother Jake playing with his toys. He was not sick. He looked happy and fun. Lily felt jealous. She wanted to play too. Jake, can I play with you? Lily asked. No, Lily, you are sick. You have to stay in bed, Jake said. And you have to take the pill. Mommy said so. Lily was angry. She did not like Jake. He was mean and bossy. She wanted to make him sad. She had an idea. She acted like she was very sick. She coughed louder and louder. She closed her eyes and moaned. Mommy, Mommy, Lily is very sick! Jake shouted. He was scared. He ran to get Mommy. Mommy came and saw Lily. She was worried. She felt her head and took her temperature. She saw the pill on the floor. Lily, why did you spit out the pill? Mommy asked. You need to take it to get better. Lily opened her eyes and smiled. She was not sick. She was acting. She wanted to trick Jake. She wanted to play with his toys. Im sorry, Mommy. I dont like the pill. Can I play now? Lily asked. Mommy was not happy. She was angry. She knew Lily was acting. She did not like her lie. No, Lily, you cannot play. You have to take the pill and stay in bed. And you have to say sorry to Jake. He was worried about you. You were not nice to him. You were jealous and mean, Mommy said. Lily felt bad. She knew Mommy was right. She did not want to make Jake sad. She wanted to be nice to him. She said sorry to Jake and took the pill. She hugged Mommy and Jake. She hoped she would get better soon. She learned not to act and lie. She learned to be happy for Jake and share his toys.Today was a different day for Billy. They started to walk slowly, step by step. Dotty watched Mr. Ts feet and tried to copy him. It was hard at first, but she kept trying. Soon, Dotty learned how to walk better and faster. She thanked Mr. T and said, Now I can play with my friends without falling down! Dotty and Mr. T became best friends, and they spent many happy days together in the big green forest. He skipped until he arrived just before dark. He had really enjoyed his adventure and thought about the oyster all the way home.Once upon a time, there was a farmer named Jack. He had a big farm with lots of different animals. Every day he had to load up the animals so they could go to the market. One day, Jacks neighbor wanted to borrow Jacks donkey. He asked Jack to lend him the donkey, but Jack said no. His neighbor was getting very mad! You are being very selfish! the neighbor exclaimed. Suddenly, I understand why people call you Selfish Jack. Jack started to feel very sad. He knew he should share his animals with his neighbor, but he wanted to keep them all to himself. That night Jack had a dream. In his dream, all the farm animals went to the market together, loaded on the same wagon. He could see his neighbor next to him, and they were both smiling. Jack woke up and knew that he had to do the right thing. He loaded up his donkey and let his neighbor borrow it. From then on, Jack was no longer known as Selfish Jack he was Friend Jack!Tuesday was a sad day for Tommy as he dropped his favorite toy on the floor. He asked his mom if they could get the puppy, but his mom said they had to keep going and get the bandaid first. Tommy was so disappointed. When Tommy and his mom arrived back home, Tommy quickly ran to the window to look for the puppy. But it was gone. Tommy was so sad and started to cry. His mom tried to console him and told him that the puppy had gone to find a new home. But the sad ending just made Tommy feel worse. He would never see the puppy ever again. He knew he couldnt get it back and he just wanted his favorite toy. He cried and cried until he fell asleep.Once upon a time, there was a small mouse named Timmy. Timmy was always scared of everything and everyone. He would hide in his little hole all day, every day. One day, Timmy saw a big cat walking towards him. He was so scared that he didnt know what to do. He thought about running away, but he knew the cat was faster. Just then, Timmy remembered something his mommy had told him. She said that if he ever felt scared, he should answer with courage. So, Timmy took a deep breath and stood up to the cat. To his surprise, the cat just walked away. From that day on, Timmy was no longer scared of anything. He learned that sometimes, even the smallest of creatures can have the biggest courage.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. He wanted to explore the world but his parents said no. One day, he heard a strange noise coming from outside. He wanted to go and see what it was, but he was scared and started to tremble. His mama saw him. She asked him what was wrong. He looked at her and said he wanted to go outside. She said no but he was too curious. He went out of the house and saw a huge airplane flying in the sky. He was so amazed and forgot to be scared. The airplane was from a faraway country. For a moment he forgot that the world was so big. He was so excited that he forgot to be stubborn and followed his parents back into the house.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to wear her pink vest when she went outside to play. One day, Lilys mom told her that she had to stay inside because it was raining outside. Lily was sad because she wanted to play with her friends. Suddenly, there was a knock on the door. Lilys friend, Tommy, was standing outside with a big smile on his face. Hi Lily, do you want to come over to my house and play? he asked. Lily was so happy that she forgot about the rain and put on her vest. When they got to Tommys house, they decided to play with his toy cars. But one of the cars was spoiled and wouldnt move. Tommy tried to fix it, but he couldnt. Lets play something else, said Lily. I know, lets rock back and forth on the rocking chair! They had so much fun that they forgot about the rain and played until it stopped. From that day on, Lily and Tommy were the best of friends.Once upon a time, there was a tight room filled with excited kids. Suddenly, a man with a trumpet entered. He was tall and smiled at everyone. The man said, Today Im going to show everybody how to play this magical instrument. Its called a trumpet. Does anyone want to give it a try? All of the kids raised their hands. The man chose one of the kids, a three year old girl. She was really excited. With the help of the man, she put the trumpet up to her lips and tried to make a sound. After a few tries, the girl made a beautiful sound. Everyone clapped and cheered. The girl was so proud and she smiled big. The man said, With a little practice, you can really make this trumpet sing! The girl was determined to practice and she kept the trumpet close. The man winked at her and said, I just know that one day well hear your beautiful trumpet playing all around town! The girl smiled and nodded. She was excited about the possibilities that could be in store.Once upon a time there was a bear named Bob. He was very excited to hear about a van that was coming to his home. He rushed to his window and saw the big van driving up his driveway. He heard a sound and realized it was coming from the van. When the van stopped, Bob quickly went outside to see what was inside. When the doors opened, Bob saw a surprise! Inside the van were lots of balloons in all different colors! He was so excited he started bouncing. His mom and dad came outside too and laughed at Bobs happiness. They played with the balloons for a long time. After a while, Bob heard a sound of an engine. He quickly got up and looked outside. The van was driving away. Bob waved as the van drove off, hoping it would come back someday soon. His mom and dad said goodbye and Bob went back inside, still excited about the colorful van.One day, a small town was filled with joy. There was a very special event happening. Everyone gathered in the town square and watched as a beautiful lady stepped out of a carriage wearing a long white dress. She kneeled down to the ground, with a kind look in her eyes. The people in the town had no idea why she was kneeling, so they waited in silence. Suddenly, the sky grew dark and a voice boomed from the heavens. It said that the lady had come to bless the town and asked everyone to kneel too. The people all obeyed and kneeled to the ground. When the voice stopped speaking, it was suddenly very bright outside again. Everyone got up and exchanged happy smiles, thrilled that they had been blessed. The lady said goodbye, waved to everyone and hopped back in the carriage. The people of the small town felt special, grateful for the amazing blessing that had been bestowed upon them. They talked amongst themselves and always remembered the special day when they all kneeled together.Ben and Mia were playing in the park with their bikes. They liked to ride fast and make noises. They saw a big hill and wanted to go down it. Lets race! Ben said. I bet I can go faster than you! OK! Mia said. But be careful. There is a cable at the bottom of the hill. It is for the lights. We have to stop before we hit it. They got ready and started to pedal. They went down the hill very fast. They felt the wind in their hair and the sun on their faces. They laughed and shouted. But Ben did not listen to Mia. He wanted to win. He did not look at the cable. He did not stop. He hit the cable with his bike. He fell off and hurt his leg. He started to scream. Mia stopped and ran to him. She saw the blood on his leg. She felt sorry for him. She said, Ben, why did you not stop? I told you about the cable. You were not wise. You were silly. Now you are hurt. Ben cried and said, Im sorry, Mia. I wanted to win. I did not think. You were wise. You were careful. Can you help me? Mia nodded and said, Yes, I can help you. But first, we have to call Mom. She will know what to do. She will take you to the doctor. He will make your leg better. She took out her phone and called Mom. She told her what happened. Mom said she would come right away. She told them to stay where they were and not to move. Mia hugged Ben and said, Dont worry, Ben. It will be OK. Mom is coming. She will help you. And I will stay with you. You are my brother. I love you. Ben smiled and said, Thank you, Mia. You are my sister. I love you too.Once upon a time there were two friends called Bob and Lucy. They went out on a sunny day to find something fun to do. So they decided to go to the park. When they arrived, they saw lots of things they could do, like swing on the swing and roll down the slide. But Bob saw a rake and thought it would be fun to try it out. Lets try it! said Bob. He took the rake and Lucy held it. Then Bob tasted the handle. It was an ordinary taste, but Bob tasted it anyway. That doesnt taste good! said Bob. Lucy shook her head and said, Bob, you shouldnt taste things that youre not sure about. But it was too late. Bob had already tasted it. Then he was feeling very sick. The moral of this story is to never taste things you are not sure about. Just because something looks ordinary doesnt mean that it is safe.Once there was a girl who liked to take the subway. Every day she would use the regular subway. Every morning she would hop on the subway and go downtown. She would take the regular subway the whole way there. One day, something special happened! Instead of taking the regular subway, she took a special one. It was called the express subway. On the express subway, she went much faster than she went on the regular one. When she got downtown, she was very excited. She was happy that she had gotten there so quickly using the express subway. From then on, she usually took the express subway. But every now and then, she would use the regular subway, so she could go at her own pace.Once upon a time, there was a little boy. He was so excited to go and play in the park. He had a new toy and he wanted to show his friends. As he walked, he saw a big lake. He wanted to row his toy across the lake. He tried and tried but he was just too little. He kept dropping the oars. He got so frustrated he started to cry. His mum saw him struggling and said Dont worry, I can help! She helped him row to the other side of the lake. He was so proud of himself, he had worked so hard! He showed all his friends his toy. They were so impressed and they all decided to go and row together. It was such a fun day. The little boy learned that with a bit of hard work, he can do anything!Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lisa. Lisa wanted to be strong, so she started to do exercise. First, she did some light running around the yard. Then, she did some jumping jacks. Next, she did a few push ups. By the end, Lisa was out of breath. But she felt very good, because she knew she was getting stronger. Then, it started to rain. So Lisa stopped her exercise and went inside. The next day, Lisa decided to start her exercise again. She was proud when she finished the routine. She felt strong and happy.Once upon a time there was a little girl named Katy. She loved to explore the world around her. One day, while out walking on the street, Katy saw something she had never seen before. A sign! She was so curious that she wanted to go read it. But the sign was very high up, too high for Katy to reach. She felt helpless. Just then, a kind old man approached her. Do you need help?, he asked. Katy smiled and nodded, and he helped her read the sign. It said Welcome to Katys street! Katy was so happy! The old man and Katy hugged each other, and from that day on Katy knew she could always find help when she needed it.Once upon a time, there was a man named Mr. Mustache. He had a big, bushy mustache that made him look very silly. One day, he went on a trip to a faraway place that was very distant. He wanted to teach the people there about his mustache. When he arrived, the people were very curious about his mustache. They had never seen anything like it before! Mr. Mustache was happy to teach them all about how he took care of it and how it made him feel special. The people were amazed and wanted to grow their own mustaches just like his. After spending some time in the distant place, Mr. Mustache had made many new friends. They all had big, bushy mustaches too! He was happy to have taught them something new and to have made so many new friends. And with that, he said goodbye and headed back home, feeling proud of his mustache and the new friends he had made.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat her cereal with a spoon every morning. One day, she woke up and saw that her spoon was missing. She looked all over her kitchen, but she couldnt find it anywhere. Lilys mom told her that maybe the spoon was hiding in the fridge because it was feeling cold. Lily didnt believe her, but she checked anyway. And there it was! The spoon was hiding behind the milk carton. Lily was so happy to have found her spoon that she waved it around in the air. From then on, she made sure to always check the fridge before she ate her cereal.Once upon a time, there was a kind and compassionate girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, she saw a small bird with a hurt wing. Lily wanted to help the bird, so she went to search for something to make it feel better. Lily looked everywhere for something to help the bird. She looked under rocks, behind trees, and in the tall grass. Then, she found a soft bush with pretty flowers. Lily thought that the flowers could make the bird happy and help it feel better. Lily carefully picked some of the flowers from the bush and brought them to the bird. The bird looked at the flowers and seemed to smile. It ate a little bit of the flower and started to feel better. The birds wing was not hurt anymore, and it could fly again. The bird flew up in the sky and sang a happy song. Lily knew that her search was worth it, and she felt happy that she could help her new friend.Once upon a time, there lived a cute little dog named Tia. She was always looking for something fun to do. One day, she had a great idea. Tia found an old ashtray and decided to fill it with water and make a mini swimming pool for herself. She filled it with cold water from a hose in her backyard and then put some of her favorite toys inside it. Tia was so excited to be able to take a dip in her very own mini pool. She wagged her tail and barked with joy. Tia spent all afternoon and evening playing in her pool. She swam and played fetch with her toys. She was so happy that she went to bed that night with a big smile on her face. The next day, Tia filled the ashtray with sunflower seeds and threw them all around her backyard. She watched the birds come and eat them with a huge grin on her face. Tia was so excited to have discovered that an ashtray made a great little swimming pool and a great bird feeder too. She was so proud of herself for finding such a cute and fun way to enjoy her day.Once upon a time there was a brave girl. Her name was Melinda and she was very persistent. Melinda had a special velvet cape and she liked to wear it when she needed courage. One day, Melinda wanted to join a game that the other children were playing. She took off her cape and ran to join them, but the children said no. They did not want her to play. Melinda felt sad but she was still persistent. She asked them again to let her join the game, but the children said no. Then, suddenly, Melinda remembered her velvet cape. She put it on and ran back to the game. She was so brave and determined that the other kids were surprised. They let her join and Melinda had the most fun ever!Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her garden. She liked to make mud pies and pick pretty flowers. One day, Lilys garden was very slow. The flowers were not growing and the mud was not soft. Lily was sad because she loved her garden very much. She asked her mommy what was wrong. Mommy said that the garden needed more water and sunshine. So, Lily got a big watering can and poured lots of water on her garden. She also asked the sun to come out and shine on her garden. After a few days, Lilys garden was no longer slow. The flowers were bigger and prettier than ever before. Lily was happy again and she continued to make mud pies and pick pretty flowers in her beautiful garden. The end.Tom and Anna are friends. They go to the same school. They have an exam tomorrow. The exam is about shiny things. They have to know the names of shiny things and how to polish them. Tom is wealthy. He has many shiny things at home. He has a big car, a silver watch, a gold ring, and a shiny trophy. He polishes them every day with a soft cloth. He thinks he will do well on the exam. Anna is not wealthy. She has few shiny things at home. She has a small bike, a copper coin, a brass button, and a glass bead. She polishes them sometimes with a rag. She is not sure if she will do well on the exam. Can I come to your house and study with you? Anna asks Tom. Sure, you can come, Tom says. But you have to bring your own shiny things. I dont want you to touch mine. They are very precious. Anna feels sad. She thinks Tom is not a good friend. She thinks he is selfish and greedy. She decides to study by herself. She reads her book and looks at the pictures of shiny things. She learns their names and how to polish them. The next day, they take the exam. The teacher gives them a paper with questions and a box with shiny things. They have to write the names of the shiny things and polish them with a cloth. Tom is confident. He knows all the names of the shiny things. He polishes them quickly and neatly. He thinks he will get a good grade. Anna is nervous. She does not know all the names of the shiny things. She polishes them slowly and carefully. She thinks she will get a bad grade. When the teacher collects the papers and the boxes, she smiles at Anna. She says, You did a very good job, Anna. You polished the shiny things very well. You made them sparkle and glow. You have a good eye and a gentle hand. You get a high grade. She frowns at Tom. She says, You did a poor job, Tom. You polished the shiny things very badly. You made them dull and dirty. You have a bad eye and a rough hand. You get a low grade. Anna is happy. She thinks she did better than she expected. She thinks she learned something new and useful. Tom is angry. He thinks he did worse than he deserved. He thinks he knew everything and wasted his time. Anna and Tom are friends. But they are not the same. They have different things, different skills, and different attitudes. They have to learn from each other and respect each other.once there was a boy. he was only three. he liked to blink and look around. one day he looked out the window and saw something blue far away. it was so beautiful he wanted to go see it. so he put on his shoes and left his home. he walked and he walked until finally he reached the blue thing. it was a big blue balloon! he was so excited he started to jump and laugh. he wanted to take it home with him. so he grabbed it with both hands and walked back home. when he arrived he held up the balloon for everyone to see. he was so happy to have this beautiful blue balloon at home.Sam was a guard. He was different from other guards. He wanted to do something special. He looked around and then he had an idea. Sam decided to lie down. He lay very still and pretended to be asleep. Everyone was surprised. They asked What are you doing? Sam just smiled. Soon a little bird came to Sam. It wanted to find a safe place to rest. Sam said You can stay here. I am the guard. The bird felt happy and safe. Others guards were still surprised. They asked Why are you different? Sam said Sometimes you have to do something different to make the world a better place. Everyone smiled and agreed. Sam continued to lie there, guarding the little bird. And he stayed like that all day.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. So they played outside in the rain together, under the clear umbrella.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to dance. So Mia went to school with a smile. Mia took the test and did her best. When she got home, she danced with joy. She was happy because she was honest and tried her best.Sara did not like broccoli. She thought it was green and yucky. She did not want to eat it for dinner. She pushed it away with her fork. Please, Sara, try some broccoli. It is good for you, her mom said. She urged Sara to eat some. She put a small piece on her plate. Sara shook her head. She made a face. She said, No, thank you. I want pasta. Her mom sighed. She said, You can have pasta after you eat some broccoli. Just one bite, okay? Sara looked at the broccoli. She did not want to make her mom sad. She was a good girl. She picked up the piece with her fingers. She was careful not to drop it. She put it in her mouth. She chewed it slowly. She was surprised. It was not so bad. It was a little crunchy and a little sweet. She swallowed it. She smiled at her mom. See, it is not yucky. Do you want some more? her mom asked. Sara nodded. She said, Yes, please. I like broccoli. Her mom was happy. She gave her some more broccoli and some pasta. She said, I am proud of you, Sara. You are a brave girl. Sara felt good. She ate her dinner. She liked broccoli. She was glad she tried it.Once upon a time there was a big strong bear. He was brave and liked to dare other animals to do silly things. One day he dared a rabbit to jump into a big pond in the middle of spring. The rabbit was so scared and kept saying, No! No! But the bear kept saying, Go ahead and jump, dont be scared! Finally the rabbit decided to be brave and took a big jump. He jumped high and far, into the pond. When he got out of the pond he was really wet and cold. The bear said, Now do you see why I dared you? It isnt so bad, is it? The rabbit agreed, and then the bear said, Now if you do something even more daring Ill give you something special. The rabbit thought for a moment, and then said, Dare me to go into the expensive store and get something from it? The bear said, Ok, that is daring! Go get something special for yourself if you can. The rabbit hopped off and went to the expensive store. He got something special, and the bear was so proud of him. He gave the rabbit a special reward, and from then on the rabbit was not scared to dare himself to do new things.Once upon a time, there was a bald dad and his beautiful daughter. The daughter was excited and joined her dad with her eyes closed. Breathlessly, the dad asked, What do you wish for? The daughter smiled and replied, A puppy! The dad smiled and opened his eyes, and when he looked down, there was indeed a puppy coming up to the daughter. You can receive your puppy now, the dad said. The daughter and the puppy hugged each other and the dad was delighted. From then on, they went on their morning walks together as a happy bald dad, a beautiful daughter and a playful pup.One day, a little boy was playing outside. He was feeling warm and cozy in his new socks. He wanted to touch them and feel how soft they were. He bent down, slowly reached out his little hand, and touched the sock. Suddenly, his hand felt a prickly sensation and he pulled it away quickly. He looked down and saw the ground was covered in prickly thorns. The sock had caught on one of the thorns. He tugged and tugged, but the sock wouldnt come off. He started to cry and scream. His mom came running to help him and carefully pulled the sock off the thorn. Unfortunately, the sock was ruined and now has a big hole in it. The little boy was very sad that his warm and cozy sock was ruined.Lily and Ben like to play with bubbles. They have a big bottle of bubble soap and a wand. They blow bubbles in the park and watch them fly in the air. They try to catch them and pop them. One day, a huge dog comes to the park. He sees the bubbles and thinks they are balls. He runs after them and tries to bite them. He barks and jumps and scares Lily and Ben. He pops all the bubbles with his teeth and tongue. Lily and Ben are sad and angry. They want to play with bubbles, not with the dog. They tell the dog to go away, but he does not listen. He wants more bubbles. He knocks over the bottle of bubble soap and spills it on the grass. He licks the soap and makes a funny face. Lily and Ben see the soap on the grass. They have an idea. They pick up some soap with their hands and throw it at the dog. The soap makes more bubbles in the air. The dog is surprised and confused. He tries to catch the soap bubbles, but they scatter and fly away. He runs around and around, but he cannot catch them. Lily and Ben laugh and clap. They have fun throwing soap bubbles at the dog. The dog has fun chasing the soap bubbles. He stops barking and jumping and scaring them. He wags his tail and licks their faces. He is a friendly dog. He just likes to play. Lily and Ben make friends with the dog. They share their bubble soap and wand with him. They blow bubbles together and have a happy day.One day, a boy saw a purple bird outside. Ricky did not want to freeze, he wanted to move and make noise. Suddenly, Ricky had an idea. He thought if he froze really still like a statue, he would be able to move without anyone noticing. He held his breath and became as still as he could, not even blinking his eyes. Slowly, Ricky began to move his feet and creep around the classroom on tip toe. He shuffled his feet across the light blue carpet and passed by the desks and chairs, careful not to make a sound. Ricky was so thrilled that he was able to move without anyone noticing. He couldnt help but giggle and smile as he continued his sneaking around the classroom. Eventually, he decided it was time to freeze again and sneak back to his desk. Even though he had to rest after naptime, he felt like a secret spy!Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, she saw a cactus in her backyard. The creature was very friendly and always said hello to everyone. One day, the creature decided to take a walk around its planet. As the creature was walking around, he noticed something very interesting in the distance. A large spaceship was flying above the planet. Amazed, the creature shouted up to the spaceship, What are you doing here? The voice from the spaceship replied, We are here to study your planet. Do you permit us to stay? The creature thought about it for a moment and replied, Yes, I permit you to stay and explore my planet. Please be gentle and do not harm my planet. The spaceship gave the creature a warm thank you and the exploration began. The creature watched the spaceship fly around the beautiful planet and had the best day.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved candy very much. She chose a lollipop and was very happy. When they got home, Lily put the lollipop in her backpack. She knew it would be very useful later when she needed a sweet treat.
