Winter had arrived and Bob was happy. He had the perfect plan for how to make the most of the winter months. He would build a snowman! Bob went off in search of the perfect place to build. After hours of walking, he finally found the perfect spot. But when he arrived, he spotted something strange. In the middle of the snow was another snowman! Bob was surprised. He thought he was the only one who had the idea. As he got closer, he noticed something even more peculiar. The other snowman looked just like him! Bob was amazed and slightly dizzy by the sight. From up there she could see the whole park. She felt so successful! But while she was basking in the view, her foot slipped and she fell all the way down. Luckily, there was a big, soft cushion nearby that the kangaroo fell on. Suddenly, Janet stopped when she heard someone shouting. In the distance, she could see a little boy crying. Janet ran over to him. She asked him why he was upset. The little boy looked up at her. He said, I have a pain in my tummy and I dont know what it is. Janet put her hand on his tummy and said, Its okay. I know how to make it better. The little boy smiled. Janet rubbed his tummy in circles and softly hummed a song. After a few minutes, the pain went away. The little boy thanked Janet for her help. He was so happy to not have the pain anymore. He would break them or lose them. Lily was sad and angry. One day, Lily had an idea. She decided to make a special boat for Ben. She used paper, glue, and crayons to make it. But she also added something else. She put some pepper inside the boat. She hoped that Ben would sneeze when he opened it. She thought that would teach him a lesson. She left the boat on the table and went to the pond. She sailed her other boats and had fun. She waited for Ben to come and find the boat. She wanted to see his face when he sneezed. But Ben did not come. He was busy with something else. He did not see the boat on the table. He did not touch it or open it. He did not sneeze. Lily came back from the pond. The seed began to grow and it was so happy! Every day, it grew bigger and bigger. Soon it was too big for the sink. It needed to move to a new home. So the seed looked and looked. Finally, it found a place. It was a hard spot, but it was perfect. The seed started to grow again. Before long, it was a big and beautiful plant. The plant was so happy to have a new home. It waved in the wind and smiled in the sun. The seed had grown so much since it was first planted. And it was so happy to have a place all its own.One day, a little pig and a little duck were playing in the mud. They liked to splash and roll and make funny noises. They did not see the farmer who was watching them from behind a fence. The farmer was very hungry and wanted to eat the pig and the duck for his dinner. He thought they were stupid and easy to catch. He had a big net and a sharp knife. He waited for the right moment to sneak up on them. Hey, pig, look at me! the duck said. I can flap my wings and fly in the air! The duck jumped and flapped and flew a little bit. The pig clapped his hooves and laughed. Thats amazing, duck! the pig said. You are so clever and brave! I wish I could fly like you! The farmer saw his chance. He ran towards the pig and the duck with his net and his knife. He threw the net over the pig and grabbed the duck by the neck. The pig and the duck were scared and screamed. Help! Help! The farmer is here! He wants to eat us! they cried. But it was too late. The farmer was stronger and faster than them. He put them in a sack and took them to his house. He cooked them in a big pot and ate them for his dinner. He was very happy and full. He did not care that the pig and the duck were his friends. He loved going on adventures and exploring the big, wide sea. One day he decided to make a long journey across the bays and around the rocks. But the little shrimp was very tired. He needed to stop and rest. He swam into a quiet sheltered cove and there he found a big, cozy sandy spot. The little shrimp lay down and he was soon fast asleep. The little shrimp had finished his journey and now he was back home.Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was very strong and loved to play with her stuffed animals. She had four of them, and each one was special to her. But one day something bad happened. The little girl dropped one of her stuffed animals down the stairs and it ripped. The little girl was very sad. She began to cry, saying No, no, no! She wished that she could repeat the day and be careful with her special stuff this time. But the little girl realized that life was not like that. That no matter how much she wanted it to, the past could not be undone. Instead, she had to take what had happened and learn from it. The next morning, the little girl was extra careful with her stuffed animals. She held them close when she was going down the stairs, and always made sure to put them in a safe place when she wasnt playing. The lesson she learned was clear. No matter how strong you think you are, its always important to be careful with the stuff that is special to you.Once there was a large kangaroo. He really liked to talk. He spoke to all the animals in the forest, even the ones he had never seen before. He would ask them all kinds of questions, and they would answer. One day, he decided to go on a journey. He was so excited. There were so many new animals to meet and talk to, like the seagulls and the crabs. He spent hours talking and learning about the sea creatures. Finally, the large kangaroo had to go home. He said goodbye to all the animals and thanked them for talking to him. She saw Tom sitting on the ground with a bunch of herbs in his hands. He was chewing on some of them and making funny faces. Tom, I found you! Lily said. What are you doing with those herbs? Tom looked at Lily and smiled. Im eating them. They taste good and make me feel funny. Do you want some? He offered Lily some herbs. Lily was curious and took a bite. The herbs were bitter and spicy. Pete√¢s friend Lucy noticed how excited he was and asked him why. √¢≈ìI want to soar in style like the other birds√¢ he said. Finally, one day Pete was ready and he took off in the sky with Lucy beside him. He spread his wings wide and soared up into the clouds. His style was perfect and his heart was filled with joy. √¢≈ìThis is the best feeling ever!√¢ Pete yelled. He glided through the sky, feeling chubby and proud.Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Benny. Benny loved to play in the woods with his friends. One day, Benny and his friends went on an adventure to find a hidden treasure. They searched high and low, but they couldnt find it. Benny thought they should tell the truth and ask for help. Suddenly, they saw a glow in the distance. They followed the glow and found the treasure. Benny was so happy that he jumped up and down!Once upon a time, there was a big cloud. The cloud was scary. It was dark and loud. The cloud had lightning inside it. One day, the cloud wanted to spread. It moved and moved. The lightning went with the cloud. The cloud went over a small town. The people in the town saw the cloud. They saw the lightning. They were scared. They ran inside their homes. The cloud moved away. The people were happy again. The scary cloud and lightning were gone.Once upon a time, there were two friends named Carlos and Jessica. The two always loved to play together in the garden. One day, when the Sun was shining and the birds were singing, Carlos and Jessica were playing a game of hide and seek. Carlos decided to hide behind a big tree and he waited for Jessica to search for him. But Jessica was too fast and found him almost immediately! Carlos was so excited when Jessica shouted I found you! Just then, a big, fluffy dog came walking past. Jessica thought the dog was so adorable, so she shouted Lets play with the puppy! But the puppy was too scared and ran away. Carlos was determined to make the puppy come back so he said, Lets give him some milk. Maybe hell surrender to us. So Jessica and Carlos took a bowl of milk and placed it in the garden. They waited for the puppy to come back. After a few minutes, he eventually returned and started to slurp up the milk. Carlos and Jessica hugged him and said goodbye. From then on, the puppy became the three friends.Tim and Tom are brothers. They like to play with their toys and eat snacks. But sometimes they fight over who gets what. One day, their mom makes meat for lunch. She puts two plates on the table, one for Tim and one for Tom. Here you go, boys. Eat your meat and veggies. They are good for you, mom says. Tim and Tom run to the table. They both want the bigger piece of meat. They grab the same plate and pull. Let go! This is mine! Tim shouts. No, its mine! I saw it first! Tom yells. They tug and tug until the plate falls to the floor. The meat and veggies splatter everywhere. Mom hears the noise and comes back. What happened here? mom asks. She is angry. Tim is selfish! He took my meat! Tom says. No, Tom is selfish! He took my meat! Tim says. Mom shakes her head. She is disappointed. Boys, boys. You should share and be nice to each other. Meat is not the most important thing. Love is. Now you have no meat and no lunch. And you have to clean up this mess. I dont permit you to fight like this. Do you understand? mom says. Tim and Tom look at each other. They feel sorry. They nod. Yes, mom. We understand. We are sorry, they say. They hug and say sorry to each other. They help mom clean up the floor. They eat some bread and cheese instead. They learn their lesson. They promise to be less selfish and more loving. Mom smiles and hugs them. She is proud.Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Daisy. Daisy was too young to take care of herself, so she had to ask her mom for help. Tom wanted to show Sunny to his friend Lily, who lived next door. He put on his shoes and lifted the birdcage with both hands. He walked out of his house and across the street. Look, Lily, this is my bird Sunny! Tom said, holding the birdcage in front of him. He can sing very well. Do you want to hear him? Lily nodded and smiled. She liked birds too. She reached out to touch the birdcage, but Tom pulled it away. No, you cant touch him. He is mine. Only I can touch him, Tom said, feeling jealous. Lily felt sad and angry. She wanted to touch the bird too. She thought Tom was being mean. She decided to play a trick on him. She said, Okay, Tom, I wont touch him. But can you do something for me? Can you spin around with the birdcage very fast? I want to see how Sunny likes it. Tom thought that sounded like fun. He liked to spin around and feel dizzy. He said, Okay, Lily, I will do it. Lily watched him and waited for the right moment. When Tom was very dizzy, she said, Now, Tom, let go of the birdcage! Throw it in the air! Sunny will fly and be happy! Tom was too dizzy to think. He did what Lily said. He let go of the birdcage and threw it in the air. He saw the birdcage fly up and then fall down. He heard a loud crash and a sad squeak. He stopped spinning and looked at the ground. He saw the birdcage broken and Sunny lying still. He felt a pain in his chest and tears in his eyes. He had killed his bird. I didnt know Sunny would die. Please forgive me. But Tom didnt hear her. He was too sad and angry. He pushed her away and ran to his house. He locked the door and cried. He hated Lily. She knew that her mom was right about the storm. When they got home, they watched the news and saw that there was a hurricane coming. It was very shiny, with strings that shone like diamonds. Nobody understood why it was so special. One day, a small three year old girl found the violin. She began to pluck the strings. The notes made a beautiful sound. She smiled as she heard the music. Suddenly, the little girl had a brilliant idea. She grabbed a bow, and started to move it back and forth. As she did this, the violin strings made a more musical sound. She had discovered the art of playing the violin. She beamed with pride as she continued to play the violin like a pro.One day, a young boy named Tom went to the park with his mom. He saw a big slide and wanted to go on it. But there was an old man sitting on the slide. He looked sad and angry. Mom, can I go on the slide? Tom asked. Sure, honey, but you have to ask the man nicely if he can move, Mom said. Tom walked up to the man and said, Hello, sir. Can I please go on the slide? The man did not answer. He just frowned and looked away. Tom felt bad. He wondered why the man was so unhappy. He decided to try again. Sir, Im sorry if you are sad. Do you want to talk to me? Tom said. The man looked at Tom with surprise. He saw that Tom was not mean or rude. Tim wanted to help put out the fire. He thought of his ball and had an idea. Tim kicked his ball into the fire. The ball rolled over the fire and put it out. The forest was safe again. Tim was happy that he could help. Everyone thanked Tim for being brave and smart.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go on adventures with her family. Whats that noise? she asked her mom. Its probably just some things bouncing around in the trunk, her mom replied. Lily and Max were curious, so they asked if they could see what was in the trunk. The boy replied, Sure, I can do that. The boy went to his garden and brought back lots of carrots. He filled the patch with them. Benny was so happy! Hennys job was to carry hay from one place to another. But one day, Henny could not manage to carry the hay. She felt very ashamed. Henny went to her friend, the cow named Mooey. Henny said, Mooey, I cannot carry the hay today. I feel bad. Mooey looked at Henny and said, Do not feel bad, Henny. We all have days when we cannot do our job. I will help you. Mooey and Henny worked together to carry the hay. It was hard work, but they did it. In the end, Henny felt happy and not ashamed. All the animals on the farm were happy too. They learned that if they help each other, they can do anything.Lily and Ben were friends who liked to ride their bikes. One day, they rode to the pond near their house. They saw some ducks and fish in the water. Look, Ben, the ducks are hungry. Lets give them some bread, Lily said. OK, Lily, but we only have a little bread. We need some for ourselves too, Ben said. They broke the bread into small pieces and threw them to the ducks. The ducks quacked and ate the bread. Lily and Ben smiled and watched them. But then, a big goose came and chased the ducks away. It ate all the bread and honked loudly. Lily and Ben were scared and angry. Hey, goose, thats not nice. You should share with the ducks. They were here first, Lily shouted. The goose ignored her and looked for more bread. It saw Lily and Bens bikes and thought they were food. It bit the tires and the seats and made holes in them. Lily and Ben ran to their bikes and tried to stop the goose. But it was too strong and mean. It pecked at them and made them cry. Help, help, someone help us, they screamed. A man who was walking his dog heard them and came to help. He shooed the goose away and checked their bikes. He saw that they were ruined. Im sorry, kids, your bikes are broken. You cant ride them anymore. What were you doing here? he asked. We were feeding the ducks, but the goose came and took everything. It was greedy and nasty, Lily said. The man nodded and said, I see. Well, you were kind and generous to the ducks, but you should also be careful and wise. The pond is not a safe place for kids and bikes. There are many animals and things that can hurt you. Next time, you should ride somewhere else, or ask your parents to come with you. Lily and Ben thanked the man and his dog. They learned their lesson and never rode to the pond again. They also learned to be more grateful for what they had and to respect other living things.Once upon a time, there was a turtle named Timmy. Timmy was very slow and liked to take his time. One day, Timmy saw his friend, a rabbit named Robbie, who was very fast. Robbie liked to race and always moved quickly. Timmy wanted to race with Robbie, but he knew he couldnt win because he was too slow. Robbie saw that Timmy wanted to race and felt bad that he couldnt win. So, Robbie came up with an idea. He suggested they race in slow motion. Timmy was happy with this idea because he could finally race with his friend without feeling like he was losing. The two friends started their race in slow motion. They moved calmly and carefully, making sure they didnt go too fast. Timmy was happy that he could finally race with Robbie and Robbie was happy that he could spend time with his friend. From that day on, Timmy and Robbie would race in slow motion every time they saw each other.Once upon a time there was a lucky bird. Every day it would fly high up into the sky over the valley. It would soar in the air and feel so happy. The bird√¢s friends were two little rabbits who lived in the valley. Every day they would run around playing, chasing each other and having lots of fun. One day the lucky bird flew down to them and taught its friends how to fly. The rabbits were so excited. They flapped their ears like wings and jumped up and down trying to fly. But no matter how hard they tried, the rabbits couldnt get high enough to fly. So the lucky bird swooped down and grabbed each rabbit with its strong beak. It flew up into the sky and dropped them inside the valley. The rabbits were so happy and thanked the lucky bird for helping them. They ran around the valley playing, chasing each other and having lots more fun. From then on, the lucky bird and the two rabbits were best friends forever.Once upon a time there was a nice mule. He loved to create things. Every day he would make something new with his hooves. He created castles, cars and funny hats. One day, he decided to show his creations to the world. He took all of his creations and went on a nice walk. Everywhere he went, people were amazed at his magical creations. After a while, the mules creations became famous. Soon everyone wanted to have one of his creations. The mule kept creating more things, so everyone had something special. The mule was so happy that he had created something that made everyone happy. He was so proud of his creations. From that day on, he kept creating even more magical things.Once upon a time there was a very rich family that had a little girl. The girls parents both worked hard and they had a nice TV in the living room. The girl loved the TV and asked her parents if she could watch it every day. Her parents said she could, but only if she promised to trust them. Every day the girl would come home and trust her parents. When it was time to go to bed, the girl would often try to stay up to watch her favorite show on TV. Even though her parents told her no, she still tried to watch it anyway. One night the girls parents caught her trying to watch TV when she wasnt supposed to. They told her that if she couldnt trust them, she wouldnt be able to watch TV anymore. The little girl was sad, but she knew her parents were right and she promised to trust them from then on. She kept her promise and soon she was able to watch TV again. From that day on, the little girl always trusted her parents and everything was right in the world.Once upon a time, there was a clown who loved to walk around the peaceful park. He had a big red nose and wore colorful clothes. One day, he saw a little girl who was crying. He asked her what was wrong, and she said she lost her favorite toy. The clown felt sad for the little girl and decided to help her. They walked around the park together, looking for the toy. They looked under the trees, behind the bushes, and near the pond. Finally, they found the toy in the sandbox. The little girl was happy and thanked the clown. The clown smiled and said, Its always good to help others when they need it. The little girl learned that its important to ask for help when she needs it, and its also important to help others. The clown and the little girl walked away from the park feeling happy and peaceful.Lily and Tom were playing in the living room. They saw a big cushion on the sofa. They wanted to have fun with it. Lets weigh the cushion! Lily said. I will stand on the scale and you put the cushion on me. OK! Tom said. He lifted the cushion and put it on Lilys head. The scale showed a big number. Wow, you are very heavy! Tom said. The cushion is heavy too! Lily laughed. She felt the cushion was soft and warm. She liked it. Can I try too? Tom asked. He wanted to know how heavy he was with the cushion. Sure! Lily said. She took the cushion off her head and put it on the floor. She helped Tom stand on the scale. Then she put the cushion on his back. The scale showed a smaller number than before. Ha, I am lighter than you! Tom said. He felt the cushion was cozy and fluffy. He liked it too. They both smiled. They had fun with the cushion. The cushion was harmless and nice. They hugged the cushion and each other. They were happy.Once upon a time, there was a dog named Max. Max was very happy because he had an owner who loved him very much. Maxs owner would always play with him and give him lots of treats. One day, Maxs owner had to go away for a long time. Max felt very lonely without his owner around. He missed playing with his owner and getting treats. But one day, a nice lady came to Maxs house. She wanted to adopt Max and take care of him. Maxs owner was happy to hear this and agreed to let the nice lady adopt Max. The nice lady promised to take good care of Max and pay for all his food and toys. Max was happy to have a new owner who loved him just as much as his old owner did.Once upon a time, there was a spoiled girl who loved to show her symbol. Everywhere she went, she let her symbol follow. Wherever she went, people knew who she was. One day, she decided to go on a journey. She grabbed her symbol and let it shine bright. All the animals smiled at her and waved goodbye. As the day went on, the spoiled girl and her symbol kept walking further and further. Suddenly, the symbol stopped and grinned at her. Lets go fly, it said. The spoiled girls eyes lit up and said yes. Together, they flew up in the sky and released the symbol into the air. It flew around and around, letting everyone know the spoiled girl was near. When it was time to say goodbye, they waved and the symbol flew back down. Everyone cheered as the symbol landed on the spoiled girls shoulder. The two made a new promise that they would always let their symbol show. From then on, the spoiled girl and her symbol were always together and never apart.Mum and Dad said it was time to go on an adventure. But their little girl was scared. Now she just had to mind until they were back.Once upon a time, there was a naughty but tiny little monkey called Mike. Mike had a very special drum that was brown. Whenever Mike played with this drum, he was the happiest monkey around! One day, Mike was feeling very adventurous and he decided to crawl up a tree. He carefully crawled up and up until he came across an old cocoon. Mike was so curious and he wondered what was inside. Suddenly, the cocoon opened up and out came a butterfly. A little voice said √¢≈ìHello Mike! Do you want to play with my drum?√¢ Mike looked up and saw that the voice was coming from the butterfly. He was so excited! Mike said √¢≈ìYes please!√¢ The butterfly gave Mike the drum and Mike crawled back down the tree with his new toy. They said goodbye and Mike brought it back home. He happily played with his new brown drum all day long. Mike had lots of fun and he never forgot that special day.Once upon a time there was a very thoughtful girl. She would often invite her friends to her house to play. On this particular day, her best friend had come over and they were exploring the backyard. Look, whats that? asked the friend, pointing to something. The girl looked carefully and saw it was a toy car. It was old and rusty but she knew it could be fixed. I think this car needs a new battery, she said. They found an old battery and worked together to get the car running again. The girl turned to her friend. Lets try and reverse it, she said. Excitedly, they got the car going in reverse. Whooping and cheering, their excitement filled the backyard. Even their parents came out to see what all the noise was about. The girl smiled, knowing she had been thoughtful and been able to fix the car.Lily loved her kitten, Fluffy. Fluffy was small and soft and liked to play with Lily. Lily liked to hug Fluffy and give her milk and toys. One day, Lilys mom said they had to go to the store. Lily wanted to take Fluffy with her, but mom said no. Mom said Fluffy had to remain at home, because the store was not a good place for kittens. But why? Lily asked. Fluffy is good and cute. She will not make trouble. Mom said, The store is big and loud and has many people and things. Fluffy might get scared or lost or hurt. She will be happier and safer at home, where she knows everything. Lily was sad, but she understood. She kissed Fluffy and said, I will be back soon, Fluffy. You remain here and be good. I love you. Fluffy meowed and licked Lilys face. She watched Lily and mom leave, then curled up on Lilys bed. She missed Lily, but she was glad to be in her cozy and quiet home. She dreamed of playing with Lily again.The sun was high in the sky and it was very bright. But it was ok, because dad had taken a shade. The shade was big and it was light. It was like a big umbrella. Dad put it over their heads so that they could stay in the light and not get too hot. Mum had taken a basket with snacks so that everyone could eat and drink something. They were all happy, sitting in the shade. Jennies little brother Thomas took his little car and drove it around in the dirt. He was having lots of fun, making engine noises. After a while, mum and dad had to take the shade down because it was starting to get dark. They packed up all the snacks, and off they went, back home. But Jennie had a great day outside in the light with mum, dad and Thomas.Tom and Lily were twins who liked to play with their toys. One day, they found a big box of blocks in the basement. They decided to build a castle with the blocks. They worked hard and made a tall and strong castle. Look at our castle, Lily! It is so big and nice! Tom said. Yes, Tom, it is. But we have to be careful. Do not destroy it! Lily said. They played with their castle for a long time. They pretended to be kings and queens and knights and dragons. They had a lot of fun. But then, their mom called them. Tom and Lily, it is time for your shower! Come upstairs, please! Tom and Lily did not want to stop playing. They wanted to stay with their castle. They ignored their mom. Tom and Lily, I am waiting for you! Come on, get ready for your shower! their mom said again. Tom and Lily still did not listen. They kept playing with their castle. But then, they heard a loud noise. They turned around and saw their dog, Rex, running towards them. Rex was big and playful. He saw the castle and thought it was a toy. He jumped on the castle and destroyed it. He knocked down all the blocks and made a big mess. Rex, no! Tom and Lily shouted. They ran to their castle and tried to save it. But it was too late. Their castle was gone. They felt sad and angry. Look what you did, Rex! You destroyed our castle! Bad dog! Tom said. Lily started to cry. Our castle was so beautiful! Why did you do that, Rex? Rex did not understand. He wagged his tail and licked their faces. He thought they were playing with him. Their mom came downstairs and saw what happened. She was not happy. Tom and Lily, what is this? Why did you not come for your shower? And why did you make such a mess? she asked. Tom and Lily looked at their mom. They felt sorry. They knew they did something wrong. We are sorry, mom. We did not listen to you. We wanted to play with our castle. But Rex destroyed it. He did not know it was ours. Tom said. We are sorry, mom. We should have come for our shower. We should have put away our blocks. But we were having fun. We did not think about Rex. Lily said. Their mom hugged them. She was not angry anymore. She was glad they were honest. I understand, Tom and Lily. I know you love your castle. But you have to listen to me when I call you. And you have to be careful with your toys. You have to share them with Rex. He is part of our family. He does not mean to destroy your things. He just wants to play with you. she said. Tom and Lily nodded. They learned their lesson. They said sorry to Rex. They gave him a hug and a treat. They helped their mom clean up the mess. Then they went upstairs for their shower. They were ready to be clean and cozy. The end. Moral value The story teaches the children to listen to their parents, to be responsible for their toys, and to be kind to their pets.Once upon a time there was a happy boy. He liked to go outside and play every day. One sunny day he saw something twisting in the breeze. He wanted to find out what it was, so he ran over to take a closer look. When he got there, it was a cute little kite moving up and down in the sky. The happy boy was so excited, he wanted to fly the kite. He grabbed the strings to control it and started running around, twisting it around and around in the sky. The kite flew higher and higher above the trees. The boy was laughing with joy and he stayed out flying the kite for many hours. He never wanted to stop it, but eventually he had to go home. The next day, the happy boy couldnt wait to fly the kite again. He raced outside and watched the kite twisting in the blue summer sky.Once upon a time, there were two friends a rabbit and a bear. They were very excited as today was their special day a day to celebrate! The bear grabbed the rabbits paw and said, Lets go and watch the ugly television to make our special day even more fun! They hopped excitedly all the way to the bears house and quickly turned on the television. They were so mesmerized by the colorful moving pictures, they couldnt pull their eyes away. It was so much fun that they decided to celebrate their day together every year. The bear and the rabbit laughed and cheered and had the best time. They would always remember this special day and all the fun they had. They even promised to watch the ugly television to celebrate every year.Tom and Amy are children. They like to play in the park. They enjoy the swings, the slide and the sand. They laugh and shout. They are loud. Look at me, Amy! Tom says. He swings very high. He feels happy. I can swing higher, Tom! Amy says. She swings faster. She feels brave. But they are too loud. They do not see the big dog. The big dog does not like loud noises. The big dog runs to the park. He barks and growls. He is angry. Help, help! Tom and Amy scream. They are scared. They jump off the swings. They try to run away. But the big dog is faster. He bites Toms leg. He bites Amys arm. They cry and bleed. They are hurt. The big dogs owner comes. He shouts at the big dog. He pulls him away. He says sorry to Tom and Amy. He calls for help. But it is too late. Tom and Amy are very sick. They go to the hospital. They do not play in the park anymore. They do not enjoy anything anymore. They are sad. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and go to the park. One day, she saw a clown in the park. The clown was wearing a crazy hat and had a big red nose. Lily went up to the clown and said, Hi Mr. Clown, why do you look so crazy? The clown replied, Im trying to sell my balloons, but nobody wants to buy them. Lily felt sad for the clown, so she asked her mom for some money to buy a balloon. She gave the clown the money and he gave her a big red balloon. Lily felt happy that she could help the clown. She learned that sometimes, its important to help others even if they look different or seem crazy. From that day on, Lily always tried to help others whenever she could.Sara and Tom were twins. They liked to play with their toys and books. One day, their mom said, We are going to the store. Do you want to come with me? Sara and Tom said, Yes, yes, yes! They put on their coats and shoes and got in the car. Mom drove them to the store. It was a big store with many things. Sara and Tom saw a lot of light in the store. They saw light from the sun, light from the lamps, light from the TVs, and light from the toys. They said, Wow, this store is amazing! Mom said, You can each pick one thing to buy. What do you want? Sara and Tom looked around. They saw many things they liked. Sara saw a doll with a pink dress and a hat. Tom saw a truck with big wheels and a horn. Sara and Tom ran to the things they wanted. They said, Mom, mom, look! We want these! Mom smiled and said, OK, lets go pay for them. She took the doll and the truck and went to the cashier. The cashier scanned the things and said, That will be ten dollars, please. Mom gave the cashier ten dollars and got a receipt. She said, Thank you, have a nice day. The cashier said, Youre welcome, byebye. Mom gave Sara and Tom their things and said, Are you happy? Sara and Tom said, Yes, yes, yes! Thank you, mom! They hugged mom and got in the car. Excuse me, sir. Can you help us? Lily says. The man is kind. He smiles and walks to them. He looks at the box and the lock. Sure, I can help you. Let me see if I have the right key. He says. He tries different keys. None of them fit. He is about to give up. But then he finds a small key. He puts it in the lock. It turns. The lock opens. Yay, you did it! Lily and Ben cheer. They open the box. They see many amazing things. They see books, toys, games, and candy. They are very happy. Wow, this is the best box ever! Lily says. Thank you, sir. You are very nice! Ben says. One day, he went to the store with his mom and saw a game that he really wanted. He asked his mom to buy it for him, but his mom said he had to use his own money. Timmy didnt have any money, so he decided to sell his toy cars to make some. He went to his neighbors houses and knocked on their doors. He asked if they wanted to buy his toy cars. Some people said no, but some people said yes and gave him some money. After a while, Timmy had enough money to buy the game he wanted. He went back to the store with his mom and bought the game. One day, Ellie decided that she wanted to go explore the wide valley. She put on her sun hat and set off. As she wandered around the valley, she peeked around every corner. She saw all kinds of wonderful things, from the singing birds in the trees, to the grasshoppers hopping across the ground. Finally Ellie came to a clearing. She was amazed by just how wide the clearing was, and she began to peek around to try and find out what could be in this special place. Before long, she found a secret garden full of all kinds of flowers. Ellie smiled and had lots of fun exploring this wide, secret garden. Soon it was time for Ellie to go back home and so she left the garden until next time. The infant looked around and tried to find something to open the door, but she wasnt able to. The infants mom could see the disappointment on her daughters face and said with a gentle hug, Dont worry, I know how to unlock this door! She grabbed a big key, and with a big smile said, Letting you use my big key to unlock it would be the best way to let you learn something new! The infant was elated and exclaimed, Yes! Let me try it! She cheerfully grabbed the key and tried to find the right hole, but it was difficult. After several attempts, she finally managed to unlock the big door. Lily exclaimed. Her mom smiled and said, Yes, thats what happens when you spray water on things. Later that day, Lily went outside to play with her friends. Sarah looked around her yard and noticed a lot of yellow things a yellow leaf, a yellow flower, and a yellow butterfly! But that wasnt what she needed to solve the problem. She then saw an old yellow bucket and she had a great idea. She picked up the bucket and filled it with some of the yellow things around her yard. Then Sarah noticed something else. There were two little yellow birds in her yard. They were chirping and flapping their wings. She smiled and filled the bucket with the birds too. Sarah took the bucket over to her mom. Mommy, she said. I solved the problem! Her mom smiled and said, You sure did, sweetheart. Good job! Sarah was very proud and went back to playing in her yellow yard. Charlie felt proud of himself. He couldnt believe he had done it.One day at school, the children were in their classroom and the teacher was teaching them something new. She told them that they were going to learn a rare word called yield. All the children looked at each other and were confused. The teacher tried to explain the meaning of the word yield, but the children just couldnt understand it. One of them finally asked What does that mean? The teacher smiled and said Yield means to give up something. You have to make an effort and then you might get something new out of it. Its rare, but its important to know. The children still looked confused and one of them said But why should we do it?. The teacher replied So that you can learn something new, and to help others. Yielding is not something that we do everyday, but its important to know when and how to do it. The children thought about it and eventually understood what the teacher meant. Now they know how to yield to help others and learn something new.Joey was very ready for his day. He hopped out of bed and put on his shoes. He grabbed a board and went outside. The man and woman sailed around the harbor until it got dark. But, as soon as it got dark, the wind started to push them away from the harbor. They couldnt get back in! The man and woman sailed around the harbor all night, but they couldnt find a way back in. By morning, they were so far away from the harbor that it seemed like it was just a speck on the horizon. The man and woman were never able to come back to the harbor. They were lost at sea for weeks, until finally their boat drifted onto a shore far away from the harbor. They like to play in their room. They have many toys, but they also like to use other things. One day, they see a telephone on the table. It is big and shiny. They want to touch it. Lets crawl to the telephone, Tom says. Maybe we can talk to someone. Okay, Anna says. But we have to be quiet. Mom and Dad are in the kitchen. They crawl to the table. They reach the telephone. Tom picks it up. He presses some buttons. He hears a beep. Hello, hello, he says. Who is there? Anna takes the other part of the telephone. She puts it to her ear. She hears Toms voice. Hi, Tom, she says. Its me, Anna. They giggle. They think they are very clever. But they do not know that the telephone is hard. It is not a toy. It is a real telephone. And they have called a real number. The number is 911. It is for emergencies. When people need help, they call 911. A voice answers the call. It is a woman. She works at 911. She is serious. 911, what is your emergency? she says. Tom and Anna do not understand. They keep giggling. Hello, hello, Tom says. Who are you? 911, what is your emergency? the woman says again. This is for emergencies only. You should not play with the telephone. You should hang up now and tell your parents what you did. Tom and Anna are scared. They hear the womans voice. Mom and Dad are not happy. They are not angry. They are worried. They explain to Tom and Anna what 911 is. They explain why they should not play with the telephone. They explain why they should listen to the woman. They tell Tom and Anna that they love them. They tell them that they should be careful. They tell them that they should be respectful. What are you doing here? The sparrow said, I was playing with your old chess pieces. I tore one of the pieces in two! The old man was surprised. He told the sparrow not to worry, and carefully picked up the two pieces of the chess piece. He looked at the pieces, and smiled. The old man said, At least you were having fun! We can put it back together. Here, watch me carefully. The old man carefully put the two pieces together, and then the piece shone just like new. The old man said to the sparrow, See, we fixed it! Now, lets play a game of chess together. The old man and the sparrow played a game of chess, and the old man won every time. And the circle started to go around and around, this time going forward. Finally, it found the way out of the maze and was so very happy. It was free! Lily and Tom were curious and wanted to play with it. Lets see what this engine can do! Tom said. He climbed on the engine and started to push the buttons. No, Tom, dont! Lily said. She was anxious and scared. She knew the engine was not a toy and could be dangerous. We should ask dad first! But Tom did not listen. He pushed more buttons and pulled some wires. The engine started to make strange sounds and smoke. Lily and Tom felt the engine shake and tremble. Help! Help! they cried. They tried to get off the engine, but it was too late. The engine exploded with a loud bang. Lily and Tom were hurt by the fire and the metal. They screamed and cried. Dad heard the noise and ran to the garage. He saw the engine in flames and his children on the ground. He was angry and sad. He called the ambulance and the firemen. He hugged Lily and Tom and said, Why did you play with the engine? He was having so much fun splashing around. Suddenly, he heard a terrible sound. It was a mean crocodile! The crocodile was angry and scaring the fish away. The little boy was very scared, he started to cry. The crocodile heard him and started to splash the little boy. The little boy was too scared to move he just put his hands over his eyes. Luckily, his mom came and rescued him. She shouted at the crocodile and it ran away. The little boy was so happy to be safe again. He and his mom went home and he never splashed in the pond again.Once upon a time, there was a small bird who loved to fly high in the sky. The bird was sad and scared. It tried to fly out, but the cage was too small. The bird remembered the history of its family, who had been trapped before. Suddenly, the bird saw a person coming to release it from the cage. The bird was so happy and flew away into the sky. From then on, the bird never forgot about the history of its family and always made sure to check for open doors before flying inside.Two friends, Bob and Bill, were walking through the park. She got it for her birthday from her mom and dad, who were both scientists. They told her that studying was important and fun, and that she could learn a lot from looking at tiny things. One day, Anna found a leaf in the garden. It had many colors and shapes on it. She wondered what it looked like under the microscope. She ran inside and put the leaf on a slide. She turned on the light and looked through the eyepiece. Wow! she exclaimed. The leaf is so pretty and different up close. It has many tiny dots and lines and patterns. And look, there is a bug on it! She called her mom and dad to come and see. They came and looked at the leaf and the bug with her. They smiled and praised her for her discovery. Thats a very special bug, Anna, her mom said. Its called a ladybug, and it helps the plants by eating the bad bugs. Its also a symbol of good luck and happiness. Youre very lucky to find one on your leaf. Really? Anna asked. Can I keep it as a pet? Her dad laughed. No, sweetie, you cant keep it as a pet. They said hello to everyone they met. One night, Anna and Ben saw something unusual in the sky. It was a big ball of fire with a long tail. It was a comet. They had never seen a comet before. They were amazed and excited. Wow, look at that! Anna said. It is so bright and beautiful! Yes, it is! Ben said. Do you think it is a wish comet? A wish comet? Anna asked. What is that? Ben said, A wish comet is a comet that can make your wish come true. You just have to close your eyes and say your wish out loud. Anna and Ben liked the idea of a wish comet. They decided to try it. They closed their eyes and said their wishes. I wish for a new bike! Anna said. I wish for a big cake! Ben said. They opened their eyes and waited for their wishes to come true. But nothing happened. The comet was still in the sky, but their wishes did not come true. They felt sad and disappointed. They wondered why their wishes did not come true. Then they heard a voice. It was an old man who was also jogging in the park. He had seen them make their wishes. Hello, children, he said. I see you were trying to make a wish on the comet. Yes, we were, Anna said. But it did not work. Why not? The old man smiled and said, The comet is not a wish comet. It is just a comet. A comet is a big rock that flies around the sun. Sometimes we can see it from the earth. It is very rare and special, but it cannot make your wishes come true. Then how can we make our wishes come true? Ben asked. The old man said, You can make your wishes come true by working hard, being kind, and helping others. Those are the things that make you happy and proud. The comet is a gift from nature, but it is not a magic wand. You have to make your own magic. Anna and Ben thought about what the old man said. They realized he was right. They thanked him for his advice and said goodbye. They looked at the comet again and smiled. They still thought it was beautiful, but they did not wish on it anymore. They decided to jog back home and work on their wishes. The moral of the story is You cannot rely on magic to make your wishes come true. She thinks bathing is boring and cold and wet. She runs away when her mom calls her to the bathroom. She hides under the bed or behind the sofa or in the closet. Her mom is patient. She does not get angry or yell at Lily. She waits and waits and waits. She says, Lily, it is time to bathe. Bathing is good for you. It makes you clean and fresh and happy. You can play with your toys in the water. You can make bubbles and splash and sing. Please come to the bathroom, Lily. Lily hears her mom and feels a little sorry. She knows her mom loves her and wants her to be healthy and comfortable. She also knows her mom will not give up. She decides to give bathing a try. She comes out of her hiding place and goes to the bathroom. Her mom is happy to see her. She helps her take off her dirty clothes and puts them in the hamper. She fills the tub with warm water and adds some soap and shampoo. She gives Lily a rubber duck and a boat and a sponge. She says, Lily, you can bathe now. Have fun and be careful. I will be right here if you need me. Lily gets into the tub and feels the water on her skin. She likes how it feels. She plays with her toys and makes bubbles and splash and sing. She lets her mom wash her hair and body with the sponge. She rinses off the soap and shampoo with the shower head. She feels clean and fresh and happy. She says, Mom, thank you for bathing me. I like bathing now. It is not boring or cold or wet. It is fun and warm and nice. Can I bathe again tomorrow? Her mom smiles and hugs her. She says, Lily, you are welcome. I am proud of you for trying something new. You can bathe again tomorrow, but only after you play in the mud.Once upon a time, there was a farmer. He lived far away, in a distant place. The farmer liked to stop and pause when he worked. He would rest and look around, to take in the sights. One day, he saw something strange. It was a small, white animal with big ears. He had never seen one before! He paused and watched it, wondering what it was. Suddenly, it started to hop away. The farmer ran after it, crossing fields and hills. He finally caught up to the animal and paused to look at it. It was a rabbit, and it hopped away again. The farmer paused to laugh. He was happy to see the rabbit, even if it was far away. He waved goodbye, and the rabbit hopped away into the distant, green fields.Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Mary who loved to admire everything around her. One day, she and her dad went for a walk in the park. They stopped near a big open field where she could admire the clouds in the sky. Look dad! she said, pointing to the clouds, Do you see all the shapes the clouds make? Her dad replied, Yes, Mary, I too admire the beautiful shapes they make. Mary and her dad continued walking and soon they came across a pile of coal. Mary was surprised to see this and asked her dad, What is that? Her dad explained, That is coal. It is used to make fire and heat. Mary continued to admire the coal, but her dad warned her, You need to be very careful around the coal, Mary, an open flame can be very dangerous. Once they were finished admiring the coal, Marys dad told her an important lesson. Admiring things from a distance is important, but it is also important to know when something is too dangerous to get too close to. The moral of the story is that it is important to admire the things around us, but it is also important to know when something is too risky to get too close to.Once there was a boy, who was only three years old. Kittys friend, Doggy, came into the room and saw what she was doing. Doggy said, Kitty, what are you doing with the clock? Kitty replied, I wanted to see how it worked, so I mixed all the pieces together. Doggy helped Kitty put the clock back together. They worked together and fixed the clock. The fish was so excited to be swimming in the bowl of tasty water that he stayed in for a very long time. He was having so much fun splashing around that he did not realise that the water was slowly soaking into his skin. Suddenly the bowl started to get smaller and smaller. The fish tried to jump out, but he couldn√¢t. He was stuck! He cried out, √¢≈ìHelp me! Please help me!√¢ Desperate, the fish shouted to his friends in the pond, √¢≈ìDo not jump in the bowl! Stay in the pond!√¢ The fish√¢s friends listened and stayed away. Sadly, the bowl shrunk so much that the poor fish died. She saw that the bear had a knife in its paw and was looking for something to eat. Lily had an idea. She picked some berries and offered them to the bear. The bear was so happy that it forgot about the knife and ate the berries instead. The bear and Lily became friends and wandered through the forest together, picking flowers and berries. The end.Lily and Ben were friends who liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a big truck with a sign that said Ice Cream. They ran to the truck and asked for some ice cream. What flavor do you want? the man in the truck said. I want chocolate! Lily said. I want vanilla! Ben said. The man gave them each a cone with a scoop of ice cream. They paid him with some coins that their moms had given them. Thank you! they said and walked away. They licked their ice cream and smiled. It was cold and sweet and yummy. This is the best ice cream ever! Lily said. I agree! Ben said. They saw a bench and sat down to enjoy their treat. But then, they noticed something strange. There was another cone on the bench, with a scoop of ice cream that was green and had brown spots. Who left this here? Lily wondered. I dont know. Maybe someone forgot it, Ben said. They looked around, but they did not see anyone who looked like they owned the cone. Maybe we should try it, Lily said. It might be good. I dont know. It looks weird, Ben said. Lily was curious. She picked up the cone and took a small bite. She made a face. Yuck! This is awful! she said. It tastes like grass and dirt and bugs! She spit out the ice cream and threw the cone away. Are you okay? Ben asked. Im fine. But that was the worst ice cream ever! Lily said. They hugged each other and decided to never try unknown ice cream again. She was very careful not to spill or burn herself. She added some milk and sugar, just like her mom liked. She carried the mug to her moms bedroom. She saw her mom sleeping on the bed. She smiled and walked quietly. She wanted to put the mug on the nightstand, but she saw something on the way. It was a big spider. It was crawling on the floor, near the bed. Lila hated spiders. She thought they were scary and gross. She wanted to scream, but she didnt want to wake up her mom. She decided to protect her mom from the spider. She put the mug down on the floor and grabbed a shoe. She aimed at the spider and threw the shoe. She hoped to hit the spider and make it go away. But she missed. The shoe hit the wall and made a loud noise. Her mom woke up and saw Lila holding another shoe. Lila, what are you doing? her mom asked, rubbing her eyes. Mom, Im sorry, I wanted to make you coffee, but there was a spider, and I tried to protect you, but I missed, and I made a noise, and Im sorry, and I love you, Lila said, all in one breath. But Mom says, Wait, you have to stay here. It is raining outside. You will get wet and cold. Lily and Ben are sad. They do not like to stay inside. They want to play on the swings and slides. They look out the window and see a big black cloud. It makes loud noises and drops water on the ground. Mom says, Do not worry, the rain will stop soon. Then we can go to the park. Why dont you play with your toys for a while? You have many fun toys to choose from. Lily and Ben nod. They go to their room and find their toys. They have cars and dolls and blocks and books. They start to play with them and make up stories. They forget about the rain and have fun. After a while, Mom comes to their room and says, Guess what? The rain is gone. The sun is shining. We can go to the park now. Are you ready? Lily and Ben are happy. They put away their toys and grab their hats and shoes. They run to the door and say, Yes, we are ready. Lets go to the park! They are eager to see the swings and slides and the flowers and the birds. They thank Mom for letting them play with their toys and for taking them to the park. They have a great day.Once upon a time there was a bridge. The bridge was very long and it crossed over a deep, wide river. The bridge was very reliable, so people knew that it was safe to use. One day, a boy wanted to cross the bridge. He was only three years old, so he was scared to try. He took a deep breath and slowly stepped onto the bridge. He held tight to the ropes as he walked, but he still felt scared. At the end of the bridge, the boy saw his mom waiting. She cheered and clapped for him. He was so relieved that he had made it across the bridge all by himself. He had been brave, and he had tried really hard. The bridge was reliable, and it had helped the boy cross the river. That made him feel really happy.Tom and Sue were friends who liked to play on the beach. They made sand castles and looked for shells and crabs. One day, they saw a big boat on the water. It was long and had many sails. Wow, look at that boat! Tom said. I want to go on it and see the world. Me too, Sue said. But how can we get there? It is too far and the water is deep. They thought for a while. Then Tom had an idea. I know! We can make a raft with wood and rope. Then we can paddle to the boat. It will be fun! Sue liked the idea. They found some wood and rope on the beach and worked hard to make a raft. They used their jackets as paddles. They were proud of their raft. Are you ready? Tom asked. Yes, lets go! Sue said. They pushed their raft into the water and climbed on. They paddled towards the boat. They were happy and excited. But they did not notice that the tide was changing. The water was moving away from the shore. The boat was getting farther and farther. The raft was getting smaller and smaller. Tom, Im scared, Sue said. We are too far from the beach. How can we go back? Tom looked around. He saw that they were in trouble. He wished they had not left the shore. Dont worry, Sue, he said. We will be okay. We have to support each other. We have to paddle harder. We have to wait for the tide to change again. Then the water will bring us back. He tried to sound brave, but he was scared too. He hoped that someone would see them and help them. He hoped that the tide would change soon. He hoped that they would see the beach again.Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sarah who was very curious about the world. She had a special request for her parents. The water looked cool and refreshing, but the bird noticed something strange. There was a big, scary cat hiding behind a bush near the puddle. The bird suggested to itself that it should be careful and not go near the puddle. But the bird was so thirsty that it forgot about the cat and flew down to the puddle to drink. As soon as the bird landed, the cat pounced and caught the bird in its sharp claws. The bird realized too late that it should have listened to its own suggestion and stayed away from the puddle. He pushed his plate away and made a face. Mom was not happy. She frowned and said, Ben, dont be rude. You have to try new things. You cant just eat pizza and ice cream every day. Lily was embarrassed. She said, Oops, Im sorry, dad. I didnt mean to do that. Dad smiled and said, Its okay, Lily. It was an accident. But maybe next time, you can be more gentle with your fork. When the butterfly looked closer, it realised the little hiding places were full of seed! But the butterfly couldnt reach the seed. No matter how hard it tried, it just couldnt get to the top of the branch. Suddenly, it heard something, a deep and gentle voice. Little butterfly, why dont you rest for a moment? the voice said. The butterfly looked around and discovered that the voice had come from a kind little bird. The bird smiled and said If you let me serve you, little butterfly, I could help you get the seed. The butterfly thought long and hard, and decided to trust the bird. The bird served the butterfly by pushing her up toward the top of the branch. The butterfly was so happy she was able to get the seed. She thanked the bird for serving her, and promised to do the same if the bird ever needed help. It stared at Jack with big eyes. Jack was so scared he didnt know what to do. Then the creature blinked slowly, and Jack suddenly felt much calmer. But there were too many stuffed animals there. The computer kept searching until it found the perfect place. The computer hid the secrets in a toy box. It told the secrets to stay safe and to never leave the box. Then it ran to the kitchen and told the family. The family was very happy to know the secrets were safe. They played catch with a ball. Timmy threw the ball to his friend, but his friend missed and the ball went rolling down the street. Timmy ran after the ball and caught it. He was glad he caught the ball. As Timmy was walking back to his friends, he noticed a dog running towards him. The dog was trying to catch Timmys pants with his teeth. Timmy was scared, but he knew he had to be brave. He said, No, dog! Dont catch my pants! The dog stopped and wagged his tail. Timmy was glad the dog didnt catch his pants. From that day on, Timmy made sure to always keep an eye on his pants when he played outside. And he was glad to have such good friends and a brave heart. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy had a big mirror in her room. She liked to look at herself in the mirror every day. But Amy did not know the value of the mirror. She was ignorant. One day, Amys friend, Tom, came to play with her. Tom saw the big mirror and said, Wow, Amy! You have a big mirror. It is very nice. Do you know its value? Amy shook her head and said, No, I dont know. What is value? Tom smiled and said, Value means how important something is. This mirror is special. It helps you see yourself and make sure you look good. So, it has value. Amy thought for a moment and then said, Oh, I see! So, the mirror is important because it helps me. Thank you, Tom, for teaching me about value. From that day on, Amy was not ignorant about the value of her mirror. She took care of it and always made sure it was clean and shiny.Jen and Ben were twins who liked to play together. But sometimes they also liked to fight. One day, they found a big ball in the park. They both wanted to play with it, but they did not want to share. Give me the ball! Jen said. No, its mine! Ben said. They pulled and pushed and shouted. Then Jen got angry and slapped Ben on the arm. Ben felt a mild pain and started to cry. Ow, that hurt! Ben said. You are mean! Jen felt sorry and gave Ben the ball. She hugged him and said, Im sorry, Ben. I love you. They smiled and played with the ball together. They did not fight anymore. But they did not see the big dog that was watching them. The dog liked balls too. He ran towards them and barked. He wanted to play with the ball, but he did not want to share. The twins got scared and ran away. They left the ball behind. The dog took the ball and ran away too. The twins learned a lesson. They learned to share and be kind. They also learned to watch out for dogs.Rosie was miserable. The sky was as blue as could be and it made the man happy. He decided to go for a walk. He went to the park, and there was an empty pitch. He sat down and watched the birds rising in the sky. They were so pretty and graceful. He was mesmerized by their beauty. Suddenly, he felt something shift underneath him. What was it? The pitch was rising! He could not believe his eyes! He got up and saw that the pitch had risen to a more comfortable level. He was so happy and couldnt believe his luck. The bald man sat down and looked up at the sky once more. He was so astonished by his luck. He thanked God for this miracle and decided to never forget it. The man thought for a moment. √¢≈ìLet√¢s make a signal!√¢ He said. √¢≈ìThen the trucks can see us and slow down. That way they won√¢t hurt us.√¢ So they waved their arms to stop the traffic. Soon the trucks began to slow down and the street became much safer. Jim smiled. He was no longer hurt and lonely. He had a blue mitten. He looked at Lily and said, This is my hill. You cant slide here. Go away. Lily felt sad and angry. She said, No, this is not your hill. This is a big hill for everyone. He wished he could take it out with his friends, but he was sure they wouldnt let him. So he grabbed the raft and ran down to the docks. When he got there, his friends were already there on their raft. He started to paddle out to them, when suddenly his paddle broke! The boy was so scared, he tried to get back to shore, but the wind was too strong. He was stuck in the middle of the lake and started to cry. His friends had seen him and paddled closer to help him, but when he tried to make it to them, the wind would push him back. Finally, his friends had to shut off their raft and turn back to get help. Unfortunately, by the time they got there the boy had been swept out to sea. The moral of the story is that jealousy will lead you nowhere. One day, her mom gave her a special mission. She put an iron in Lilys hands and said, Lily, I dare you to iron your own clothes! Lily was so excited. She knew it would take practice, but she was determined to succeed. She spent every day ironing her own clothes. She didnt give up. Finally, one day she did it! She had learned how to iron without help from anyone. She had done it all by herself, and she was proud. From then on, Lily was known as a very independent girl who was proud to conquer the challenge of ironing her own clothes. The end.Tommy was feeling so excited for his first day at school. He was wearing his new red shirt, which he loved. He was very happy when his mom gave him the shirt. On his way to school, he saw a cat. He wanted to chase it but his mom said not to. He was so embarrassed when his mom told him he couldnt chase it. He had a quick lunch with his classmates at school. He ate a hotdog and had some juice. The lunch was really yummy but it was over very quickly. In a few minutes the teacher asked everyone to gather around the table. He was a bit scared but started to follow the other students. The teacher gave each student a long pencil. He felt relaxed and happy when he saw his pencil was the longest one. Tommy was so proud to have such a long pencil. He was so excited for his first day of school that he almost forgot about his embarrassing moment with the cat.Once upon a time, there was a generous pigeon. Everywhere she went, she tried to help animals by sharing some of her food. All the other animals welcomed her with a smile. But one day, the pigeon had eaten all of her food. She was very hungry and had nowhere to go. Then, she heard a voice in the distance. It was an old fox. The fox said, I will give you some food, dear pigeon if you help me with a task I have. I need you to collect some stones that are lying around my den. Can you help me? The generous pigeon happily agreed to help the fox. Once she had collected the stones, the fox gave her a feast of food to eat. The moral of the story If you are generous and helpful to others, you will be rewarded.Once upon a time, there was a big park with lots of trees and grass. Many kids liked to play there because it was so fun. One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mommy. Lily saw a big slide and wanted to go down it, but there were too many kids waiting. So, she decided to go on the swings instead. She stood on the ground and waited for her turn. After a while, Lily got tired and wanted to go home. She asked her mommy where the exit was. Her mommy pointed to a gate and they walked towards it. On the way, they saw a popular ice cream truck. Lily wanted some ice cream, but her mommy said they could get some another time. Finally, they reached the exit and went home. Lily was happy because she had fun at the park and knew she could come back another day.Once upon a time, a little boy named Timmy wanted to climb a big tree. He was so happy and proud of himself. Suddenly, he heard a loud sound. It was thunder! Timmy was scared, but his mommy said, Dont worry, Timmy. Thunder is just a loud noise in the sky. One day, Jack got on a big crane and it started to lift him high up into the sky. He was so excited to be up so high and see the world from above. But then something unexpected happened! As the crane kept lifting Jack higher and higher, the sky became dark and a deep storm cloud started to form above him. Lightning flashed across the sky and thunder roared like a lion. Jack was so scared that he started to cry. The crane operator tried his best to lower Jack back down to safety, but the storm cloud was too strong. It kept pushing the crane further and further up into the sky until eventually it was impossible to go back. Jack was so far up in the sky and he was never seen again. The moral of the story is that no matter how excited you are to explore the world, always be careful of the deep storm clouds.Once there was a silly rabbit who loved to play. One day he found a bin and decided to turn it over. He smiled as he watched it reverse onto the ground. He decided it would be fun to jump inside and he hopped in. He wiggled and bounced around until he accidentally knocked the bin back over again. The rabbit was surprised but it made him laugh. He reversed the bin back onto the ground and giggled as he jumped inside again. He kept reversing the bin onto the ground and jumping inside every time until he eventually got tired and lay down for a nap inside the bin. His friends came to find him but could not figure out where he was until they saw the reversed bin. He lived in a cave by the sea and he ate fruit every day. One day, he decided to go for a walk in the forest. As he was walking, he came upon a small rabbit. The rabbit seemed scared and was shaking a lot. The bear walked up to the rabbit and asked, Whats wrong? The rabbit looked at the bear and said, There is a mean fox in the forest. He is trying to steal all the fruit. Please help me protect the fruit. The bear smiled and said, I will help you! We will protect the fruit together. So the wise old bear and the small rabbit worked together to keep the mean fox away. They watched over the fruit every day until the fox eventually gave up and left. The bear and the rabbit became good friends and they shared the fruit together. From that day on, they vowed to protect the forest and its fruit forever.Once upon a time, there was a big bush in the forest. The bush was very friendly and always waved to the animals passing by. One day, a little bird came to the bush and said, I wish I could build a nest in your branches, but they are too prickly and uncomfortable. The bush felt sad and wanted to improve so that the little bird could make a nest in it. The bush asked the other plants in the forest for help and they suggested that it grow softer leaves. The bush worked hard and soon it had soft leaves that the little bird could use to build a cozy nest. The little bird was so happy and thanked the bush for being so friendly and helpful. The sailor was sailing in his boat, smiling in the sunshine.Suddenly, there was a nosy bird. The bird flew overhead, looking around. The sailor smiled and nodded at the bird. The sailor kept sailing and soon came to shore. It was a beautiful beach, filled with colorful shells. The sailor walked around, looking at everything. But then he noticed something strange. A nosy crab was walking around, looking at everything too. The sailor nodded at the crab. Then he noticed something even more strange. It was a nosy little girl, peeking out from behind a rock. The sailor smiled and waved at the girl. She smiled back and waved goodbye. The sailor sailed away, waving goodbye to the nosy girl and the nosy crab. He smiled, feeling happy and content. The nosy bird flew above, watching him sail away.Tom and Sue are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big map on a wall. The map shows many places and colors. Look, Tom, this is where we are, Sue says. She points to a spot on the map. And this is where the sun goes down. It is called west. Wow, west is far away, Tom says. He looks at the map. I wonder what is there. Maybe there are animals and trees and mountains. Maybe we can find out, Sue says. She has an idea. Lets pretend we are explorers. We can go west and see what we can find. OK, lets go, Tom says. He is excited. He and Sue take their backpacks and hats and start to walk. They follow the map and the sun. They walk for a long time. They see many things. They see cars and buses and shops and people. They see flowers and birds and dogs and cats. They see a river and a bridge and a boat. They have fun. But they do not find west. West is still far away. They start to feel tired and hungry. Tom, I think we should go back, Sue says. She looks at the map. We are lost. We do not know where we are. Me too, Tom says. He looks at the sun. It is getting dark. We need to find our way home. They are scared. They do not know what to do. They look around. They see a big sign. The sign says Park. Look, Sue, the park! Tom says. He is happy. He knows the park. We are not lost. We are lucky. We can find our way home from here. Yes, Tom, we are lucky, Sue says. She is happy too. She knows the park. We can find our way home from here. They run to the park. They see their parents. Their parents are looking for them. They are worried. Tom! Sue! Where have you been? their parents say. They hug them. They are relieved. We went west, Tom and Sue say. They show them the map. We were explorers. We saw many things. But we got lost. Then we found the park. We are lucky. Their parents smile. They are proud. They are glad. You are lucky, their parents say. But you are also brave. And curious. And smart. You learned a lot today. But next time, please tell us where you are going. And do not go too far. West is a big place. Maybe we can go there together someday. Tom and Sue nod. They agree. They are sorry. They are happy. They go home. They have dinner. They tell their parents more stories. They have a lot of questions. They want to know more about west. They go to bed. They dream of west. They are lucky.Once upon a time there was a noisy rain. The chicken was very quiet but the cow knew where he was. She said, I see you in the hay! Suddenly the cow heard a fierce roar. It was a lion! The lion said, Lets all play together! The cow and chicken were so scared. But then the cow had a clever idea. She said, Can you fold up the hay and make a big cushion for us to sit on? The lion gave a big smile and said, I can! They were very upset and were making an awful racket. The rabbit heard one pig saying, I cant find my clean blanket. The rabbit knew that would make the pig very sad, so he hopped closer to help. He searched the meadow and soon he found the blanket inside a large bush. Quickly he ran over and presented the blanket to the pig. The pig was very happy to have his clean blanket back. The two farmers argued for a long time. Finally, the modern crane farmer said that since the old crane farmer had gotten to the hay first, the hay was his. The modern crane farmer knew that it was the right thing to do, even though he didnt get to use his crane this time. The moral of this story is that it is better to be flexible and think of others, even when it costs you something. One day, Max found a big drum in the forest. He was so excited that he started playing it right away. The sound of the drum was loud and made Max feel even happier. As he was playing the drum, Max noticed that his friend, the bird, was feeling uncomfortable. The bird was shivering because it was cold outside. Max knew just what to do. He stopped playing the drum and hugged the bird to keep it warm. After a while, the bird stopped shivering and felt comfortable again. Max was happy to see his friend feeling better. Of course, my little Benny, his mommy replied. Were ready for any kind of weather. As they sat inside their shelter, Bennys mommy told him a story about a little bird who didnt have a shelter and got very wet in the rain. Benny felt sad for the little bird and decided that he would share his shelter with any animals who needed it. He looked at Anna. He smiled. Sure, I can get you that book, he said. But what will you give me? Anna thought. She did not have much to give. She had her books, her toys, her dolls, her teddy. She scolded them. What are you doing? Why are you fighting? Why are you ruining the book? she said. Anna and Tom looked down. They felt sorry. They felt ashamed. They told their mom what happened. Their mom sighed. She hugged them. Anna, Tom, you are both wrong, she said. Books are not for fighting. Books are for sharing. Books are for learning. Books are for enjoying. But you have to take turns. And you have to be careful. And you have to say thank you. Anna and Tom said thank you. They took turns. They were careful. They read the book. He heard voices coming from inside the mist, so he decided to take a closer look. As he stepped toward the mist, two figures suddenly appeared out of it. They were two ladies and they both started to stare at him. Joe was so scared he wanted to cry. The ladies asked Joe why he looked so troubled. Joe told them he was worried about the mist. The ladies smiled and told him it was nothing to worry about. They said it was just the fog and the mist was just a part of the morning. He hopped off and there, Peter could see the board was actually placed over a stream. Peter was scared to hop back on the board, but then he noticed the stream was so sparkly and pretty that he decided to give it a go.
