With butterflies in her tummy, Jess slowly opened the front door and crept inside. Jess looked all around. She noticed the beautiful curtains and way up high, a lock! Jess went to have a closer look. There was something special about this lock and Jess knew she had to find out what it was for. Jess watched carefully as her dad took a key out of his pocket and unlocked the door. A whoosh of cool air blew past Jess. It was so nice and calm inside. Then Jess realized what the lock was for it was to keep her safe while she slept! Jess smiled and gave the lock a hug. She knew that she would always be safe and secure if she had a lock like this.Tim and Sam love to play with their toy trains. They have many trains of different colors and sizes. They like to make tracks on the floor and pretend they are driving the trains. One day, Tim and Sam find a big box in the garage. It has a picture of a train on it. They open the box and see a shiny new train. It is red and black and has a big engine. It also has a remote control that can make the train go fast or slow, or make sounds. Tim and Sam are very happy. They take the train and the remote control to the living room. They clear some space on the floor and set up the train on a track. They turn on the remote control and press a button. The train starts to move. It makes a loud whistle sound and a puff of smoke. Tim and Sam laugh and clap. They take turns driving the train. They make it go around the track, over a bridge, and through a tunnel. They make it stop and start, and change directions. They have a lot of fun. But then, the train starts to slow down. It makes a weak sound and stops. Tim and Sam look at the remote control. It has a red light that says low battery. They need to supply more power to the train. They look for more batteries, but they cannot find any. They are sad. They decide to play with their other trains. They put the new train on a shelf and take out their old trains. They make new tracks and drive their old trains. They are quiet, but they still have fun. They hope they can find more batteries soon and play with their new train again. They love their trains.Once upon a time, there was a very furry little cat. It was white, grey and black all mixed together and it loved to play outdoors. One day, the furry little cat was out chasing its favourite butterfly, when it suddenly heard a loud noise. It was a crane coming down from a very tall tree! The furry little cat was scared and ran away in a hurry. But then the crane started to strike the ground with its big beak. It looked so strong and fierce, but then it went back to the tree again. The furry little cat was so relieved that it was safe. From then on, it always stayed a bit further away from the big crane that stayed in the tree.Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to build things with his tools. One day, Timmys dad gave him a rare tool to use. Timmy was very happy and said thank you to his dad. Timmy wanted to build a big tower with his new tool, but he didnt know how to use it. He asked his dad for help, and his dad showed him how to use the tool. Timmy then made a request to his dad, asking if they could build the tower together. Timmy and his dad worked together and used the rare tool to build the biggest tower they had ever seen. Timmy was so proud of himself and his dad. He said thank you to his dad again and they both smiled. From that day on, Timmy loved using his rare tool to build things with his dad.Tom and Sam are brothers. They share a room. Tom likes to keep his toys tidy. Sam likes to make a mess. One day, Tom sees that his favorite car is missing. He looks under the bed, in the closet, and in the drawers. He cannot find it. He goes to Sam and asks, Sam, did you take my car? Sam shakes his head and says, No, I did not. I do not like your car. It is too small and red. Tom does not believe him. He thinks Sam is a thief and a liar. He says, You are a thief and a liar. You took my car and hid it somewhere. Give it back to me now! Sam gets angry and says, I am not a thief and a liar. You are a mean and bossy brother. Go away and leave me alone! They start to fight and push each other. Their mom hears the noise and comes to their room. She sees the mess and the boys fighting. She is not happy. She says, Stop it, both of you! What is going on here? Tom and Sam stop fighting and look at their mom. They both say, He started it! Their mom says, I do not care who started it. I want you to stop it and say sorry to each other. And I want you to tidy up this room. Now! Tom and Sam say sorry to each other. They do not really mean it, but they do not want to make their mom more angry. They start to tidy up the room. As they do, Tom finds his car under a pillow. He says, Look, I found my car! Sam, you did take it! Sam says, No, I did not. I do not know how it got there. Maybe it was a magic car that moved by itself. Tom says, Yeah, right. That is a silly story. You are still a liar. Sam says, No, I am not. You are still a meanie. They start to argue again. Their mom hears them and says, Enough! No more fighting and no more lying. If you want to keep your toys, you have to share them and take care of them. And you have to be nice to each other. Do you understand? Tom and Sam nod and say, Yes, mom. They finish tidying up the room. They put their toys in their places. They decide to play with the car together. They take turns and make vroomvroom sounds. They have fun. They forget about being angry. They are brothers.Once upon a time, there was a kind and generous girl named Lily. Kims mom laughed and said that it was too early for night time and that the clock said it was morning. Confused, Kim asked, How does the clock know? Her mom said that there were numbers on the clock and the numbers tell you if its morning, afternoon, or night. Kim thought about this for a minute and asked another funny question, Do the numbers move?. Mom said yes, that the numbers were like a boat on the sea and when the sea moved the boat moved too. Kim asked, Do I move the clock? and her mom said no, the hour and minute hands took care of it. Kim thought this was really funny and had to tell her friends all about it! The rabbit was so excited to have a friend to dance with now. But then he had a great idea. He said to the little squirrel, √¢≈ìLet√¢s have a dance competition! Whoever can dance the best will get a special reward.√¢ The little squirrel was so excited at the thought of a reward, so they started to practice. The rabbit was getting better and better at his dancing and the little squirrel was too. Finally, they had their competition and they both danced so well that they both got a reward. They had danced so well that they both felt like they had won. And from then on, they were the smartest, best dancers in the whole meadow.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite toy, a teddy bear. One day, she lost her teddy bear and couldnt find it anywhere. She asked her mommy and daddy if they knew where it was, but they didnt know. Lily was very sad and went to her room. She looked under her bed and in her closet, but her teddy bear was nowhere to be found. She felt empty without her teddy bear. Suddenly, she heard a voice coming from her toy box. I know where your teddy bear is, said the voice. It was her toy clown. Where is he? asked Lily. Hes in the closet, said the clown. Lily ran to the closet and found her teddy bear. She was so happy and hugged him tightly. But then, the closet door closed on her and she couldnt get out. She was stuck inside and no one knew where she was. It was true that the clown knew where her teddy bear was, but it was also true that the closet was a dangerous place to play.Once upon a time, in a big garden, there was a little flower. The little flower was very worried. It wanted to bloom, but it was scared. One day, a kind guard came to the garden. The guard saw the worried flower and asked, Why are you so worried, little flower? The little flower said, I want to bloom, but I am scared. The guard smiled and said, Dont be scared, little flower. I will help you. The guard gave the flower some water and talked to it every day. Soon, the little flower started to feel better. One sunny day, the little flower bloomed. It was so happy! The guard was happy too. They both knew that with a little help and love, anything is possible. And from that day on, the little flower was never worried again.Anna and Ben like to play in the park. They see a big truck with many branches on it. The truck is loud and strong. The truck driver is nice. He says, Hello, kids. Do you want to help me load the branches? Anna and Ben nod and smile. They run to the truck and pick up some branches. The branches are brown and green. Some are long and some are short. Some are hard and some are soft. Anna and Ben carry the branches to the truck and put them on it. They work hard and have fun. The truck driver says, Thank you, kids. You are very helpful. Do you want a ride in the truck? Anna and Ben say, Yes, please! They climb into the truck and sit next to the driver. The driver starts the truck and drives away. The truck makes a big noise. Anna and Ben wave to the park and the trees. They feel happy and proud. They helped to load the branches.Once upon a time, there was a vendor who was very excited to match people with the items they wanted. She always greeted customers happily and tried her best to help them. One day, a little girl came to the vendor. She asked for a new dress but the vendor hadnt any in the girls size. The vendor was very upset that she couldnt help the little girl. The girl was also upset, so she left the store. Just then, the little girls grandmother came into the store. She was very happy to match the little girl with a dress she needed. The grandmother said, Im so glad Im here! Im so sorry your vendor couldnt help you before, honey. Im sure youll look very pretty in your new dress. The vendor was very happy. She was glad that the little girl had found a dress that matched. From that day onward, the vendor always reminded herself to stay happy, no matter how upset she got.Once upon a time, there was a large ranch. In the ranch, there lived two children Tom and Susie. One day, Tom and Susie were walking in the ranch. Suddenly, Tom said to Susie, Lets dance! Susie smiled and said, Yes! That sounds like fun! Tom and Susie started dancing around the large ranch. They jumped and twirled in the warm sun. All the animals grazing on the ranch stopped to watch them. On and on they danced until they were too tired to dance anymore. After a while, Susie said, That was so much fun! Lets do it again soon! Tom smiled and said, Yes, lets do it! It was a great way to spend the day! And that is how Tom and Susie spent their day dancing in the large ranch!Tom and Sue were playing in the garden. They liked to dig and make mud pies. They found an old ashtray in the dirt. It was blue and round and had a picture of a fish on it. Look, I found a fish bowl! Tom said. He filled the ashtray with water and put some grass and stones in it. No, its not a fish bowl, its an ashtray. My dad has one like that. He puts his smokes in it. Sue said. She took the ashtray from Tom and dumped the water out. Hey, give it back! I want to play with it! Tom said. He grabbed the ashtray from Sue and ran away. Sue chased him and tried to get it back. They ran around the garden and splashed in the puddles. They got very wet and dirty. The ashtray got soaked too. Stop, stop, youre making a mess! Mom said. She came out of the house and saw them. She was not happy. She took the ashtray from them and threw it in the trash. Thats not a toy, thats a nasty thing. You shouldnt play with it. And look at you, youre soaked and muddy. Come inside and get cleaned up. Mom said. Tom and Sue followed Mom inside. They were sad and sorry. They liked the blue ashtray. They wanted to play with it more. But they knew they did something bad. They said sorry to Mom and hugged her. Mom forgave them and gave them a bath. She told them a story about a real fish bowl and a real fish. Tom and Sue liked the story. They forgot about the ashtray. They were happy again.Once upon a time, there was a little rhinoceros named Rob. He loved to clap his hands and jump around. He was very happy and full of energy. One day, Rob heard a strange sound coming from the forest. He walked closer, and suddenly heard a voice. It said Help, Im stuck! Rob went closer and saw a small dog covered in mud. He said, Hello, do you need help? The dog was very happy and nodded. Rob quickly started to pull the dog and freed him from the mud. The dog was so happy that he started to clap. Rob was so surprised that he started to clap too. Suddenly, he heard another noise. He turned around and saw a deaf elephant. Rob was shocked, so he clapped even harder to get the elephants attention. The elephant trumped and started to move closer. Rob quickly put his hand on the elephants trunk and the two of them started to clap together. The little rhinoceros and the deaf elephant clapped and danced together, until the sun comes up. They were the best of friends.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a cat named Mittens. Mittens was very soft and had pretty eyes. One day, Lilys mommy decided to bake some cookies. It smelled so yummy! Mittens was very interested in the smell and came to the kitchen to see what was happening. Lilys mommy let Mittens lick the spoon after she finished baking the cookies. Mittens was so happy and licked the spoon clean. The cookies were delicious and everyone was happy, especially Mittens!Tim and Sam were brothers who liked to go camping with their dad. They had a small cabin in the woods where they could sleep and play. One night, they heard a loud noise outside. They were scared and ran to their dad. Dad, what is that? Tim asked. It sounds like a bear, boys. Stay inside and be quiet, their dad said. He grabbed a flashlight and a stick and went out to scare the bear away. Tim and Sam waited in the cabin, but they did not hear their dad come back. They heard more noises, like growls and thumps and screams. They were very troubled and hugged each other. Dad, where are you? Sam cried. But their dad did not answer. The bear had found him and hurt him very badly. He could not move or talk. The bear was hungry and angry and wanted more food. It smelled the boys in the cabin and broke the door with its claws. Tim and Sam saw the bear and screamed, but it was too late. The bear attacked them and ate them. They could not sleep or play anymore. They were gone.Once upon a time, there was a humble little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to hop around and play with his friends. One day, Benny saw a purple flower in the field and he wanted to pick it. But he couldnt reach it because it was too high. Benny asked his friend, a wise old owl, How can I get the purple flower? The owl replied, You must wait until the sun rises and the flower will rise with it. Benny didnt understand how the flower could rise with the sun, but he trusted his friend. So, Benny waited patiently until the next morning when the sun rose. And just as the owl had said, the purple flower rose up towards the sky. Benny was so happy and grateful to his friend for the wise advice. From that day on, Benny knew that sometimes, things will rise up if you just wait patiently.Once there was a family and they had a daughter who was three years old. He pushed Lily and made her drop the block. Lily felt sad. She cried and said, That was not nice! You hurt me! Ben felt sorry. He did not mean to hurt Lily. He just wanted the red block. He said, Im sorry, Lily. I was wrong. Can I have the red block, please? Lily looked at Ben. She saw that he was sorry. She said, OK, Ben. You can have the red block. But you have to be gentle. She felt so happy and free! Suddenly, she heard a loud sound. It was coming from the sky and it was getting louder. Daisy was scared, so she hid behind a tree. She looked up and saw a dragon. She didnt want it to hurt again, so she decided to wait until her knee was all better.Once upon a time, there was a wise old fox who lived in a big forest. Every day, the fox liked to sit in a clearing and think about life. One day, a little bunny hopped over and saw the fox. The bunny asked, What are you thinking about, fox? The fox said, Im thinking about understanding. The bunny asked, What does that mean? The fox replied, It means to use your head. You understand things when you use your head to think about them. The bunny thought for a moment and then asked, Can I use my head to understand the color of my hair? The fox smiled and said, Yes, you can. The fox explained if the bunny looked at his hair and thought about it, he could understand why it was the color it was. The bunny thanked the fox and hopped away. The fox smiled and knew that the bunny now understood that using your head to think and understand was a very wise thing to do. The moral of the story is this understanding things is important, and it comes from thinking, not from just knowing facts. Thats why its important to be wise and think before you act.Lily and Tom were twins who loved to play outside. They had a big yard with many trees and flowers. One day, they saw a new tree that was very different from the others. It was green all year and had sharp needles instead of leaves. It was a pine tree. Wow, look at that tree! Lily said. It is so big and pretty! Can we climb it? Tom asked. He liked to climb trees and see the sky. I dont know, Lily said. It looks very high and hard. Maybe we should ask Mom first. They ran to the house and found Mom in the kitchen. She was making cookies for them. Mom, Mom, can we climb the pine tree in the yard? Tom asked. The pine tree? Mom said. Thats a special tree, my dears. Its a Christmas tree. A Christmas tree? Lily and Tom said. They had heard of Christmas, but they did not know much about it. Yes, a Christmas tree, Mom said. Its a tree that we decorate with lights and ornaments to celebrate the birth of Jesus. He is the son of God, who loves us very much. Who is Jesus? Lily asked. Jesus is our friend and savior, Mom said. He came to the world to teach us how to love and be kind. He also died for us, so we can be with him in heaven. What is heaven? Tom asked. Heaven is a wonderful place, where there is no pain or sadness, only joy and peace, Mom said. We can go there after we die, if we believe in Jesus and follow his ways. How do we follow his ways? Lily asked. We follow his ways by praying to him, reading his words, and doing good deeds, Mom said. Praying is talking to him in our hearts, and telling him what we are thankful for, what we need, and what we are sorry for. Reading his words is learning from the Bible, which is his book. Doing good deeds is helping others, sharing, and being honest. Lily and Tom listened to Mom with wonder and curiosity. They wanted to know more about Jesus and heaven. Can we pray to Jesus now? Tom asked. Of course, my loves, Mom said. We can pray anytime, anywhere. He always hears us and answers us. Lets pray together. Mom held their hands and closed her eyes. Lily and Tom did the same. Dear Jesus, thank you for this day, and for this beautiful pine tree that reminds us of you. Thank you for our family, and for our cookies. Please help us to learn more about you, and to follow your ways. Please forgive us when we make mistakes, and help us to be better. Please bless us and keep us safe. We love you, Jesus. Amen. Amen, Lily and Tom said. They opened their eyes and smiled. They felt a warm and happy feeling in their hearts. Mom, can we still climb the pine tree? Tom asked. Mom laughed and hugged them. Sure, you can climb the pine tree, but be careful. Its an enormous tree, and you are still little. And dont forget to thank Jesus for the fun you have. Okay, Mom, Lily and Tom said. They ran to the yard and climbed the pine tree. They felt the needles prick their fingers, and the wind blow their hair. They saw the birds and the clouds, and the sun shining bright. They thanked Jesus for the pine tree, and for everything else. They had a wonderful time.Once upon a time there was a tree. It was big and strong. One day a fierce lion appeared in the meadow. We all appreciate it. The lion was very happy and thanked the tree. From then on, the lion and the tree were good friends. After drinking the milk, the cat went back to sleep. He dreamed about the prize he got and how delicious the milk was. The next day, the cat woke up and saw that the prize was gone. She loved to play outside, but there were always mosquitoes biting her. One day, she was playing with her friend Timmy when she got bitten by a mosquito on her arm. Ouch! That mosquito bit me, she said. Timmy suggested they go inside to avoid more mosquito bites. But Lily didnt want to stop playing. No, I want to keep playing. I dont want to go inside, she said. Later that day, Lily started to feel itchy all over her body. She realized she had many mosquito bites. She wished she had listened to Timmys suggestion. The next day, Lily and Timmy went to the store to buy mosquito spray. It smelled funny, but it worked amazing! They sprayed it all over their bodies and didnt get any more mosquito bites. From that day on, Lily always listened to Timmys suggestions.Once there was a boy. His name was Luke. He was three years old. One day, Luke found a tower. It was tall and made out of blocks. He was very excited. He started to play with the blocks. Before long, Luke had made a tower of his own. He was so excited. He tried to make it as tall as the other tower. He giggled and laughed. It was very funny. Once the tower was finished, Luke was happy. He wanted to show it to everybody. He ran outside and showed it to his mom. She was excited too. Suddenly, there was a loud crash! The tower had fallen over! Luke was sad, but he was still excited. He started to build a new tower. This one was even funnier than before! He laughed and had lots of fun.Once upon a time, there was a friendly gorilla named Gigi. Gigi lived in a big forest with her friends. She liked to play with her friends and eat yummy food. One day, Gigi found a big ice cream cone on the ground. She was very happy and excited. Gigi picked up the ice cream cone and said, I will share this with my friends! She walked around the forest to find her friends, but the sun was very hot. Gigi felt the ice cream start to melt in her hand. She knew she had to hurry to share it with her friends. Gigi found her friends and said, Look what I found! Lets share this ice cream! But when she opened her hand, the ice cream had melted away. All that was left was a sticky mess. Gigi and her friends were sad that they couldnt eat the ice cream. They learned that sometimes, things dont go the way we want them to.Once upon a time, there was a silly cat named Mittens. Teddy tried to find his way, but he couldnt. He felt very alone and sad. Eventually, Teddy got so tired that he fell asleep. The next morning, his friends found him and brought him back home. She does not know what space is. She thinks it is a place far away. She says, Maybe it is where the stars are. Do you think someone from the stars sent us a message? Tom nods. He thinks that is cool. He says, Maybe they want to be our friends. Maybe they have toys and books too. Lily and Tom smile. They press another button. The screen changes. It shows a picture of a green face with big eyes and a funny mouth. The face says, Hello, earth kids. We are from space. We want to play with you. Can you clap your hands? Lily and Tom are surprised. They see the face and hear the voice. They think it is a joke. They look around, but they do not see anyone. They wonder who is hiding and making the voice. They decide to play along. They clap their hands. The face on the screen claps too. It says, Good, good. You are smart and fun. We like you. Do you want to see more of us? Lily and Tom are curious. They want to see more of the space friends. They nod and say, Yes, yes. Show us more. The face on the screen smiles. It says, OK, OK. We will show you more. But first, you have to do something for us. You have to give us your toys and books. We need them for our space mission. Can you do that? Lily and Tom are confused. They do not understand why the space friends need their toys and books. They like their toys and books. They do not want to give them away. They shake their heads and say, No, no. We cannot do that. We need our toys and books too. They are ours. The face on the screen frowns. It says, No, no. You have to do that. We are your space friends. You have to listen to us. We will not show you more if you do not give us your toys and books. We will be angry. We will go away. Do you want that? Lily and Tom are scared. They do not want the space friends to be angry. They do not want them to go away. They do not know what to do. They look at each other. They do not like this game anymore. They think it is weird and mean. They want to stop. They say, No, no. We do not want that. But we do not want to give you our toys and books either. We do not think you are our space friends. We think you are bad. We do not want to play with you. We want to go home. They turn off the box. They grab their toys and books. They run away from the park. They do not look back. They do not see the face on the screen change. It is not a green face anymore. It is a red face. It is angry. It says, Bad, bad. You are not smart and fun. You are silly and rude. We do not like you. We will find other earth kids to play with. We will get their toys and books. We will not stop. We are from space. We are clever and strong. You will see.Once upon a time, there was a round orange ball who wanted more than anything to reach the top of the hill. He tried and he tried, but the hill was so big and he was so small that he couldnt do it on his own. He saw a dependable old friend of his and asked for his help. The friend said yes, and together they started to struggle up the hill. The round orange ball kept slipping because the hill was so steep, but his friend kept pushing him along bit by bit. Finally, the round orange ball made it to the top of the hill. He was so happy and thanked his dependable friend for helping him. With a smile, the two of them ran back down the hill, never to forget their struggle up the hill that day.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved music and wanted to start a band with her friends. One day, she asked her friend Timmy if he wanted to be in her band. Timmy said yes and they were very happy. Lily said, We need more friends to complete our band. Who else can we ask? Timmy said, My sister is good at singing. Lets ask her! They asked Timmys sister and she said yes. They practiced their music every day. Lily played the drums, Timmy played guitar, and Timmys sister sang. One day, they had a big concert. Lily was nervous because her drums were delicate and she didnt want them to break. But the concert went well and everyone loved their music. They were a complete band and had so much fun playing together.Once upon a time, there was a big lion. The lion was very powerful and he liked to show his power to other animals. One day, a little rabbit saw the lion and got scared. The lion saw the rabbits face and thought it was funny that the little rabbit was scared of him. The lion started to chase the rabbit, but the rabbit was too fast for him. The rabbit ran and ran until he got to a big hole. The rabbit jumped into the hole and the lion couldnt follow him. The rabbit felt safe in the hole, but he was also sad that he couldnt play with the other animals because he was too scared of the lion. Then, a wise old owl appeared and told the rabbit that the lion was not as powerful as he thought. The owl revealed that the lion was actually scared of something else. The rabbit felt better knowing that the lion was not as scary as he thought. The next day, the rabbit saw the lion again, but this time he wasnt scared. He looked the lion in the face and saw that the lion was actually afraid of the dark. From that day on, the rabbit and the lion became friends and played together without any fear.Once there was a curious little girl. She wanted to find a treasure. But to get it she had to ride her bike very far. She had heard there was a treasure far away in the woods. She thought it would be hard to get there but she was very excited. The next day, she got on her bike and began to ride. After a few hours of riding her tires started to get flat. The little girl was worried and looked around for help. Just then, she spotted a cute bunny hopping by. It looked friendly and she decided to trust it. The bunny hopped closer and motioned for her to follow it. The little girl followed the bunny deep into the woods. After a while they reached a clearing. There, in the center was a large chest. The little girl realized she had gotten her treasure! She was so excited. From then on she would always take her bicycle on adventures in the woods.One day, a lawyer went to the park. He was glad because it was sunny. The girl was so happy. She said, Thank you! The lawyer was glad he could help. He said, Youre welcome! The girl and the lawyer played with the ball. He wanted to be strong and brave. One day, he suddenly heard a noise. It was a small mouse that had come to visit the old man. It looked at the sword and wanted to play with it. But the old man did not permit it. The mouse was sad but then it had an idea. It asked the old man if it could help him sharpen the sword. The old man said that it could, as long as it was careful. So the mouse took the sword and sharpened it with some rocks. The sword was now even sharper and even glowed in the dark. The old man was very pleased and thanked the little mouse. The mouse was happy that it had helped and scurried away.Once upon a time there lived a small mouse. He lived in a dark cave and wanted to find the light. He tried to find a way out of the cave but it was full of twists and turns. He could not find his way out. One day he decided to escape. He ran as fast as he could but the darkness seemed to go on forever. He could barely see anything and became scared. But then he saw a small light in the distance! He followed the light until it was brighter and brighter. He was very slow, but he kept going until he reached the outside of the cave. He was so happy to finally see the daylight! He felt freedom and relief. He ran around, enjoying the sunlight, until he saw a bolt of lightening across the sky. He was mesmerised. He had finally escaped the darkness and found the light.Once there was a little girl. Her name was Lucy and she was three years old. They smelled good and made a sizzling sound. Lily and Tom felt hungry and wanted to taste them. Can we have one? Lily asked Tom. Maybe, Tom said. But mom said not to spoil them. Lily reached for the pan handle, but it was very hot. She burned her hand and cried out. Tom tried to help her, but he bumped the pan and spilled the eggs on the floor. They made a big mess. Mom heard the noise and came back to the kitchen. She saw the eggs and the pan and the twins. She was very grumpy. What did you do? she asked. You spoiled the eggs and the pan and the floor! Put some into the bucket until you cannot put any more in.√¢ So Daisy put lots of small pieces of wood into the bucket, until finally it was full. She started carrying the bucket away, but she couldn√¢t take it far. Her little heel got stuck in the mud, and no matter how hard she tried, she couldn√¢t pull it free. Daisy started to cry, but her big sister seemed to know just what to do. She ran and got some rope from the house, and with it she tied the bucket to Daisy√¢s hands. Daisy could now pull the bucket along with her feet, without getting her heel stuck in the mud again. Suddenly, he saw something moving. He was scared so he slapped it with his hand. It was only a little sand bug! The soldier felt bad and said sorry to the bug. He kept walking, but then he heard something else moving. This time it was a snake! The soldier was scared again, so he slapped the snake with his hand and the snake slithered away. The soldier was so hot that he needed a drink of water. He walked for a few more minutes until he reached a lake. Then he jumped in the lake and splashed around. He was so happy to have some cool water and was so glad he had not slapped the lake. He smiled and said √¢≈ìYay!√¢Once there was a fisherman. He went out on a boat every day to catch fish. Suddenly, something else came out of the water. It was a crab! It was so tight that the fisherman couldnt get it off the hook. But then the crab bit the fishermans hand and ran away. The fisherman chased it and eventually brought it back to the boat. He was so happy! The fisherman was so proud of what he brought back from the water. He cooked the crab for dinner and watched the sunset. He was happy that he had a successful day fishing.Once upon a time, there were two friends Sam and Lucy. He wanted to go on a trip with his family, but he was very tired. So he stayed home alone. He looked out the window to see everyone already off on their trip. He felt sad that he wasnt part of the family fun. Suddenly he heard a loud noise coming from the backyard. He went outside to investigate. To his surprise, he saw the family√¢s old tree rotting away. Max was so disappointed. He decided that he needed to do something. He decided to take a nap to try and forget about the rotted tree. He thought maybe he could think of a way to make things right when he woke up. When Max woke up a few hours later, he found that the tree had completely rotted away. There was nothing Max could do. He felt so sad that he was away while this happened. He wished he had been there to prevent it from rotting. Then he sadly realized that he was too tired to help. The end.Billy wanted to play hide and seek. He felt that the best spot was behind a curtain, so he opened it up. The curtain was tough, but Billy was brave and so he pushed it back and crawled inside. He felt so safe and quiet, covered by the cloth. It was like he was hidden in a secret cave. As he curled up in the corner, he heard his mom call his name. Billy popped his head out from the curtain and looked around. All of his friends were gathered around and they were ready to start the game. He went out and joined them, ready to cover up and start counting. It was a lot of fun. They all took turns covering themselves up behind the tough curtain. They looked forward to the game every day and it became a regular routine. Billy continued to love the thrill of feeling hidden away in the secrecy of the curtain.Once upon a time, there was a warm day. A little boy named Tim went to play near a creek. He liked to watch the water move and listen to the sounds it made. One day, Tim saw something new in the creek. He wanted to examine it. It was a small, shiny thing. Tim tried to reach for it, but he fell into the water. The water was cold and Tim was scared. He cried for help, but no one was close to hear him. Tim tried to swim, but he could not. In the end, Tim could not get out of the creek, and it was a very sad day.Tom and Lily are going on a big trip with Mom and Dad. They are very happy and excited. They pack their bags and toys and get in the car. Mom and Dad drive to the airport. At the airport, they see many people and planes. They have to wait in a long line. Then they have to show their passports to a man. A passport is a small book with your name and picture. It tells where you are from and where you can go. Can I see your passport, please? the man asks Tom. Here you go, Tom says. He opens his passport and gives it to the man. The man looks at it and smiles. Very good, Tom. You have a reliable passport. It is not old or broken. It is valid and safe. You can go on the plane, the man says. Thank you, Tom says. He takes his passport back and puts it in his pocket. Can I see your passport, please? the man asks Lily. Here you go, Lily says. She opens her passport and gives it to the man. The man looks at it and frowns. Oh no, Lily. You have a problem. Your passport is not reliable. It is old and torn. It is not valid and safe. You cannot go on the plane, the man says. What? No! Lily says. She starts to cry. She does not want to stay at the airport. She wants to go on the big trip with Tom and Mom and Dad. Dont worry, Lily. We will fix this. We will get you a new passport. It will be fast and easy. Then you can go on the plane, Mom says. She hugs Lily and wipes her tears. Really? Lily says. Really, Mom says. They go to another place where they can get a new passport. They take a picture of Lily and fill out a form. They pay some money and wait for a little while. Then they get a new passport for Lily. It is shiny and new. It has her name and picture. It is reliable. Here you go, Lily. You have a new passport. It is reliable. It is valid and safe. You can go on the plane, the lady says. Thank you, Lily says. She opens her new passport and smiles. She is happy and excited again. They go back to the line and show their passports to the man. The man nods and lets them go. They walk to the gate and board the plane. They find their seats and buckle their belts. They are ready for the big trip. Are you happy, Lily? Tom asks. Yes, I am happy, Tom. I have a reliable passport. I can go on the big trip with you and Mom and Dad, Lily says. Me too, Lily. Me too, Tom says. They hold hands and look out the window. They see the plane take off and fly in the sky. They are going on a big trip. They are very happy and excited.Once upon a time there was a man called Tim. He was very weak and always felt sad. One day, he was out trying to find some food when he suddenly saw something shiny. It was a knife! He was so excited, he picked it up and took it home. At home, Tim examined the knife and found that it was very sharp and shiny. He knew that he could use it to cut food. He felt even more excited. He took the knife outside and tried to cut some vegetables. The vegetables were very hard and he had to push the knife very hard to cut them. He was so weak that he was having trouble. Suddenly, the knife slipped and Tim caught his finger! He was very scared and started to cry. He ran home and his mom put a bandaid on it. She hugged him and told him that he had to be very careful next time. Tim was sad but he was still excited about his new knife. He made sure to be very careful from now on and it made him feel a lot better.Lily wanted to wear her new coat with the big zipper. She liked how it made a sound when she pulled it up and down. She put on the coat and tried to zip it by herself. But the zipper was stuck. She pulled harder, but it did not move. Mommy, help me! she cried. The zipper is broken! Mommy came and looked at the coat. She saw that the zipper was not broken, but it was caught on some fabric. She gently freed the zipper and zipped it up for Lily. There you go, sweetie. The zipper is fine. You just have to be careful not to catch it on anything. Lily smiled and hugged Mommy. Then she looked at the coat again. She wanted to zip it by herself. She reached for the zipper and pulled it down. Lily, what are you doing? Mommy asked. Its cold outside. You need to keep your coat zipped up. Lily shook her head. She wanted to play with the zipper. She liked how it made a sound. She insisted on zipping it up and down. No, Mommy, I want to zip it! she said. Mommy sighed. She knew that Lily was curious and liked to learn new things. But she also knew that the zipper was weak and could break if Lily pulled it too much. She did not want Lily to ruin her new coat. Lily, listen to me. The zipper is not a toy. It is a part of your coat. If you zip it too much, it will get tired and stop working. Then you will not be able to wear your coat anymore. Do you want that? Lily thought for a moment. She did not want to lose her coat. She liked her coat. It was warm and soft and had a big zipper. She decided to listen to Mommy. She zipped up her coat and left it alone. Okay, Mommy, I will not zip it too much. I will be gentle with the zipper. Thank you for helping me. Mommy smiled and kissed Lily. She was proud of Lily for being smart and polite. But the swan was nowhere to be found! The girl searched high and low but there was still no sign of the swan. Finally, after a while, the girl spotted the swan in a tree. It was so thin, it was like water. But it was still soup. Every day, a special dog came to the thin soup. The dog would act very silly. He would twirl around and do funny tricks. The thin soup was very excited to see the dog each day. The thin soup decided to act silly, like the dog. So he started twirling around and doing his own tricks. The thin soup was even thin enough to do a somersault. It was so fun that the thin soup started dancing. All around the soup bowl, he moved his arms and legs in circles and swoops. The iron had three magical powers. First, it could unite people. Second, it could turn gentle. Third, it could make things happen. One day, the iron was very lonely. All days and nights went by, but nobody wanted to play with him. He thought, Why am I so lonely? What am I missing? A little bird flew by, and said to the iron, Maybe you need to make yourself gentle first. People will like you then. The iron wasnt sure what to do, but he followed the birds advice. He took a deep breath, and slowly become gentle. People suddenly noticed the iron. To their surprise, he was no longer rusty and old, but friendly and gentle. One little girl named Sarah approached the iron and said, Hello there! Can you help me unite my family tomorrow? We need your magic! The iron smiled and said, Of course I can! And he continued to be playful and have fun with his toys every day.Tom and Lily were playing in the park. They saw a big, green frog on a rock. Tom wanted to touch it, but Lily was scared. The frog did not move. Tom touched it softly. It felt wet and slimy. See, it is not scary, Tom said. It is just a frog. Do you want to touch it too? Lily shook her head. She did not want to touch the frog. She thought it was ugly and gross. Come on, Lily, it is fun, Tom said. It will not hurt you. It is just a frog. Lily took a step closer. She looked at the frog. It blinked its big, black eyes. Lily felt brave. She reached out her finger too. She touched the frog gently. It felt wet and slimy. Wow, it is not scary, Lily said. It is just a frog. It is kind of cute. Tom and Lily smiled. They liked the frog. They touched it some more. The frog croaked. Tom and Lily laughed. They made friends with the frog.One day, a girl and her brother were playing in the yard. They found an interesting big box. The girl said, Lets open it! After a long time, they finally found it! They quickly brought it back to the pond, so that the frog could take it and get better. And sure enough, the frog felt much better after taking the medicine it could swim again! The duck was so happy that it hopped around and splashed in the water with the frog. They thought the man and the woman would not mind if they had a little sip. They waited until the man and the woman went to fetch some water from the river. You cant hurt me with my shield! The dragon realized he couldnt hurt Jack and flew away. Jack felt proud and happy that he had his shield to protect him from the dangerous dragon.Billy was a little boy. He loved exploring outdoors. One day while he was playing he saw a track in the dirt. He grabbed his stick and started to poke it. He poked and poked until it made a little bump. Then he kept poking until he made a track. He kept poking until the track was very long, and then he followed it. He was so excited when he saw a rabbit peeking out from the other side. Billy got scared and ran back. But he kept coming back to the track and poking it. He enjoyed it so much that he started doing it every day. He would poke the track, run around it and see what he could find. One day, he found a little mouse! After that, he started to poke the track even more. His mom was very proud of him, and she always smiled when she saw him poking and exploring the track.Once upon a time there lived a sweet little girl. She always wanted to be happy and play. Every day before the little girl ate breakfast, she would run into the living room and stand in front of the mirror. She always wanted to see how she looked, and it made her smile. One day the little girl noticed something strange in the mirror. She touched the surface and it felt soft. She decided to keep touching it and see what would happen. Then, with a single hop, the little girl leapt into the mirror. She was surprised to find herself in a new place full of beautiful things! Everything was soft and different colours. The little girl was so excited to explore this new world. Everywhere she looked, she saw different shapes and sizes. She was full of hope that she could have lots of fun. The little girl played for hours until she heard her mom calling her for dinner. She then hopped back into the mirror and returned to her own world. She was happy and grateful for her adventure. The little girl smiled and shared her story with her mom. They both smiled and they made a promise to each other that the little girl would return to the mirror very soon!Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw pictures of her favorite animals, like bunnies and puppies. One day, Lilys mom said, Lily, lets organize your drawings so we can find them easily. Lily asked, What does organize mean? It means we can put all your bunny drawings together and all your puppy drawings together, her mom explained. Lily thought that was a great idea. She went to her room and brought out all her drawings. Her mom helped her sort them by animal, and then they put them in a big folder to keep them safe. After they finished organizing, Lilys mom said, Lets print a picture of your favorite animal and put it on your wall. Lily thought for a moment and said, I love bunnies. They are so sweet! So they printed a picture of a cute bunny and hung it on Lilys wall. Lily was so happy to see her organized drawings and her sweet bunny picture every day.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play at the beach with her mommy and daddy. One day, they went to the beach and saw a crab walking on the sand. Lily said, Look, a crab! Its so cool! Her mommy said, Be careful, Lily. Crabs have claws that can pinch you. Lily replied, I wont touch it. I just want to watch it. After a while, Lilys tummy started to feel empty. She said, Mommy, Im hungry. Can we go get some food? Her daddy said, Sure, lets rush to the snack bar before it gets too crowded. Lily was happy to get some food and she said, Thank you, mommy and daddy. This is yummy!Tim and Liz were playing by the river. They saw a big raft made of wood and rope. They wanted to go on it and have fun. Can we go on the raft, please? Tim asked his mom. Okay, but be careful. Dont go too far and wear your life jackets, mom said. Tim and Liz put on their life jackets and climbed on the raft. They used sticks to push the raft along the water. They saw ducks, fish and frogs. They laughed and sang. Suddenly, the raft hit a rock and started to spin. Tim and Liz were scared and confused. They did not know what to do. They held on to the raft and each other. Help! Help! they shouted. Mom heard them and ran to the river. She saw the raft spinning and her children crying. She threw a rope to them and pulled them to the shore. Are you okay? mom asked. Yes, we are okay. But we are dizzy and wet, Tim said. Im sorry, mom. We did not mean to spin the raft, Liz said. Its okay, my loves. Im glad you are safe. Next time, be more careful and stay away from the rocks, mom said. She hugged them and took them home. They had some hot chocolate and cookies. They learned their lesson and never spun the raft again.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go to the park and play with her friends. One day, her mommy told her they were going to the zoo! Lily was so excited and couldnt wait to see all the animals. When they got to the zoo, they bought a ticket and went inside. Lily saw lots of animals she knew, like lions and monkeys. But then, she saw a big sign that said Beware of the unknown creature! Lily didnt know what that meant, but it made her a little scared. As they walked around, Lily saw a big cage with a sign that said Do not disturb the animals. But then, she heard a loud noise coming from inside the cage. She wanted to see what it was, but her mommy reminded her of the sign. Later on, they saw a big, scary looking animal that Lily had never seen before. It was the unknown creature! But Lily wasnt scared anymore, because she knew to be careful and not disturb it.Anna and Ben are playing with a big box. They want to make a house with the box. They find some old clothes and a rope. They use the clothes to cover the box and make a roof. They use the rope to tie the clothes to the box and make a door. Look, we made a house! Anna says. She is happy. She goes inside the box and pretends to cook. Ben follows her and pretends to eat. Yum, yum, this is good! Ben says. He is happy too. They laugh and play. Suddenly, they hear a loud noise. It is their dog, Spot. Spot sees the box and thinks it is a toy. He runs to the box and barks. He pulls the rope with his teeth. He wants to play too. Spot, no! Anna and Ben shout. They are scared. They try to stop Spot, but he is too strong. He breaks the rope and the clothes fall off the box. The house is gone. Anna and Ben are sad. They cry. They worked hard to make the house. They liked the house. They do not want to play anymore. Their mom hears them cry. She comes to see what is wrong. She sees the mess and the dog. She understands what happened. She hugs Anna and Ben and calms them down. Im sorry, sweeties. Spot did not know. He just wanted to have fun. He did not mean to ruin your house. She says. She is kind. She pets Spot and makes him sit. Can we make another house? Anna asks. She is hopeful. Of course, you can. You did a great job. You had success. You can try again. But this time, lets use something else to tie the clothes. Something that Spot cannot break. How about some clips? She says. She is helpful. She finds some clips and gives them to Anna and Ben. Anna and Ben smile. They are happy again. They thank their mom and take the clips. They start to make another house with the box and the clothes. They use the clips to tie the clothes to the box and make a door. Look, we made another house! Anna says. She is proud. She goes inside the box and pretends to sleep. Ben follows her and pretends to snore. Shh, shh, this is cozy! Ben says. He is cozy too. They giggle and rest. Spot watches them from a distance. He is calm. He does not bark or pull. He knows the house is not a toy. He knows Anna and Ben are his friends. He waits for them to come out and play with him. He is a good dog.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jake. Jake loved eating cereal and he especially liked the wild berries in his cereal. One morning, Jake kept worrying about where to find more wild berries. He asked his mom if he could go outside and look for them, but she said no. Jake was getting worried because he wanted to eat his wild cereal. Suddenly, Jake remembered something. The night before, he had seen a wild bush outside his window and it was covered with wild berries. Jake was so excited, he ran outside to find the bush. As soon as he reached the bush, it was full of wild berries and more. Jake happily picked some of the berries and ran back inside with them. He was so happy to have his wild cereal again. From then on, Jake never worried about where to find wild berries again.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. It was his best throw ever! But, when the banana came back down, it bumped into a bird. The bird flew away and then Bob felt bad. He wished he never threw his food. From that day on, Lily loved to make pictures and hang them up with glue.Tim and Kim were twins who liked to play outside. But on Sunday, it was very cold and rainy. They could not go to the park or ride their bikes. They felt miserable and bored. Mom, can we watch TV? Tim asked. No, you have watched enough TV this week. Why dont you read a book or draw a picture? Mom said. But we dont want to do that. We want to have fun! Kim said. Mom sighed and said, You know, there are many children who dont have toys or books or TV. They have to work hard or live in bad places. They would be happy to have what you have. You should be grateful and not complain. Tim and Kim did not listen to Mom. They kept whining and sulking. They did not want to do anything. They just sat on the couch and shivered in the cold. Then, they heard a knock on the door. Mom opened it and saw a man holding a big basket. He was smiling and said, Hello, Im from the church. We are collecting donations for the poor families in our community. Do you have anything to spare? Mom said, Of course, come in. Let me see what I can find. You are very kind and generous. Have a nice day. He left with the basket. Tim and Kim watched the man go. They felt ashamed and sorry. They realized how lucky they were and how selfish they had been. They said to Mom, Mom, we are sorry. We were wrong. We have so much and we should be happy. Can we give some of our toys and clothes to the poor children? Mom smiled and hugged them. She said, Im proud of you. Thats very nice of you. Yes, you can. Lets go and find some things to donate. Maybe we can also make some cards or cookies for them. That would make them happy. Finally, after a while, the worms came. The little bird was so happy and ate all the worms she could find. She felt full and satisfied. The moral of the story is that if you work hard and wait patiently, good things will come to you.Mira and Tom are twins. They like to play with their toys. But sometimes they fight over the same toy. One day, they both want to play with the original red car. The original red car is shiny and fast. It is their favorite toy. Give me the car! Mira demands. She tries to grab the car from Toms hand. No, it is mine! Tom says. He holds the car tight to his chest. They pull and tug on the car. They are angry and loud. Their mom hears them and comes to see what is wrong. Why are you fighting? Mom asks. She looks at the car. This is the original red car. You both love it. But you have to share it. You can take turns playing with it. But I want it now! Mira says. She stomps her foot. Me too! Tom says. He puts the car on his shoulder. Mom sighs. She knows they are both stubborn. She has an idea. She goes to the closet and takes out a box. She opens the box and shows them what is inside. Look, I have a surprise for you. Two new cars! They are not original, but they are very nice. They are blue and green. They are also shiny and fast. You can each have one. Then you dont have to fight over the original red car. Mira and Tom look at the new cars. They are curious and excited. They forget about the original red car. It was juicy and sweet, just like the sun shining down on them.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play at the park and swing on the swings. One day, a stranger came to the park. He had a gentle voice and asked Lily if she wanted to play with him. Lily was happy to have a new friend, but she didnt know the stranger was bad. He asked her to balance on the edge of the slide, but she fell and hurt herself. The stranger didnt help her, he just ran away. Lily cried and cried until her mommy came to take her home. She told her mommy about the stranger and how he hurt her. Her mommy was very angry and called the police. They caught the stranger and put him in jail. Lily learned that she should never trust strangers and to always be careful when playing.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing outside in the sun. One day, she went to the park with her mom. It was very hot outside, but Lily didnt mind. Lily saw a big slide and wanted to go down it. Her mom said she could, but only if she was careful. Lily climbed up the stairs to the top of the slide. She looked down and saw a bunch of kids waiting at the bottom. She felt excited and happy. Lily started to slide down, but she went too fast. She couldnt stop herself and she hit a point on the slide. She cried out in pain. Her mom rushed over to help her. Lilys arm was broken. She had to go to the hospital and get a cast. From that day on, Lily always remembered to be careful when playing on hot days and to number her steps on the slide.Once upon a time, there was a happy bird. It liked to soar high in the sky. One day, it was flying around when it saw a big missile. It made a loud noise when it shot up into the sky. The bird was scared, so it flew away. It flew away as fast as it could. But the missile was faster and soon it was chasing the bird. The bird zoomed and darted through the sky. It was scared and flew as fast as it could. Finally, the bird was safe. It hugged a tree and the missile flew away. The bird was very happy. It spread its wings and soared into the sky. It soared higher and higher until it could barely be seen. The bird felt peaceful and free, soaring through the sky. The happy bird flew home at the end of the day and it never saw the missile again. Its freedom was safe and it was happy it could soar as high as it wanted.Once upon a time, there was a big dog called Bob. Bob had a regular tail and he loved to play. One day, Bob decided to explore. He entered a forest full of adventure. Bob had been walking for a while and then he heard a strange noise. He stopped and listened carefully. Help! Help!, the noise said. Bob followed the voice and entered a clearing. At the centre of the clearing was a tiny mouse. Oh, thank you for coming to my rescue! the mouse said. Bob asked the mouse what was wrong. Well, I was walking through the woods and got my regular tail caught in a bush, the mouse replied. Bob smiled and said, Dont worry, I can help you. He used his strong paws to untangle the mouses tail from the bush. The mouse was so thankful and the two friends said goodbye. Bob continued his adventure, but this time he was more careful. He knew that an unexpected tail can be quite a surprise!One day the wind came. It was wet and cold. Mommy and Daddy took Sally outside. Daddy was holding Sallys hand. The wind came and caught the umbrella. Mommy and Daddy laughed as they ran with the wind. Sally didnt like the wind anymore. The wind was blowing so hard. She asked Daddy to take her inside. He picked her up and carried her inside. The wind kept coming, wet and cold. But Mommy and Daddy knew it was time to stay inside and be warm and dry. They laughed and talked about the fun they had in the wet wind.Once upon a time there were two brothers called Tom and Jack. Tom was 3 years old and Jack was 6 years old. Tom was so proud and he wanted to show Jack. Jack was happy for his brother, but he wanted the trophy for himself. So he tried to spoil it. He shook it and held it the wrong way up. They sneak away with their paints and brushes. They climb up the cliff. They find a flat spot. They start to paint. They paint a fierce lion. It has a big mane and sharp teeth. It roars at the sky. They paint a fierce tiger. It has stripes and claws. It growls at the lion. They paint a fierce bear. It has fur and a big nose. It snorts at the tiger. They are very proud of their paintings. Lily said. It has mud all over its skin. Thats how hippos stay cool and protect themselves from the sun, mom explained. They also have very thick skin, so they dont feel the bites of bugs. Lily counted to ten and then looked for Tom. She checked under the bed, behind the curtains, and in the closet. She could not find him. Where are you, Tom? she called out. I give up! Tom did not answer. He was hiding behind a big sheet that was hanging on the wall. He thought he was very clever and wanted to surprise Lily. He waited for her to come closer and then he jumped out from behind the sheet. Boo! he shouted. Lily was very scared. She did not expect Tom to appear from behind the sheet. She screamed and ran away. She tripped over a toy and fell to the floor. She hurt her knee and started to cry. Tom felt bad. He did not mean to scare Lily so much. He ran to her and tried to help her. He said he was sorry and gave her a hug. He offered her his favorite teddy bear to make her feel better. But Lily was very angry. She did not want Toms teddy bear. She did not want his hug. She did not want his sorry. She pushed him away and said he was mean. She said she did not want to play with him anymore. She said he was not her brother. Tom was very sad. He did not understand why Lily was so mad. He thought he was just playing a game. He thought she would laugh and play again. He thought she was generous and kind. He did not know what to do. He went to his bed and covered himself with his sheet. He wished he had never jumped out from behind the sheet. He wished he had never scared Lily. He wished he had never played hide and seek. He wished he had a different sister.Once upon a time, there was a little duck. The duck lived near a stream. Every day, the duck would go for a swim in the stream. One day, the duck saw a fish struggling in the stream. The duck wanted to help the fish, but it was too hard. The duck tried and tried, but couldnt help the fish. As the duck was resting, a nosy rabbit came by. The rabbit saw the duck and asked, Whats wrong? The duck told the rabbit about the fish struggling in the stream. The rabbit said, I can help! The rabbit hopped into the stream and was able to help the fish. The duck and the rabbit became friends and went on many adventures together.One day, a brave little soldier was walking in the forest. Suddenly, a huge wind came and pushed him over. He felt so guilty for letting the wind push him over. He tried to stand up and keep walking. Just then, an old man appeared from behind a tree. He said to the soldier, Why do you feel guilty? We can all be pushed over sometimes it doesnt mean anything. The soldier smiled. He appreciated the old mans advice. He said, Thank you. Im feeling better now. But then another strong wind came and pushed the soldier down again. This time he couldnt get up. All his strenght was gone. The old man looked worried. He said, Little soldier, I think its time for you to go home. The little soldier sadly nodded. He knew his adventure in the forest had come to an end. He slowly turned and walked away. The old man watched as the little soldier walked away. His heart felt heavy and he felt guilty he knew he should have done something more to help. But it was too late. The little soldier was gone forever.Once there was a little girl who was feeling very lonely. No one ever wanted to play with her. One day, the little girl got an idea. She decided to make something pretty so that maybe somebody would want to be her friend. She found some pretty pink paper, a pencil and some glue. Then she started to make a very beautiful card. When she was done she felt very happy. But then something terrible happened. When she was getting ready to give it to someone, she dropped it and it tore into pieces. She felt so sad and was about to cry. Suddenly, her mommy came in. She saw the mess and asked why the paper was on the floor. The little girl told her mommy everything, she was so scared that she would be punished. But her mommy was very kind. She hugged her and said that if she was careful the next time, there would be no need to punish her. And the little girl was very happy.One day, Meg and her mom were walking in the park when they saw a little bird sitting on a bench. Megs mom smiled at Meg and said, Lets be humble and give that little bird a hug. Meg and her mom both stretched out their arms and hugged the bird together. The bird felt safe and warm in their embrace and it stayed still, allowing Meg and her mom to give it big, gentle hugs. When they let go, the bird flew away. Meg and her mom were very happy that they had given the little bird a hug. As they walked away, Meg asked, Mommy, can we hug more animals in the park? Her mom said, Sure. Lets give more hugs. The two of them laughed and went around the park giving hugs to animals like squirrels and ducks. By the end of the day, they were both exhausted, but they were also full of joy.Once upon a time, there was an ancient kitchen. Everything in the kitchen was old and still worked. One day, when the cook was making lunch, he sneezed. His sneeze started a chain reaction. The ancient oven began to shake and something started to move. The cook was very surprised! The cupboard opened up and something hidden for a long time was revealed. It was a treasure chest full of coins! The cook was so happy that he shouted out loud. He was going to be rich! The cook was in such a good mood that he started to dance in the kitchen. He sneezed again and the ancient oven shook even harder. Suddenly, out of nowhere, a genie appeared in the kitchen! He said that the cook was granted three wishes! The cook thought of what he wanted and wished for two more kitchens, one modern and one ancient. He also wished for an endless supply of coins. The genie granted his wish and disappeared in a puff of smoke. The cook was very happy. He looked around and saw a beautiful modern kitchen and an ancient kitchen. He also saw a treasure chest full of coins! He was so thankful for his three wishes!Once upon a time there were two friends, Bob and Will. Bob had a hurt mouth and wanted to gather something to make it feel better. Will remembered he had some yummy sweets in his pocket. He told Bob, I can give you my sweets if you want. Bob was so happy that he jumped up and down and said, Thats great! The friends gathered the sweets and Bob ate one straight away. He said, This sweet tastes so yummy, my mouth isnt hurt anymore. Will was happy that Bob felt better. They hugged each other and went off to play a game. The endOne day, a little boy was playing in his backyard. He noticed something strange in the sky. He grabbed his binoculars to observe. There was a big, orange witch flying on a broomstick! The witch was wearing a bright orange dress and a big, orange hat. Her skin was bright orange and she had an orange nose. The little boy was so excited that he tried to wave at the witch. The witch smiled and waved back. She said Hello, little boy! Would you like to come for a ride with me? The little boy was so excited that he nodded his head. The witch swooped down. She grabbed the little boy in her arm and took him on a magical adventure. They flew past mountains and over rivers. The little boy laughed and laughed with joy. When they had been flying for a while, the witch said they had to go home. She gave the little boy a hug and flew away on her broomstick. He waved to say goodbye and watched her until she disappeared in the sky.Once there was a graceful bird. It was so graceful that it loved to fly around the sky. Every day, it woke up to the warm sun and flew up high. No matter what it did, it felt graceful. One day, the bird was thirsty so it flew to a river. It found a spot and decided to drink from the cool, clear water. As it drank, it felt very refreshed. The brainy bird suddenly thought of a great idea. It could use its grace to help other birds get quench their thirst too! So, the graceful bird taught all the other birds how to drink from the river. Now, all the birds could feel refreshed and quench their thirst. The graceful bird was so proud that it could use its brain to help others.Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Teddy. Teddy was very tired because he had been playing all day long. He wanted to go to sleep, but he couldnt find his favorite page from his bedtime storybook. Teddy searched and searched, but he couldnt find the page he was looking for. Just then, his friend Bunny came along. Bunny saw that Teddy was tired and asked him what was wrong. Teddy explained that he couldnt find his favorite page. Bunny knew just what to do. She hugged Teddy and told him that it was okay if he couldnt find the page. She said that what mattered most was that they were together and that they could make up their own story. Teddy felt much better and hugged Bunny back. They cuddled up together and made up a wonderful story that they both loved. Teddy learned that sometimes its not about finding the perfect page, but about being with the ones you love.Once upon a time, there lived a shy girl. She had big windows in her house and she loved to look out of them. However, one day, a big storm came. The winds were so strong, they almost broke her windows! The girl was scared, so she asked her mum what she could do to prevent the windows from breaking. Her mum said she had to hang thick curtains over the windows. So the girl did. After that, it never rained so hard that the windows could break. The big curtains prevented the windows from the strong winds. The girl was so happy that the curtains had saved her windows. And she was happy she had been smart enough to think about protecting the windows. She thanked her mum for thinking of the curtains. The girl was very proud of herself and she was glad that she had been able to prevent her windows from breaking. From then on, she was no longer shy and she felt proud of her accomplishments.Sara liked to bake with her mom. They made cookies, cakes and pies. Sara learned how to mix, roll and cut the dough. She also learned how to measure, pour and stir the ingredients. She enjoyed smelling the sweet and yummy things in the oven. One day, Sara asked her mom, Mom, why do we bake? Her mom smiled and said, We bake because it is fun, and because it makes us happy. We also bake because it is part of our history. Do you know what history is? Sara shook her head. She did not know what history was. Her mom explained, History is the story of the past. It is what happened before we were born. It is how we learned to do things, and why we do them. Our history is in our family, our culture and our country. Baking is part of our history, because our ancestors baked too. They baked bread, muffins and scones. They baked for their families, their friends and their celebrations. They baked to share, to thank and to love. Sara nodded. She understood a little bit. She said, I like history. I like baking. I like to share, to thank and to love. Her mom hugged her and said, I like history too. I like baking too. I like to share, to thank and to love too. You are my history, and you are my baking. You are my attractive and smart girl. I love you very much. Sara smiled and said, I love you too, mom. Can we bake some more? Her mom laughed and said, Of course we can. Lets bake some more cookies. What shape do you want to make them? Sara thought for a moment. She said, I want to make them heartshaped. Because baking is love, and love is history.One day, Tom was at the park with his Mom. He saw a friendly case on the ground near the swings. He asked Mom if he could have it, so Mom said yes. Tom was so excited to receive the case. He opened it up when he got home. Inside was a small toy car. Tom was so happy to have it. He rolled the car around on the floor. Then he wanted to show his new toy to his friend, Joe. So he and Mom went to Joes house. His friend was so friendly and pleased to see the case. He thanked Tom for the car and they both pushed the car around on the floor for hours. At the end of the day, Joe and Tom both held their toy cars and Mom gave them each a hug. Tom had received something special from the park and shared it with his friend.Once upon a time there was a competitive knob. He was a very busy knob, always signing things. Every day, he signed more and more things. One day, the competitive knob decided to have a competition. He asked all of his friends from around the world to meet in his home. They all agreed and showed up. When they arrived, the competitive knob gave everyone a sign to sign. He explained that whoever could sign the most in one minute, would win the competition. Everyone started signing as quickly as they could. The competitive knob watched with a smile on his face. After one minute, the competitive knob stopped the competition. He looked around the room to see who had signed the most papers. To his surprise, it was a three year old child! Everyone cheered and clapped as the little child proudly walked up to the knob to receive his prize. The knob was very pleased with the childs performance, so he invited the child to be his special guest. From then on, the knob and the child were the best of friends. The child visited the knob every day to sign more and more papers. It was a magical time of friendship and competition!Once upon a time, there was a pillow who was very colorful. She wanted to go for a journey but needed some help. So, she asked around to see who could help and soon found a truck. The truck was very eager to help and said it could load the pillow. So, the pillow started loading herself onto the truck. First, she got onto one side, then the other, until she was all loaded up. The truck and the pillow were ready to go. They drove along the road and had lots of fun. Everywhere they went, the pillow felt special because of her colorful feathers. People were amazed when they saw her. After a while, the truck and pillow arrived at their destination. The pillow thanked the truck for helping her and hopped off. She never forgot the great adventure they had and smiled every time she remembered.Once upon a time, there was a big elephant named Ellie. Ellie had a wife named Ella who was very large too. One day, Ellie went to the store to buy some bananas for Ella. But when he got home, he saw that Ella was very angry. What happened? asked Ellie. You spoil me too much! said Ella. I dont want bananas anymore. I want something else. Ellie didnt know what to do. He loved Ella so much and didnt want her to be upset. So, he went back to the store and bought some flowers for her. When he gave them to her, Ellas face lit up with a big smile. She hugged Ellie and said, Thank you, my dear husband. You always know how to make me happy. From that day on, Ellie learned that spoiling his wife didnt always mean buying her things, but sometimes just showing her love and affection.Once upon a time, there was a gifted dog named Spot. So, he put a rope on the wagon and lead it to the park. At the park, he saw his friends, a cat and a bird. They were very happy to see Spot and his wagon. Spots friends took turns riding in the wagon. The cat sat in the wagon first, and Spot lead the wagon around the park. Then, it was the birds turn. One day, he went to the circus with his friends. He gave his ticket to the lady and went inside the tent. The lion saw a man with a big hat and a whip. He was making the animals do tricks. The lion felt frightened. He wanted to go home. His friend asked him what was wrong. The lion said, I dont like the man with the whip. He makes me roar. His friend said, Dont worry, we can leave now. The lion was happy to leave the circus. He gave his ticket to the lady and went back to the jungle. From that day on, the lion never went to the circus again.Lily was eager to wear her new dress. It was pink and had flowers on it. She wanted to show it to her friends at school. She put it on and looked at herself in the mirror. She felt happy and pretty. She ran downstairs to eat her breakfast. Mommy gave her a bowl of cereal and a glass of milk. Lily ate quickly and drank her milk. She was ready to go to school. She grabbed her backpack and ran to the door. But Mommy stopped her. Lily, wait a minute. You cant wear your new dress today. Its too cold outside. You need to wear your coat and your hat and your gloves. And you need to bring your board. You can slide on the snow with it. Lily felt sad and angry. She didnt want to wear her coat and her hat and her gloves. She wanted to wear her new dress. She didnt want to bring her board. She wanted to play with her friends. She said, No, Mommy, no. I want to wear my dress. I dont want to slide on the snow. I want to go to school. Mommy was firm. Lily, you have to listen to me. Its very cold outside. You can get sick if you dont wear warm clothes. And you can have fun with your board. You can slide on the snow with your friends. You can wear your dress another day. Now, please, put on your coat and your hat and your gloves. And take your board. We have to go. Lily didnt want to argue with Mommy. She knew Mommy loved her and wanted her to be safe and happy. But she still felt sad and angry. She put on her coat and her hat and her gloves. She took her board. She followed Mommy to the car. She hoped that maybe, just maybe, she could wear her new dress tomorrow.Once upon a time, there was a big and fat fish named Fin. Fin lived in a big and beautiful reef with his friends. One day, Fin saw a delicious cake being baked by a kind lady. Fin wanted to eat the cake, but he knew he shouldnt leave the reef. But Fin couldnt resist the temptation, so he left the reef and swam to the ladys house. As he was eating the cake, he got caught in a net. The lady took him to the market and sold him to a restaurant. Fin realized his mistake and wished he had never left the reef. The moral of the story is that we should always listen to our parents and not give in to temptation.Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big dog. The dog is brown and has a long tail. The dog barks at them. Sara and Ben are scared. Go away, dog! Ben says. He throws a stick at the dog. The dog runs after the stick. Ben and Sara run away too. They hide behind a tree. Are you okay, Sara? Ben asks. He sees that Sara is crying. Her knee is red and has a small cut. She fell when she ran from the dog. Im okay, Ben. But my knee hurts. And the dog was scary. Sara says. She wipes her tears with her hand. I have an idea, Sara. Lets go to my house. My mom can help your knee. And she can give us cookies and milk. And we can play with my toys. Do you want to come? Ben says. He smiles at Sara. Yes, Ben. I want to come. Thank you for being my friend. Sara says. She smiles back at Ben. She stands up and holds his hand. They walk to his house. Before they leave the park, they see the dog again. The dog is not barking now. He is lying on the grass. He looks weak and sad. He has no stick and no friends. Maybe the dog is not bad, Ben. Maybe he is lonely and wants to play. Sara says. She feels sorry for the dog. Maybe you are right, Sara. Maybe we can be his friends too. Ben says. He feels brave and kind. They go to the dog. They talk to him in a soft voice. They pet his fur. They give him some of their cookies. The dog wags his tail. He licks their faces. He is happy. Sara and Ben hug the dog. They hug each other. They are happy too. They have a new friend.One day, Susy went to a park to search for something fun to do.
