Sam said, grabbing a red car from Mias hand. No, its mine! Mia said, pulling it back. You have so many cars already! I want this one! Sam said, trying to take it again. They started to fight over the car, and Mia scratched Sams arm with her nails. Sam cried out and let go of the car. He looked at his arm and saw a red mark. Ow, ow, ow! Sam said, rubbing his arm. You hurt me! Sorry, sorry, sorry! Mia said, feeling bad. I didnt mean to hurt you! She gave him the car and hugged him. Sam hugged her back and stopped crying. Are you okay? Mia asked. Im okay, Sam said. But you have to be more careful with your nails. I know, I know, Mia said. Im sorry. They looked at their toys and saw that they were all over the floor. They had made a big mess. Mom will be mad if she sees this, Sam said. Lets clean up, Mia said. We have to be organized. They started to put their toys back in their boxes and baskets. He wanted to explore more. He came to the place where he had discovered the skull. He said to his mom, Look! I found this yesterday! His mom looked at him and said, Be careful! There might be something dangerous in the forest! John continued to explore the forest with his family. Suddenly, they heard loud noises coming from the direction of the skull. They went to look and saw something amazing. The skull had moved and revealed a huge cave! John and his family had discovered something incredible!Tom is a fat cat who likes to sleep on the sofa. He does not like to play with toys or run in the garden. He only likes to eat and sleep. One day, Tom sees a bottle on the table. It is shiny and red and has a lid. Tom is curious. He jumps on the table and pokes the bottle with his paw. The bottle makes a funny noise. Tom pokes it again. The bottle rolls off the table and falls on the floor. Tom is scared. He runs away and hides under the sofa. He thinks the bottle is angry and wants to hurt him. He does not want to poke the bottle anymore. Sara is a little girl who lives in the house. She likes to play with toys and run in the garden. She also likes to feed Tom and pet him. She comes home from school and sees the bottle on the floor. It is her bottle of juice. She picks it up and sees that it is empty. She is sad. She wonders who drank her juice. She looks for Tom and finds him under the sofa. She sees that he is fat and has a wet mouth. She knows that he poked the bottle and drank her juice. She is angry. She scolds Tom and tells him to share and be nice. Tom feels sorry. He comes out from under the sofa and rubs his head against Saras leg. He purrs and tries to be cute. He hopes that Sara will forgive him and give him some more food. He was happy to have so many friends to play with.Once upon a time there was a lion. He was big and strong with a loud voice and bright yellow fur. Every day he would wake up early and roar up to the sky with all of his might, which everyone could hear. Some of the animals living in the nearby forest were scared of the roaring, but one brave little songbird enjoyed it. She found the lions roar lively and full of energy and eventually she started singing her own song in response. The lion was happy to hear the little bird. He would roar and the bird would sing. And soon all of the other animals, from elephants to monkeys and even more songbirds, started joining in. The noise was happy and loud with everyone singing and roaring and playing together. The lion and his animal friends had lots of fun making music together. Their song would go on until the sun went down and a peaceful nighttime win over the forest.Sam liked to ride his bike. He rode it every day in the park with his mom and dad. He liked to go fast and feel the wind on his face. He also liked to ring his bell and say hello to the other kids and dogs. One day, Sam saw a big pile of laundry on the grass. It was colorful and soft. He wondered what it was doing there. He asked his mom, Mom, what is that? Mom looked at the laundry and smiled. She said, That is Mrs. Lees laundry. She lives in the building next to the park. She likes to dry her clothes in the sun. It is normal for her. Sam was curious. He wanted to touch the laundry. He said, Can I ride my bike to the laundry? Mom said, No, Sam. That is not polite. The laundry is not ours. It belongs to Mrs. Lee. She might not like it if you ride your bike to the laundry. You might make it dirty or wrinkled. How would you feel if someone did that to your clothes? Sam thought about it. He did not want someone to ride their bike to his clothes. He liked his clothes clean and neat. He said, I would feel sad and mad. I do not want to make Mrs. Lee sad and mad. I will not ride my bike to the laundry. I will ride it around the park. Mom said, That is a good choice, Sam. I am proud of you. You are a kind and respectful boy. Come on, lets go and have some fun. She gave him a hug and a kiss. They rode their bikes together and enjoyed the sunny day.Once upon a time, there was a big train. It had a strong engine that helped it go fast. One day, the train stopped at a station. A man came to the train and said, I need to weigh this train to see how heavy it is. The train was calm and didnt move while the man weighed it. After the man finished weighing the train, the train started to move again. It chugged along the tracks, passing trees and fields. The train was happy to be moving again, and the passengers inside were happy too. They looked out the windows and saw the beautiful scenery. Finally, the train arrived at its destination. It was a big city with lots of tall buildings. The train slowed down and came to a stop. The passengers got off and thanked the train for a fun ride. The train was happy to have helped them get to their destination safely.Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a famous cat named Tom. Tom loved to sleep all day long. He would sleep on the soft grass, under the warm sun. One day, Tom woke up and found a map on the ground. The map showed a big park with a lot of trees. Tom thought, I want to go to this park and sleep under a tree. So, Tom took the map and started walking. On his way, Tom met a little dog named Max. Max asked, Where are you going, Tom? Tom showed Max the map and said, I am going to the big park to sleep under a tree. Max liked the idea and went with Tom. They walked together, following the map, until they reached the big park. There, they found a big tree and slept under it, happy and safe.Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lily. She loved wintertime because she got to wear her warm jacket. One day, Lily decided to go out in the snow with her friends. There was a large icy hill and everyone was so excited to go sledding. Lily was brave and she went down the hill first. Suddenly, while she was at the bottom of the hill, Lily heard a loud crack sound. Lilys jacket had broken! Tears filled her eyes. Lilys friends told her, Dont worry, Lily. You should have listened to your mom and not gone sledding with us. Now, youll have to go back home and tell your mom. The moral of the story is that sometimes its best to listen to grownups. They give good advice and it is important to follow it.Once upon a time, there was a very expensive cactus. Every day the cactus needed water, or it would turn dry. One day, the cactus forgot to get watered. It started to get really dry, but it was too expensive to buy a new one. The cactus was very sad. Suddenly, it heard a voice. It was a fairy! She said she could help the cactus. The fairy sprinkled a magic spell on the cactus, and it started to fill with water. Soon the cactus was happy and juicy again! The fairy winked and waved goodbye. ever since, the cactus remembered to get watered every day. It was happy and juicy and not too dry.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. Jack loved to play games with his friends at the park. They would run around and try to score points by throwing a ball into a basket. Jack was very good at this game and he always won. One day, Jack and his friends found an ancient box buried in the ground. They wondered what was inside. Jack opened the box and found a mysterious object. He didnt know what it was, but he thought it was very cool. Later that day, Jack started to feel sick. He didnt know why, but he felt very tired and weak. His mom took him to the hospital, but it was too late. Jack had touched a dangerous object and it had made him very sick. He couldnt play with his friends anymore and he was very sad. His friends wondered what had happened to him and they missed him very much.Once upon a time there was a lazy fox. He was always so lazy that he would never try to do anything. One day, he decided to move to the left side of the woods to find something to eat. As he was walking along he spotted a nut. The nut was so big and tasty, it made his mouth water. The lazy fox tried to open the nut, but it wouldnt budge. He tried and tried but he was too lazy to put any effort in. He decided to give up and said, Oh well, I guess I cant have this nut. Just then, a wise old owl flew overhead. He noticed the poor fox and said, I can help you open that nut if you try one more time. The fox looked up at the owl but shook his head and replied, No thank you, Im much too lazy to try again. The owl stared down at the fox sadly and said, Then I guess you will never get to have the nut. The fox sadly watched as the owl flew away and he never had the nut. The End.Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had an amazing idea about how she could have some fun. She wanted to repeat things over and over again. Later, she thought of another amazing idea. She grabbed some toys and put them in a circle. She repeated this over and over again and eventually, the toys made a big circle around the room. She thought it was great and couldnt wait to show it to her friends. The little girl kept repeating ideas. Each one was even more amazing than the last. And soon, she was having so much fun that her mom and dad had to join in the fun too!Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They saw a big cloud in the sky. It was white and fluffy. Look, a cloud! Lily said. It looks like a bunny. No, it looks like a car, Ben said. Lets mix it and make something else. They both blew hard at the cloud. They tried to mix it with their breath. The cloud moved and changed shape. Wow, now it looks like a cake! Lily said. Im hungry. Can we eat it? Ben laughed. No, silly. We cant eat a cloud. Its just water and air. But we can pretend. They ran inside and got some plates and spoons. They came back to the garden and sat under the cloud. They pretended to scoop some cloud and put it on their plates. They pretended to eat it and make yummy noises. Mmm, this cloud is delicious! Lily said. It tastes like strawberries. Mmm, mine too! Ben said. It tastes like chocolate. They ate and ate until they were full. They smiled and hugged each other. They had fun mixing and eating the cloud.Anna was very happy. She was going to visit her grandma for the first time. They found a big piece of cheese on the counter, but it was too high for them to reach. Timmy said, I wish we could get that cheese. Sammy replied, Dont worry, I have an idea. Sammy climbed up the oven and jumped onto the counter. He grabbed the cheese and threw it down to Timmy. Timmy was so happy and thanked Sammy for being so brave. After a while, he felt a tug on his line. He pulled it in and found a big fish! He was so excited because he knew he would have a delicious dinner tonight. He put his bait back in the water and waited again. Suddenly there was another tug on the line and he pulled in an even bigger fish. The little fish was very proud of his home, the coral reef. He would explore all around it, looking for food and finding fun places to play. One day, he discovered an old broken shell on the reef. He decided to make it into something special, so he swam to find a sharp rock. He used the rock to make a hole in the shell and then hung it from a tall rock. Now, every morning the little fish would swim to the shell, admiring it and feeling so proud. He turned the old broken shell into something beautiful and it reminded him how special his reef was. The little fish had made his reef even more special with his clever idea. He was very proud of himself and it made him smile every day.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys and run around outside. One day, Timmys mom told him that they were going to a birthday party for his friend Sarah. Timmy was excited to go because he knew there would be lots of cake and presents. At the party, Timmy saw a big box with a shiny bow on top. He knew it was a gift for Sarah. Timmy thought the box was very attractive and wanted to play with it. But his mom told him that the gift was not for him, it was for Sarah. Later on, when it was time to open presents, Timmy saw that Sarah ignored the big box with the shiny bow on top. She opened all her other gifts first. Timmy wondered why Sarah didnt want to open the attractive gift. Finally, when all the other gifts were opened, Sarah opened the big box. Inside was a beautiful doll that Sarah had been wanting for a long time. Timmy realized that sometimes its important to ignore things that are attractive to us, because they may not be the best gift for someone else.Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Daisy. Daisy wanted to know what time it was, so she asked her mummy. But her mummy said she had to look at the clock. Daisy was very excited, she had never seen a clock before. She ran around the corner and there, right next to the window, was a big clock! There were big hands pointing to the number five and some small hands pointing to the number nine. Daisy was so happy and amazed. Suddenly, a sour smell appeared in the room. Daisy wondered what it was and she looked around to see if she could find out where it was coming from. Then, she saw a small bowl of sour lemons on the table. Daisy laughed because the lemon smell was so sour! Daisy looked back at the clock, and saw the big hand had moved and was now pointing to the number six. She was so excited because she had watched the clock move and now she knew how to tell the time!Once upon a time there was a little cloud. Every day it would float around in the sky and look down on the world below. All the animals loved him and often asked him to bring them treats from the sky. One day, the cloud became angry when a little girl asked for a special request. She wanted the cloud to make it rain ice cream. The cloud was so angry that he started to cry. Little girl Im sorry cloud! I didnt mean to make you angry. Please stop crying, said the little girl. Cloud Im too sad to stop. What can I do to make it up to you? Little girl Maybe you could make one of your special rainbows? The cloud thought for a moment and then it nodded. It stopped crying and spread its misty arms wide. Then it made the most beautiful rainbow! The little girl clapped and laughed at the incredible sight. As she watched, the sun came out and made the rainbow shine. The little girl thanked the cloud for her special gift and the cloud smiled. Its angry clouds were gone and it was happy again.Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play outside. They have a big ball and a small bike. They take turns to kick the ball and ride the bike. One day, they see a big dog in the park. The dog is brown and furry. It has a long tail and a wet nose. The dog runs to them and wags its tail. It wants to play too. Hi, doggy! Tom says. Do you want to play with us? The dog barks and licks Toms face. Tom laughs and pets the dog. Lily is scared of the dog. She hides behind the bike. Tom, I dont like the dog, Lily says. It is too big and loud. Can we play something else? Tom looks at Lily and sees that she is sad. He wants to make her happy. He thinks of a new game. OK, Lily, lets play itch, Tom says. We can scratch the dog and make it happy. The dog will scratch us back and make us laugh. It will be fun! Lily thinks about it. She likes to laugh. She likes to make others happy. She decides to try the new game. OK, Tom, lets play itch, Lily says. But you go first. Tom nods and walks to the dog. He scratches the dogs ears and belly. The dog wags its tail and rolls over. It scratches Toms back and legs. Tom giggles and tickles the dog. The dog barks and licks Toms face. Lily watches them and smiles. She sees that the dog is friendly and playful. She feels ready to join them. She walks to the dog and scratches its chin and paws. The dog wags its tail and rolls over. It scratches Lilys arms and neck. Lily squeals and hugs the dog. The dog barks and licks Lilys face. Tom and Lily are happy. They have a new friend. They play itch with the dog until they are tired. Then they sit on the grass and cuddle the dog. The dog snuggles with them and closes its eyes. They are all happy.Once upon a time, there was a farmer named Paul. He had a cute little donkey named Daisy. He used Daisy to carry all his crops to the farmers market. One day, Paul and Daisy were walking to the market when they saw a shield lying on the ground. It was very shiny and Paul was very happy. He decided to carry it with him. When they got to the market, Paul found a customer who wanted to buy the shield. He was very happy and made lots of money. Paul shared the money with Daisy and she was so happy! The moral of the story is that people should be kind and generous. If you help others, good things will come your way.Tommy liked to ride his bike in the park. He had a red bike with two big wheels and a shiny pedal. He could go very fast and make loud noises with his mouth. He felt happy and free on his bike. But Tommy was not nice to other kids. He did not share his bike or his toys. He did not listen to his mom or his dad. He did not say sorry or thank you. He was ignorant and rude. He thought he was better than everyone else. One day, he saw a little girl with a yellow bike. She had a basket with flowers and a bell that rang. Tommy wanted her bike. He rode up to her and said, Give me your bike. It is mine now. You are stupid and ugly. The little girl was scared and sad. She said, No, this is my bike. I got it for my birthday. Please go away. Tommy did not care. He pushed her off her bike and took it. He laughed and rode away. But Tommy did not know how to ride the yellow bike. It was smaller and lighter than his red bike. It had a different pedal and a brake. Tommy did not pay attention to the road. He did not see the big truck that was coming. He did not hear the horn that was honking. He did not feel the bump that was ahead. The truck hit Tommy and his yellow bike. There was a loud crash and a lot of pain. Tommy flew off the bike and landed on the ground. He was bleeding and broken. He cried and screamed. The little girl ran to him and tried to help. She was kind and brave. She said, Im sorry, Tommy. I hope you are okay. Tommy did not answer. He shut his eyes and did not open them again. He was gone.Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lucy. She was walking in the park one day and suddenly she heard a loud caw. Lucy stopped and looked around, trying to find the source of the noise. Suddenly, a great black raven flew down from the sky and landed right beside her. Startled, Lucy screamed and started to panic. Whats wrong, Lucy? asked the raven. I feel dizzy, replied Lucy. The raven thought for a moment. I have an idea! the raven said. Lets go for a ride! Lucy grabbed the ravens feathers and, with a powerful flap of its wings, the raven soared off into the sky. As they swirled round and round in the air, Lucy felt a wonderful wind on her face and she was no longer dizzy. At last, the raven landed back in the park and Lucy thanked it for the ride. The raven smiled back. Dont be scared next time, it said. And Lucy was never scared of ravens again!Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jack and Jill. They wanted to see what was at the top of a big hill. So they started to walk up the hill. It was steep, so they had to take lots of little steps. Soon they were at the top. But it was very uncomfortable up there. The wind was chilly and the hill was very high. Jack and Jill started to look around. They wanted to find something special. Suddenly they saw it! It was a big group of colorful butterflies. They were gathering in a circle, fluttering around in the sunshine. Jack and Jill were so happy. They watched the butterflies until they were all gone. Then they hopped down the hill and went home.Sara and Ben were playing with their toys in the living room. They had a big box that they used as a house, a car, or a boat. They liked to pretend that they were on adventures. Lets go to the beach! Ben said, putting on his hat and sunglasses. He grabbed a towel and a bucket. We can make sand castles and find shells. OK! Sara agreed, following him. She took her doll and a shovel. They dragged the box to the backyard, where there was a sandbox. They put the box in the sand and climbed inside. They pretended that they were sailing on the ocean. They used the shovel and the bucket to make sand castles and dig holes. They found some rocks and sticks and pretended that they were shells and fish. They had a lot of fun, but they also got very dirty. Sand was everywhere on their clothes, in their hair, and on their toys. The sun was very hot and harsh. It made them thirsty and sweaty. Lets go inside and wash, Sara said, feeling sticky and itchy. We can have some juice and cookies. OK, Ben said, feeling tired and thirsty. He grabbed the towel and the bucket. He helped Sara carry the box and the doll. They left the sandbox and went to the door. But when they got there, they saw Mom waiting for them. She looked angry. She saw the sand and the dirt on them and on the floor. What have you done? she asked, in a loud and harsh voice. You made a big mess! You cant bring the box and the toys inside. They are too dirty. You have to wash them outside first. And then you have to wash yourselves. Go to the hose and spray everything. Now! Sara and Ben felt scared and sad. They did not mean to make Mom angry. They just wanted to have fun. They did not like the hose. It was cold and wet. They did not want to wash their toys. They liked them the way they were. They started to cry. They dropped the box and the toys. They hugged each other. Please, Mom, dont be harsh, Sara said, in a small and soft voice. We are sorry. We love you. Mom saw their tears and heard their words. She felt sorry too. She realized that she was too harsh. She knelt down and hugged them. Im sorry too, she said, in a gentle and kind voice. I love you too. I know you were just playing. But you have to be careful. Sand can hurt your skin and your eyes. And dirt can make you sick. You have to wash it off. Its good for you. Ill help you. Come on, lets go to the hose. It will be fun. And then we can have some juice and cookies. OK? Sara and Ben nodded. They felt better. They smiled. They took the box and the toys. They followed Mom to the hose. They washed everything. They laughed and splashed. They had fun. They learned that washing was not so bad. And that Mom was not so harsh. She was just trying to keep them safe and clean. They loved her. And she loved them.Once upon a time there was a restless girl who wanted to see the world. One night, she decided to go on an adventure. She put on her shoes and grabbed a lantern and went out the door. The night air was cool and the stars twinkled brightly. She started walking, but soon became lost. Her lantern seemed too far away, and she felt scared. Suddenly, she heard a noise and something appear in front of her. It was a magical creature! It had bright eyes and lots of feathers. It looked so friendly and full of love. The creature said shed help her find her way. Hand in hand, they made their way back home. As the morning sun rose, the girl knew the creature couldnt stay, so the creature disappeared. The little girl was so happy shed found her way home. She knew this adventure was full of love and she would never forget it.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved playing soccer with his friends. One day, Timmys dad came to watch him play. Whats the goal, Timmy? asked his dad. To score a goal! Timmy replied with a big smile. During the game, Timmys friend Billy kicked the ball towards him. Timmy ran as fast as he could and kicked the ball with all his might. The ball went flying into the goal! I did it! I scored a goal! Timmy shouted happily. After the game, Timmys mom brought out some snacks for the team. Timmy noticed that his friend Sarah had a different snack than everyone else. What did you bring, Sarah? Timmy asked. I brought some cutup apples, Sarah replied. Can I try some? Timmy asked politely. Sarah smiled and shared her apples with Timmy. They were delicious! From that day on, Timmy brought cutup apples to every soccer game. He loved trying different snacks and sharing them with his friends. And he always remembered the goal to have fun and score as many goals as possible!One day, on a Tuesday, the sun began to rise. It was a very bright and happy day. He was excited to play outside with his friends. Tim put on his shoes and went out to have fun. Tim and his friends played all day on Tuesday. They laughed and ran under the big, bright sun. They had so much fun. When the sun started to go down, they said bye to each other. Tim went back to his house, tired but happy. Timmys weird hat and his drum made him very happy. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Belle. Belle loved to play outside and care for her pet bird. One day, she was out in her garden, when she saw something strange a broken wheel. She took the wheel and carried it inside. When Belles mom saw the wheel, she said, What did you do, Belle?! Belle said, I was trying to care for it. Her mom smiled and said, Come on, lets go see where it belongs. Belle and her mom walked around the neighborhood. They saw a little old dog who looked very hungry. Belle looked at the wheel and said, Lets give this to the dog. He looks like he needs it. Belles mom smiled and said, Thats a very caring thought, Belle. Lets go and see if the dog wants it. They walked to the dogs house and when the dog saw the wheel, he wagged his tail with joy. He was so happy he couldnt stop thanking them. Belle knew that if she cared, others would be happy. From then on, she made sure to care for everyone and everything.Once upon a time there was a popular shark. He liked to hop around the ocean. He told everyone he met about how much he liked to hop. One day he saw a fish swimming around and he really wanted to play with it. He asked the fish if it wanted to hop with him. The fish said yes and they both started to hop around the ocean. They had so much fun together. Everywhere they hopped, the fish and the shark laughed. Soon they became very good friends and loved hopping together. The shark was so happy that he had found a new friend to hop with. Finally, when it was time to go home, the fish and the shark waved goodbye and hopped off in different directions. They both looked forward to the next time they could hop together!Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys. Her favorite toy was a teddy bear. But the monster was not scary at all. It was just a toy monster that Timmy had forgotten about. Timmy was so happy that he finished his fear. Timmys sister, Sally, came into the room and saw the monster. She wanted to play with it, but Timmy said no. Sally thought Timmy was being selfish. He was so eager to look at all the books that he wasnt careful. He ended up knocking over some of the shelves of books and making a big mess. The librarian came and scolded Paul. She told him that he doesnt have enough respect for books and needs to be careful. Paul felt so bad about what he had done that he started to cry. The librarian was very kind and hugged Paul. He promised himself he would never do it again and he would listen to the librarian from then on. He regretted not being more careful and knew he should always show respect to the books.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the rain. He would jump in puddles and splash around, getting very wet. But one day, Timmys mom said he couldnt go outside because it was too serious of a storm. Timmy was sad and didnt know what to do. He decided to spend his time playing with his toys inside. But he quickly got bored and missed being outside in the wet rain. He thought about sneaking out, but he knew it was too serious of a storm. Suddenly, Timmy had an idea. He asked his mom if they could make paper boats and sail them in the puddles outside. His mom thought it was a great idea, and they spent the rest of the day making boats and having fun in the rain. Timmy was no longer sad, and he learned that even when things seem serious, theres always a way to have fun. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved playing outside in the rain. One day, Lilys mommy told her not to go outside because it was raining too much. But Lily didnt listen and went outside to play anyway. Lily was having so much fun splashing in the puddles, but then she started to feel cold and wet. She realized that her clothes were soaked through and she needed to change into dry ones. As Lily was walking back to her house, she saw a big, interesting tree. She decided to climb it and see what she could find. But as she was climbing, she slipped and fell down. She hurt herself badly and had to go to the hospital. Lilys mommy was very upset with her for not listening and going outside in the rain. Lily learned her lesson and promised to always listen to her mommy from now on.Jack went to the beach with his family. He felt excited and happy but also a little scared. He saw some small waves in the sea and he wanted to explore. He could hear the birds chirping and the sound of the wind. As Jack walked closer to the sea he began to feel scared. There were large shadows moving in the water and he heard a loud sound like somebody was yelling. Then he realised it was a shark! Jack shrieked and he tried to run back to the shore. The shark seemed to be getting closer and it was bigger than hed expected. He tried to scream for help, but he couldnt quite remember how. But the shark was getting closer! The small waves and the noise of the birds became distant as the fierce shark kept chasing Jack. He was getting exhausted and he knew he couldnt keep running. Suddenly the shark was right in front of him and he had nowhere to hide. He yelled out loud but nobody could hear him. Finally, the shark ate Jack and he was never seen again.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Benny. He was three years old and loved to learn new things. Timmy looked at her drawing and said, Wow, Lily! Youre really good at drawing. Youre so gifted! Lily smiled and said, Thanks, Timmy. I love drawing!Tom and Sue like to play with their toy cars. They have many cars of different colors and sizes. They drive them on the floor, on the table, and on the porch. They make sounds like vroom, beep, and honk. One day, Tom sees a new car in Sues hand. It is big and red and shiny. It has four big wheels and a loud horn. Tom wants to play with it. He asks Sue, Can I have your car? Sue says, No, this is my car. I got it from Grandma. It is tough and fast and fun. You have your own cars. Tom feels angry. He thinks Sue is not nice. He wants to take her car. He waits until Sue is not looking. Then he grabs her car and runs away. Sue sees Tom with her car. She feels sad and mad. She shouts, Tom, give me back my car! That is not fair! She chases Tom around the house. They run and bump and yell. They knock over chairs and lamps and books. They make a big mess. Mom hears the noise. She comes to see what is wrong. She sees Tom and Sue with the car. She sees the mess. She feels unhappy. She says, Tom and Sue, what are you doing? Why are you fighting over a car? Why are you making a mess? Tom and Sue stop and look at Mom. They feel sorry. They say, We are sorry, Mom. We were playing with the car. Tom wanted it and Sue did not want to share. We were not nice to each other. Mom says, I understand. But you have to learn to share and be kind. The car is a gift from Grandma. She loves you both. She wants you to enjoy it together. How about you take turns driving it? And how about you help me clean up the mess? Tom and Sue nod. They say, OK, Mom. We will share and be kind. We will help you clean up. We love you and Grandma. Mom smiles. She says, I love you too. Now, lets go to the porch and drive the car. It is a beautiful day.Once upon a time, there was a parent. This parent was very competitive and wanted to win every game they played. One day, they were competing in a race. They ran to him and showed him the broken toy car. Dad, can you fix our car? Sara asked. Let me see, what happened? Dad said. He looked at the car and saw the broken wheel. Oh, I see. This is not a big problem. I can repair it for you. But I need some tools and glue. I will get them from the garage. Thank you, Dad! Ben said. Dad went to the garage and came back with some tools and glue. He worked on the car and fixed the wheel. He tested the car and it worked again. He gave it back to Sara and Ben. She didnt like feeling fat, so she decided to go play outside and run around. She had fun and forgot all about feeling fat. One day Mia went to the beach with her parents. She was so excited! But, when they got there, Mia started to complain. The sand was not soft enough and the waves were too big. Her mom said, I have an idea! She pulled out some salt and told Mia she could sprinkle it in the water. Mia was even more excited! She ran to the beach and sprinkled the salt in the water, like sugar on cereal. Suddenly, the water started to sparkle and the waves were much smaller. Mia was so happy! She ran around the beach, playing and splashing. She smiled and laughed and she never complained again.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to collect pretty stones and shells at the beach. One day, she saw a wide seashell that she really wanted to add to her collection. But it was in the water and she couldnt reach it. Her friend, a boy named Max, came by and saw her trying to get the seashell. I can help you pass it to you, he said kindly. And so, he helped her get the seashell. Lily was very happy and thanked Max for his help. She learned that its always nice to help others and that friends are there to help each other collect the things they love.Once upon a time, two friends named Jack and Jill were walking through the woods. As they walked, Jack saw a bright light coming from behind a tree. It was a big, round bulb that was shining light all around it. The friends were very excited! They quickly grabbed the bulb and held it up so they could get a closer look. Inside the bulb was a very rich, sparkling gold! Jill was so amazed, she couldnt believe what she was seeing. She shouted, Lets take it home! Jack agreed, so the two friends quickly made their way home. They put the bulb into the ground and waited. As the sun began to rise in the morning, the bulb lit up the sky. Jack and Jill looked up in awe as the light from the bulb rose high into the sky. Soon, the sky was filled with a golden brightness. Jack and Jill were so proud of their new bulb. The rich golden light would remind them of their amazing adventure in the woods forever.Once upon a time, a curious bunny was hopping in the forest. The bunny saw a trap on the ground. The trap was made of metal and had sharp teeth. The bunny knew it was dangerous, so it didnt go near it. Suddenly, the bunny saw a carrot on the other side of the trap. The bunny really wanted the carrot, but it didnt want to get caught in the trap. So, the bunny had an idea. It decided to part the trap in the middle with a stick. The bunny was able to get the carrot without getting caught in the trap. It was happy and ate the carrot. From that day on, the bunny was very careful when it saw traps in the forest.Lily liked to play with her moms comb. It was shiny and had many teeth. She used it to make her hair look pretty. Sometimes she pretended it was a magic wand or a sword. One day, she found the comb on the table in the living room. She picked it up and ran to her room. She wanted to play with it alone. She closed the door and locked it. She did not want anyone to bother her. She put the comb on her bed and looked for her dolls. She wanted to comb their hair too. But she could not find them. They were hidden under the blanket. She lifted the blanket and saw them. She smiled and grabbed them. She heard a knock on the door. It was her mom. She said, Lily, open the door, please. I need the comb. It is mine, not yours. Lily did not want to give the comb back. She liked it too much. She said, No, mom. It is mine. I found it. Go away. Her mom said, Lily, that is not nice. You have to share. The comb is not a toy. It is for brushing hair. If you do not open the door, I will be angry. Lily felt scared. She did not want her mom to be angry. She did not want to make her sad. She thought for a moment. She decided to be good. She said, Sorry, mom. I will open the door. Here is the comb. You can have it. She unlocked the door and gave the comb to her mom. Her mom smiled and hugged her. She said, Thank you, Lily. You are a good girl. I love you. Lily felt happy. She said, I love you too, mom. Can I play with the comb later? Her mom said, Yes, you can. But only if you ask me first. And only if you are careful. OK? Lily said, OK, mom. I will ask you first. And I will be careful. They both smiled and went to the living room. They played with the comb and the dolls together. They had fun.Anna and Ben are twins. They share a room and a crib. They like to play with their toys and talk to each other. Sometimes they make funny noises and laugh. One day, Mom comes in and says, Its nap time, my sweeties. Time to go to the crib and sleep. She picks up Anna and puts her in the crib. Then she picks up Ben and puts him next to Anna. She kisses them and says, I love you. Have a good nap. Anna and Ben do not want to nap. They want to play more. They look at each other and whisper, Lets get out of the crib. They try to climb over the rails, but they are too high. They try to push the crib, but it is too heavy. They try to call Mom, but she does not hear them. They get tired and frustrated. They start to cry. Anna says, This is a stupid crib. I hate it. Ben says, Me too. Its not fair. Why do we have to nap? Anna says, I dont know. Mom says its good for us. But I dont like it. Ben shrugs. He does not know what to do. He says, Maybe we should sleep. Maybe it will make Mom happy. And maybe we will have a nice dream. Anna thinks for a moment. She says, Maybe you are right. Maybe its not so bad. Maybe we can play later. She yawns and cuddles with Ben. Ben yawns and cuddles with Anna. They close their eyes and fall asleep.One day, a little girl named Alice was walking with her basket in the park. She was so excited for the adventure ahead. She was determined to reach it, so Alice moved closer and closer. Even though it was very hard, she was too stubborn to give up. Alices friends were watching, and they were so proud of her. At last, Alice was able to pick the yellow flower from the branch. She was so happy to have achieved her goal, and put the flower in her basket. Alice had learned a valuable lesson that day. That was a very special, unique experience.√¢Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine and pick flowers. One day, while she was playing, she saw a butterfly that looked very tired. Lily was worried that the butterfly might be sick, so she picked it up gently and brought it inside to show her mommy. Mommy told Lily that the butterfly needed some oxygen to feel better. Lily didnt know what oxygen was, but mommy explained that its a special gas that we all need to breathe. Mommy also said that the butterfly might be feeling impatient because it wanted to fly again. So, mommy and Lily decided to help the butterfly by putting it in a jar with some fresh air and flowers. They also put a little piece of banana in the jar for the butterfly to eat. After a little while, the butterfly started to feel better and it flew away happily. Lily felt very happy too, knowing that she helped the butterfly feel better and fly again.Once upon a time, there was a silly little fox. He had bright red fur. He loved to play in the forest. One day, the fox saw a big cart filled with hay. He was very curious and he wanted to see inside. He crawled up and began to load the hay into the cart. Suddenly, the fox heard a deep voice. It was the farmer. He was angry! The fox had been very foolish to touch the cart. He wouldnt let the fox get away with it. The farmer grabbed his arm and threw him out of the forest. The fox was sad, but he vowed never to be so foolish again! He ran back home and curled up in his warm fur. From that day onward, the fox was always careful and never played with the farmers things again.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her toys. One day, she found a stick and started to measure things. She measured how tall the flowers were and how wide the trees were. But then, it started to rain and Lily got very wet. She was miserable because she didnt like being wet. She ran back to her house and her mom gave her a warm blanket to dry off. Lily was happy to be inside where it was warm and cozy. She realized that sometimes its better to be inside when its raining outside. She hugged her mom and said, I love you.Tom was a little boy who liked to play with his toys. He had many toys, but his favorite was a red car. He liked to zoom the car around the floor and make loud noises. He also liked to put the car in his mouth and bite it. One day, Tom was playing with his car in his room. He was having fun, but he was also tired. He did not want to stop playing, so he did not listen to his mom when she called him for dinner. He put the car in his mouth and lay down on his bed. Soon, Tom fell asleep with the car in his mouth. He did not know that the car had a small wheel that could come off. While he was sleeping, the wheel came off and went into his throat. Tom started to choke and cough. He woke up and felt scared and hurt. His mom heard him and ran to his room. She saw the car in his mouth and the wheel in his throat. She quickly took the car out of his mouth and helped him spit out the wheel. She hugged him and took him to the doctor. The doctor checked Tom and said he was lucky. He said that the wheel could have hurt him more if it stayed in his throat. He told Tom not to put toys in his mouth, because they are not food. He said that toys are for playing, not for eating. Tom learned his lesson. He said sorry to his mom and thanked the doctor. He promised not to put toys in his mouth again. He also promised to listen to his mom when she called him for dinner. He realized that playing is fun, but eating and sleeping are important too. He was a good boy after that.Lily liked to look at the sky and see the aeroplanes. They were big and loud and flew very fast. Sometimes they had different colours or shapes. Lets record our song! said Sam. Bella agreed, and they found a way to save their song. Sam played his drum, and Bella sang her song. They played and sang all day long. Sam had a long, fluffy tail which he was very proud of. One day, Sam decided to show off his tail to the other mice in the forest. When they saw it they all began to laugh. Look at that silly tail! they said. Sam was embarrassed, and he ran away so they couldnt see him. Once Sam was out of sight, he heard a funny sound coming from one of the tree branches. It was a wise old owl watching the whole scene. Its not nice to make fun of someones tail, said the owl. You should try to always be kind and sort out your differences in a peaceful way. Sam thought about these words. From then on, he treated everyone with respect, no matter what their tail looked like.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Just then, a kind man who worked at the store came over and said, I can serve you that orange. Its on me. Timmy was so happy and said thank you. Timmy and his mom were so grateful and thanked the man again. He did not have another one. He sat on the grass and cried. A girl saw him crying. She was walking with her mom. She had a ball too. It was red and shiny. She liked to bounce it too. I dont know. Maybe they are angry or greedy or afraid. Maybe they dont have enough things or love, Anna said. That is poor. We have enough things and love. We dont need to fight, Tom said. One day, they went to the park with their music. They saw a man sitting on a bench. He was reading a book. He looked very quiet and calm. Lets play music for him! Sara said. Maybe he will like it! Ben nodded. They ran to the bench and started to bang, blow, and ring their music. They did not have a good rhythm. They did not ask the man if he wanted to hear their music. They were not polite. The man frowned. He put his book down. He looked at Sara and Ben with angry eyes. Stop it! Stop it now! he shouted. You are very rude and noisy! You are hurting my ears and my head! Go away! Sara and Ben were scared. They dropped their music and ran away. They felt very bad. They regretted playing music for the man. They wished they had been more polite and respectful. The moral of the story is Always ask before you play music for someone. Not everyone likes the same kind of music. Be polite and considerate of others.Once upon a time, there was a cute little bunny named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to hop around and play with his friends in the forest. He started to feel a pain in his tummy because he was so hungry. Tweetie saw that Fluffy was sad and asked him what was wrong. I forgot where I put my carrot, Fluffy said sadly. Now Im hungry and my tummy hurts. Dont worry, Fluffy, Tweetie said. Ill help you find your carrot. Well search the whole forest together! The dad saw the little girl and said, Dont be scared! There is nothing to be afraid of. He showed her the grill and explained how it worked. The little girl watched and soon she wasnt frightened anymore. The family cooked the food and enjoyed the feast. They celebrated with a lot of laughter and fun. They ate the food and shared stories. At the end of the night, they were all very happy. They had the best celebration ever!Once upon a time, a little girl was walking by a garden and saw a vase. It was very pretty with flowers on it. She wanted to pick it up, but her mom said she shouldnt. So, she asked her mom what she should do. Her mom told her that God wants us to be good and provide for others. She said the vase should stay in the garden to help the flowers grow. The little girl thought about it and decided that was a good idea. Every day, she visited the garden and watered the flowers around the vase, so they could stay healthy and pretty. She was so happy to help her mom and God provide for others. The moral of the story is that its important to help and serve others. Being good and providing for those around us will make us and them happy.Sara and Tom were playing in the park. They had a toy gun that could shoot water. They liked to shoot each other and laugh. Tom, I will shoot you! Sara said. She ran after him with the gun. No, Sara, dont shoot me! Tom said. He ran away from her. He hid behind a tree. Sara looked for Tom. She saw his feet under the tree. She smiled. She aimed the gun at his feet and shot. Ah, Sara, you got me! Tom said. He came out from the tree. He was wet. They heard a loud noise. They looked up. They saw an enormous plane in the sky. It was flying very low. It had a big star on it. Wow, look at that plane! Sara said. She pointed at it. Its so big! Tom said. He stared at it. The plane flew over them. It made a loud sound. It dropped something from its belly. It looked like a big ball. What is that? Sara asked. She was curious. I dont know, Tom said. He was scared. The ball fell to the ground. It made a big boom. It was a bomb. It exploded. It made fire and smoke. It hurt many people and things. Sara and Tom were very lucky. They were far from the bomb. They did not get hurt. But they were very sad. They saw the fire and smoke. They saw the people and things that were hurt. They dropped the toy gun. They did not want to shoot anymore. They hugged each other. They cried.Once upon a time, there was an old crab. He was ancient and wise. One day, he was walking along the beach when he met a little girl. She said, Hello, Mr. Crab! Can I play with you? The crab smiled. Yes, that would be nice. The girl grabbed a shovel and soon, the crab and the girl were playing happily in the sand. After a while, the crab said, Thank you for the fun, but now I must go. The little girl said, Wait! Can I pay you with a hug? The ancient crab smiled. Yes, that would be nice. The little girl hugged the crab tightly, and the crab felt happy. Then, the crab waved goodbye and walked away.Once upon a time, there was a little bird and it was just learning to fly. One day it was close to a river and decided to splash in the water. The bird was so happy as it splashed and it felt good. But then suddenly, a big fish came out of the water and gave the little bird a reward! It was a piece of light fruit that sparkled in the sun. The bird was very excited and ate the piece of light fruit straight away. It was so delicious and the bird was so thankful for the reward. After that, it splashed and played in the river for the rest of the day. It was so much fun and the little bird was very happy that it got the light reward from the fish.Jim was very intelligent. He loved to play the guitar. He was very good at it, but he had a tendency to forget to practice. Today was no exception. Jim had forgotten to practice and his father was not happy. He said to Jim, You must practice or I will punish you! Jim was so scared, he ran away quickly with his guitar. He ran to his neighbours house and started to play his guitar. He was so smart and made beautiful music. Jims neighbour heard the music and was impressed. He said to Jim, You must practice every day or else you wont get better! Jim liked what his kind neighbour said and promised to practice every day. He knew that he needed to do this or he would be punished.One day, Jimmy went out to play in the park. He was so excited but he started to worry. What if he didnt find a friend to play with? Then, he heard a happy tune coming from a nearby bush. It was a little bird, whistling away! Jimmy was not worried anymore, he wanted to learn the song and whistle it himself. He got closer and wanted to make friends. The little bird was scared and flew away. Jimmy kept listening and tried to learn the tune by ear. He kept trying and soon he was whistling the same tune as the little bird. The bird came back and was amazed at Jimmys whistling. They got to talking and the bird told Jimmy his name was Tweety. They were soon playing hide and seek. Jimmy felt happy, he wasnt worried anymore. They played until it started to get dark. Jimmy didnt want Tweety to fly away so he gave him a cheap whistle as a goodbye gift. Tweety said goodbye and flew away. Jimmy was happy, Tweety was his new friend. From that day on, he never worried again.Once upon a time, there was a little squirrel named Nutty. Nutty loved to gather nuts to eat. One day, Nutty found a big nut, but it was stuck in a tree. Tweetie calmly flew up to the tree and gently knocked the nut loose. Nutty was so happy and grateful that he shared his nuts with Tweetie. He saw a patch of soil that looked a bit different from the rest of the ground. He stopped and looked at it and noticed it was a darker color. He wondered why it was darker than the rest. Suddenly, he started to worry. What was wrong with the soil? Was it normal, or was something wrong? Tom started to think and he decided to get closer to the soil. He bent over and felt the soil with his hand. It felt a bit wet, so he scooped up a bit of the soil. He held it in his hands and realized it was normal dirt. He was relieved! Tom smiled and continued walking away. He was no longer worried about the soil. He knew it was simply a normal patch of dirt, and nothing was wrong with it. He was happy, and went on his way.Once upon a time, there was a little square. The square had four tight sides. It lived in a big box with many other shapes. One day, the square saw a big ball join the box. The ball was very round and could roll fast. The square wanted to play with the ball but it couldnt roll like the ball. The square thought and thought about how it could join the ball. It tried to roll, but its tight sides made it hard. Then, the square had a great idea. It saw a big hill outside the box. The square knew that if it could get to the top of the hill, it could slide down and join the ball. The square climbed up the big hill with all its might. At the top, it looked down and saw the ball waiting at the bottom. The square took a deep breath and slid down the hill as fast as it could. As it slid, it went faster and faster. At the bottom, the square finally joined the ball. They laughed and played together all day long. The square was very happy that it found a way to join its new friend, the ball.Lily and Tom were playing with paper. They cut and folded the paper to make animals and hats. The end.Tim had a yellow pipe that he liked very much. He liked to blow bubbles with it and make funny noises. He took his pipe everywhere he went, even to bed. He put his pipe in his mouth and leaned over the water. But he leaned too far and fell into the pond. He was scared and wet and cold. He tried to call for his mom, but his pipe was still in his mouth. He could not breathe. He swallowed water and bubbles. His mom saw him and ran to the pond. She jumped in and grabbed him. Inside the nest were three tiny eggs. Timmy knew he had to be careful not to harm the eggs, so he climbed back down. He decided to watch the nest from afar and make sure the eggs were safe. Days went by and Timmy watched the little bird family grow. He saw the mother bird bring food to her babies and watched as they learned to fly. The seed was scared, because it had never been to the soil before. But the voice was gentle and said that it would be ok. The seed now understood why it was important it was meant to help the soil become more and more healthy. So the seed listened, and fit itself into the soil. After a few days, the seed started to grow. It grew bigger and bigger until the roots became strong and the leaves were thick and green! The soil had become healthier because the seed fit in. The seed was proud to be important, because it showed that it could help and make a difference. The seed knew that no matter what, it could always fit in somewhere.Once upon a time, there was a smart dog called Fluffy. Fluffy had a beautiful tail that could wag like a flag in the wind. He ran forward and jumped in, but as soon as he did, it started to snow and the lake began to freeze. Fluffy realized he was in trouble and he started to bark. One day, the lion met a small mouse. The mouse was scared of the lions big roar. The lion said, Dont be scared, little mouse. I wont hurt you. The lion saw that the mouse was eating a potato. The lion had never seen a potato before. What is that? the lion asked. The mouse said, This is a potato. It is very yummy. Would you like to try it? The lion nodded and took a small bite. He liked it a lot! Later, the lion got caught in a big net. He roared and roared, but he could not get out. The little mouse heard the lions roars and remembered how the lion had been nice to him. The mouse ran to the lion and used his sharp teeth to cut the net. The lion was free! The lion thanked the mouse and said, You are small, but you are very brave. I am glad we are friends. The mouse smiled and said, We are friends because you were kind to me. And from that day on, the lion and the mouse were best friends, and they always helped each other. Sally was so happy. She had never had such a sour morning turn into such a sweet end!Ben and Lily were playing in the garden. They saw a big red apple on a tree. They wanted to eat it because it looked yummy. Lets get the apple! Ben said. He tried to climb the tree, but it was too high. He fell down and hurt his knee. Ow! he cried. It hurts! Lily hugged him and said, Dont cry, Ben. I have an idea. We can use a trap to get the apple. She ran to the shed and found a big basket and a long rope. She put the basket under the apple and tied the rope to the handle. She hid behind a bush and waited. Soon, a squirrel came to the tree. It saw the apple and jumped on the basket. The basket tipped over and the squirrel was inside. Lily pulled the rope and closed the trap. Ha! We got it! Lily shouted. She ran to the basket and opened it. The squirrel was scared and angry. It bit Lilys finger and ran away. Ow! she cried. It bites! Ben came to her and said, Dont cry, Lily. I have an idea. We can use a squeeze to make it better. He took a leaf and squeezed it. He put the juice on Lilys finger and wrapped it with another leaf. He kissed her finger and said, There. It will heal soon. Lily smiled and said, Thank you, Ben. You are very kind. They looked at the apple and saw that it was still on the tree. They decided to leave it alone and go back to the house. Maybe we can have some cookies instead, Ben said. They are yummy too. Lily nodded and said, Yes, lets go. And maybe we can play with something else. Traps and squeezes are not fun. They held hands and walked to the house. They were happy and hungry. They forgot about the apple and the squirrel.Once upon a time, there was a red board. It was very pretty and shiny. A little boy liked to play with it. He would hang it on his wall and look at it all day. One day, the little boy was playing with the red board and he accidentally broke it. He was very sad. He tried to fix it, but he couldnt. The little boys mom saw what happened and she was angry. She told him that he shouldnt have played with the red board so roughly. The little boy felt very bad. In the end, the red board was broken and the little boy was sad. He learned that he should be careful with his toys so they dont break.Once upon a time there was a family who loved to eat. The truck told the eye about its dizziness. The eye said that it knew just the thing. It said that it could help get the truck to its destination. The eye went to work, spinning around with the truck. Gradually, the trucks dizziness went away. Finally the truck was able to make its delivery. It beamed with pride. The eye was happy too, it had helped the truck and made a new friend.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a friend named Max who was very tall. They drank the water and felt much better. From that day on, they always brought a water bottle with them when they climbed the high tree. They were happy to have each other as friends and to always be prepared with a supply of water.Molly was feeling very thirsty. She had been playing with her toys all day and was ready for a drink. She lifted the cup to her lips and took a big drink. It was so delicious! After she finished, Molly tipped the last bit of juice into the cup. The noise was so loud that it could be heard from very far away. Every day, many people gathered in the field to enjoy the pleasing sound. One day, a man came to the field with a big saw. He cut down one of the trees that was making the noise. When the tree fell, the noise stopped. Everyone was sad and angry, but the man said he had to do it for a good reason. The days and weeks went by, and the noise didn√¢t come back. Eventually, the people in the field realized what the man had done he had cut down all the trees that made the fair noise. He had ruined the beautiful sound forever, and they felt very sad.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to help her mommy in the kitchen. One day, her mommy asked her to help make a special treat for their neighbor who was very sick. They decided to make a basket of cookies and wrap it up with a pretty bow. Lily helped her mommy mix the dough and shape the cookies. They baked them in the oven and let them cool. Then, they put them in a basket and wrapped it with a pretty pink ribbon. They walked over to their neighbors house and gave her the basket of cookies. She was very happy and thanked them for their kindness. A few days later, there was a knock on Lilys door. It was the neighbors daughter who was very wealthy. She thanked Lily and her mommy for the basket of cookies and gave them a big bag of money as a thank you. Lily and her mommy were very surprised and happy. They learned that sometimes when you do something nice for others, good things can happen to you too.Lily and Tom are brother and sister. They like to play in the garden with their ball and their dog. One day, their mom calls them from the kitchen. Lily, Tom, come inside! The beef is ready! she says. Lily and Tom hear their mom and run to the door. But their dog sees a cat and chases it. The dog barks and the cat hisses. Lily and Tom want to see what happens. They forget about the beef and follow their dog. Their mom waits for them in the kitchen. She has cooked a big beef roast with potatoes and carrots. She is hungry and wants to eat with her children. She looks at the clock and wonders where they are. She calls them again. Lily, Tom, where are you? The beef is getting cold! Lily and Tom hear their mom again. They see that their dog has caught the cat and is playing with it. They think it is funny and laugh. They do not listen to their mom and stay in the garden. Their mom gets angry and sad. She decides to eat the beef by herself. She cuts a big slice and puts it on her plate. She takes a bite and says, Mmm, this is delicious. Too bad Lily and Tom are missing it. Lily and Tom smell the beef from the garden. They remember that they are hungry and want to eat too. They leave their dog and the cat and run to the kitchen. They see their mom eating the beef. They say, Mom, we are here! Can we have some beef too? Their mom looks at them and shakes her head. She says, No, you cannot. You did not listen to me when I called you. You did not come when the beef was ready. Now the beef is gone. You have to wait until the next meal. Lily and Tom feel sorry and ashamed. They realize that they were rude and selfish. They say, Mom, we are sorry. We should have listened to you. We should have come when you called us. We love you and your beef. Their mom smiles and hugs them. She says, I love you too, my children. But you have to learn to obey and respect me. And you have to appreciate what I cook for you. Maybe next time you will come when the beef is ready. Lily and Tom nod and promise to do better. They hug their mom and their dog and their cat. They learn their lesson and never miss the beef again. The moral value of the story is Listen to your parents and appreciate what they do for you.Once upon a time, there was a funny little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play and run all day. Spot said, Yes, lets play! They played together and had a lot of fun. After a while, Spot felt tired. He sighed and said, I need to go home now. The big bird was sad and didnt want Spot to leave. So, the bird hid Spots toy so he couldnt find it. Spot looked and looked, but he couldnt find his toy anywhere. Spot was very sad and cried. The big bird felt bad and gave Spots toy back. Spot was still sad because he didnt like the big birds mean trick. He walked back down the hill and went home without saying goodbye to the big bird.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very restless and couldnt sleep at night. They made their home in a beautiful meadow full of flowers and grass. One day, the family decided to go for a walk. They all put on their shoes and stepped out of the house. They were so excited to explore the meadow together. When they arrived at the meadow, the family stopped to admire the beautiful view. Suddenly, a rabbit hopped by and the family shouted, Hello! The rabbit heard the familys greeting and stopped to look at them. She smiled and said, Would you like to play with me? The family was delighted. They asked, Can we play? The rabbit nodded and said, Yes, but you must wait until I permit it. The family agreed and waited patiently. Suddenly, the rabbit hopped around in a circle and shouted, Now you may play! The family laughed and jumped into the meadow where they had a wonderful time running, hopping and playing together under the warm autumn sun.Lily was a little girl who liked to look at herself in the mirror. Lily did not want to go downstairs and join the party. She wanted to stay in her room and eat the cake by herself. She took the cake from the kitchen and ran to her room. She locked the door and put the cake on her bed. She looked at herself in the mirror and smiled. She thought she was the happiest girl in the world. But then, something strange happened. Her friend asked her, Why is your ball so dull? Lily replied, I dont know, but I still love to play with it. As they were playing, they heard a noise. Lilys friend said, Lets peek through the window and see what it is. They saw a group of children playing with shiny, new balls. Lilys friend said, Wow, those balls look so cool! I wish we had one. Lily thought for a moment and said, Even though our ball is dull, we still have fun playing with it. We dont need a shiny, new ball to have fun. Her friend smiled and said, Youre right, Lily. Our ball may be dull, but its still a great sport to play. Lets keep playing and have fun together! From that day on, they played with their dull ball and had just as much fun as the other children with their shiny, new balls. The moral of the story is that its not what you have, but how you use it that counts.Once upon a time, there was a big box. The box had many toys inside. It also had a fake button. What does it do? she asked. I dont know, said Tim. Lets find out! They pressed the button. Nothing happened. They pressed it again. Still nothing. They were sad. They wanted the button to do something fun. But it was a fake button. So, it did not work. Tim and Sue played with the other toys in the box. They had fun for a little while. But they kept thinking about the button. They wished it was real. They wished it could do something amazing. In the end, they put the toys back in the box. They closed the lid. Hello, Lily. What do you have in your backpack? Miss Lee asked. Lily smiled and opened her backpack. She took out Anna and held her up. This is Anna. She is my best friend. She is very pretty and smart. Do you like her? Lily said. Miss Lee looked at Anna and nodded. She said, Yes, she is very pretty and smart. But Lily, you know that today is a special day, right? Lily frowned. She did not know what Miss Lee meant. She said, What special day? Miss Lee said, Today is picture day. We are going to take a picture of our room. We just have to wear ordinary clothes for a little while.Lila and Sam were best friends. They liked to play with dolls, cars and blocks. They shared their toys and snacks. They had fun every day. Sam felt sad and angry. He tried to grab the doll from Lila, but she pulled it away. They started to fight. Give me the doll! Sam shouted. No, its mine! Lila yelled. They pulled and pushed until the dolls head came off. Lila and Sam stared at the broken doll. Lila burst into tears. She loved her new doll and now it was ruined. She wept and wept. Sam felt sorry for Lila. He did not mean to break her doll. He wanted to say sorry, but he did not know how. Miss Lee, their teacher, heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. She saw Lila crying and Sam looking guilty. She picked up the dolls head and body and put them together. She said it was not a big problem. She said she could fix the doll with some glue and tape. She said Lila and Sam should not fight over toys. She said they should be kind and share. She said they should say sorry to each other and hug. Lila and Sam listened to Miss Lee. They felt ashamed and sorry. They looked at each other and said sorry. They hugged and said they were still friends. Lila offered Sam to play with her doll. Sam thanked Lila and said she was a good friend. They smiled and played with the doll. Miss Lee smiled and said they were lovely children. She gave them a sticker each and a hug. She said she was proud of them. Lila and Sam felt happy and proud. They learned a lesson that day. They learned to share and care.Once upon a time there lived a boy named Joe. Joe was only three years old but he was very brave. Joe had a special bow that made him feel calm. One day, Joe wanted to take his bow outside and show it to his friends. But Joes mom warned him, No Joe, you must not go outside with your bow. But Joe ignored his moms warning and happily went outside with his bow. He called out to all of his friends but none of them came. Joe felt very sad. He sadly walked back home and saw his mom in the garden. Joe expected his mom to be mad at him, but she was not. Instead, she had a big smile on her face. Joes mom said, Dont be bitter Joe. Everyone has days like this. I too was once a little boy and I know how you feel. Im sorry I ignored you earlier. Joe hugged his mom, who wiped away the tears in his eyes. She looked at him and said, Lets go inside and have some ice cream! Joe smiled and felt better. The end.Once upon a time, there was a polite boy named Tim. He liked to play with his toys. One day, Tim found a toy weapon in his room. It was a sword. Tim was very happy. He might try to take it from you. Anna and Ben laugh. They think the woman is joking. They eat their cake and play with Spot. They do not see that Spot is looking at their cake. His mom and dad were proud of him. After a while, Mikey got tired and ran off to find somewhere to rest. He found a tree with a big leafy branch. He climbed up and sat on the branch with his drum. He started to play it and the sound echoed through the trees. Mikey smiled and he was so proud of his clear drum.Timmy was playing in the garden when he saw a big barn. He had never seen a barn before and he was very excited. He went to the barn and saw some shiny tools and things. He found a brush and a bucket and he wanted to polish something. He looked around, and spotted an old shovel. He started to polish the shovel. He worked hard, but it was no use. The shovel was very old and it didnt get very shiny. Timmy was getting a bit frustrated. Suddenly, he heard a voice from inside the barn. What are you doing, little boy?, the voice asked. Timmy was so surprised he almost jumped out of his skin. Timmy told the voice what he was doing, and he asked if the shovel would get shiny. The voice laughed and said that the shovel looked very old, and it wouldnt get shiny. Timmy felt very bitter and he left the barn. But the voice shouted at him. Wait! I can show you a better way to polish a shovel. Timmy went back inside the barn and the voice showed him exactly how to polish the shovel. Soon the shovel was shining brightly! Timmy was so happy and thanked the voice for the help. He took the shovel and ran home, feeling proud of his shiny new treasure.There was a boy named Charlie. He was 3 years old and loved to play. He had a special game he liked to play every day. Nobody answered and the man kept on knocking for a long time until a little girl opened the door and he showed her the law. The little girl was very lonely and she had no family. The man in the suit said he would show the little girl a new home. The little girl was happy, so she smiled and took a big breath of fresh air from outside. The man and the little girl then got into the big lorry and they drove away to the new home. The little girl was no longer alone.Once upon a time there was a furry bear named Sammy who liked to explore. One day, Sammy was looking for trouble and he got himself stuck in a tree. The kind man gave Sammy a hand and Sammy was free again. At the end of his adventure, Sammy knew that if he looked for trouble he would only get in trouble. He thanked the kind man and ran away. One morning, Sarah said to Jake, Lets go out and explore nature today and I will support you! Jake rolled his eyes and agreed, so they set out into the forest. Jacky was intrigued, he had never seen a blueberry before! Jacky ran up to the bush and started to pick the blueberries. Suddenly, a wise old fox appeared from the shadows. Little rabbit, the fox said, you should never be so lazy with your life, you should always reach for greater heights and never be content with mediocrity. Now, off you go and pick some more of those delicious blueberries! Jacky understood the lesson and he went back to picking blueberries with newfound ambition. He gathered enough for a nice blueberry pie, and Jacky and the fox had a wonderful meal that only a lazy little rabbit and wise old fox can appreciate. The moral of the story is that its important to never be too lazy and complacent with your life. Whenever you have the opportunity to do something new, have an ambition to strive for greater heights and never be content with mediocrity. Sarah turned around to see an old man with a long beard. She smiled at him and told him honestly, My mom gave it to me. The old man nodded and smiled. Then he said, Keep it, Sarah. From then on, she always remembered the old mans words and was honest.Lily likes to talk to her grandma, who lives far away. She misses her a lot. Sometimes, she calls her on the phone, but sometimes, she wants to show her something. Then, she uses her moms tablet to send her a message. One day, Lily draws a picture of a flower with many colors. She is very proud of it. She wants to share it with her grandma. She asks her mom to help her send a message with the picture. Mom, can you help me send a message to grandma? Lily says. Sure, honey. Let me see your picture. Its very pretty. Im sure grandma will love it. Mom says. Mom takes the tablet and opens the app. She helps Lily type Hi, grandma. I love you. This is a flower for you. She also attaches the picture. Then, she presses the send button. There, we sent your message. Now, we wait for grandma to reply. Mom says. Lily smiles and hugs her mom. She likes to send messages to grandma. She thinks its a modern way to talk. She hopes grandma will like her flower. She wonders what grandma will send back. Maybe a picture of her cat, or a story, or a song. She cant wait to see.Once upon a time, there was a big box. The box was in the east part of a room. The box was very special because it could fit many things inside it. One day, a little girl named Lily found the box. She was very excited to see what she could fit in the box. Lily tried to fit her toys in the box. She put her teddy bear, her ball, and her blocks inside. They all fit perfectly! Lily was very happy. She decided to put more things in the box, like her shoes and her hat. They fit too! One day, Lily found a lemon under the table. She thought it was a toy and put it in the box. Later, she took a bite of the lemon and it was very bitter! She made a funny face and laughed. Even though the lemon was bitter, Lily still loved her box and all the things that fit inside.Once upon a time, there was a cold night. Inside a house there was a door with a handle. Her mom came outside and said, Let me try. She held the handle, and it was cold, too. So her mom said, I know the best thing to do. Do you know how to do that? Joe nodded. He knew how to feed the doggy because his mum had taught him. He grabbed a bowl from the cupboard and then got the dog food from the shelf. But after a while, the bird felt a bit scared and so it started zooming back to its birdcage. When it got back, the bird met its best friend, a cat. The cat asked the bird, Where have you been? You were gone for so long! The bird replied, I zoomed outside. I saw so many new things and I wanted to explore, but I was a bit shy, so I came back. The cat said, Thats okay. But as he was eating, he heard an angry buzzing noise. There were hundreds of bees flying around him and they did not look happy. Honey knew he had to get away quickly or else he would be in trouble! He ran down the hill faster than he ever had before. Luckily, he was faster than the bees and made it back to the bottom of the hill. He was safe. They found some that were red and square, some that were blue and round, some that were yellow and starry, and some that were green and triangular. She does not see the animal that lives in the flowers. The animal is a bee. It is yellow and black. It does not like Lily picking its flowers. It gets angry. It flies out of the flower and stings Lily on her hand. Lily cries out loud. It hurts a lot. Her dad hears her cry and runs to her. He sees the bee and the flowers. He sees the sign. He is not happy. She liked to soar high in the sky and feel the wind on her wings. She had many friends who flew with her, like Tom the sparrow and Lily the dove. They played games and sang songs in the air. One day, Ella saw a big tree with a long trunk. She was curious and wanted to see what was inside. She flew closer and saw a hole in the trunk. She heard a deep voice say, Who is there? Ella was scared and flew away. Who was that? Tom asked her. I dont know. It sounded like a big animal, Ella said. Maybe it was a bear or a lion, Lily said. Or maybe it was a wise owl, Tom said. They live in trees and know many things. Ella wondered if Tom was right. She wanted to meet a wise owl and learn from him. She decided to go back to the tree and say hello. She flew to the hole and said, Hello, Im Ella. Are you a wise owl? There was silence for a moment. Then the voice said, No, Im not a wise owl. Im a hungry snake. And you are my lunch. Ella was shocked and frightened. She tried to fly away, but the snake was faster. He stretched out his head and grabbed Ella with his teeth. He pulled her into the trunk and swallowed her whole. Tom and Lily saw what happened and cried. They flew away and told the other birds to stay away from the tree. They learned a sad lesson not everyone who lives in a tree is wise or friendly. Some are mean and dangerous.Once upon a time, there was a reliable dog who liked to pull things. He loved to pull all kinds of things, like sticks, logs, and anything else he could find.
