Finally, he found a tiny hole in the ground and he decided to jump in it. He figured he could itch away from everyone, so he started to scratch, pull and squirm. When he finished all of his itches, the reliable dog jumped out of the hole and back into the park. He was a very relieved and happy pup who learned an important lesson that day never scratch an itch in public!Once upon a time, there was a big mountain called a volcano. The volcano was very restless and made loud noises. The people who lived nearby were scared of the volcano. They did not want it to erupt and make hot lava come out. One day, a brave boy named Timmy decided to climb up the volcano. He wanted to see what was inside. As he climbed higher and higher, he felt scared because the volcano was shaking. But he kept going until he reached the top. When he got to the top, Timmy looked inside and saw red hot lava. It was very bright and made him feel scared. He quickly climbed back down and told everyone what he saw. They were very thankful to Timmy for being so brave and warned others to stay away from the restless volcano.Sam was walking down to the church. He felt excited. The church was not only smelly, but it was now destroyed. Sam kept rolling until he was safe. He was very sad. The church was gone.Lily and Ben were playing on the beach. They liked to make sand castles and dig holes. They also liked to wave at the boats and the birds. Sometimes they found shells and stones and put them in their buckets. One day, they saw a big boat with a wide sail. It was white and blue and had a flag on it. Lily and Ben waved at the boat and hoped it would wave back. But the boat did not wave back. It came closer and closer to the shore. Look, Ben, the boat is coming to us! Lily said. Maybe they have sugar for us! Ben said. He liked sugar very much. He wanted to eat some sugar with his sand cake. But when the boat reached the land, Lily and Ben saw that it was not a nice boat. It was a pirate boat! The pirates had swords and hooks and eye patches. They jumped off the boat and ran to the beach. They saw Lily and Ben and their buckets. Arrr, what have we here? Some little landlubbers with treasure! one pirate said. Give us your buckets, or well make you walk the plank! another pirate said. Lily and Ben were scared. They did not want to give their buckets. They did not want to walk the plank. They did not want to see the pirates. They wanted to run away. Help, help! they cried. But no one heard them. The pirates grabbed their buckets and laughed. They dumped the shells and stones on the sand and looked for gold and jewels. But they did not find any. They only found sand and more sand. These buckets are full of sand! Where is the treasure? one pirate said. Maybe they hid it somewhere else! another pirate said. Lets find it! Come on, mates, lets search the beach! the first pirate said. The pirates left the buckets and ran to look for treasure. They did not see Lily and Ben, who were hiding behind a big rock. They waited until the pirates were far away. Then they ran to their buckets and picked them up. They ran to their mom and dad, who were sitting on a blanket. They told them what happened. Mom, dad, the pirates took our buckets and looked for treasure, but they only found sand! Lily said. They were mean and scary and they did not wave back! Ben said. Mom and dad hugged them and said they were brave and smart. They said they were sorry that the pirates took their buckets, but they were glad that they were safe. They said they would buy them new buckets and more shells and stones. They said they would also buy them some sugar for their sand cake. Lily and Ben smiled and said thank you. They were happy to have their mom and dad. They did not like the pirates. They hoped they would never see them again. They ate some sugar and made a new sand castle. They waved at the boats and the birds. And they hoped that someone would wave back.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a blue bicycle that he loved to ride. One day, he had to go to the doctor. The doctor said, Prince, you need to stop drinking juice. It is not good for you. The silly prince finally listened and started drinking water. He picks up a yellow crayon. Okay, Tom. But be careful. Do not color outside the lines, Jill says. She gives him the page. Tom starts to color the flower and the bee. He is happy. He likes to color. Tom, Tom, come here! Jill calls. She has turned to another page. The page has a picture of a lion and a zebra. What is it, Jill? Tom asks. He puts down the crayon and goes to Jill. Look, Tom, a lion and a zebra! They are big and strong. Do you know what they say? Jill asks. Tom shakes his head. He does not know. Let me tell you. The lion says roar and the zebra says neigh. Can you say that, Tom? Jill says. Tom tries to say that. He says roar and neigh. He sounds funny. Jill laughs. Tom laughs too. They have fun with the book. They learn new words and colors. They are happy friends.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the store with her mommy to buy candy. It was the best day of my life.Once upon a time, there lived a big ugly fish in a deep blue pond. One day, he saw a jar of ink and he was very curious. He swam over to the jar and splashed it with his tail. The jar broke, and the ink splashed into the pond. The fish laughed and laughed as the ink flew all around. The ink was everywhere in the pond, so he quickly dashed away. But unfortunately, the ink had made the pond very dark and ugly! The fish was sad and he was worried. He didnt know what to do. Then suddenly, he saw a little butterfly fluttering around the pond. He asked the butterfly for help. The butterfly told him he could help make the water sparkle again. So the butterfly waved her wings and the ink started to disappear. Soon, the pond was sparkly and clean again. The fish was so happy and he thanked the butterfly for helping him. From then on, he was always careful whenever he saw ink nearby!Lena and Tom are playing in their room. They have a big sheet and some chairs. They want to make a tent with the sheet. She often flew in a zigzag path as she was so happy in the air. One day, the mild wind blew strong and pushed the duck off course. She tried to fly back to her zigzagging but the wind kept pushing her away. The duck became frustrated and spoke out loud. Why must the wind be so mean to me?, she said. Suddenly, a voice called out from above. It was a thunderous voice that made the duck quiver. It was a giant cloud that had struck the duck with a powerful gust of wind. How dare you defy my wish!, the cloud shouted. I have power to make you fly in whatever direction I wish! The duck was so scared. She tried to explain that she was just delighted to be flying in a zigzag, but the cloud was too angry. Suddenly, the cloud softened its voice and said,Go now, but make sure you stay in the zigzagging path from now on. The duck breathed a sigh of relief and agreed. She flew off in the zigzag path and never defied the mild cloud again.Once upon a time there was a person named Joe. Joe liked to bow down to the ground and stretch. They liked to see the trees, the flowers and the birds. They also liked to look for bugs. They had a jar to keep the bugs they found. One day, they saw a big, shiny bug on a leaf. It had many colors and wings. Tom wanted to catch it and put it in the jar. Lily said, No, Tom, that is a cheap thing to do. The bug is happy on the leaf. It does not want to be in the jar. Let it be free. Tom did not listen to Lily. He ran to the leaf and grabbed the bug. He put it in the jar and closed the lid. He was proud of his catch. He said, Look, Lily, I have the best bug ever. It is so pretty and rare. You are just jealous. Lily was sad and angry. She said, Tom, you are not nice. You are selfish and mean. The bug is not happy in the jar. It is scared and sad. You should let it go. It is not yours to keep. Tom did not care. He said, No, Lily, this is my bug. I caught it fair and square. I will not let it go. It is mine. But then, something bad happened. The bug was not a bug at all. It was a bee. And it was very angry. It stung Tom through the jar. Tom screamed and dropped the jar. The jar broke and the bee flew away. Tom cried and held his hand. It hurt a lot. Lily ran to Tom and helped him. She said, Tom, I am sorry you are hurt. But you should have listened to me. You should not take things that are not yours. You should respect the life of others. That is the right thing to do. Tom nodded and said, Lily, you are right. I was wrong. I was cheap and greedy. I should have let the bee be. I am sorry. Can you forgive me? Lily smiled and said, Yes, Tom, I forgive you. You are my friend. But next time, please be more careful and kind. And maybe we should look for other bugs. Bees are not fun to play with. Tom agreed and said, Yes, Lily, you are right. Bees are not fun to play with. They are better to watch from far away. And there are many other bugs to find. Lets go and jog some more. Maybe we will see a butterfly or a ladybug. They are pretty and gentle. And they do not sting. Lily and Tom hugged and jogged away. They learned a lesson that day. They learned to be respectful and not cheap. And they had more fun with the bugs that did not hurt them.Once there was a little girl who really loved to celebrate. Every weekend her family celebrated something. One weekend they celebrated the sun. They put their hands out and shouted hurray for the sun! One day there was a special celebration. After the party was over the little girl knew that it was because of the xray that they had a reason to celebrate. She was so glad that she was able to take an xray and have a reason to celebrate with her family and friends.Once there was a small boy who was very wealthy. The girl smiles and says, Hi, I am Mia. Thank you for your ball. It is very nice. Do you want to try my bike? She gives her bike to Tom. Tom is happy and surprised. He has never ridden a bike before. He tries to get on the bike, but it is too big for him. He falls down and hurts his knee. He cries. Mia runs to him and says, I am sorry, Tom. Are you okay? Here, take your ball back. It is better for you. And here, have a hug. It will make you feel better. She gives him his ball and a hug. Tom stops crying and smiles. He says, Thank you, Mia. You are very kind. I like you. Do you want to be my friend? Mia says, Yes, Tom. I like you too. You are very brave. Do you want to play with me and my bike? I can teach you how to ride it. Tom says, Yes, Mia. I want to play with you and your bike. You can teach me how to ride it. And I can teach you how to throw my ball. We can have fun together. Tom and Mia become friends. They play with the ball and the bike. They share and give and learn. They are normal and quick and happy.Once upon a time, there was a humble rabbit named Benny. He liked to stand on his hind legs and hop around. One day, Benny found a shiny diamond in the grass. He was so happy and showed it to his friend, a little bird. Look, look! Benny said, holding up the diamond. Pretty! The bird looked at the diamond and said, Wow, thats amazing! Can I hold it? Benny gave the diamond to the bird, who flew up into the sky with it. Benny watched as the diamond sparkled in the sun. He felt proud and happy that he had found something so special. From that day on, Benny continued to stand tall and hop around, grateful for the little things in life.Lily was a little girl who liked to play with her toys. She had a doll, a bear, a ball and a car. She liked to make them talk and move. She was very happy. One day, she saw a new toy in the shop. It was a cat. A cat that could blink and meow. Lily wanted the cat very much. She asked her mom if she could have it. Her mom said yes, but only if she was good. Lily was very good. She helped her mom with the dishes, the laundry and the dusting. She did not cry or fuss. She was very patient. When they went back to the shop, Lily ran to the cat. She picked it up and hugged it. She felt its soft fur and its wet nose. She saw its green eyes blink at her. She heard it meow softly. She was very happy. She thanked her mom and took the cat home. She gave it a name Fluffy. She played with Fluffy all day. She fed it, brushed it and cuddled it. She kissed its lip and whispered in its ear. She was very happy. Fluffy was happy too. It liked Lily very much. It followed her everywhere. It was very alert. It watched her toys, her books and her bed. It was very curious. They became best friends. Lily and Fluffy. They blinked, meowed and smiled at each other. They were very happy.Once upon a time there was a little girl called katrine. She had a great big smile and she was always happy. One day she was so excited to go to the park and swing on the swing. Katrine sat on the swing and she began to swing back and forth. As the swing started to go higher and higher, she noticed something on the ground. What is it? She thought to herself. She jumped off the swing and found an impressive diamond. She picked it up and showed it to her mom. Mom, can I keep this?, she asked. Her mom hesitated but finally responded, You know diamonds have a lot of value. So, I guess you can keep it. Katrine was so happy and ran around the park, showing her diamond to everyone. Suddenly a man appeared and said, Where did you get that diamond?. Katrine didnt know what to do so she stayed quiet. The man took the diamond away, explaining that it was his. Katrine was sad and disappointed that she had to give away something of value. She knew nothing implressive would ever be hers.John and his parents decided to go for a ride in the park. John saw an old man standing beside a motorcycle, so he asked his dad Dad, can I have a ride on that motorcycle? Dad looked kindly at John and said John, we should be compassionate. This old man must need the motorcycle more than we do. We should ask him if he would be willing to borrow it to us. Johns parents walked over to the old man and asked politely if they could borrow his motorcycle. The old man looked surprised, but he said Of course, Id be happy to let you borrow it. Thank you for being so respectful. John was excited to ride the motorcycle, but he remembered that his parents had taught him to be respectful and compassionate. He learned you must always be kind and considerate to others. John thanked the old man and said goodbye when it was time for them to leave. The old man smiled and waved goodbye, grateful for their understanding. John and his family had a wonderful time in the park, and he remembered the importance of being compassionate and polite.Once upon a time there was a big shelf. It was very tall and had lots of different toys on it. One day, the shelf began to shrink. It slowly got smaller and smaller. The toys on the shelf couldnt believe what was happening. They all hopped off quickly so they wouldnt get squished. Whats happening? asked a blue toy car. Im not sure, replied a yellow stuffed bear. Suddenly, a voice came from the shelf. Im shrinking because there arent enough toys available now, said the shelf. The toys were surprised. The yellow bear asked, What can we do to help? If more toys were available, then I wouldnt shrink anymore, said the shelf. The toys all rushed around to look for more toys. Soon, they had enough to fill the shelf. The shelf stopped shrinking and was back to its usual size. The toys cheered in delight! They all hopped back onto the shelf, ready to have lots of fun together.John and his mom were looking at some clothes in the store. But this hanger helps us measure the length of the clothes, she said. John was confused. What does measure mean, Mommy? he asked. His mom smiled and said, To measure something is to find out how big or how small it is. We dont know how big or how small these clothes are yet thats why its an unknown! John smiled and said, Okay! He says, This is my home. There is a lot of honey here. Do you want some? Ant is hungry. He says, Yes, please. I love honey. Thank you for sharing with me. He follows Bee to the hive. They see many other bees working and buzzing. Ant is scared. He says, Are they angry? Will they sting me? Bee says, No, they are fine. They are my family. They make honey and take care of the hive. They will not hurt you if you are nice. Come, I will show you where the honey is. He leads Ant to a comb full of golden honey. He says, Here, you can have some. But not too much. We need to save some for winter. Ant says, Okay, I understand. I will only take a little bit. It is very sweet and yummy. You are very kind, Bee. I am glad we are friends. He takes a small bite of honey and smiles. Bee smiles too. He says, Me too, Ant. You are very brave and smart. We are different, but we can share and have fun. That is what friends do. They eat some honey and then go back to play in the sun. They are happy.Anna and Ben are twins. They like to play outside in the park. One day, they see a big truck with a picture of icecream on it. Tony wanted to restore the tree so he tried to think of what he could do. Suddenly Tony had a brilliant idea. He decided to use his bunny ears to make music to restore the tree. He delayed for a little bit, but then he went inside. After lunch, Timmy went back outside to look at bugs again. He found a really strong ant that could carry a big crumb! Timmy was amazed. One day, the river became very fast and the fish could not swim well. The duck saw the fish struggling and knew he had to help. The duck used his beak to carry the fish to safety. The fish was very grateful and thanked the duck. The duck just nodded and they continued to be friends. From that day on, the duck and the fish always looked out for each other. The radish asked to borrow the basket, so he could store his treasures. The carrot was happy to help and handed over the basket. When he got home, he showed the corn to his wife and said, Look at what I discovered today! Isnt it beautiful? The wife looked at the corn and said, Its lovely, but you should have left some for the other people who live on this farm. That way everyone can benefit from what you have discovered. The farmer thought about his wifes words and decided that she was right. So he took some of the corn back to the field and left it for the other people to enjoy. Just when he thought he was going to sink, a friendly dolphin came to rescue him. The dolphin swam the captain safely back to the boat. From that day on, the captain had a new friend and helper. He held the box with both of his hands and opened it. To his surprise there was a small box inside the box. Inside the small box was a note which read the truth is inside. At the hospital, the doctors put John in a big bed and checked him all over. He was suffering a lot and couldnt feel like playing any more. His parents were very worried. The doctor said John is not feeling very good, he needs to stay in the hospital for a few days while we take care of him. John was very scared. Is it going to hurt? he asked the doctor. The doctor replied, Im sorry, it might be a bit uncomfortable, but well do our best to make sure you stay strong, he said. They are happy to start a new day.Ben and Mia liked to play near the park. The park had a big pond with ducks and fish. The park also had a rail that stopped people from falling into the pond. Ben and Mias mom always told them to stay away from the rail and not to climb on it. One day, Ben and Mia saw some older kids climbing on the rail. They looked like they were having fun. Ben wanted to join them, but Mia was scared. She said, Mom said no. It is not safe. We can fall and get hurt. Ben said, Mom is not here. She will not know. I want to try. It looks easy. He ran to the rail and started to climb on it. Mia followed him and said, Please, Ben, come back. It is not good. You are not listening. But Ben did not listen. He climbed higher and higher on the rail. He felt brave and happy. He said, Look at me, Mia. I am so high. I can see everything. Mia said, Ben, be careful. The rail is not strong. It can break. You can fall. But Ben did not hear her. He was too busy looking around. He did not see that the rail was old and rusty. He did not see that it was shaking and cracking. He did not see that it was about to snap. Suddenly, the rail broke. Ben screamed and fell into the pond. He splashed and sank. He was scared and cold. He could not swim. He could not breathe. Mia saw what happened. She was calm and smart. She ran to the older kids and asked for help. They called for a grownup. The grownup came and jumped into the pond. He grabbed Ben and pulled him out. He gave him a towel and checked if he was okay. Ben was wet and shivering. He was sorry and sad. He said, Thank you, sir. Thank you, Mia. I was wrong. I should have listened to mom. I should have listened to you. I was not safe. I was not good. Mia hugged him and said, It is okay, Ben. I am glad you are okay. I love you. But next time, please do not climb on the rail. It is not fun. It is dangerous. Ben nodded and said, I promise, Mia. I learned my lesson. I will not do it again. I will be good. The moral of the story is Do not do things that are not permitted. They can be harmful and hurtful. Listen to your mom and your sister. They know what is best for you. Be calm and smart. Ask for help when you need it.Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Tim. Tim liked to play and move all day. One day, while playing in his room, he saw a switch on the wall. He had never seen this switch before. Tim was curious. Tim asked his mom, What does this switch do? His mom said, It makes the room bright when it is dark. You can try it when the sun goes down. That night, when the sun went down, Tim went to his room. He remembered the switch on the wall. He moved his hand up and touched the switch. The room became bright! Tim was happy and showed his mom. They both smiled and played in the bright room.Once upon a time, there was a lazy leg. The leg liked to drop everywhere. He dropped from the bed, the chair, and even from the table. Everywhere the lazy leg went, he dropped. On a sunny day, the lazy leg decided to go for a walk. He dropped from one step to the next, not even trying to jump. He dropped down, around and about until he reached the end of the street. Suddenly, a big dog raced out of a house and dashed after the lazy leg. The lazy leg was so scared and tried to run, but he only dropped from one place to the next. He kept on dropping until he saw his house and jumped in the front door. The lazy leg was very happy that he made it home safe. From that day, the lazy leg was careful not to drop too much!Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jack and Jill. They were playing together in the park on a sunny day. Suddenly, they heard a loud scream, coming from a tree. Jack and Jill were very scared, so they ran to the tree to find out what it was. When they reached the tree, they saw a small bird sitting on a plate. The plate looked very dry, so Jack and Jill thought the bird must have been very thirsty. We need to get this bird some water, Jack said. Jill nodded in agreement and the two friends ran off to find the bird some water. They soon came back with a full plate of cool, refreshing water. The bird was so thankful and started to drink the water. After it was done, the bird flew away with a happy chirp. Jack and Jill were so relieved to have helped the bird and returned home with a big smile on their faces.Once upon a time, there was a monkey who lived in the forest. She began to levitate! Suddenly, Tilly flew above the trees and all over the sky! A nearby farmer saw Tilly and he started shouting at her. Come down, Tilly! Come down this instant!, he yelled. They thought that if they rubbed the matches on the safe, it would get hot and melt. They took the box of matches and went to the safe, which was in their dads office. They did not see the sign that said Danger Flammable. Lila and Ben rubbed the matches on the safe, but nothing happened. They rubbed harder and faster, until one of the matches lit up. They were excited and scared. They dropped the match on the floor, where it met a pile of papers. The papers caught fire and soon the whole office was in flames. Help! Help! Lila and Ben screamed. She had a cozy nest with her mom and dad and two brothers. Sara liked to sing and play with her brothers, but sometimes she was selfish. She wanted to have the best twigs and feathers for her nest, and she did not like to share. One day, a big storm came to the tree. The wind was loud and scary, and it shook the branches. Sara was afraid and hid in her nest. She saw that her brothers were afraid too, and they wanted to cuddle with their mom and dad. But Sara did not let them. She said, This is my nest, and you cannot come in. Go away! Her brothers were sad and hurt. They tried to find another place to hide, but the storm was too strong. They cried and called for Sara, but she did not listen. She thought she was safe and warm in her nest, and she did not care about her brothers. But then, something bad happened. A big gust of wind blew Saras nest away from the tree. Sara screamed and flapped her wings, but she could not fly. She fell and fell, until she landed on the ground. She was hurt and cold and alone. She wished she had her mom and dad and brothers with her. She realized she had been very selfish and mean. She looked up and saw her family flying down to her. They were worried and scared for her. They hugged her and comforted her. They said, We love you, Sara, and we are sorry you lost your nest. But we are happy you are alive. We will help you and make a new nest together. Sara felt sorry and ashamed. She said, I love you too, and I am sorry I was selfish and mean. I did not share my nest with you, and I did not care about you. Can you forgive me? Her mom and dad and brothers smiled and said, Of course we forgive you, Sara. You are our sister, and we are a family. We will always stick together, no matter what. Sara learned a lesson that day. She learned that being selfish is not good, and that sharing and caring is better. She learned that her nest was not just a pile of twigs and feathers, but a home filled with love. She learned that her family was the best thing she had, and she never wanted to lose them again.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy navy ships in the bathtub. One day, his mom told him it was time to get out of the tub and go to bed. Timmy promised his mom that he would be obedient and go to bed right away. But instead of going to bed, he snuck back into the bathroom to play with his navy ships some more. Suddenly, Timmy knocked over the bottle of bubble bath and made a big mess. His mom heard the noise and came to see what happened. She was very upset and told Timmy that he had broken his promise to be obedient. Timmy was sad and went to bed feeling guilty. The next day, he apologized to his mom and promised to be more obedient in the future. From then on, Timmy always kept his promises and was a good boy.Once upon a time, there was a beautiful independent dove. She liked to stay on her own and do her own thing. One day she was flying around looking for somewhere to stay for the night. Suddenly she saw a nice big tree with a cozy nest in its branches. She flew over to take a closer look. The nest looked perfect, so she decided to stay there for the night. She settled down in the nest, feeling nice and safe there. But just when she was about to sleep, a little bird flew up to see who was there. It was a little three year old bird. The three year old bird was happy to see the dove and asked if she was staying in the nest. The dove said yes, and the three year old bird asked if they could stay together. The dove thought about it and thought it would be nice to have some company. So she said yes, and the whole night they stayed together in the nest, chatting and laughing and telling stories until the morning. The next morning the dove said goodbye to the three year old bird and flew away to find another place to stay. But she was always thankful for her night with the little bird. From then on, she was even more independent, ready to stay anywhere she wanted.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends. Timmy ran to his friends and said, Hey guys, we better go inside. The weather is going to be bad soon. His friends agreed and they all went inside to play. One day, he fancied playing in the rain and so he ran outside when it started to shower. His mom saw him from the window and called out to him, Tom! You naughty boy! Come inside now! Tom just ignored her and kept playing, so his mom opened the window and shouted, Tom! If you dont come inside, Im going to frown! Tom stopped playing and looked up. He was a bit scared, so he ran inside as fast as he could. His mom smiled and said, Now Tom, dont be naughty and go play inside. Tom nodded, trying to hide a naughty smile. He was glad his mom hadnt had to frown.Once upon a time, there was a smart swan who lived in a pond. He often played and sang in the pond. One day, he saw a little girl in the pond. She was trying to catch the fish but was not very successful. The swan swam closer and said, Why dont you use a sharp hook? The little girl smiled and thanked him for his advice. She quickly sharpened a stick and threaded it with a piece of string. She cast it in the water and within minutes, she had caught a fish! The swan was pleased and he said, You are so smart! You should come to the pond more often! The little girl smiled and said she would. From that day onwards, she would come to the pond to see the swan and learn from him. She was so smart that she soon became one of the best fishers around.Once upon a time, there was a very wealthy man who loved to sit in his chair. He always looked down on the people who had less than he did. Every day, he would remind himself how wealthy he was, and how better he was than anyone else. One day, an old woman walked up to the wealthy man and said she wanted to change places. The man laughed and said no. But the old woman asked again, and again the wealthy man said no. Finally, the old woman asked the wealthy man, if I can make this chair move backwards, will you agree to change places with me?. The wealthy man thought it was impossible, but he agreed. The old woman then began to move the chair slowly backwards. The wealthy man then realised how fortunate he was, and how truly blessed he was to have all the wealth he had. He learned a lesson that day and made sure to never again look down on other people who didnt have as much as him. The moral of this story is that being truly wealthy is about what you have in your heart, not just what you have in your pocket.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Suddenly, the man heard a loud noise. He turned around and saw a huge tree falling down. The tree had been too close to the fire and it burned too much. The man was scared and ran away from the fire. He realized that he needed to be careful when he made a fire in the forest. From that day on, the man always made sure to keep his fire far away from the trees. He felt very tired from all the work he had been doing in the hot sun. He decided to take a break, so he walked over to the fence and sat down. He closed his eyes and took a few deep breaths. Ollie was very happy and excited. He invited his best friends, Sammy the seal, Lila the beaver, and Finn the dolphin. They all came to his party and brought him presents. They played games, sang songs, and ate cake. Ollie felt very loved and special. But there was one thing that Ollie wished for more than anything. He wished he could see a rainbow. Mom smiled and gave them the juice and cookies. She said, Youre welcome, my sweeties. You have been playing very nicely. Enjoy your snack. Lily and Ben took a sip of their juice. It was orange juice. It had a sweet and sour taste. They liked it. They took a bite of their cookies. They were chocolate chip cookies. They had a soft and crunchy taste. They liked them too. They looked at each other and smiled. They were happy and full. They were not envious of each other. They shared their snack and their spray bottle. They said, We love you, Mom. And we love each other.Once there was a little boy named Joe. One day Joe went to a garden and saw a big apple tree. He was so excited and couldnt wait to eat an apple. As he approached the tree he heard a voice say stop. Joe looked up and saw a purple bird perched on the branch. The bird said That apple is mine! Dont you even think about taking it. Joe was very upset by the birds words. He tried to reason with the bird but the bird was very stubborn. In the end, Joe had a great idea. He offered the bird another apple in exchange for the one on the branch. The bird was delighted with this and accepted the deal. Joe got the apple, and the bird got the one Joe had offered. They both smiled and went their separate ways. Joe was very happy that he got to have the apple. He was even more happy that he was able to solve the conflict in a friendly way.Once upon a time, there was a mom and her daughter. The daughter was very sweet and pretty. She loved jam. They saw many animals, like lions, monkeys, and giraffes. But Tim and Lily liked the penguins best. They watched them swim and slide on the ice. Can we feed them? Lily asked Mom. No, sweetie, we cant. They have their own food, Mom said. Tim saw a man with a bucket of fish. He was wearing a blue coat and a hat. He looked like he worked at the zoo. Maybe he can give us some fish to feed the penguins, Tim said. He ran to the man and said, Hello, sir. Can we have some fish, please? The man smiled and said, Sure, kid. You can have one fish each. But be careful, they might bite. He offered Tim and Lily a fish from the bucket. Tim and Lily thanked him and walked to the penguin pool. They held the fish in their hands and waved them at the penguins. The penguins saw the fish and came closer. They made loud noises and flapped their wings. Some of them jumped out of the water and tried to grab the fish. Wow, they are hungry! Lily said. But one penguin was different. He was smaller and quieter than the others. He stayed in the corner of the pool and looked sad. Whats wrong with him? Tim asked. I dont know. Maybe he is sick or lonely, Lily said. She felt sorry for the little penguin. She decided to give him her fish. She walked to the edge of the pool and said, Here, little penguin. This is for you. I hope you like it. She threw the fish to the penguin. He looked surprised and happy. He caught the fish in his beak and ate it. He waddled to Lily and rubbed his head against her hand. He made a soft noise. Aw, he likes you! Tim said. Lily smiled and petted the penguin. He felt warm and soft. She said, Youre welcome, little penguin. Youre very cute. The penguin nodded and smiled. He followed Lily wherever she went. They call him Ducky and he loves to swim in the bathtub. The little girl was so happy to have saved the fake ducks life. She fell in love with her rescue and she would never forget her adventure.Once upon a time, there was a rabbit. The rabbit was hopping around the forest, searching for something delicious and yummy to eat. Then, the rabbit saw something glittery, shiny, and blue it was a jet! The rabbit was so excited and could not wait to taste the jet. But, when the rabbit got close to the jet, it quickly noticed that the jet was dead. The rabbit was so sad and disappointed. The moral of this story is that we should only try to taste things that look alive. Sometimes, what we first notice might not be what we were expecting. So, be careful about what you decide to taste!Once there were two friends, Jodie and Tommy. Jodie was persistent and Tommy was patient. They wanted to find a diamond. So they went looking together. Ben says, No, I will win. I am smart and clever. They start the race. They push the tire as hard as they can. The tire goes very fast. Lily and Ben run after it. They laugh and shout. The moral of this story is that it is important to listen to our parents, so that we don√¢t miss out on the beautiful things life has to offer. As a dessert, the family had ice cream and giggled together about the fun day they had at the beach.Once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved to read books. One day, he was reading his favorite story when he heard a knock at the door. He went to answer it and found a stranger there. The little boy was a bit scared but the stranger was very friendly and smiled. The stranger asked him if he wanted to hear a story and the little boy was so excited that he nodded eagerly. The stranger started to read a story about a magical dragon and soon, the little boy was completely entranced. He dozed off to sleep with his chin resting on his chest as the friendly stranger went on. When the story was finally finished, the friendly stranger kissed the little boy on the forehead and left. The little boy loved his new story, and he never forgot the friendly stranger who had read it to him. And wherever the stranger was, the magical dragon was thought of too.One day, Tom and Sally went for a walk. Tom saw something sparkly on the ground. He went over to mark it. Sally asked, What is it? Tom replied, I do not know. Lets see how much weight it has. They picked the sparkly thing up. It felt quite heavy. Sally said, I think it is the key to something! Tom was alert and quickly looked around but he did not spot anything. They put the key in Toms pocket. They walked away and suddenly noticed a chest. It was standing there, all alone. They were excited and ran over. Tom took the key out and opened the chest. Inside, they found some candy and a funny toy! They were so happy and quickly thanked the key for leading them to this surprise.Once upon a time, there was a bee. He flew around looking for a place to live. He found a big open field and flew around it until he found the perfect spot. He started to build a nest, but it was not easy. One day, he saw a little hole in the ground. It was a nice hole, so he decided to bury his nest inside. He started to bury the nest and worked very hard. When he was done, the nest was deep in the ground. The bee was so happy. He flew around the open field, looking for flowers to eat. He was happy and safe in his nest. The bee lived in its nest for a long time. It was always warm and cozy there. One day, however, the bee died. So the bees friends buried him underneath the open field too. He was next to his nest, so he was happy forever after. Thats the end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat avocados, but her brother, Max, thought they were disgusting. Max shook his head and said, No way, I dont want to eat that gross thing. Suddenly, Lily had an idea. She said, Lets play a game. Well reverse roles and you can be me and Ill be you. That means you have to eat the avocado and Ill eat something you like. Max thought about it for a moment and finally agreed. The tornado was so surprised that it stopped spinning. The town was safe, and the people cheered for Lily. She had a special teacher who helped her learn with signs and pictures. She also had many friends who played with her and talked to her with their hands. One day, Lily found a magic ring in the playground. It was shiny and had a big red stone. She put it on her finger and felt a strange tingling. She looked around and saw that everything was getting bigger. Or maybe she was getting smaller. She was shrinking! She tried to take off the ring, but it was stuck. She got scared and ran to find her teacher. But she was so tiny that no one could see her or hear her. She called out with her voice and her signs, but it was no use. She felt alone and lost. She saw a big ant crawling near her. It was bigger than her head. She was afraid it would bite her. She ran away from it, but it followed her. She saw a hole in the ground and jumped in. She hoped the ant would not find her. She landed on something soft and warm. It was a mouse. The mouse looked at her with curious eyes. It sniffed her and licked her. It did not hurt her. It was friendly. Lily felt a little better. She smiled at the mouse and stroked its fur. The mouse squeaked and nuzzled her. Maybe the mouse could help her. Maybe it could take her to her teacher. She pointed at the ring and made a sign for help. The mouse nodded and picked her up gently. It ran out of the hole and across the playground. It dodged the ant and the children and the teachers. It found Lilys teacher and dropped her on her lap. Lilys teacher was surprised and happy. She saw the ring and understood what had happened. She took off the ring and gave it to the mouse. She thanked the mouse and hugged Lily. Lily hugged her back and thanked the mouse too. The mouse winked and ran away. Lily was back to her normal size. She was glad and relieved. The egg cracked and Tweety was sad. Tweetys friends saw him crying and asked him what happened. Tweety showed them the cracked egg and they all felt sorry for him. But then, one of the friends had an idea. She said they should pray to the birdie gods to help fix the egg. Tweety and his friends closed their eyes and prayed really hard. Suddenly, something amazing happened. The egg started to move and wiggle. It was like magic! The egg hatched and a cute little chick came out. Tweety was so happy and his friends were amazed. They all hugged and played with the new chick. Tweety learned that even when things seem bad, praying can make them better. And the little chick was so flexible, it could even do somersaults!Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and explore. One day, she found a big rock in her backyard. She wanted to see what was underneath it, but it was too heavy for her to lift. Lily went to her mom and said, Mommy, can you help me lift this rock? I want to see whats under it. Her mom said, Sure, lets lift it together. They both lifted the rock and found a little bug hiding underneath. Lily was so happy and said, Look mommy, we found a bug! Is it safe for it to be outside without oxygen? Her mom explained that bugs breathe oxygen just like we do and its safe for them to be outside. Lily was relieved and said, Phew, Im glad the bug is safe. Thank you for helping me lift the rock, mommy! Her mom smiled and said, Anytime, sweetie.One day, Arnold and his family were on their way to the park. Arnold was so excited, he could barely wait to get there. He knew it was going to be perfect. As they drove along in their family vehicle, Arnold noticed an old tractor in the field next to them. He asked his Mom if they could part and go see it. But his Mom said no, they were running late, so they had to keep going. Arnold was really disappointed. He really wanted to see the old tractor and he knew it was perfect. But they just couldnt part and go see it. So, Arnold decided to do something. He asked his Dad if they could at least drive by slowly and take a look at it. His Dad smiled and agreed. So, as they drove along, Arnold was so happy, as he was able to catch a glimpse of the tractor. It was perfect!Tom and Sam are brothers. They like to play with cars and balls. But they have to go to school every day. They have to wake up early and get ready. One day, Tom and Sam hear their mom say, Hurry, boys! Its time to go to school. Look at the clock. Its almost eight. Tom and Sam look at the clock. It has a big hand and a small hand. The big hand is near the eight and the small hand is near the twelve. That means it is almost eight oclock. Tom jumps out of bed and puts on his clothes. He brushes his teeth and combs his hair. He packs his bag and goes to the kitchen. He eats his breakfast and says, Thank you, mom. Im ready to go. Sam stays in bed and says, I dont want to go to school. I want to play. He covers his head with his blanket and closes his eyes. He ignores his mom and the clock. Mom says, Sam, hurry up. You will be late. You have to go to school. You will learn new things and make new friends. School is good for you. But Sam does not listen. He says, No, no, no. I dont like school. I like to play. Mom gets angry and says, Sam, if you dont get up now, you will miss the bus. You will have to walk to school. And you will miss the fun activities and the snacks. You will be sad and sorry. But Sam does not care. He says, I dont care. I dont want to go. Tom says, Sam, please hurry. I dont want to go without you. We are brothers. We should go together. School is fun. You will like it. Please, please, please. But Sam does not listen. He says, Go away. Leave me alone. I want to play. Tom sighs and says, Okay, Sam. I will go. But I will miss you. I hope you change your mind. He kisses his mom and says, Bye, mom. I love you. He takes his bag and goes to the bus stop. He sees his friends and smiles. He gets on the bus and waves to his mom. Sam hears the bus leave and feels lonely. He looks at the clock. It is past eight. He thinks, Maybe I made a mistake. Maybe school is not so bad. Maybe I should have listened to mom and Tom. Maybe I should have hurried. He gets out of bed and puts on his clothes. He brushes his teeth and combs his hair. He packs his bag and goes to the kitchen. He sees his mom and says, Mom, Im sorry. I was wrong. I want to go to school. Can you take me? Mom says, Sam, Im glad you changed your mind. But you are too late. The bus is gone. You have to walk to school. It is far and hard. You will be tired and hungry. You will miss the fun activities and the snacks. You will be sad and sorry. She gives him a sandwich and a bottle of water. She says, Here, take this. You will need it. And be careful on the road. I love you. She kisses him and says, Bye, Sam. I hope you learn your lesson. Sam says, Bye, mom. I love you too. Im sorry. I will learn my lesson. He takes his sandwich and his water. He goes to the road and starts to walk. He sees the cars and the bikes. He sees the trees and the flowers. He sees the birds and the bugs. He thinks, This is not fun. This is boring. I wish I was on the bus with Tom and my friends. I wish I was at school with them. I wish I had hurried. The moral of the story is You should listen to your mom and hurry when she tells you to. School is good for you and fun. You should not waste your time and miss your chance. You should be a good brother and a good friend. You should be a good boy.Once upon a time, there was a little brown mouse who lived in a big chimney. One day, the mouse had a special request. He wanted to have a friend to play with. He peered out of the chimney and looked around. Just then, the mouse saw a small brown bird perched on a nearby tree. The mouse peered at the bird and called out, Hey! Can you be my friend? The bird thought for a moment, then replied, Yes! I would like that. The mouse and the bird played together for a long time. They both had lots of fun! They raced and hide and seek, and ran through the grass in the sunshine. From that day forward, the mouse and the bird were the best of friends. They played together every day and were never apart. The end.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old. Sarah was feeling very cold one day, and she was also feeling a bit sad. She didnt want to go outside and play, and stayed in bed with a blanket. Her dad saw that she was not feeling well, and wanted to encourage her. So he took out a special treat from the kitchen. It was a big, sugary, chocolate bar! He said to Sarah, Its ok to stay in bed today, but I want to encourage you to feel a little better. Sarah was very excited when she saw the treat. She still felt cold, but the treat made her feel a little bit better. Her dad said, Lets enjoy this special treat together before you go back to bed. Sarah smiled and said, Thank you, daddy!. And she and her dad shared the special treat before it was time for her rest. Sarah was so happy that her dad encouraged her and gave her a special treat!Sam and Mia are playing in the backyard. They have a lot of equipment to have fun. They have a ball, a bike, a slide, and a hose. Sam likes to spray water with the hose. He thinks it is funny to make things wet. Look, Mia, I can spray the ball! Sam says. He turns on the hose and points it at the ball. The water hits the ball and makes it roll away. Wow, Sam, you are strong! Mia says. She claps her hands and laughs. She likes to see the ball move. Thank you, Mia. Do you want to try? Sam asks. He gives the hose to Mia. Mia takes the hose and tries to spray the ball. But the hose is too heavy for her. She drops the hose and the water sprays everywhere. Oops, Mia, you made a mess! Sam says. He runs to pick up the hose. He turns off the water and puts the hose away. Sorry, Sam. The hose is too big for me. I need a smaller one. Mia says. She looks sad. Its okay, Mia. Dont be sad. We can play with something else. How about the bike? Sam says. He smiles and hugs Mia. Okay, Sam. I like the bike. Lets go! Mia says. She smiles and hugs Sam back. They leave the wet ball and the hose behind. He wanted to have something delicious to eat. But all Bobby could find in the sea was seaweed. One day, Bobby asked his mother if there was anything better than seaweed. His mother got a twinkle in her eye and said, I can give you the most incredible thing in the world. I promise I will get you some tuna if you follow me. Bobby was so excited he could barely contain himself! He swam after his mother and they came to a magical cave. Inside the cave, Bobby saw a big pile of golden tuna. He couldnt believe his eyes! Bobby gobbled as much tuna as he could, saying thank you to his mother. His mother smiled and said, You are welcome, Bobby. I promised you the most incredible thing in the world and here it is! Bobby smiled and enjoyed his delicious treat!Tom was a bird who liked to deliver things. He had a big bag of seeds that he took from the farm. He flew to his friends in the forest and gave them some seeds. They were happy and said thank you. But Tom was lonely. He had no friends who were birds like him. He only saw them when he delivered things. He wished he had someone to fly with and talk to. One day, he saw a bright green vine. It was hanging from a big tree. It looked like a long snake. Tom was curious. He flew closer and said hello. The vine moved and said hello back. It was not a snake. It was a parrot. A parrot who had escaped from a cage. He was also lonely. He had no friends who were parrots like him. He only saw them in books and pictures. Tom and the parrot became friends. They flew together and talked to each other. The boat was going to sink, and the people on it were very scared. Tweetie wanted to help, but she didnt know what to do. Suddenly, she remembered something her mommy had told her. If you ever see someone in trouble, try to find land and lead them there. So, Tweetie flew around until she found a nearby island. She flew back to the boat and chirped as loud as she could to get their attention. Then, she led them to the island where they were safe. The people on the boat were so grateful to Tweetie for saving them. They gave her lots of hugs and kisses and thanked her over and over again. From that day on, Tweetie felt very proud of herself for helping others. After a while, the sound went away and the cactus uncovered itself. It was so relieved that it went back to its naps with its blanket. The happy cactus lived happily ever after in the desert.Once upon a time, there was a chubby little girl named Daisy. She liked to pinch things. One day, in the park, she saw an opera. He ran to his dad and said, Dad, dad, the pool has a hole! Can you repair it? Dad looked at the pool and nodded. He said, Yes, Ben, I can repair it. But I need some tape and glue. Can you help me find them? Ben said, Yes, dad, I can help you. I know where the tape and glue are. They are hidden in the garage. Lily hid them there. She likes to hide things. Ben and dad went to the garage. They looked for the tape and glue. But they could not find them. Lily had hidden them very well. Ben and dad were frustrated. They wanted to repair the pool. One day, Max went to the store to get some cheese. He loved cheese so much! But when he got to the store, he saw a big grumpy cat. The cat looked hungry and mean. Max was scared, so he ran back to his hole. Later that day, Max heard a noise outside his hole. It was the cat! The cat had found Maxs hole and was trying to get in. Max was so scared, he didnt know what to do. He peeked out of his hole and saw the cats big paws. Max knew he had to do something. Max called out, Hey cat! Why are you so grumpy? Do you want some cheese? The cat stopped and looked at Max. Cheese? I love cheese! the cat said. Max quickly ran to the store and got some cheese. He brought it back to the cat and they shared it together. From that day on, the cat and Max were friends and Max never went to the store alone again.Tom and Anna liked to play with their toy train. She said to Tom, That is not nice. We should share the train. It is ours, not yours. But Tom did not listen. He took the train and all the cars and went to his room. He said, Hello, Lily. I am here to make you feel better. Do you want to play with me? Lily nodded and smiled back. She liked the bear. He was warm and cuddly and fun. She had many rocks of different colors and shapes in her box. She was proud of her rocks and showed them to her friends. One day, she saw a shiny rock in the park. It was the most beautiful rock she had ever seen. It sparkled in the sun and had many colors. She wanted to have it for her box. She ran to the rock and picked it up. She looked around and saw a big rock nearby. She decided to replace the big rock with the shiny rock. She thought no one would notice. But Sam saw what she did. Sam was playing with his ball in the park. He liked the big rock and used it as a goal. He was envious of Lilys shiny rock. He thought it was not fair that she took it. He ran to Lily and said, That is not your rock. You took it from the park. You have to give it back. Lily did not want to give it back. She said, No, it is my rock. I found it. You have many balls. You do not need the big rock. They started to argue and tug at the shiny rock. They did not see the park ranger coming. He heard them and saw what they did. He was not happy. He said, What are you doing? You cannot take rocks from the park. They belong to everyone. You have to put them back where you found them. He made Lily and Sam replace the rocks. He told them to say sorry to each other and to the park. He said, You can look at the rocks, but you cannot keep them. You can find other things to play with and share with your friends. Lily and Sam felt ashamed. They said sorry and put the rocks back. They decided to play with Sams ball instead. They learned to respect the park and each other. They became friends and shared their toys. They still liked rocks, but they did not take them anymore.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the beach with her family. Every time they went, she would run to the water and jump over the waves. She enjoyed feeling the water on her toes and the sand in her hands. One day, they went to the beach in the evening. It was getting dark and the sky was turning black. Lily was a little scared of the dark, but she still wanted to play. She asked her dad if they could go closer to the water. He said yes and they walked towards the waves. Lily saw the waves crashing against the shore and she thought it was so cool. She loved how the water moved and made a loud sound. She felt happy and safe with her family by her side. Even though it was dark, Lily enjoyed playing at the beach with her family.Tom and Lily were at the park with their mom. They saw a big slide and ran to it. They wanted to ride the slide and have fun. But there was a woman in front of the slide. She was rude. She did not let Tom and Lily go on the slide. She said, This is my slide. Go away. You are too small and slow. Tom and Lily were sad and angry. They did not like the woman. They wanted to ride the slide. They asked their mom for help. Their mom came to the woman and said, Excuse me, can you please share the slide with my children? They are waiting nicely and they want to have a turn. The woman looked at their mom and said, No, I cant. This is my slide. I paid for it. You and your children are not welcome here. Go find another slide. Their mom was shocked and mad. She said, That is not true. This is a public park. The slide is for everyone. You are being very rude and selfish. You need to move and let others play. The woman did not listen. She said, No, I wont. This is my slide. You cant make me. Their mom said, Yes, I can. I will call the park ranger and he will make you. He will tell you to follow the rules and be nice. Or he will ask you to leave the park. The woman was scared. She did not want to talk to the park ranger. She did not want to leave the park. She said, Fine, fine. I will share the slide. But only for a little bit. Then I will come back and ride it again. She moved away from the slide and let Tom and Lily go on it. Tom and Lily were happy. They thanked their mom and rode the slide. They had fun. The woman watched them and frowned. She was not happy. She was still rude.Once upon a time there was a little bird named Rupert. Rupert was always very peaceful and he loved to spend the mornings singing in the tree. One morning, Rupert was singing his song and he saw a little caterpillar named Carly walking underneath the tree. Rupert looked down and said Hello Carly, what are you doing down there? Carly said, Im trying to find a way to cross this river but its so wide I dont know how Ill get over. Rupert said, Dont worry, I can help you! Let me fly down and Ill carry you on my neck across the river. Carly was so excited. Rupert flew down to the river and perched on the bank. Carly climbed onto Ruperts neck and he flew over, carrying her safely across the river. When they finally reached the other side, Rupert said, Carly, you can now go on your way. I hope you learned that if you help others, youll get help in return! Carly was very thankful for Ruperts help and with a smile she waved goodbye and continued on her way. Rupert watched Carly go and then he flew back across the river, reversing the journey that he had taken with Carly on his neck. He was very grateful that he could help Carly and remembered the lesson that he had learnt that its important to help others.Alice was a three year old girl. She loved to explore her world. She asked him, √¢≈ìHow can I help you?√¢ Little Bob said, √¢I am trying to number the mailboxes on my street√¢ The lady veterinarian was very understanding and kindly gave him some advice. She said, √¢≈ìIf you count 1, 2, 3, 4 and then start again from 1, it might be easier√¢ Little Bob thought it was a great idea and thanked the lady veterinarian for her help before he headed back home to count the mailboxes.One day, a tough dog named Max found a big barrel. He wanted to spend time playing with it. So, he pushed it with his nose and it rolled down the hill. He barked and ran after it, wagging his tail. As the barrel rolled, a little cat named Lily saw it too. She thought it was a fun game. She said, Lets play together, Max! Max agreed, and they both chased the barrel, laughing and having fun. Finally, the barrel stopped at the bottom of the hill. Max and Lily were tired but happy. They spent the whole day playing with the barrel and became good friends.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to help her mommy in the kitchen. One day, her mommy said, Lily, can you help me prepare dinner tonight? Lily was very excited and asked, What are we making, mommy? We are making spaghetti, replied her mommy. Lily helped her mommy handle the spaghetti noodles and put them in the pot to cook. She also helped her mommy make the sauce by stirring it with a big spoon. After dinner was ready, Lilys mommy said, Lily, can you help me clean up the dishes? Lily replied, Yes, mommy! As she was washing the dishes, she accidentally dropped a dull knife on the floor. Her mommy quickly picked it up and said, Be careful, Lily. We need to handle sharp objects with care. From that day on, Lily always remembered to be careful when handling sharp objects.Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they find a map on a bench. The map has a big X on it. Look, a map! Anna says. Maybe it is a treasure map! Lets follow it! Ben says. Maybe we can find gold or jewels! They take the map and start to walk. They follow the lines and arrows on the map. They go past the swings, the slide, the pond and the bridge. They come to a big tree. The X is here! Anna says. The treasure must be under the tree! They dig with their hands and their sticks. They dig and dig, but they find nothing. Where is the treasure? Ben asks. Did someone take it? Suddenly, they hear a laugh. They look up and see a boy in the tree. He is holding a camera. Gotcha! the boy says. It was a joke! I made the map and put it on the bench. I wanted to see if you would fall for it. I filmed everything. It is so funny! Anna and Ben are angry. They do not like the boys joke. They think it is mean and silly. That is not funny! Anna says. That is rude! You made us waste our time and get dirty! Yeah! Ben says. You are not nice! You are a bully! We do not want to play with you! They throw the map at the boy and run away. They go back to the park and play with their other friends. They forget about the boy and his joke. They have fun and laugh. They are brave and smart. They do not let the boys joke ruin their day. They are happy.Once upon a time, there was a big cabinet in a house. The cabinet was very fragile and could break easily. One day, a little girl was playing near the cabinet when she accidentally knocked it over. The cabinet fell down and started to rot because it was made of old wood. The little girl felt very sad and scared because she thought she had done something wrong. But then her mommy came and said it was okay and they would fix the cabinet together. The little girl felt much better and learned that accidents happen sometimes, but its important to be careful and ask for help when something goes wrong.One day, Jack and Jane were in their backyard having a great time playing together. Jack called out to Jane, Lets go explore the forest! Jane agreed and the two ran off together. They went deep into the forest, discovering new things and having a wonderful time. Soon, they stumbled across a small pond where they spotted a beautiful swan. The swan swam around the pond in the most playful way. Jack and Jane watched in awe. Jack then called out to the swan, Hello Swan! Can we be your friends? The swan replied, Sure! My name is Grace and I make this pond my home. I love swimming, playing and exploring. Spot said, Imagine you are already a good horse. You can do it! Brownie thought about it and felt better. The next day, Brownie ran faster than ever before. She clicked a button and out popped a loaf of bread. The duckling was delighted and started to munch away. Just then a friendly voice called out from the machine, Good morning duckling! One day, they decided to play a guessing game with their mom. Mom gave them a big box and said, There is something inside the box that you both love. You can ask me yes or no questions to guess what it is. Whoever guesses first gets to have it. Ben and Lily were excited and started to ask questions. Is it a toy? Ben asked. No, it is not a toy, Mom said. Is it a book? Lily asked. No, it is not a book, Mom said. They asked more questions, but they could not guess what was in the box. Mom smiled and said, Do you want a hint? Ben and Lily nodded eagerly. Mom said, It is something you can eat, and it is yellow and curved. Ben and Lily thought hard. Then, Ben shouted, I know! It is a banana! Mom opened the box and showed him a big, ripe banana. Ben was happy and reached for the banana. But then, he saw Lilys face. She looked sad and disappointed. She also liked bananas, but she did not guess first. Ben felt sorry for his sister. He remembered that Mom always taught them to share and be kind. He said, Lily, do you want to share the banana with me? We can split it in half and eat it together. Lily smiled and hugged Ben. She said, Thank you, Ben. You are a good brother. I am grateful for you. Mom was proud of Ben and Lily. She said, You are both very smart and generous. I love you both very much. She gave them each a half of the banana and a kiss. The moral of the story is It is better to share and be kind than to be greedy and selfish. The foreshadowing or setup is when Mom says that there is something in the box that they both love, and the payoff is when Ben decides to share the banana with Lily.Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Every night, he would sit on the hilltop and look out into the dark, empty landscape. The volcano felt terribly lonely and wanted some company. One night, he found a voice. It was arguing with itself. When the volcano asked who was talking, the voice replied that it was only a small bird. The bird had been flying around all night looking for a place to rest. But the volcano made too much noise so the bird kept on flying. The volcano felt sorry for the bird and invited it to stay with him on the hilltop. The bird accepted, and the two of them talked until the sun began to rise. The bird told the volcano stories of its travels and the volcano listened. Every night when the sun went down, the volcano and the bird would talk until morning came. Then one night, instead of talking, the bird started to complain about how cold and lonely it was up on the hilltop. The volcano felt terrible. He was so sorry to hear the bird complain and wanted to make things better. The volcano said to the bird that it could come and stay in the big hollow beneath his peak. He wanted to take a nap so he decided to find a nice place to rest. He flew over a meadow until he came across a bright and sunny spot. The ladybug settled down and was just about to take a nap when he heard a voice. Whos there? asked the voice. The ladybug opened his eyes and saw a dragonfly nearby. The dragonfly had lots of power and immediately the ladybug got scared. The dragonfly shook his wings. You are not allowed to nap here. This is my spot! he said. The ladybug was too tired to argue so he flew away and went to look for another place to take a nap. The ladybug flew and flew but he couldnt find a place to nap in peace. He eventually began to feel really tired and just before he could fall asleep he heard a voice again. It was the dragonfly! He had followed the ladybug and was there to stop him from napping! The bad news was that the dragonfly succeeded. The ladybug was too exhausted to fly away so he had to just sit there, wide awake and unable to rest. The moral of the story is that if you are famous, you might find it hard to take a nap in peace!Once upon a time, there was a lady who was very lonely. He wanted to find a fierce animal, so he set out on a hike in the woods. He walked for a long time and eventually, he saw something coming towards him. He got closer and realized it was a tiger! He was scared and wanted to run, but he wanted to take a look. The tiger was so fierce! He was almost trembling, but he kept looking at the tiger all the same. He stayed still, and the tiger started to come closer and closer. The little boy was scared, but he wanted to take a look. He was amazed by the tigers beauty, and he watched as it slowly passed by. When it was gone, the little boy was so relieved and happy that he had seen such a fantastic animal. He sat in the woods for a while, thinking about his journey, when suddenly he heard a sound from behind. He turned around and there was the tiger again! It was coming back for him! He was scared, but he stayed still and watched. The tiger came closer and closer. He was about to run for it when the tiger stopped and just looked at the boy. It looked at him with a fierce gaze, and the little boy slowly started to smile. He knew that the tiger was not going to hurt him. He thanked it for the wondrous experience and the tiger slowly walked away. The little boy went home, happy and with a story hed never forget.Molly and her Mom were in the attic. The cone was round and white and it had beautiful colourful sprinkles all over it. The cone was very happy with its life, it was glad to be alive. One day it decided to take a stroll in the sun. It felt so good in the warm summer air. Along the way, the cone saw a cabbage. The cabbage said Hey cone, why havent you melted yet? The cone replied Im glad that Im still here, I love the sun! But soon the sun became too hot, and the cone started to rot. The cone said sadly Oh no, Im melting away. The cabbage was sad to see the cone rot away. It said Dont worry cone! I will always remember you. The cone smiled and waved goodbye as it melted away.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved peanuts very much. Her mom said, We should go inside, Lily. A storm is coming. Lily replied, But I want to play outside. Its so busy and fun! Her mom said, We can return outside when the storm is over. Lily didnt want to go inside, but she listened to her mom. They went inside and waited for the storm to pass. After a while, the storm stopped and the sun came out. Lily was happy and said, Lets go outside now! But when they went outside, they saw that the storm had caused a lot of damage. Lilys favorite tree had fallen and her swing was broken. Lily was sad and said, I wish we didnt have to go inside. Then my tree and swing would be okay. Her mom replied, Sometimes we have to listen to grownups, even if we dont want to. I dont care, Sara says. I want to look pretty. You are silly and boring. You always wear the same coat and boots. Sara runs to her room and puts on her dress. He cried out in pain, but there was nobody around to help. He couldnt carry his basket any more, so he put it down and tried to limp home. Just as Ted was about to give up, he heard a voice. It was the farmer! The farmer had heard Teds cries and had followed him into the forest. He fixed Teds ankle and then carried the heavy basket for Ted. She had colorful wings that looked like a pastel drawing. She flew around the flowers and trees, looking for sweet nectar to drink. One day, the butterfly saw a sharp thorn on a rose bush. She tried to fly past it, but her wing got caught. She was stuck and couldnt fly away. The butterfly felt scared and sad. But then, a graceful bird saw the butterfly and came to help. The bird gently removed the thorn and set the butterfly free. The butterfly was so happy and grateful. She thanked the bird and flew away, feeling safe and free once again.Ben and Lily were playing in the yard. They liked to make things with sticks and stones and leaves. They made a house, a car, a boat and a chain. The chain was long and shiny. They used silver paper and tape to make it. Look at our chain! Ben said. It is so pretty. We can mail it to grandma. She will like it. Yes, lets mail it to grandma! Lily said. She will be happy. How do we mail it? Ben thought for a moment. He saw a big box near the fence. It had a hole on the top. He ran to the box and lifted the chain. Here, Lily, help me put the chain in the box. This is the mail box. We can mail things in it. Lily ran to help Ben. They put the chain in the box. They were proud of their work. Bye bye, chain! they said. Have a nice trip to grandma! They went back to play with their other things. They did not see the rain clouds in the sky. Soon, it started to rain. The rain was heavy and cold. It made everything wet. The box got wet. The hole got bigger. The chain got wet. It slipped out of the box. It fell on the ground. It got dirty and muddy. Ben and Lily did not know. They ran inside the house. They were wet and cold. They changed their clothes and had some hot chocolate. They forgot about the chain. The next day, they went to the yard again. They saw the box. It was soggy and torn. They saw the chain. It was dirty and dull. Oh no! Ben said. Our chain! It is ruined! It did not mail to grandma! Oh no! Lily said. Our chain! It is ugly! Grandma will not like it! They were sad. They picked up the chain. They tried to clean it. But it was too wet and sticky. They threw it away. They learned a lesson. They learned that rain can make things wet. They learned that wet things can get spoiled. They learned that mail boxes are not for chains. He was so hungry he could feel it in his trunk. Suddenly he spotted a banana tree. Bob blinked in surprise. He walked towards the banana tree and began to eat the ripe, yellow bananas. He munched on the sweet fruit until his appetite was satisfied. He was feeling very fine now and he was ready to continue walking through the jungle. He walked through the tall grass, looking around and blinking at the trees and animals. Suddenly he heard a loud thump! Bob blinked in surprise and peered around. He spotted a trunk lying in the grass and wondered what it could be. He cautiously walked towards it, sniffing as he went. It smelled like a trunk, but it was too small for an elephant. Bob bent down to look closer and saw that it belonged to a baby elephant! Bob wrinkled his trunk in surprise and carefully picked up the trunk. He saw that the little elephant was just fine. He placed the trunk around the babys body and held it there while the baby happily wiggled her trunk. The note said Come to my cave on the other side of the forest. I have something special to show you. Signed, bear. Tom ran home to his parents. He told them all about the note. Toms parents were worried it was dangerous to go alone! However, Tom was clever and decided to take the bear up on his offer. He asked his parents if he could go and promised to be very careful. Tom set off into the woods, stopping every once in a while to take in the beauty of the forest. At last he found the bears cave. But just as he was about to start washing, he found something strange. It was a big sausage! It had floated into one corner of the bath. At first the boy was frightened, but then he had a bright idea. Instead of eating, he decided to bathe the sausage! He rubbed it up, reaching every little bit and after some time the sausage was sparkling clean. Even his mum couldnt believe it when she saw. She loved to wrap it around her when she felt cold or troubled. One day, Sally lost her wrap. She looked everywhere, but she could not find it. Sally asked her mom, Mom, have you seen my wrap? Her mom said, No, but lets look for it together. They looked in the bedroom, the kitchen, and the living room. But they still could not find the wrap. Sally was sad and troubled. She could not resist crying. But then, she saw her dog, Spot, in the yard. Spot had her wrap! He was playing with it. Sally ran to Spot and hugged him. Thank you, Spot! she said. Now Sally was happy and warm again.Once upon a time there was a bird called Sam. He was very small, but he could soar like noone else. He flapped his wings and soared through the sky with ease. The sun was shining brightly and Sam felt so free. He let out a loud chirp and could hear his voice echoing across the land. Meanwhile, in a nearby garden, a little girl was playing with her doll. Then, suddenly, she heard a voice from above and looked up to the sky. There was Sam, soaring high above with the sun glistening on his gorgeous, blue wings. The little girl watched as Sam glided in and out of the clouds. He looked so perfect! The little girl waved to him and Sam flew down and perched next to her. They spent the rest of the afternoon playing together in the garden and watching Sam soar.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a toy box full of toys. He loved all of his toys very much, but his favorite was his red fire truck. He would play with it every day and never let anyone else touch it. One day, Timmys friend came over to play. Timmy showed him all of his toys, but when he got to the fire truck, he said, This is mine and you cant play with it. His friend was sad, but Timmy didnt care. Later that day, Timmys mom asked him to clean up his toys. Timmy didnt want to, but he knew he had to. He quickly put all of his toys away, but he forgot to shut the toy box. That night, a mouse snuck into Timmys room and saw the open toy box. The mouse climbed in and found the fire truck. He started to play with it and accidentally knocked it off the edge of the toy box. The fire truck broke into a million pieces. Timmy was very sad when he woke up and saw his broken fire truck. He realized that he should have shared his toys with his friend and he should have shut the toy box. He learned a valuable lesson that day.Once upon a time, there was a zebra named Stripey. Stripey had black and white stripes all over his body. One day, Stripey met his friend, a monkey named Bongo. Bongo asked Stripey, What are you doing today? Stripey replied, I want to make a snowman because its icy outside. Stripey and Bongo went to the park to make a snowman. They rolled the snow into a big ball and put it on top of another ball. They made the snowmans head out of a small ball. The snowman looked great! But suddenly, a big gust of wind came and knocked the snowman over. Stripey and Bongo were sad because they worked so hard to make the snowman. Stripey said, I wish we didnt make the snowman. It was too hard. Bongo replied, I know, but we can try again tomorrow. Stripey and Bongo walked home, feeling sad that their snowman was gone. They learned that sometimes things dont go as planned, but its important to keep trying.Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. The bear and the rabbit talked for a long time. The bear told the rabbit about all of his worries and his sadness. The rabbit listened carefully and was very kind to the bear. When it started to get dark, the rabbit said goodbye and hopped away. The bear felt much better and was no longer grumpy. That night, the bear watched the stars above the pond with a big smile on his face. From then on, the bear and the rabbit were friends and they talked all the time.Once, there was a bull who was fierce. He lived in a farm with a lot of other animals. The bull stomped over to the chicken and said in a loud, fierce voice What are you doing? The chicken was scared and said in a tiny voice Im covering this egg. The bull said I think you should stop covering the egg. If you dont stop, Im going to hurt you! The chicken was very scared and quickly ran away. The bull was so fierce and full of rage that he started to cover the whole farm. He was determined to cover everything. In the end, all the animals fled the farm in fear. She wanted to use it to see how deep the hole was. But her mommy said, No, Lily, that stick is too sharp. You could hurt yourself. Lets find something else to use. So, they found a long stick that was not sharp. Lily carefully put the stick down into the hole. It was very deep! She was happy she didnt fall in.
