She smiles. She is happy. She thinks she is the best. Ben is sad. He does not have any pictures he likes. He does not have any fun. He thinks he is the worst. Then, Mom comes in. She sees the pictures. She sees Lily and Ben. What are you doing, kids? Mom asks. We are playing with the printer. I am the queen. Ben is my servant. Lily says. Is that so? I am very sad. I dont get to print what I want and how I want it. Ben says. Mom frowns. She does not like what she hears. She does not like bossy queens and sad servants. She has an idea. Lily and Ben look at each other. They are surprised. They are curious. They nod. OK, Mom. They say. Mom smiles. She gives them a hug. She leaves them to play. Lily and Ben switch roles. They think they are the best.Lila liked to play dressup with her dolls. She had many clothes and hats and shoes for them. She liked to make them look pretty and different. She gave each doll a name and a style. One day, she was playing with her doll Mia. She put a pink dress and a yellow hat on her. She said, Mia, you look so nice. You have a sunny style. Do you like it? Mia did not answer, because she was a doll. But Lila pretended she did. She said, Yes, Lila, I like it. But can you remove the hat? It is too hot for me. Lila was surprised. She said, But Mia, the hat is part of your style. It matches your dress. Why do you want to remove it? Mia said, Because it is not mild today. It is very warm. The hat makes me sweat. I want to feel the breeze on my hair. Lila thought for a moment. She said, OK, Mia, I understand. You can remove the hat. But you have to keep the dress. It is very pretty. Mia said, Thank you, Lila. You are very kind. I like the dress too. It is soft and light. Can we go outside and play? Lila said, Yes, Mia, we can. Let me get my shoes and my bag. Then we can go and have fun. Lila and Mia went outside and played in the garden. They enjoyed the sun and the flowers. They had a happy day.Once upon a time, there was a hill. It was a very tidy hill. The grass was short and the trees were neatly trimmed. Every day the sun shined brightly on the hill. Then one day, it began to rain. The rain made everything very wet. All of the grass and trees on the hill were covered in water. The gentle sound of the rain made the hill sound happy. After a while, the rain stopped and the sun came back out again. The hill looked even tidier than before. Everything glistened and sparkled in the bright daylight. The hill was so beautiful that everyone walking past would stop and admire it. From that day forward, the hill always stayed neat and tidy, no matter if it rained or shone.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved flowers. She would pick them and hold them close to her nose to smell their sweet fragrance. One day, she saw a soft, pink flower and wondered what it would feel like to touch it. Lilys friend, Timmy, came over and saw the flower too. That flower is so pretty! he exclaimed. Can I touch it? Lily nodded and Timmy reached out to touch the flower. But as soon as he did, a bee flew out and stung him on the hand. He cried out in pain and Lily ran to get help. Sadly, Timmy had an allergic reaction to the bee sting and had to go to the hospital. Lily felt terrible for showing him the flower and wondered if she should have been more careful. From that day on, she made sure to always check for bees before touching any flowers.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was 3 years old, and she loved snacking. Then they saw a boy with a water gun. He was spraying water at the flowers and the birds. He looked like he was having fun. Can I play with your water gun? Lila asked the boy. No, it is mine! the boy said. Go away! Lila felt sad. She wanted to spray water too. She looked at her big blue marble and thought it was not so shiny and pretty anymore. Sam saw that Lila was sad. He wanted to make her happy. He had an idea. Hey, I have a water bottle! he said, taking it out of his backpack. We can spray water with this! He unscrewed the cap and squeezed the bottle. A stream of water came out. He sprayed it at the flowers and the birds. They flew away and made noises. Lila smiled. She took the water bottle from Sam and sprayed it too. They took turns spraying water and laughing. The boy with the water gun saw them. He felt jealous. He wanted to play with them. He looked at his water gun and thought it was not so fun anymore. Can I play with your marbles? he asked Lila and Sam. Sure, you can! Lila and Sam said. We can share! They gave him some of their marbles and he gave them his water gun. They rolled the marbles and sprayed the water together. They became friends and had a lot of fun.Once upon a time, in a big park, there was a hidden play area. Many kids did not know about it. The leaves shook, and Lily felt scared. She held her ball tight and looked around. She wondered what could make such a big motion. Then, out of the bushes came a little kitten. It was not scary at all! Lily felt happy and not fearful anymore. She played with the kitten and they became best friends. How could he have taken someone elses carrot? He felt even more miserable than before. Maria smiled. Dont worry, she said. I have more carrots in my house. I can get you one if you want. Those are our radishes, not yours! The rabbit looks up and sees the twins. It is scared and hops away, dropping a radish on the ground. Come back here, you thief! Mia yells. You owe us a radish! The twins chase the rabbit, but it is too fast and disappears into the bushes. Sam and Mia are out of breath and sad. They look at their patch and see that the rabbit has eaten many of their radishes. Oh no, what are we going to do? Sam asks. We worked so hard to grow them. Mia thinks for a moment. They had many toys, but they always wanted more. They were spoiled children who did not share or say thank you. One day, their mom brought home a new blanket for them. It was soft and warm and had colorful animals on it. Wow, look at this blanket! Tom said. It is so nice. I want it for myself! No, I want it! Lily said. It is mine! You have enough toys already! They both grabbed the blanket and pulled hard. They did not care that they were hurting the blanket or each other. They only wanted to have it all. Stop it, you two! their mom said. This blanket is for both of you to share. If you cannot play nicely, I will take it away! But Tom and Lily did not listen. They kept fighting and yelling. They seemed very angry and mean. They did not notice that the blanket was tearing apart in their hands. Suddenly, the blanket ripped in half. The animals fell off and the stuffing came out. The blanket was ruined. Tom and Lily looked at the broken blanket and cried. Look what you did! Tom said. You ruined the blanket! No, you did! Lily said. You started it! They blamed each other and did not say sorry. Their mom was very sad and disappointed. She took away the blanket and their toys. She said they had to learn to be kind and grateful. She said they could not have any more new things until they changed their ways. Tom and Lily had no blanket and no toys. They had no fun and no friends. They were cold and lonely. They wished they had shared the blanket and played nicely. But it was too late. They had spoiled everything.One day, a wise bird named Blue had a pretty feather. Blue wanted to display the feather for all his friends to see. He put the feather on a big rock near the tree where he lived. A small bird named Tiny saw the feather and asked, Blue, what is that pretty thing on the rock? Blue said, It is my feather, Tiny. I want everyone to see how pretty it is! All day, Blues friends came to see the feather. They all said it was very pretty. Blue was happy that he could share his feather with his friends. They played near the feather until the sun went down.Once upon a time, there was a big wild forest. In the forest, there was a small house. In the house, there was a boy named Tim and his mom. Tim loved to play with his toy machine. One day, Tims mom told him not to go too far into the wild forest. Tim was playing near the forest with his toy machine. He saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. He put his toy machine down and started to climb. When he was up high, he saw a big bird. The big bird said, Hi Tim! I see your toy machine. It looks fun. Can I play with it? Tim said, Yes, but be careful. My mom told me not to go too far into the wild forest. The big bird took the toy machine and flew away. Tim was sad. He climbed down the tree and ran to his mom. He told her what happened. His mom said, I told you not to go too far into the wild forest. Now, we must find the big bird and get your toy machine back. Tim and his mom went into the wild forest. They saw the big bird and Tim pointed at it. The big bird saw them and said, Im sorry, Tim. I should have listened to you. Here is your toy machine. Tim was happy to have his toy machine back. He learned to listen to his mom and not go too far into the wild forest. The moral of the story is to always listen to your parents and be careful when playing near wild places.Once upon a time, there was a lively child named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and explore the world around him. One day, Timmy went to the park to play with his friends. As Timmy was playing, he saw a big dog lying under a tree. Timmys friend said, Dont go near that dog, he might bite you! But Timmy wanted to pet the dog, so he went closer. The dog didnt bite Timmy, instead, the dog licked Timmys hand. Timmy was happy and said, Im glad I didnt listen to you, my friend. That dog is friendly and likes to lie under the tree.Once upon a time, there lived two friends called Ben and Harold. When it finally came in, Ben exclaimed Wow, it looks perfect!. Harold was so happy. He couldnt believe he had a new uniform that was already pale. He quickly put it on and twirled around to show off. Suddenly, Ben shouted out, That looks so good on you! Lets go play outside now! And so they raced outside in their new pale uniforms and had a great time!Tim and Jen were twins who liked to play in the snow. They had red mittens that their mom made for them. One day, they went outside to make a snowman. They rolled big balls of snow and stacked them up. They found a carrot, a hat and some buttons for the snowmans face. But then, a big dog came running towards them. It was black and hairy and had sharp teeth. It barked loudly and jumped on the snowman. It knocked down the balls of snow and bit the carrot. Tim and Jen were frightened. They ran back to the house, but they dropped their mittens on the way. The dog saw the mittens and thought they were toys. It grabbed them with its mouth and tore them apart. It made a big mess of wool and threads. Tim and Jen arrived at the house and told their mom what happened. They were sad and scared. Their mom hugged them and said she was sorry. She said she would make them new mittens, but it would take a long time. Tim and Jen cried and wished they had their red mittens back. They did not like the big dog. It was a bad day.Once upon a time, there was a boy. He had a funny looking notebook. His mom said, Oh what a sweet notebook you have! When he got home, he showed it to his parents. Mom said, Why did you bring a sour fruit home? The boy said, To remember it. I like sour things! His parents laughed and said, Okay, if you like it, keep it in your notebook! So the boy kept the sour fruit in his notebook as a special reminder of his adventure outside.Mum and Dad took me to the park. We saw lots of birds and animals and Mum said it was fun. We were very worried because Dad was gone so long. Then we heard sirens and the ambulance drove away very quickly. Where is Dad? I asked. Hes safe, Mum said. The hero restored the peace, and everyone danced and smiled. The hero was so brave and amazing that she was given a medal of honor. Everyone cheered for her, and they all hugged and thanked her. The EndOnce upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweetie. Tweetie lived in a big tree with all of her bird friends. One day, a big storm came and disturbed the birds peaceful home. The wind blew so hard that it knocked down some of the branches and made the birds scared. Tweetie and her friends decided to fly away to find a new home. They searched and searched until they found a beautiful garden with impressive flowers and a little pond. They decided to make their new home there and it was the best decision they ever made. From that day on, Tweetie and her friends lived a happy life in the garden. They sang songs, ate yummy seeds, and played in the sun. They never forgot their old home, but they were grateful for their new one. Sometimes, when the wind blew hard, it would disturb their peaceful life, but they knew they could always find a new home if they had to.Once upon a time, in a deep, deep forest, there was a little girl named Lucy. She picked up her toy iron and followed the sound of the scream. She found a small bird stuck in a hole. The bird was very scared and screamed again. Lucy used her toy iron to help the bird get out of the hole. The bird was so happy and flew away. She saw the purple butterfly again and tried to catch it. But it flew away again. Lily was sad, but she remembered how fun it was to help her mom clean the glass.Lily and Ben were twins who liked to play in their room. They had a big curtain that hung from the ceiling and made a wall in the middle of the room. Sometimes they pretended that the curtain was a door to a different place, like a castle or a jungle or a spaceship. One day, they decided to play a game of hide and seek. Lily said, I will count to ten and you hide behind the curtain. Then I will try to find you. Ben nodded and ran behind the curtain. Lily closed her eyes and counted out loud, One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten! Ready or not, here I come! Lily opened her eyes and looked around the room. She saw a small bump under the bed, a pile of toys in the corner, and a lamp on the table. She thought, Where is Ben? Maybe he is under the bed. She walked to the bed and lifted the blanket. But there was no Ben, only a stuffed bear. She said, Oops, not here! She moved to the corner and looked at the toys. She saw a truck, a ball, a doll, and a book. She thought, Maybe he is behind the toys. She pushed the toys aside and looked behind them. But there was no Ben, only a spider web. She said, Yuck, not here! She walked to the table and looked at the lamp. She saw a cord, a switch, a shade, and a bulb. She thought, Maybe he is under the lamp. She lifted the lamp and looked under it. But there was no Ben, only a dust bunny. She said, Ew, not here! She scratched her head and wondered, Where is Ben? He is very good at hiding. Maybe he is behind the curtain. She ran to the curtain and pulled it aside. But there was no Ben, only a big hole. She gasped and said, Oh no, the curtain is split! She heard a giggle from the other side of the hole. She looked through it and saw Ben. He was smiling and holding a pair of scissors. He said, Surprise! I made a new door. Do you like it? He was very playful and thought it was funny. Lily was not amused. She was angry and sad. She said, Ben, that was not nice. You ruined the curtain. Mom and Dad will be mad. How will we fix it? She started to cry. Ben realized that he had made a mistake. He felt sorry and ashamed. He said, Im sorry, Lily. I didnt mean to make you cry. I just wanted to have fun. Please dont be mad at me. Maybe we can sew the curtain back together. Or maybe we can find a new curtain. Or maybe we can pretend that the hole is a window. Can we still be friends? Lily looked at Ben and saw that he was sincere. She wiped her tears and said, OK, Ben. I forgive you. But you have to promise not to cut the curtain again. And you have to help me clean up the mess. And you have to let me hide next time. Deal? Ben nodded and said, Deal. Im sorry, Lily. I love you. He hugged her and said, You are the best sister ever. Lily hugged him back and said, You are the best brother ever. But you are also very naughty. Come on, lets go find Mom and Dad and tell them what happened. Maybe they will not be too mad if we say we are sorry and we will fix it. They held hands and walked out of the room. They hoped that Mom and Dad would understand. They learned that playing is fun, but not when it hurts someone or something. They also learned that saying sorry and forgiving are important when you make a mistake. They were still twins who liked to play, but they were also more careful and kind.The little girl was so excited! She had been waiting all day. It was finally time to go outside and see the moon. One day, the boat was sailing through the ocean, when it noticed a big salty wave. The boat was a bit scared, but it still tried to bravely sail through the wave. Just then, two other boats came sailing past it. It was a race! The boats were very competitive, but the little boat didnt want to compete. It just wanted to explore the world. Suddenly, the little boat noticed a tiny hole in the bottom of its boat. The salty wave had made the hole! Now, the little boat could not sail safely anymore. The moral of the story is that its important to focus on exploring rather than competing. Ben wanted to remove the apples from the tree, but he was too small. He jumped and jumped, but he could not reach them. He was very sad. Then, a tall giraffe named Gina saw Ben and asked, Why are you sad? Ben told Gina about the apples and how he could not remove them. Gina wanted to help. She used her long neck to reach the apples. She removed them and gave them to Ben. Ben was so happy! He shared the apples with Gina, and they became the best of friends. From that day on, they always helped each other and shared their favorite fruits.Once upon a time, there was a lovely little girl named Lucy. She liked to play with her toys and wear pretty clothes. One day, Lucys mom bought her a new dress. It was pink and had a big bow on the front. Lucy was very happy. Lucy put on her new dress and went outside to play. She saw her friend, Tom, playing with his ball. Hi, Tom! said Lucy. Look at my new dress! Tom looked at Lucys dress and said, Wow, thats a lovely dress, Lucy! Lucy and Tom played together all day. They played catch with the ball and ran around in the grass. When it was time to go home, Lucys dress was dirty. She was sad, but her mom said, Dont worry, Lucy. We can wash your dress and it will be clean again. Lucys mom washed her dress and hung it up to dry. The next day, Lucy put on her clean dress and said, Thank you, Mom, for washing my dress. It looks lovely again! Her mom smiled and said, Youre welcome, Lucy. Now go have fun and play with your friends! And so, Lucy went outside to play with her friends, wearing her lovely clean dress. She was happy and thankful for her mom who helped her keep her clothes clean.Once upon a time, there was a young girl named Sarah. One day, Sarah wanted to do something fun, so she made a plan. She ran to her mom and said, Mommy, can I plan a party? Her mom smiled and said, Yes, you can plan a party. What do you want to do? Sarah said, I want to have some friends over and play games. We can have a prize for the winner! Her mom thought it was a wonderful idea, so she helped Sarah plan the party. The next day, Sarahs friends came over and they all had a great time playing games. After all the games were done, Sarahs mom announced the winner and gave them the prize. Everyone was happy and laughed a lot. They all had a friendly time together. Sarah was so proud of herself for planning such a fun party.Billy was so excited, it was his birthday. His mom gave him a present, it was a shiny new jacket. He tried it on and loved it. It was so soft and warm. Billy showed his dad the jacket and said Look Dad, I got a new jacket! His dad said Wow, thats great Billy! You have to take good care of it. Billy took it to school the next day and was so proud of it. However, at lunch time he was not so careful. His friends wanted to play a funny game, and Billy was silly and decided to join them. The game was so silly, it made everyone laugh. But during the game, Billy jumped too hard and his zipper split open. Billy felt so stupid but his friends said Dont worry, its just a zipper, you can replace it. Billy was sad because he knew his mom would be upset. He knew he had spoiled his new jacket and was really embarrassed. He went home and asked his mom for help. Fortunately, his mom saw how sorry Billy was and told him not to be so stupid. She said it was an accident and helped him fix the jacket. Billy was so relieved. He learned an important life lesson that day. His mom had saved the day!Once upon a time, there was a boy called Bill. Bill went to the park to have fun and play. Soon, it got dark and cold outside. Bill was scared and decided to kneel down. He saw something dead in front of him and was even more scared. He slowly backed away and ran home. Inside his house, it was warm and cozy. He forgot all about the cold and the dead thing he saw. He hugged his mum and dad and went to bed, feeling safe and happy. The next day, it was sunny and warm again. Bill went back to the park to play with his friends. He was brave and did not kneel down, but ran around and smiled. He soon forgot all about the cold and the dead thing. Everything was now bright and happy at the park.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lila. She loved to watch the sunset every day. But one day, as she looked up in the sky and saw the beautiful colors of the sun setting, she noticed something else a green cloud! Lila felt so curious, she had never seen anything like it before! She quickly ran off to find someone who could explain what it was. At last, she found her father and said, Daddy, what is that green cloud in the sky? Her father smiled and said, Thats a special cloud, Lila. Its called a sunset cloud and its a beautiful gift from the sun. We have to accept it as part of nature. Lila smiled and said, Okay, I accept. From then on, Lila saw the sunset cloud every day and felt happy that she had accepted this beautiful gift from the sun.Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a big lion. The lion liked to roar very loud. He thought it was fun to scare all the little animals. One day, a small mosquito came to the forest. The mosquito was very selfish. It wanted all the other animals to listen to it. But the lion roared louder and no one could hear the mosquito. The mosquito felt sad and asked the lion to stop roaring. The lion saw that the mosquito was selfish, but he decided to be kind. The lion stopped roaring and the mosquito was happy. The animals in the forest learned to share and be nice to each other.Once upon a time there was an otter who lived in the river. He was always happy and friendly to everyone he saw. One day, he noticed an angry bird standing on a log near the water. The otter swam over to him and said, Hello, are you okay? The bird was too angry to speak so he just stared at the otter. The otter thought for a moment, then offered If it would help, I could listen to your story. The bird thought about it and then agreed, so the otter closed his eyes and listened. As the bird spoke, the otters heart grew closer to the bird, until the birds anger turned to tears. The otter opened his eyes and said softly, Your story is over now, and you no longer have to be alone. The bird thanked the otter, and they said goodbye, each one smiling and grateful. The moral of the story is that sometimes it takes courage to deal with our anger. We dont have to handle it all by ourselves, as a listening ear can transform our hearts and bring us closer together.Once upon a time there was an old crocodile. He lived in a pond in a big forest. Everywhere he went he saw lots of animals but he never recognized them. He had never seen anyone else like himself. One day, while he was swimming in the pond, he saw something familiar. It was another crocodile! The old crocodile was so happy. He swam closer to take a better look and the other crocodile began to move its tail. He recognized it was a friend. The old crocodile was so happy. He swam around the pond with his new friend. Everywhere they went, the other animals would come and say hello to the two crocodiles. Now he was not alone anymore!One day, a little girl named Lily went for a walk. She saw a tidy house with a pretty garden. In the garden, there was a twisty path. Lily walked on the path and found a cross at the end. She was very curious. Lily heard a voice and turned around. Hi, I am Tom, said a little boy. Do you like my twisty path and cross? Lily smiled and said, Yes, I like it a lot. Your house and garden are very tidy too. Tom was happy to hear this. Thank you! I work hard to keep it clean. Do you want to play with me? Lily nodded her head. They played together all day long. They became good friends and loved to explore the twisty path and the cross in the tidy garden.Once upon a time, there was a bald man who loved to swim in the river. He had a dog named Spot who loved to play fetch with a bone. One day, the man and Spot went to the river to swim and play. As they were swimming, a big fish jumped out of the water and scared Spot. Woof woof! Scary! barked Spot. The man laughed and said, Dont worry, Spot. The fish wont hurt us. But as they continued to swim, the man suddenly felt something grab his leg. It was a big alligator! Help! Help! he cried. Spot tried to save him by biting the alligators tail, but it was too late. The alligator took the man underwater and he never came back up. Spot was very sad and went home alone without his owner. He missed the man and the bone they used to play with. From that day on, Spot never went back to the river again.Once upon a time, there were two friends who went to a restaurant. Their names were Tommy and Jenny. They decided to have lunch together. Jenny wanted something sweet, so she chose a sweet drink and some sweet candy. They were so excited for their snacks. They were both very sad, and they never went back to the restaurant again.Lila was a modest girl who liked to help her mom and dad. She did not ask for many toys or treats. She was happy with her books and dolls. One day, she saw a big train at the park. It had many cars and a loud whistle. Lila wanted to ride the train, but she was afraid. She asked her mom, Can I ride the train, please? Her mom said, Yes, you can, but you have to try. It is not scary, it is fun. You can hold my hand if you want. Lila nodded and followed her mom to the train. She saw a long line of people waiting to get on. She saw some kids who were excited and some who were nervous. She felt her heart beat fast. When it was their turn, her mom helped her climb on the train. She sat on a seat near the rail. She held her moms hand tight. She heard the whistle blow and the train start to move. She closed her eyes. Her mom said, Look, Lila, look at the trees and the flowers and the animals. They are so pretty. The train is going fast, but it is safe. You are brave, Lila, you are trying something new. Lila opened her eyes and looked around. She saw the green grass and the blue sky and the yellow sun. They try to make noise with it, but it is too quiet. It is no fun, Tom says. Lets go find something else, Jen says. But Tom is stubborn. He wants to know what the iron thing is. He notices a wire coming out of it. He follows the wire to the wall. He sees a plug. Maybe this makes it work, he says. He pulls the plug out of the wall. Nothing happens. He puts the plug back in the wall. Nothing happens. See? It is no good, Jen says. But Tom is still stubborn. He notices a button on the iron thing. He pushes the button. Suddenly, the iron thing makes a hissing sound. Steam comes out of the holes. It is very hot. Ow! Ow! Ow! Tom screams. He drops the iron thing. It falls on his foot. It hurts a lot. Tom! Tom! He started picking up the snow and rolling it into a ball. After a few minutes he had a big round snowball! He rolled it to another spot and did the same until he had 3 balls of snow. Then he put them all together. Tom searched around for some decorations and found some rocks to use as eyes, a branch for the nose and finally a scarf to wrap around the snowmans neck. Tom stepped back and smiled. He had made a very modest snowman. He folded his hands and said a quiet prayer. Thank you for giving me this snow. I wish the snowman could come to life and be my friend. Suddenly there was a bright sparkle of light, and the snowman started moving! His eyes twinkled and he blinked at Tom. Can I have some cream please? the snowman asked. It was magical! She noticed the slug had two big eyes, which looked a bit scary but also kind of cute. The slug slowly moved away and went back on the ground. Jane smiled as she watched it move away slowly. Ill make you a promise. If you wait here, Ill bring you a nice, juicy cherry. Lily smiled and waited. She watched the bird fly away. It wasnt very long before the bird came back with a cherry. It wanted to explore the world, so it sped away. It moved along very fast, but it didnt feel free. Despite going as fast as it could, it never seemed to get anywhere. One day, the little boat had an idea. It realized it needed something to slow it down and help it stay safe on its journey. The boat decided it should get an anchor! The anchor was dropped into the water and the boat felt secure. Now the boat could explore the world, but at a slower, safer speed. Whenever it needed to take a break and recharge, the anchor was there to keep the boat in one place. The little boat was still creative and vivacious. It explored and discovered many new things, as it travelled and experienced life at a slower pace. The moral of this story is to stay creative while being mindful of your own safety. Enjoy exploring, but always make sure you have a safe anchor to hold you back.Once upon a time, in a small garden, there lived a little ant. The ant liked to gather food for his family. Every day, he went out to find tasty things to eat. One day, the ant found a big, dull rock. He thought it was food, but it was not. He tried to gather the rock, but it was too heavy. The ant felt sad. Then, a friendly bug came to help. Together, they pushed the dull rock away. They found yummy food under the rock. The ant and the bug gathered the food and took it to their families. They were very happy.Mum was measuring something. She held the long gas in one hand and stretched the other hand over it. She said it was to help her measure the length. Dad was working hard. He had a big machine and he was turning lots of knobs and pushing lots of buttons. He was putting lots of gas into the machine. Dad said the gas would help make the machine work. Mum and Dad talked about measuring things. Dad told Mum that he was measuring the amount of gas that went into the machine. They needed to measure it very carefully to make sure it was the right amount. Mum and Dad kept working hard. After a while, they stopped and smiled. They both said they had measured the gas really well and their machine was going to work really beautifully.Once upon a time, there was a man named John. John had a big smile and was very enthusiastic. He had been planning an adventure for a very long time. Finally, the day had arrived. John set off on his journey, following a map he had found. He walked for a while, until he came to a big, old tree. As he started to turn away, he heard a strange noise. John walked closer and saw a little creature with purple skin. He was very small, no bigger than a penny! The creature was shouting and turning around and around. John was excited. John watched as the creature began to climb the tree and then disappear into a hole in the trunk. He couldnt believe what he had seen! John was now determined to find out more, so he quickly climbed the tree and followed the creature. To his surprise, he found himself in a magical world, full of amazing creatures. John was so excited, he couldnt believe his luck. He explored and discovered more and more until it was time for him to go home. John left that magical world with a smile on his face. His journey had been full of excitement and he had made some fascinating discoveries. He would never forget his adventure!Once there was a little girl named May. May was a curious person who liked to explore. She found an old mill and wanted to see what was inside. Wait here, May warned her mom. May went in the mill by herself. Inside the mill was something shiny. May was excited and wanted to attach it to her backpack. But as soon as she touched the object, a loud siren started to sound. May was scared and tried to run out the mill, but the door was locked. Mays mom heard the siren and came to help. But the police were already there. They saw May had taken the object from the mill and it was not good. May was taken to jail and never able to go back home.Jimmy and his friends were playing a game in the park. Jimmy had a goal of playing until the sun went down. Suddenly, the skies turned icy cold, and Jimmy could see that it was about to snow. He shouted to his friends, Lets go get our warm jackets, or else well be uncomfortable. But his friends disagreed. Lets stay and keep playing, they said. Jimmy wanted to keep playing too, but he also wanted to stay warm. He knew he had to do something. So Jimmy said something he couldnt believe Lets wear our coats while we play. Everyone agreed and they put on their warm jackets. Even though they were wearing the warm coats, they were still playing together and having lots of fun. Jimmy was glad he figured out a way to both stay warm and play with his friends. He reached his goal of playing until the sun went down!Once there was a child who wanted to meet someone special. One day, she went to a special place where she could get a massage. It was a magical place, and she was very excited. The child was greeted by a friendly lady who was going to give her the massage. She was careful and gentle with the child, and asked her to relax. The lady carefully moved her hands along the childs back until the massage was finished. The child felt very happy and calm when it was done. The child asked the lady if she could come back sometime. The lady said that she would be available any time the child wanted to come. The child was very happy and thanked the lady for the massage. They said goodbye and the child went away, knowing that she would meet the friendly lady again soon.Tom and Lily were playing with their toys in the living room. They liked to make houses and cars and animals with their blocks and dolls and cars. But they only had one roll of tape to stick things together. Tom wanted to use the tape to make a big tower with his blocks. Lily wanted to use the tape to make a dress for her doll. Give me the tape, Tom! Lily said. I need it for my doll! No, I need it for my tower! Tom said. You can use something else! They both pulled on the tape, trying to take it from each other. The tape stretched and snapped, and the pieces fell on the floor. Tom and Lily looked at the broken tape and started to cry. Mom heard their cries and came to the living room. She saw the mess and the tears and asked them what happened. We broke the tape, Mom! Tom and Lily said. We both wanted it and we pulled too hard! Mom hugged them and said, Im sorry, my loves. Tape is not for fighting. Tape is for sharing and making things together. Do you want to try again? Tom and Lily nodded and wiped their eyes. Mom gave them a new roll of tape and helped them to make a tower and a dress. They said sorry to each other and played nicely. They were happy again. The end.Once upon a time, there was a duck named Quackers. Quackers loved to swim in the pond with all his duck friends. One day, Quackers saw his friends swimming with a new duck who was very successful at swimming. Quackers wanted to be friends with the new duck too, so he asked if he could swim with them. But the new duck said, You cant swim with us because you are not successful like me. Quackers felt sad and alone. He didnt understand why he couldnt be friends with the new duck. So he went to his wise old friend, Mr. Owl, for advice. Mr. Owl told Quackers that being successful is not just about being good at one thing. Its about being kind and including others, even if they are not as good as you at something. Quackers realized that he had been excluding other ducks who were not as good at swimming as him. He decided to include everyone in his swimming group, and soon he had many new friends. Quackers learned that being successful is not just about being good at something, but also about being kind and inclusive to others.Once upon a time, there was a small boy named Jack. Jack loved music a lot. He would listen to it every day and dance to the beat. One day, Jacks mom took him to a big music concert. Jack was very excited and danced along with everyone. But suddenly, he felt sad because he couldnt see the stage very well. It was too big for his small eyes. But then, Jacks mom remembered something. She had brought a small stool for Jack to sit on. Jack was so happy and could see the stage perfectly. He danced and sang along with the music all night long. From that day on, Jack always remembered to bring his small stool to music concerts. He never missed a beat again!Anna and Ben were twins who liked to play outside. One day, they saw a big truck parked near their house. They were curious and wanted to see what was inside. They sneaked behind the truck and opened the door. Inside, they saw many boxes and bags. They wondered what was in them. They decided to open one box and reveal what was inside. They tore the tape and lifted the lid. They gasped when they saw many shiny things. They were jewels! Anna and Ben were excited and wanted to take some jewels. They thought they could keep them or trade them for toys. They reached for the jewels, but then they heard a loud noise. It was the truck driver. He had seen them and was angry. He shouted at them and ran towards them. Anna and Ben were fearful and dropped the box. They ran away from the truck, but they did not look where they were going. They ran into the street, where there was a lot of traffic. Cars and bikes were honking and braking. Anna and Ben were scared and confused. They did not know how to cross the street safely. Luckily, a kind lady saw them and helped them. She took them by the hand and led them to the sidewalk. She asked them where they lived and why they were in the street. Anna and Ben told her what they had done. They felt ashamed and sorry. The lady told them that they had done a very bad thing. She said that the jewels were not theirs and that they could have been hurt or caught by the police. She said that they should never take things that belong to others and that they should always be careful near traffic. She said that they should go home and tell their parents what they had done. Anna and Ben nodded and thanked the lady. They walked home and told their parents everything. Their parents were very upset and disappointed. They scolded them and made them return the jewels to the truck driver. They also made them apologize and promise to never do it again. Anna and Ben learned their lesson. They realized that they had been greedy and foolish. They decided to be more honest and respectful from then on. They also decided to be more careful and listen to their parents when they played outside.Once upon a time, there was a bear. The bear was thin. He lived in a big forest with many trees. So, he ate a lot of food. He ate and ate until he was not thin anymore. Now, the bear was big and strong. The little girl saw the bear again and said, You are so big and strong! The bear was happy and not embarrass anymore. They became good friends and played in the forest together.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. So, she decided to stretch the rope to see if it would come undone. Lily pulled and pulled on the rope until it finally stretched enough for her to untie the knot. She was so happy and proud of herself for being so strong. She decided to share her rope with her friends and they all played tugofwar together. John and Michael were scared of their mothers harsh tone. They put the food back in the refrigerator and went to their rooms. The two brothers never want to open the refrigerator again after that day.Once upon a time, there was a little boy. His name was Frank. He was only 3 years old and he loved to explore. One day, Frank was walking through the park. He saw something funny. It was a triangle. It was shiny and fragile. Frank wanted to touch it. Frank stumbled across the park towards the triangle. He reached out his hand to touch it, but it was too slippery. He put his other hand on it and suddenly it moved. Frank started to laugh as the triangle began to roll away. It rolled and rolled until it crashed into something else. Frank looked closer and saw it had crashed into a pile of glass. The glass was very fragile. Rhyme had broken it. Frank was very sad. He had made a mistake. Frank used his little hands to carefully pick up all the pieces of the glass. He was careful not to put too much pressure on the glass, as it was very fragile. When he had finished, the park was all clean. Frank looked down at the triangle. He realized that he had been very lucky. He vowed to never stumble across the park again, but always to take small steps.Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to explore the forest near her house. Her mother looked at the cord and said, Lily, that cord is foolish. Its not real gold. Lily didnt care. She was still happy to have found something new and exciting. He wondered who made the cut. Tim showed the cut to the ball. They both looked at it. A little squirrel came by and said, I made the cut. Tim and the ball smiled. They played with the squirrel until the sun went down. Then, they went home to rest.Sara loved to read books. She read books every day. She read books about animals, about space, about fairy tales. She learned many new things from books. One day, Sara found an envelope on her bed. It was from her grandma. Sara opened the envelope and saw a letter and a picture. The letter said Dear Sara, I miss you very much. I hope you are happy and healthy. I am sending you a picture of a unique bird. It is called a toucan. It has a big and colorful beak. It lives in the rainforest. I saw it when I visited Brazil. I hope you like it. Love, Grandma. Sara smiled and looked at the picture. She had never seen a bird like that before. It was very beautiful and different. She wanted to learn more about it. She ran to her mom and showed her the picture. Mom, look! Grandma sent me a picture of a unique bird. It is a toucan. Do you know anything about it? Mom hugged Sara and said, Wow, that is a very special gift from Grandma. She loves you very much. A toucan is a very interesting bird. It can eat fruits and nuts with its beak. It can make loud noises to communicate with other toucans. It can fly very fast and far. Do you want to read a book about toucans with me? Sara nodded and said, Yes, please! I want to read a book about toucans. I want to know more about them. Thank you, Mom. And thank you, Grandma. Mom and Sara went to the library and found a book about toucans. They read it together and learned many facts and stories about the unique bird. Sara enjoyed reading the book and asked many questions. Mom answered them and praised Sara for being curious and smart. Sara felt happy and grateful. She learned that reading books can help her discover new things and appreciate the diversity of life. She also learned that her grandma and mom love her and support her learning. She decided to write a thank you letter to her grandma and tell her what she learned about toucans. She also drew a picture of a toucan and put it in an envelope. She hoped that her grandma would like it and smile. The moral value of the story is Reading books can enrich your mind and broaden your horizons. You can also show your love and gratitude to others by sharing what you learn and create.Once upon a time, there was a little black dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his ball. He would run and jump and catch the ball all day long. Spots ball was his favorite toy in the whole world. One day, Spot was playing with his ball near the side of the house. He threw the ball up high in the sky, but when it came down, it rolled under a big bush. Spot looked and looked, but he could not find his ball. He was very sad and started to cry. Spots friend, a little girl named Lily, saw him crying and asked, Why are you sad, Spot? Spot told her about his lost ball. Lily said, Dont worry, Spot. I will help you find it! They looked under the bush and found the ball. Spot was so happy that he forgot he was ever sad. He wagged his tail and licked Lilys face to say thank you. Tom was a little unusual because he had a big, red hat and a very long nose. He was always happy and loved to help people. One day, a little girl named Jane saw Tom and had a question. She asked, Why do you have such a big, red hat and a long nose? Tom smiled and said, Its because I am special and different from other firemen. But thats what makes me good at my job. Later that day, there was a fire in a big house. Tom and the other firemen went to put out the fire. The fire was very hot and scary, but Toms big, red hat and long nose helped him get close to the fire and put it out quickly. After the fire, Jane saw Tom again and said, Thank you for saving the house! Now I know that being different is not bad, but it can be very good. Tom smiled and said, Thats right! Being unusual makes us special, and we can use our differences to help others. And so, Jane learned a valuable lesson its good to be different, and we should celebrate our unusual qualities because they make us who we are.George was walking home one day. But suddenly he started to feel dizzy again and realized he had climbed too high. Suddenly his mommy grabbed him and they both quickly started to make their way back down. The fox often explored the forest, looking for fun and adventure. One day, the fox met an old dragon. The dragon was wise and had seen many things in his long life, so he decided to teach the young fox a lesson. The dragon said Today, I will teach you how to be brave. Follow me. The fox and the dragon came to a deep cave. Inside the cave was a very hot flame. The dragon said, This is where I will teach you how to be brave. Jump into the flame and I will help you to get out. The fox was scared but he trusted the dragon and carefully jumped into the flame. The dragon laughed and said You have been brave! No matter how hard things get in life, you must be brave and never give up! The dragon and the fox left the cave, and the fox never forgot the dragons lesson. The end.Tom and Sam were brothers who liked to play outside. One day, they saw a big dog in the park. The dog had a steak in his mouth. Tom and Sam both wanted the steak. They thought it looked yummy. Lets get the steak from the dog, Tom said. He was brave and greedy. He ran towards the dog and tried to grab the steak. Wait, Tom, thats not nice! Sam said. He was kind and smart. He knew the dog would be angry and scared. The dog saw Tom and barked loudly. He showed his sharp teeth and growled. Tom was afraid and stopped. He started to tremble. He wished he had listened to Sam. Sam ran to Tom and hugged him. He said, Its okay, Tom, Im here. The dog is not bad, he just wants his steak. We should not take what is not ours. We should be happy with what we have. Tom nodded and said, Youre right, Sam, Im sorry. I was envious of the dog and his steak. But I have you and our toys and our food. I dont need the steak. I love you, Sam. Sam smiled and said, I love you too, Tom. Come on, lets go home and share a cookie. The dog watched them leave and wagged his tail. He was glad they did not bother him anymore. He ate his steak and enjoyed it. The end. Moral Do not be greedy and envious of what others have. Be kind and grateful for what you have.One day, Jack was walking through a giant forest. He had never been there before and each tree looked big and unknown. Suddenly, he heard a rustling sound. It was coming from behind one of the trees. Jack looked carefully and saw a little animal. It was a rabbit! Hello, said Jack, cautiously. The rabbit looked scared and tried to hide behind the tree. Jack stepped closer. The rabbit jumped and tried to escape! Jack smiled. Its OK, he said. I wont hurt you. The rabbit stopped and looked at Jack. Its nose twitched as it stepped closer. Jack knew he had made a friend.
